It was lunch time but my friend and I wanted just to have a coffee and enjoy the view. The staff was super polite and gave us the best table even tho we didn’t have lunch.

I was not expecting a five star lunch experience, the food was amazing and the service even better, our server Vedran was charming. the view is spectacular of the city center worth the price of the cable car to get there

Took the Cable car up of Srd hill to the upper Cable Car station, after walking around for while we stopted in at the Panorama Restaurant for a couple icy cold adult cocktails.
 The view is spectacular and so are the drink prices, but the ambiance made it worthwhile.

TIP: We would strongly recommend pre booking if possible due to its popularity, and request a table with the view of the old town, its spectacular at night.

If you found this review informative please check the box below. Thank you, the world is yours to explore.
Great place to drink beer with beautiful view as a reward after climbing! Prices are higher than standard one but it is understanable!

My boyfriend and I recently had the pleasure of enjoying sunset cocktails and a delicious meal at Panorama. Being vegetarian, they had more than enough to suffice - the vegetable risotto was absolutely amazing, and my boyfriend's Cabonara was the best of his life! Be careful the starters are very filling and super tasty!

Highly recommend this delightful place to anyone seeking out a romantic meal or a beautiful treat overlooking the wonderful city of Dubrovnik

This is the best restaurant in the best location in Dubrovnik! Call and book a table with a view and you will be amazed!
Very good customer service and great food + the best view of the city and the sea

What a view? What an experience? What an atmosphere?
To dine on such extraordinary place, with magnificante view and great cuisine is treat one don't experience every day!
Service is great, meals full of taste, surrounding astonishing.

Visiting Panorama restaurant is a fantastic experience especially if arriving by cable car. We booked a table well in advance for 6:45 and requested to sit outside on the terrace, we had possibly the best table there. The view is spectacular and we enjoyed the sunset from our table. We shared a platter to start then I had seafood pasta which was amazing and my boyfriend had the chicken. Would definitely recommend a visit to view Dubrovnik from a different angle and enjoy a lovely sunset!

What a beautiful place for dinner!
Food was impressive (although more expensive than in Old Town Dubrovnik) and the cocktails were fantastic. Service was outstanding and the waiters even brought round blankets for guests to keep warm once the sun had set. Book in advance and ask for a table on the edge for the sunset - views are incredible. They even included a complimentary cake for my other half's birthday! Would recommend 100%

Restaurant is located at the top of the hill overlooking the city of Dubrovnik and islands. 
We went there for early dinner and really enjoyed the relaxed setting as it was crowded on the viewing decks so it allowed us to relax, and enjoy our time at the top.
Food was delicious and service very professional and polite. 
We enjoyed in every minute of our dinner and sunset. It was magical!

I feel that it’s worth a trip for the view and the beautiful cocktails but I felt that the menu was quite disappointing and expensive for the offerings. We were given a second row table so as soon as somebody in the first row sat down on the table in front of us we lost out on the view which was the main reason why we visited. I wouldn’t stay for dinner but I would go up for a pre-dinner drink on your way to one of the many other restaurants in the old town! 
Also a COVID note- the tables in the second row are mostly not spaced out in a covid friendly fashion so which I felt was something worth noting for nervous travellers at the moment. We had a couple on the table right next to us separated by a low bushy plant of some kind and that was it (less than 70cm distance).

This restaurant is a must when visiting Croatia, the views are breathtaking. I would recommend pre booking when possible due to its popularity, I would request a table with the view of the old town. The meal was fantastic and definitely a highlight of the holiday, the food was stunning and the staff were very friendly and knowledgeable. As the our booking was for our anniversary they greeted us with a glass of fizz which was a nice touch. I recommend booking your table around sunset so you can watch the sunset whilst enjoying your meal. The quality of the food and service was amazing. I will definitely be returning to this restaurant on my next visit to Croatia.

Probably the best panoramic restaurant with an amazing sunset. Food also is excellent!
I recommend it and i hope i will have the chance to return back there!

The restaurant is currently only serving outside, which is definitely not an issue considering the amazing weather in Dubrovnik and the incredible panoramic view.
I had made a reservation online for one person only and upon arrival I was given what they referred to as the best table at the restaurant and, to be honest, I can't disagree.
Surprisingly, this is one of those restaurants that don't rely only on its view to attract tourists/diners, they also serve great food and have a large variety of drinks. 
I wasn't feeling very hungry, so had a salad, which came in a good portion and it exceeded my expectations. The mojito was aldo fantastic and well presented.
The price is honest for what they offer and the staff is very attentive.
I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting Dubrovnik and look forward to visiting it again.

We are so glad we ended up going up there for sunset. The views all around were just absolutely spectacular! I'd recommend making a reservation ahead of time if you want to sit at one of the tables along the side. If not, do like we did and get a first come first serve hightop table. Our server Vedran was so attentive and very friendly. The local wines were delicious, and the company even better!

There is simply no better place to eat with a view! We reserved a front row table in advance ( two sittings) and could not fault the service and atmosphere. The food was delicious, a good wine was recommended and the staff were helpful and attentive ( plus you can ring a bell if you need them!) The sunset was amazing, and we had our table till well after it had gone down. The most romantic meal ever. So much so, that after it my boyfriend proposed to me on the viewing terrace!

WOW. To put it simply. From being sat at our table to parting ways (physically, a piece of us remains with Panorama) we were in a constant state of awe. Enough cannot be said about the view but I need to put an emphasis on the staff, level of hospitality and the cuisine. Holy sh*t were we blown away. It was quite busy the evening we dined with Panorama yet the service staff were exceptional at making us feel as if we were the only table at the restaurant. I took our waiters word for it and went with the chef's special of the day which was a bone-in pork shank with bacon and potatoes. Though the portion was massive and I was full I could've easily forced myself to second help no matter what. This experience will remain with us for the rest of time or at least until we create new ones when we return.

Absolutely gorgeous meal for our last night in Dubrovnik. The food was exquisite, the drinks were delicious and the service was outstanding - special mention to our waiter Blaz who couldn’t do more for us. We visited at 6:30 which was ideal to watch the incredible sunset while we dined, then after dark the view of the lights of Dubrovnik were sensational. 100/10 and a must visit if fine dining is your thing. Great touch were the blankets and outdoor heaters for when it got a little windy and chilly

I’ll keep my review short and sweet. This was an unbelievable meal. 

The views are amazing if you’re lucky enough to get a front row table, the service is excellent and the food & drinks are amazing. An extremely romantic location, I will definitely return when back in Dubrovnik
We didn’t eat here but stopped for a drink after going up in the cable car. Such a gorgeous place to have a drink and take in the view, would definitely recommend!

Food was beautiful. 
Tables a little close together for my liking but apart from this couldn’t fault it! Will definitely recommend and return

On our seventh visit to Cavtat, we visited Dubrovnik and, for the second time, took the cable car to the top of Mount Srd.
Of course, we knew the view that awaited and prayed that, on this occasion, the mist wouldn't come in as it did on our first visit, but the main reason for our visit was to eat lunch at this beautiful, quality restaurant, offering unparalleled views of Dubrovnik Old Town and the wider major city itself.
We had a tuna salad and a hot steak sandwich served with fries and salad garnish. We chose two excellent gins with top notch tonic as we took in the views from our mountain-edge table.
Staff here are very attentive and professional and it did not come as a surprise that the restaurant is part of the group that includes the Gradska Kavarna Arsenal on the quayside of Dubrovnik's Old Town harbour.
Everyone said it was very expensive but worth it for the view but we found it was worth it for the excellent food and the view.
Food quality was as awesome as the view and the bill did not have me reaching for my card instead of cash.
A cable car ride back down and a short walk found us in the Gradska Kavarna Arsenal for a final G&T before catching the taxi boat back to Cavtat.
Now here is a challenge for everyone - which is better? The Panorama Restaurant with its spectacular views down to Dubrovnik or the Gradska Kavarna Arsenal with its spectacular view of Dubrovnik Old Harbour?
For me, the jury is out on that one..... both are absolutely excellent venues for food and views!
The mist didn't come in and the view was amazing but, so too, you feel like a movie star eating in the lovely open ambience at the Old Harbour.
Well done to the Panorama team though. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with you this year.
Next year, we will be bringing our grown up family with us.

Took cable car ride to the Panorama Restaurant.
It is advisable to go early in the day as it is one of the 'in' places to eat whilst in Dubrovnik.
Large umbarellas to sit under to shelter from the hot sun, to admire the stunning views of the city below.
Excellent service and food.
Will definitely return.

the restaurant works to rip off tourists. Not tasty. Expensive . Amazing views only. The best option is just a cup of coffee (but the coffee is not of the best quality here either). Booked a restaurant 2 weeks in advance. At the request of the administrator, he confirmed the reservation by phone on the day of the visit. but when we arrived at the restaurant they tried to give a table on the second line (booked so in advance on the first line from the sea). After our dissatisfaction, the administrator gave a new table on the first line from the sea. The food was mediocre. The waiter's service is at the level (he hoped for a generous tip, which in the end he received). You can go to the restaurant only for the view, having previously dined in a good place with high-quality, inexpensive food.

The two of us had dinner at the restaurant. The staff was super friendly in communication including the manager. We had a lot of laughs. We ate in three courses and had great wine called Malvasia from a local winery. The view was absolutely amazing so was the service. Presentation of food is given much of the attention.
Reservation is needed in advance. Ask for a table on the edge of the terrace for the better view, the feeling is really special.

Prijatelji su nam preporučili posjetu ovom restoranu. Toliko smo zahvalni na preporuci da ju želimo širiti dalje. Hrana u restoranu je nestvarna, vino također a pogled po čemu je restoran najpoznatiji oduzima dah! Kada sjednete u restoran sve stane na trenutak i tokom cijelog ručka ili večere jednostavno ne možete maknuti pogled sa grada. Preporučam svima kako bi kao i ja doživjeli ovo iskustvo i vidjeli Dubrovnik iz drugog, najljepšeg ugla. Konobar Blaž je sve od sebe dao da nam ručak u restoranu bude nezaboravan. Sve pohvale za njega, preljubazan je!

Friends recommended us to visit this restaurant. We are so grateful for the recommendation that we want to spread it further. The food in the restaurant is unreal, the wine too and the view of what the restaurant is most famous for is breathtaking! When you sit in a restaurant everything stops for a moment and during the whole lunch or dinner you just can’t take your eyes off the city. I recommend everyone to experience this experience like me and see Dubrovnik from another, most beautiful angle. Waiter Blaž did his best to make our lunch in the restaurant unforgettable. All praise for him, he is too kind!

Would highly recommend a visit to the Panorama Restaurant and Bar. Had a wonderful lunch after rather warm walk up to the restaurant. The food was excellent and the service impeccable. Staff were very friendly and catered for our every need.
Had booked in advance and requested a sea view which was a must. The highlight of our stay in Dubrovnik.

This is the perfect spot to have some drinks and enjoy the view!
I definately suggest to go during the sunset!! There are some tables reserved for dinner but if you go early you can still get one. 
I had a great Piñacolada there!
Fantastic location with stunning views and the food is first class. Take a jumper or light second covering as wind can be chilly but restaurant do supply blankets on request. A must visit.

Everything was really perfect! The view, the food (the risotto, the tuna, etc...) and a special mention to Rajko for his perfect sense of service. He was always taking care to make sure we didn’t lack anything.

Thank you for everything!
Wow the view was just incredible. Also service was impeccable and we enjoyed our food and drinks. The perfect last day in Dubrovnik! It is a must do if you visit.

Along with the cable car and Homeland War museum, having a meal at the restaurant is a must do. There was a wide selection of food and drinks which were all reasonably priced. The food itself was tasty and we were impressed with the service. The waiting staff were friendly and they made an effort to ensure we had a nice meal. 

If you’re after a view over the city, it would be wise to book ahead as those seats fill up fast. On our first visit, we were not able to get a table on the edge, however the view was still great. We loved it so much, we decided to go again and ate at around 4, as we wanted to get a table with that view!

From the moment I saw an advertisement showing that corner table overlooking Dubrovnik I knew my husband and I HAD to go there. Figuring it would be super busy I made a reservation and had fantastic service from the moment Anita, the Sales Manager, replied. When we showed up the exact table I had wanted was waiting for us and we had amazing service by Josip. Loved the cold seafood starter, lamb chop, sea bass and we had the cheese platter for dessert. Josip even remembered an anniversary I had mentioned when I made the reservation that we had (temporarily) forgotten ourselves. And to see the sunset over the Elafiti Islands was spectacular. What a special night!
My only tip is 6:30pm is still hot and sunny at the end of Aug. so I should have gone for a 7pm reservation. We were also told we needed to leave by 8:45pm since there was a 9pm reservation after us, but that wasn't a problem and we didn't feel rushed at all. The sun set about 7:30 so plenty of time to see the lights come on.

The most amazing view for a meal on the terrace, very busy and had to wait for a table so would advise booking. Staff very friendly, we waited 10 mins for our drinks which wasn’t a problem, but when they came they were on the house as an apology for the wait! Menu is a bit strange as it has pasta meals such as Carbonara/Bolognaise listed as starters (if you could eat another course after it I take my hat off to you!) Food was absolutely fantastic though! Highly recommend!

We were both very worried that, due to its amazing location, the food would be mediocre but no - the meal was the best that we had in Dubrovnik and was good value considering some of the other meals less good that we ate in the old town. The service was very friendly and attentive.

A very relaxed atmosphere with beautiful views. A wide variety of food and drinks whilst the staff were very friendly and attentive. If you are planning to drive to the top or get the cable car I would recommend stopping off here. The tables are under umbrellas so no risk of getting majorly sunburnt.

Booked this well in advance to guarantee a perfect table.
Fantastic communication booking and confirming the day of our visit.
Superb service, so polite and professional.
Great food at very reasonable prices.
X4 for lunch drinks coffee etc £130 absolute bargain if you consider the service and view.
Second time here, won’t be the last.
If you’re going to Dubrovnik this place is a must.

A must for the views of the Adriatic & Old Town, the food and drinks are a bonus. However I have always had an issue when restaurants impose a time limit when dining and the 1 hour for three diners was in my opinion is tight fisted and just never allowed me to relax.

Been looking forward to going here on the lead up to our holiday. The view is absolutely amazing. The staff were friendly and attentive. On trip advisor it states it has vegetarian options which is minimal but I had lots of starters which were lovely instead of a main course. Cocktails were sooo good! This place is the place to go for the view and service. The road up to the bar restaurant was really narrow and very steep obviously due to where it’s located so I’d recommend a taxi ride to it. But it’s really worth going if only just for the view!

Had an unexpected dinner here post sunset having taken the cable car up for sunset. The staff and service here are true professionals, attentive, polite, friendly and accommodating. The food was excellent, good selection of drinks and wine, and of course the view is unquestionably beautiful. One word on the cable car - it's incredibly expensive for a cable car e.g. like £20/$25 per person for few mins lift. It's well run and great but for the money you may opt to just Uber up and back down.

We finished our trip in Dubrovnik at this restaurant. The staff were great. The food was amazing. Warning the food does come at a premium price but its worth it. We booked our table in advance as we wanted to see the sunset. Be sure to take the cable car back down to old town.
Booked a table beforehand and staff professional and courteous. We only ate dessert (they were delicious) and cocktails but both very good.

Despite three months’ notice for my birthday party on 12 August, no effort was made to provide a decent vegan meal. Dessert for my husband and I was an orange and a cut up apple with some berries on a small slate for us to share. Not good enough!

I cannot fault the setting or the table we had, but all we had to eat were grilled vegetables and a bowl of potatoes coming in at a whopping 800 kuna with the miserly fruit salad and a glass and a half of Prosecco with some table water. Don’t go if you are vegan as they have no interest in catering for your needs and we left hungry and upset.

The other members in cur party liked their food, but for us it was wholly disappointing and the two stars are given purely for the stunning location and the view from our table.

I really expected something spectacular as I was celebrating my 50th and my friend’s 60th that evening, but Panorama is not up to speed with vegan requirements and needs to move with the times. 

The first thing we were offered at every restaurant (apart from one) was vegetable risotto. Rice is nit the only thing vegans eat - Seitan and tofu are great sources of protein and wonderful dishes can be created with these ingredients.

Please take this review in the spirit it is intended - we felt short changed and I felt very disappointed with the small portions offered, especially with the fruit platter.

The cable car was a quick trip up and we were seated right on the front with a great view down over the old town.
Cocktails were well made, the best we had during our stay.
The only reason I’ve not given 5 stars is because we were asked to move tables when we ordered a second drink, as apparently someone had specifically reserved our table and was about to arrive. We were given a small discount on our bill for the inconvenience, which was a nice surprise at the end of our visit.

When you stupidly think this place is only good for it's view, and in the end everyrhing upstairs is amazing! First of all, book your table at least a week before, if not more. they get fully booked even now! We had bad luck as our reservation was on the only day that was rainy and super stormy! Went upstairs for sunset, ended up dissapointed because had to sit inside, without view. 90% of reservations were canceled, and couple of us that came gor tables inside. If you get first row inside, it's also amazing. Food was perfect, better than 90% restaurants we visited in 7 days! Nice beef and black pig steaks, fish entree, apple pie desert. Service was also perfect. In the end they transfered us to other table, so we could enjoy city light, and dessert and limoncello liquer were compliments of the house, so they make up for the fact that our evening and sunset were ruined by storm. But you know what? It was still perfect!!!

Views views views! What a truly special experience eating at Panorama. The food was delicious, all be it with a menu that felt limited. 
The food was of good quality, service was spot on and oh yes the views. 
An addition for any Dubrovnik bucket list!
If you only do one thing on a trip to Dubrovnik, this should be it. Pre book if you want the best tables. Food was lovely, service top class. Prices a little higher than others but so worth it.

Stunning views, its very romantic, especially for dinner. Food is very delicious, coctails also and service very polite and friendly. Prices are little higher but it is good value for money. It was lovely dinner for us and I would highly recomend it for brunch or dinner (It is better to make reservation).
Excellent views, wonderful service, excellent food and drink. The prices are a little above average for Dubrovnik, but seems well worth it
This is the restaurant at the top of the cable car. Just Had cocktails which were nice. The restaurant is popular. Can be windy but there are tables inside and outside.

What Views, to get the most out of your time here, book a table immediately overlooking the City walls, food was gorgeous, Cocktails the best we'd tasted whilst in Dubrovnik, not cheap, yet not extortionate, got a taxi up there.... which was more scary than the cable cart.

We rode the cable car up & back down and had lunch at the restaurant. It isn’t a cheap lunch but you are paying for the phenomenal views! The food was delicious and drinks were chilled.

There is plenty of shade. 

It was one of the highlights of our holiday.

An amazing place and stunning views... not one you get to see everyday. The food was incredible, the service impeccable. 
This is a must do in Dubrovnik. Give yourself about 30 minutes to get up in the cable car so you can have a walk around at the top first and try and book in good time so you can reserve a prime table on the edge for the best views. 
There was no rush either so plenty of time to eat, drink and enjoy the atmosphere.

The food and cocktails were absolutely lovely. The city below was beautiful. You can see the whole of the old city from the restaurant and in the evening it is very romantic. It was a lovely experience and I would highly recommend it.

Amazing restaurant. One of the best parts of our holiday was the cable car trip up to the panorama restaurant at sunset. Gorgeous view of the old town and surrounding areas. Lovely food and cocktails. Staff took us earlier than our reservation time which was also a bonus.

We came there at around 4 pm, we had the absolute best time, there was 4 of us girls and we were welcomed the best. If you go to Dubrovnik you should definetly visit this place, you have an amazing view of whole city Dubrovnik with beautiful sea around it. The service was very heartwarming and welcoming. They explained us the whole menu and helped us decide what we want based on our usual taste in food. They had great drinks, especially the cocktails, the deserts were great and the test of the menu is absolutely perfect. It has a bit of everything for everyone which is great. The prices were understanding for what you get.❤️

What an amazing experience. Restaurant is absolutely amazing. If you are visiting Dubrovnik, this is the place to be. The view is breath-taking. Food was so delicious, and i have tried the best apple pie ever. Its melting in your mouth. Staff was so helpful, polite, explaining and offering in fluent english, they made our staying so much better, even offered to move us because of a few boring bee's, but we didnt want to leave that table 😁🍻
Thank you Panorama for this unforgettable expirience!

A beautiful restaurant with incredible views over Dubrovnik... 
we had a 10 minute wait for a table in the shade (we hadn’t booked) but there were plenty of tables available not covered.
Sadly can’t remember the name of our server but he was very friendly and helpful, even taught us a few Croatian words. 
I had the Sea bass and my wife had Tuna salad, we really enjoyed both.
Stayed around 2 hours with the food and a bottle of wine, total cost was about £60
If you didn’t have to pay £20 each to get up on the cable car we would go back, nothing else up there.
Recommend

Definitely recommend this to anyone who visits Dubrovnik. The view is breathtaking and the service we got from Mario was superb as was his knowledge of the menu and his advice. The food was great and the wines surprisingly good value given the location and setting. As a note, you can get an uber or taxi to the restaurant if you don't fancy paying the cable car charge (an uber for 2 was 60% the price of an adult single journey on the cable car).

What an incredible service! We had a pretty cloudy view sadly but Panorama gave us a 10% discount to apologise for the view - it wasn’t necessary, but a very nice touch! Food was great and staff super friendly. We got a discount card for 4 other restaurants around Dubrovnik too! 

Thanks Panorama!
My son and I had a lovely evening here, great food and very attentive staff. Bit pricey but you are paying for the fabulous view. I highly recommend.

I think I have eaten the best food ever here (chef's recomandation)and nothing is comparing with the sunset view from uphere. I recomend it for evryone who would like to enjoy a great evening on top of Dubrovnik. Also the service is excelent, 5* for the boys as they made our visit on Panorama great and funny.

After a scenic ride up in the cable car that gives you views looking back down o to Dubrovnik and then out into the Adriatic Ocean this restaurant welcomes you with a warm smile and shaded seating. Recommend to get there before noon as it fills up quickly and the seats with the best views are taken quickly. 
The cocktails are well presented, the service is excellent and the food was freshly present, packed with flavour and colour. 
Even if it's just to stop to rehydrate this is the place to stop at!

Me and my girlfriend booked the restaurant for 7:30 in the evening and I couldn’t recommend it enough eating while the sun is setting. Simply amazing views and the atmosphere is great too.

The service was fantastic throughout providing us with extras like bread and liqueurs at the end. We ordered a bottle of wine/bottled water and they’d top our drinks up. 

We thought the food was fantastic, I had the king prawns and my girlfriend had the steak. 

Thank you for a great experience.

Amazing Restaurant at the top of Mount Srđ with a beautiful view on Old Town Dubrovnik. The food was great, also the wine. It is not to expensive. We have got free desert and also 30% discount for locals!!

You should book your table in advance - and it is amazing if your table is in the first row.

Breathtaking sunset and views. Service started very good however after our main course there was a 40 minute gap where the service was poor, it was like we were forgotten about. The food however was gorgeous!! We walked up which was brilliant, if you don’t mind arriving sweaty!
From the setting to the service and most importantly dinner itself, Panorama exceeded all our expectations. A huge thank you to the entire staff. We shall be back!

Great view of the city! 
Lovely staff and amazing food!!

We didnt have a reservation but they offered us a "bad"( it wasnt first line to view) table which turned out to be just perfect!! Price was very good!

Dinner in style with a view.

We enjoyed a sunset dinner here and the views were nothing short of stunning out over the city and the surrounding islands. We booked a front row table to make sure. 

The food was exquisite and the local wine was delicious. The service from our waiter Josip was very friendly, courteous and professional plus Covid secure.

The prices aren’t the cheapest in Dubrovnik, but you have incredible food and the view is worth every penny. By comparison, you’d pay far more for a meal like that in the U.K. 

Hopefully one day we’ll return to Dubrovnik and dine here again.

My husband took me here for my 30th birthday. It was a lovely experience. The waiter Josip did everything perfect. We shared a cheese plate, which was very large portioned for two, and had a nice variety. We both had the squid, which was excellent. The wine menu isn’t very large, but they have nice selections. The view over old town is spectacular. If you want one of these good tables you do need to make a reservation in advance. It is a little chilly with the wind, so I recommend a sweater for the evening. They provide blankets on the chairs, a nice extra touch. 
Definitely recommend this place for a nice upscale outdoor dining experience.
The view is awesome, but the staff is over the top. Friendly and very polite. We had only drinks in the morning, the ambient is over the top.

Great view, good menu variety, good food taste, polite waiters.
Reserve in advance to secure a table with a good view.
At night can get cold. The restaurant has heaters and blankets for this

We came there with the cable car and had no reservation. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful, apologized they did not have a table at the seaside, gave us a nice table in the second row. Food was excellent, prices are absolutely reasonable for this location and view. If you want to spend some extra money for something special, thats the place!

My husband and I enjoyed our visit to Panorama restaurant. If you book in advance, you should be able to reserve the tables on the edge of the restaurant where you will get unobstructed view of the city below. Our meal was delicious, I loved my cocktail and the wait staff service was attentive. It was worth the premium price we paid for the experience.

This year Dubrovnik was our summer holliday destination, so we decided to go to Panorama restaurant at hill Srdj. Instead of using cable car which is in my opinnion rather pricy, we hired an super-firendly local Taxy guy who drove us from our hotel to Panorama, to old city of Dubrovnik and back to out hotel for ridicolously 20 EUR.
When we came to Panorama, we were so amazed with the view in front of us that we became speachless for a whole minute - dropped jaws and eyes wide open was the best way to describe us :-))
Super friendly and elegant waiters welcomed us with a big smile and gave us a seat right to the fence, and enjoy the most beautiful view in the Dubrovnik for sure. Since we came in the morning, we just had a coffe and sparkling water, but out host told us that beside grat view, Panorama is famous for two more things: amazing beefsteak and wedding proposals each weekend - I believe him. :-))
To make a long story short; If you want to enjoy in amazing lunch, dinner in most amazing and romantic place in Dubrovnik at more than reasonable price, or if you just want to enjoy in a cup of coffe or a glass of chilled white wine, Panorama is simply a must place to visit because it' just that amazing.
If you are a guy and you have a girlfriend with who you want to spend the rest of your life with, Panorama is the perfect and the most romantic place for getting down on your knees and asking your future wife the most romantic question, and she'll say YES for sure! :-))

We were on our honeymoon and we visited Dubrovnik for a day! This place was a must-see and we weren't dissapointed! You come here by Cable Car and the view is simply amazing! You have to wait to be seated in the restoraunt which is fair because a lot of people make reservations before coming here. The waiters were friendly and professional. We had cocktails looking on Dubrovnik and it was a really beautiful experience! Recommend it to everyone!

So enjoyed my visit here! Wonderful views and excellent local Malvasia wine. No queues and sok relaxing. Thanks for the excellent experience. Patrik looked after me - nothing a trouble! Top marks! Don't miss this place!
The view is amazing! Prices are very affordable for everything they offer. Food is very good quality. Surely will come again!
Beautiful View overlooking Dubrovnik, perfect working cable car, unfortunately the Menu is a bit expensive but again the panorama worths every coins and the service is professional. A must!
Great staff wonderful food, drinks and service. A perfect place to hang out for the afternoon. Absolute incredible location.

Due to its location, it is not surprising that it is a super busy restaurant, I didn't make a reservation but really wanted to have dinner after watching the sunset, they were really full but the staff was helpful and let me know how many people are before me in the queue for walk-in, I decided to wait at the drinks area and fortunately got a table after waiting a while. It was chilly by then and they provide blankets which is thoughtful. A lot of times, restaurants at places like this rely on the amazing view and forget about the food but not here. I had the caprese salad as starter which was lovely. For main I ordered the steak, it was cooked to medium rare as requested. I consider the side/garnish quite important and here they do pay attention to such. My only suggestion is to provide a bit more gravy. Staff was efficient and attentive. Came to HRK425 for 2 course and a drink which is on the pricey side but then not surprising given its location and view. Overall, a lovely dinner.
Food was great and the staff was friendly. The views are amazing and the prices reasonable ! Definitely recommend a visit.
One of the restaurants with a most beautiful view in Dubrovnik. There is a huge terrace just at the edge ... stuff is nice and the food is also fine I recommend it to all future guests.

went there by car (accidentally while exploring surroundings) but there's a cable car from the city. 

We were seated in the room with panoramic windows - it was one of the best viewpoints I've been to. We were late and they were about ot close, so we had apple pies and coffee (both were surprisingly good) while other guests were having pastas and salads and looked pleased. 

Totally a place to visit

A couple of blocks up from Old Town gets you to the aerial tram and a quick breathtaking ride gets you to a stunning restaurant. Everything about this restaurant is first class. The staff is very accommodating. We were a group of 10 and they found tables for all of us after a short wait. We had cocktails at some standup tables while we waited. Food was plentiful, great menu and very tasty. And of course the view is stunning!

What can I say. One of the most enjoyable meals I ever had. So enjoyable we went back two nights later. The 2nd night we got the window table. Stunning views all night of old Dubrovnik, and then the sunset. Pure heaven. The meal was wonderful too. Allin all a most memorable visit.

It was our second time in the restaurant. 

We have again enjoyed nice dinner with family and friends! Food was delicious 😋, personal friendly, helpful, polite,....TOP experience 👏👏👏! 

Coming by cabel car from Dubrovnik we again enjoyed beautiful Panorama of old city.We recommend reservations and ask for the table near the fenceao your panoramic view of Dubrovnik will be even better!

We took the opportunity to get some coffee and cake after travelling along from Slano and taking a ride on the Dubrovnik Gondola. The terrace of the restaurant provided a great location to relax and take in the views.

Service was exemplary and although coffee at 34 kuna (£3.93) per cup and pieces of cheesecake at 54 kuna (£6.25) each may seem a little expensive, put the cost aside and enjoy the spectacular setting and the quality of products. 

It was a nice treat as far as we were concerned.

We were given a card for 10% discount at their Restaurant & Cafe Dubravka (near the Pile Gate) and were able to enjoy drinks there later too.

Went up to panorama restaurant to catch the view of Dubrovnik old town. It did not disappoint. The view was breathtaking and the food was delicious which was a bonus. Restaurant staff was also friendly and patient as we were not familiar with which Croatian wines to order.
The view is the only good thing in this restaurant. The waitress was rude, the price is high for the quality of food.

We drove to the top of the mountain to visit this restaurant along a really scary road but it was worth it at the end. We didn't have time to eat but we did have a welcome drink which was served well chilled by friendly staff. There is also a museum dedicated to the fight the Croatians endured for their independence.

We had lunch at Panorama and it was fantastic. We did not have a reservation, however we managed to be given a fabulous table with amazing views. I had the veal carpaccio, delicious! It certainly is a must, but to guarantee a fantastic table on the edge, just book!

We went up to Panorama restaurant for coffee and strudels. The view was both awesome and breathtaking! 
The strudels was warm and tasted so delicious. 
All of us enjoyed ourselves very much. 
The service staff was very smiley and friendly. 
Thanks much.

I was on vacation to Montenegro and stopped shortly to Dubrovnik and Mount Srd. Well worth my time cause is breathing view on the city and surrounding islands. Food there is also great... Combined with location i couldn't ask for more. 10/10

Waited a while to get a table as we hadn’t booked. Think they forgot that they said they would come for our drinks order as they only just asked us after we had been there for half an hour. Unfortunately we were put on the mountain side, rather than the sea side so we didn’t get the view we were hoping for. Food was very nice. Service not so hot.

Had a very special birthday dinner here for myself and 3 family members mid October. Booked table for 6 pm, 3 weeks before travelling to Dubrovnik. Booked table for 6 pm (sunset). Unbelievable dinning experience! Views were outstanding. Service was excellent. The maitre d' made us feel very welcome and special and took a few photos of us that I will cherish forever.
 Food was lovely and well priced. 
In my 60 years I have dined at many more expensive restaurants but this was by far my favourite.

Only stopped for a quick drink during a tourist stop. A definite must for anyone visiting Dubrovnik. Views were spectacular and staff very friendly and attentive. In fact we have promised to return for a special meal next year. We were given discount cards to use in sister restaurants in the old town.

We were delighted to find this wonderful option after our cable ride up the the views over Dubrovnik! We had a wonderful meal and both Peter and Peter and Ivan delivered exceptional service while we celebrated my Mother's birthday! They went out of their way to make sure the experience was special and memorable!
Fabulous location at the top of the cable car in Dubrovnik with amazing views over Old Town and beyond. The food was great and the service fantastic. They were very kind to our young children.

One of my fave places we went in Dubrovnik. Recommend booking a reservation which we had. We went for lunch to fully appreciate the view. Service was excellent. Enjoyed our food and the view was simply incredible. A must

Part of the Nautika group of restaurants. Fantastic location at the top of Mount Srd with wonderful views over Dubrovnik in particular the old town. Tiered location visited although there is an indoor part of the restaurant. Initially wasn’t impressed with lady at entrance who wanted to finish a conversation with someone from the cable car. However once shown to our table our waiter was polite, helpful and ensured our visit was welcome. We only had coffees but would have returned for a main meal had we longer in Dubrovnik.

Located atop the hill where Cable Car reach, this restaurant with expansive terrace, enchanting views, fresh breeze, aromas of local cuisine, bubbling beer, enhanced my memorable Dubrovnik experience. Seating outside merge with beautiful skyline.

If you are doing the cable car trip then arrange it around lunchtime and spend an hour or so at this place taking in the superb views.You may have to wait a bit at busy times but usually no more than 15 mins unless you are a large party.
It is slightly more expensive than the old town but the views and ambiance are well worth the extra cost.Go on a fine sunny day and sit outside.

We reserved a beautiful table on the terrace with a wonderful view of the old city and the sea. We took a cab up and the cable car down and got to our reservation right on time. Service was prompt and friendly, and we enjoyed our dinner - with a superb martini to start. It's a great place to have an overview of Dubrovnik and I'm glad we came!

We had lunch in this restaurant, located in the Srd Hill, fantastic view, free parking, friendly staffs and great service. Linguine with shrimps and seashells, Risotto with shimps and courgettes and Grilled vegetables were delicious. Recommended!

What a great setting for a delicious meal. 4 of us had different items from the menu and we were all over the moon with what was served. I had the best cheeseburger I've tasted for a long long time whilst my travelling partners all had different types of salad which looked & tasted fantastic.

We were a couple that where in Dubrovnik for a week. This was the best food we had. We made a reservation two days before and asked for a view. They said they did not have a table with a view at that time. But we came anyway. When we came they had the perfect table with the best view of the city. We were so glad. The food was very good and the staff was the best.

This is a fantastic place for lunch, I had probably the best cheese burger that I’ve ever tasted 100% beef and hand made , very well cooked which I thoroughly enjoyed, my wife settled for a Cheese and ham toastie with a portion of chips washed down with a couple of beers to enjoy the views.
Okay a bit more expensive but worth it , was also impressed by the high tech table service button which directly connected you to a member of staff,.

Beautiful, amazing service and of course the view is out of this world. We drove up and there’s plenty of parking. We were seated quickly and had delicious cocktails. we were there for sunset which was amazing.

A place to visit if you go to Dubrovnik. The spectacular views of this place will leave you breathless. The place is wonderful, on one side the sea and on the other the mountain. Your sight will be lost in the distance, where the sea kisses the sky is a poem for the senses.
 We also have to see the part that gives us great sadness: the old fortress that still maintains the wounds of war, holes in the ancient walls that show the sign of shrapnel and bombs. Digging into the rock you can visit a museum where you can see the horrors of this war. There films are projected, there are photographs, a number of documents and everything related to this war that at last resulted in the independence of what is now the Croatian state.
The most fabulous view over the city, super service and lovely food and drink. A must visit in Dubrovnik

First of all, the location is spectacular.
Full panoramic views of Dubrovnik.

We stopped for a quick bite and drink during our afternoon at the top of the mountain.
We chose a selection of starters rather than a full meal. Lovely food. 
We treated ourselves to cocktails. 
They were delicious.

Thoroughly recommend a visit here.
Got the cable car to the top ate here with my family. Views are amazing and the food is fantastic as well. Great atmosphere staff are friendly and quick to serve you

I half expected to get the tourist trap treatment here given that it’s outdoor, adjacent to the cable car station on the hilltop from which you can see forever and thus has a sizeable captive audience. I was, though, pleasantly surprised since the cocktails, nibbles (cheeses & olives) and service were all spot on. The menu looked pretty enticing but since we’d already made a booking elsewhere, we had to pass. I’d certainly give the meals a try if I ever return.

If you want fabulous views whilst eating lunch, this is the place.
Food was good, more expensive than other places.
Service was so, so. Our waiter Verdun went off on a break and didn't remember to hand his wristband in that is linked to the button on the table. We were pressing it and waited for ages. Eventually we gave up and went to the bar. Thomas was great and very apologetic and we were not charged for a coffee.
Otherwise, a lovely meal.
A great meal watching the sun go down over Dubrovnik. A great restaurant at the top of the cable car. Attentive waiters who never rushed you. Food excellent. They even supply blankets

We had a great lunch with a spectacular view over the whole of Dubrovnik. Not the cheapest (£55 for two mains and 2 beers) but well worth it for the view. I would advise that you book if you want to sit at the front for the best view.

Don't miss the Sun Downer.The beautiful old town With the Adriatic Sea make a perfect setting .
The Panorama Restaurant is so well placed.
P.S-Do not go without making a reservation-specially on the peak season..
Beautiful view with wonderful food and drinks to choose from. Exceptional. Will visit again and again!

For our final night in Dubrovnik I booked us a table here and was not disappointed. Breathtaking views, sublime atmosphere and amazing food. Getting the cable car up adds to the experience. The views we got at sunset were out of this world, we enjoyed a very special moment at a very special place. 10/10 👌🏻

Beautiful place but very expensive which is a great shame . Nearly £14 for a tuna sandwich. 
Booking essential in the evening
Fantastic location at top of cable car. Great staff and service, decent food and wine. A must visit place.

Food is like most other places, same menu, same portions.
Ice cream however, is 3 scoops, only. (LOL)
The view is second to none, even if the prices are a bit higher, you do pay for the panorama. (sic)

If you walked the trail up, the beer tastes extra good!

Without doubt the best location I have ever eaten in. Simply stunning views and actually the food and service were also superb. We had a really memorable and special night here. Make sure to book a table before sunset so you can enjoy the experience and take the cable car up with plenty of time. You can always stand and admire the views and have a drink while you wait for your table. My absolute highlight of Dubrovnik

Made a reservation for dinner having visited for lunch three years ago and was once again blown away by the experience. We were welcomed like royalty and seated on the edge of the hill - breath taking views. Food was delicious and we enjoyed every bite. Ordered the chicken and the grilled beef steak. Both were full of flavour and exceptional value for the price. Dessert (apple pie & choc/walnut cake) was excellent too. General ambience and excellent staff make this an unforgettable experience! Cannot wait to come back again - cannot imagine ever tiring of this place ❤️

We had a once in a lifetime lunch at this beautiful restaurant, with a lovely table overlooking all of scenic Dubrovnik. Although we didn’t have a reservation, we were lucky enough in the third week of September to arrive at lunchtime and get quickly seated. Not long after we sat down one of the staff came over to offer us an even better table with an unrestricted view- a gesture we greatly appreciated, and which set the tone for our experience.
No one informed us that we were supposed to press the large button on the table to summon service...We were happily enjoying the view and our unexpectedly good fortune in securing such a great table and were unperturbed that we waited a bit, before our waiter stopped by and showed us the ropes! Our lunch was delicious, a touch expensive but not exorbitant given the location and the prices we found through Dubrovnik- ie, worth every penny. Service was discreet, friendly and appropriate. This lunch proved to be a real highlight of our time in Dubrovnik, and I recommend it highly. If you are certain of your schedule you probably should reserve in advance and not take your chances like we did! Keep in mind that you will need to take the cable car to reach Panorama unless you have a car, so the timing of that needs to be factored into your plans.
My wife and 8 really enjoyed this restaurant. The food was very good but a little pricey. The service was a not great, but the view and food made up for the lackluster service.
The waiter was lovely and very helpful. Prices are okay considering where the restaurant is located.

Just had dinner tonight with my family. I don't think I can put in to words the amount of praise I have for this restaurant, it was utterly spectacular.

It started out a little weird. We had booked a table weeks in advance and I'm not sure if that was related to us getting what I would consider the best table in the restaurant (possibly one of the best in the world) with breathtaking views. But shortly after we were seated, this other couple got very close to our private table and stood right behind me in a cramped space trying to take a picture... I thought it would be a quick thing but they were there for an agonizing awkwardly long time... Staff spotted the issue and politely asked them to move on as it was quite invasive and rude. 

I can't blame really blame the couple as the views for eating a first class dinner were truly incredible, once in a lifetime sort of experience. Also I was a little flattered to have table envy, not something that's ever happened before and I don't think will ever happen again.

Our waiter was exceptionally polite and friendly and even took our picture for us.

Service to take our order was a little slow but I think it was deliberate to give us time to enjoy the sunset.

I ordered the chicken which I wasn't expecting much from by the description, but it was truly exceptional and I savoured every bite. I thought it was really high quality.

I suspect that meal will remain the stand out memory of our holiday. I highly recommend it, I also recommend booking as early as you can.

We enjoyed a lovely late afternoon and early evening at the top of the cable car. The restaurant is set in such a way to make the most of the views over Dubrovnik. The service was wonderful and the food was delicious. It was too early for dinner so we ordered platters of cheese and fruit to share along with some bread and wine. The food was beautifully served and plentiful. The ambiance, music and sunset made for a truly special memory, thank you...

We arrived about 6pm and whilst the outside area was very busy we managed to get a seat inside by the window. It was nice and quiet. We loved our food, it was a real treat! We spent about £56 on 2 main meals. We were hesitant to part with so much cash, but the quality was superb. Staff were also very friendly. Grilled beef beef steak pictured

Only request would be better background music. Midi orchestral recordings.

Only dampener was the music choice. They could do with a better cd 😂 midi orchestral songs.

This restaurant is, no wonder, outrageously expensive, so I would not recommend eating here. The view is superb, though. We ordered two traditional gin fizz, which were really well made by the bartender, perhaps the best I´ve ever had and tastefully decorated. Service is also outstanding. Two drinks cost as much as a whole dinner for two down in the Old City, but were worth it.

Our family booked this restaurant for us for our wedding anniversary and I can honestly it was incredible. Views just unbelievable, good excellent and staff couldn’t do enough for us and made us feel really special. This restaurant is part of a group of three or four and we dined in a couple of the other ones too. All were lovely.
Thank you Panorama.
One tip is if you are thinking of going book a couple months in advance if you can and ask for. Front table

We didn’t have a booking so went straight to the restaurant to book for lunch. One member of staff said there was a table available, whilst the other member of staff said we would have to come back nearer lunch time?
We decided to have some drinks outside. The staff outside were very friendly and found us a table. The views were stunning...
Sadly, the weather changed and the winds blew up so we decided to get the cable car back down and we had lunch in the old town.
Did not get opportunity to enjoy a meal but did sample fabulous cocktails in stunning surroundings and a view to truly appreciate the old town. Well made and presented drinks.

We hiked up using the well developed trail. The views from our table were amazing. Our plan was to eat breakfast up there but sadly, they do not offer breakfast and their light lunch starts at 11am. We did have coffee and some apple pie and it was really good. Is this worth $30? You can decide for yourself when you visit.

The view, the food, the service, everything was fantastic.
The queue for the cable car was horrendous so we jumped in a taxi.
Took the cable car down, which worked perfectly.
Highly recommend the Beef Carpaccio.
The view from here at sunset is simply amazing.....and the food and coffee is also excellent.. great experience

We took the cable car up above Dubrovnik and decided to stay for dinner. There was a waiting list for outside tables and we thought we would not be able to get one. The wait for us was not very long. We did discover that if you want an outside unobstructed view, you have to book months in advance. We were there during October so not as busy but we are told if you want a table during peak season, you book a year in advance. Details are available through nautikarestaurants.com. 

Our meal was good and the staff are friendly and very efficient. Well worth the trek up the cable car

We arrived at the top of the cable car, and found this delightful restaurant, with spectacular views of the sea, the old town and the islands. Good value and excellent food for a potential tourist trap. We had grilled squid and a plate of delicious smoked local ham with a delightful local rosé wine. Cheerful staff and highly recommended. We walked down the mountain afterward. Further than it looks but well worth doing. Wear sensible shoes as the path is uneven in places!

First: get an Uber instead of the cable car to go up there. Much cheaper but note that not all Ubers want to go since the road is narrow and steep. We expected yet another tourist trap on top of the hill and just wanted drinks. We had cocktails for everybody which, as usual, were expensive and medium. We ended up eating dinner also and the food was really good. We had risotto and the buffalo salad. The cheesecake and apple pie for desert were forgettable. Service is friendly and the view is perfect.
We were very lucky to get a table at the front overlooking Dubrovnik, I'd recommend to reserve a table. We had drinks here, no food. The place had a lovely atmosphere. Staff were very accommodating.

We had reserved a table and were not disappointed when we arrived. We had a perfect table right on the edge of the hill, with the most amazing views, great service and lovely food. We could have spent the whole afternoon there. This was one of my favourite dining experiences and one I shall remember for a long time. Thank you to Anita and the team.
Our view was amazing, the views surrounding the restaurant are the best in Dubrovnik. However the food was average. We had good service and the atmosphere was great

We were pleasantly surprised to find such a beautiful restaurant at the top of Mt Srd. Of course we had no idea so did not have a reservation but they were able to find us a table for a quick drink and "snack".....when another guest left his table with a really wonderful view, they were nice enough to move us (even though we were paying our tab), so we stayed for another drink and enjoyed the gorgeous views. Everything here was perfect - the food, drinks and most of all the service and the views! Highly recommend visiting this restaurant if you are in Dubrovnik!!

Restaurant has panoramic view food excellent 
Service plus one we spent about 90 minutes and moment was enjoyable with the food and 
Outside view
We were slightly unhappy they never confirmed our booking and said come and try and fortunately got the table but at least three 
Tables were not occupied during 90days stay there any how this is not the big issue we had best time and enjoyed their food
We will go again as and when we get a chance to visit city again
At the end of the cable car ride was the panorama restaurant, very good service and lovely food, the views are good but crowded, price wise it's in line with most of Croatia a little expensive.
Sat down as the sun was setting, and it was a very nice experience. Good atmosphere and good service. The view is amazing.

As it was mid afternoon, we only had coffee, cake and drinks the service was great. We were given a table 2 rows from the edge, about 10 minutes later some people got up from the table with a great view, we asked if we can have that table, the staff were great, they cleaned the table and moved us so that we can have a better view even though we were having coffee and drinks.

We went for the sunset and had the best dinner in Dubrovnik. We were seated outside away from the edge of the raiiling, but a better table opened up and they moved our party of six for the best view of the city that we ever had. The dinner was excellent with a lot of variety and traditional and fresh seafood options. The waitress recommendation of a local Plavac Mali wine was spot on. Highly recommend a reservation, even before you get in the city, to make sure you get a great seat for the sunset.

We walked up the path to the restaurant and arrived at 12.30 for our reservation and was given a table right at the front which we had for 2 hours. The view was incredible. We had 2 large beers then 2 dishes - baby squid and a chicken salad, the squid was amazing the salad was nice but the chicken a little dry. We also had 2 glasses of wine and 2 coffees, the bill was £110 which was a lot but as a one off treat with that setting it was worth it.

The view alone makes the trip worthwhile. However, my family and I experienced top-notch service and food. It's a more expensive outing, but well worth it in our opinion. Definitely go if given the chance!

We decided to go to Croatia to celebrate our anniversary with our friends. The tour Croatian cycling laganini brought us to this fantastic restaurant. The food was great and the atmosphere was amazing. The trip was planned for us and it had so many great hidden surprises and this restaurant was one of them.

After hiking up (worth it if you're fit and able), to be greeted with a table with such a spectacular view was rewarding enough. Service was impersonal but efficient and we weren't rushed. We had light lunch menu items which were nice enough. The experience as a whole was well worth the premium.

We had made a reservation from UK and were promised a front row table for a two hour window, which is exactly what we got. The meal was good but pricey - but you are really paying for the spectacular view.

Beautiful setting and lovely food. We had a terrace table overlooking the Old Town. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the food was delicious. The linguine was cooked perfectly as were all our dishes.

We were late to our reservation due to the queues to get on the cable car (tip- purchase tickets in dubrovnik city, not at the cable car and allow yourself a load of time before going up. We were 45 mins to get a ticket and get up there), however the staff were absolutely lovely and we had a table with the most beautiful view! 

There was a few vegetarians options (not usually the case in Croatia!). I had the vegetable risotto and a side of rosemary potatoes which were delicious! Pudding was cheesecake and Dalmatian creme caramel -yummy! 

The waters were all really nice (esp Josip) and there was a button to press when we needed anything. Although the staff were so attentive and good at their jobs that we didn’t really have to press it! 

I would recommend it for anyone to have food up here. Epic is probably the only word to truly describe our table on the corner closest to the view. 

We had lunch cause dinner was booked out, so make sure you reserve to avoid missing out. It was the highlight of dubrovnik so would thoroughly recommend!

This location for a restaurant is superb get great views on one side of dubrovnik and lapad and on the other side you get a great view of mountains. The staff are super friendly and helpful. We didn't make a reservation and was asked to wait, about 5 minutes later they had sorted a table for us. We was expecting a much longer wait. The food is a little on the expensive side however is definitely worth it!

We arrived at the restaurant for a late lunch without a reservation. The staff were very friendly and efficient and found us a table without any problem. After a few minutes a prime viewing table became available and we were asked if we would like to move which we did. The views from the restaurant are spectacular. I had veal and my partner had pork. Both meals were excellent and reasonably priced. I thought the table buzzers for waiter service was a great idea. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here

We were a group of three couples. We arranged with our travel agent to book a table three weeks in advance and by doing so we were seated at the exact location we requested: right by the railing overlooking the Old Town. The meal was excellent. The service prefect. The view breathtaking.
Access to the top of the mountain is by cable car or motor vehicle. We took a cab to the top and it was scary/exhilarating: depending on your level of risk. Narrow road. Two way traffic. Switch backs. Driver liked speed more than comfort. (It was fun!) We took the cable car down and walked back to our hotel.
Be sure to arrive well before your dinner reservation so that you may tour the mountain top.

I pre-booked here for my wife’s birthday dinner. The communication beforehand was superb, the service from start to finish was class and the food was excellent. The views over Dubrovnik are special. Highly recommended restaurant.

Stopped here for a cold drink on a really hot day. Staff very friendly and the views amazing. While we did not have anything to eat the food that was being served looked delicious. However this Restaurant is not disabled friendly

We paid 20EUR for a bottle of water and 2 sodas. You're paying for the view for sure. 

Do yourself a favor, pack a snack and water and hike up the hill.

We had our final dinner here when visiting Croatia. I had made the reservation months in advance and was glad that I did. We got a great view in a private area. They have heaters and blankets available as a nice touch since it can get a little cold up there. The views are the best up there! Truly worth it to go and check out. Drinks were also amazing, I just wish the food could have been a little better. I ordered their steak and was left a little disappointed. But if you are looking for a romantic night with some great drinks this is the place for you!

This is a beautiful restaurant at the top of the cable car overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik from anywhere in the restaurant. There were heaters and blankets in thin open air restaurant. Food and service were excellent. Lovely evening.

Stunning views to go with some absolutely delicious food!

We caught the cable car 2 hours before sunset and managed to get a table right next to the windows, though you can sit outside.

Food was amazing, great service, friendly staff. Definitely something everyone should do visiting Dubrovnik!

You can exit the restaurant onto the cliffs to get a better look at the picturesque scenery afterwards.

We didn’t really get to enjoy our food much because it was so cold during our dinner. The wind was blowing in every direction and my hair was flying all over. It was also really dark. Thankfully the helpful staff brought us 2 heaters to keep us sufficiently warm. View was great but because we went too late, it wasn’t that spectacular. Recommend to go in the afternoon!

We decided we would get the cable car to Panarama for lunch. When we arrived it was very busy so we firstly ordered a drink. The service was fine and the pink bubbly we had was lovely but we felt that it was just a little too busy for us to have a long, relaxing lunch so we went back down to the Old Town. The views were wonderful and we did not regret going up and stopping for the drink we had.

The food was okay. The arrangement of the food was good. The service was not the best. They had no interest in us being there, it seemed. The view is amazing and I would definetly recommend going here.

Even though a little extravagant having a coffee or drink here is so worth it. Just to be able to relax and gaze at the view without the crowds around you is priceless. The staff are very friendly and professional and expect to be asked to take a photo which they happily do.

We arrived to the top via cable car and decided to go to the restraunt as planned. We did not reserve a table as it was late season. 
You MUST RESERVE A TABLE to be at the edge for the full view of Dubrovnik.
We were seated beside the serving station, it was a little disappointing. We constantly had servers beside our table, up and down. 
When one of the viewing tables became available, we asked to be moved but we're told they were all reserved. However, during our time in the restraunt, no one sat at the table!!

Apart from this, we ate the cheese board, mozzarella & tomato, and had a few drinks. We could not get comfortable for a full dining experience, so we had starters. The food was amazing, the service was great, location is awesome and sun set is spectacular. 
Bad table with lots of distraction and excuse me!

I believe, if you reserved your table by the railing for the view, this would be a 5 out of 5.

Food quality was good. The view- the restaurant's main selling point, was overrated, as the so called panoramic view is substantially blocked by the bulky cables of the cable car. Service was not so good as we felt maybe they were too busy and therefore forgot certain customers, for example, we asked one waiter to help us take a photo when he finish his work on hand, he simply forgot(oh maybe he really had lots of work to do, we have waited for like 15mins). They poured wine and offered wet wipes for other customers but not us. We expected some basic service yet we needed to remind them before they did it, like taking away the finished dishes. It was a disappointing dining experience as the service let us down.

Amazing views, delicious food, well worth the price and the trip up the mountain. Accessible by cable car (5 minute ride) or rocky walking paths. Best time to go would be during daylight so you can see everything although many go for the sunset. Highly recommend making a reservation so you can get the first row with a view of the old town. The second row gets a view of the ocean. Sometimes you can luck out as a “walk-in”. No dress-code for daytime, not sure about nightime. Portions were surprisingly generous, we were very full afterwards - but extremely satisfied! We had the Dalmatian ham and olive platter, octopus terrine as starters, then the Mediterranean squid and the grilled pork cutlet as main courses. 
Staff were very hospitable and offered to take our photo with the view in the background. 
After lunch we walked 100 metres to look-out points and to the Homeland War Museum.
Nice staff, beautiful lunch and incredible views of Dubrovnik and the horizon. Reserved in advance and had the table for up to 2 hours. Would love to go again if back in Croatia.

There is little more one can say than the prior reviews listed here. Stunning views of the old town and sunset. Great food and excellent service. Reservations should be made in advance. Uber is the best way to reach the restaurant, however the ride is exciting at dusk, and challenging in the dark.

We made our reservations about one month in advance, which probably has a lot to do with getting the very best table possible on the terrace! We got there at 6:15 to ensure we saw all stages of the sunset, which we did! Our food was very good, but the stars here are the view, overall experience, and the service. Our waiter offered to take pictures of us a few times and also brought us shawls when it got a chilly after the sunset. It was a very special, memorable night in Dubrovnik. :) Be sure to head up a little early to walk through the museum which covers the Siege of Dubrovnik... just a short walk from the cable car station.

username: The Tit: The Truth In Travel
review:
Getting to Panorama is easy. Up the tram. Getting back down their are options. We called an Uber. I think it was cheaper all together back to the Le Meridian. So think about that.

You have to experience the sunset at Panorama. We had drinks and dessert on a walk in. Our table was in back, but st least we could sit 5 down. Yes it is somewhat expensive, but the ambiance is worth it. Service is friendly and professional. Food was good too.

I saw a lot of tourists hanging on the slope of the mountain watching the sunset, free!!. A few had better views than the restaurants best seats, but you are sitting on a rock.

I researched this restaurant before we visited Dubrovnik, with the idea of eating here if we could. The Panorama is easily accessed via the Cable Car fro Dubrovnik Old Town. The views from here are Spectacular. 

The tiered seating at the Restaurant, ensures you have these fantastic views from your table. The food, wine and service were all perfect and would thoroughly recommend as a must for your visit.

Well done Panorama

I had the best birthday lunch there. Food was soo delicious especially the beef steak.
You can either get a cable car there or an Uber, so easily accessible and has amazing view on islands and old town.

I'd booked weeks ahead & had very speedy replies from Anita for my request of a front row table to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Thank you so much to the staff of the Panorama food ,service & view were all excellent this rounded off our short stay in Croatia to celebrate our anniversary.Hopefully be back some day & will book early again.
Great place to chill out and take in the views, get the steak sandwich, it’s one of the best I have had and wash it down with some local beer :)

We was here and celebrated my girlfriends birthday and we got the best table with the best view in the resturant. The staff was very kind and service minded and the view was amazing. Both the food and the dessert was very tasty.

Fantastic view, great drinks and food. Memorable experience. We had a sunset dinner view, reservations at 6pm. Highly recommended making reservations since
You may not get a table if you just walk in. We had a group of 8 people and our table was perfect spor overlooking the edge while still feeling safe.
Has impromptu lunch at Panorama and the food was very good but the views were spectacular. Worth a visit for lunch!

Title says it all really, to explain re. service issues, we waited for our table to be ready, which was fine since we were early. We'd been shown to an area to wait and told that someone would come and take a drinks order from us. We tried for 20 minutes to catch the attention of the staff who expertly avoided us. When we finally spoke to someone, he just said our table was nearly ready so to wait.
Once we were sat, we had a fantastic view for the sunset, the food was delicious and our service throughout dinner was attentive.
We paid the bill and left a generous tip (20%+), however, we hadn't said it was a tip so expected it to be brought as change for us to leave or not, as is our prerogative. We didn't see any of our waiters/waitresses once the bill was paid so it was not only assumed that the extra money was for service but they didn't come near is just in case it wasn't and we asked for the change. 
This just tarnished an otherwise enjoyable evening and to be honest, if our mood wasn't quite so jovial, I probably would have made a point of asking for the change despite my initial intention of leaving it as a tip. I didn't want to bring down the mood - much to the annoyance of my friends who were equally peeved.

We celebrated two birthdays when we were here and boy did they make it special. The waiters were super friendly and even provided a birthday song for the birthday ladies. And the food was INCREDIBLE. Wow. We were there a bit late though, because when I booked they didn't have anything available around sunset. So if you want the sunset view, you need to book far in advance ;)

We hiked up to the top of the hill and were very happy to find the Panorama Restaurant waiting for us. Friendly service, great food (burger was one of the best *anywhere*) and the views out over the city were spectacular. Lunch wasn't cheap, but we felt that we deserved it after that climb! (Also we took the cable car down, so 90 minutes up and 2.5 minutes down!)
If you are coming up in the cable car make sure you allow time to come here. Awesome food, great service and views to die for. Have lunch here or evening meal with sunset views, perfect!

We arrived an hour before sunset and after a short wait we were lucky enough to get a table however I would recommend booking. The attention to every detail in this restaurant was excellent and the atmosphere was very relaxed and comfortable. Ivan our waiter was top class. I had the steak and my friend had the lamb we both agreed it was one of the best meals we had ever had. Dessert was so rich and tasty. Best food experience in Croatia over our week. With the view and quality of food it was really great value and a priceless experience. It was a pleasure, thanks guys
Lovely view decent food although you have to come in a crowded cable car it is definitely worth it to sit up there and enjoy the wonderful view.

Booked a table for this place almost 2 months before the holiday as it looked so impressive. This definitely paid off as we got one of the best seats in the house (table 14). Such an amazing view (which i expected) but i was so pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food and service. The waiting staff were so good and would have done anything to accomodate us. They turned on some heaters for us and had blankets available if it gets colder in the evening which was a lovely touch. Would recommend trying to catch the sunset if possible. Such an amazing view of the city! A must do in Dubrovnik!
reservations mandatory but we got in for drinks just before sunset and the staff was excellent. the view is amazing and it is very popular.

The views from outside tables are incredible, but to get best tables you should make a reservation earlier. Starters, main course, desserts and cocktails for 2 people was 1065 croatian kuna (around 145 euros). It's pretty expensive but in our opinion it's worth it, both for the views and for the food quality.

Usually a restaurant with a view does not have very good food or it is horribly overpriced. I am happy to say neither is true at this restaurant. We had a party of 8 people and enjoyed a sunset meal. The cable ride up to the restaurant takes longer than you expect both because of the lines - people go to the top for the view on their own or to visit the museum or to have drinks in a separate area - glassed in cocktail lounge, and because it is an uphill walk of about 10 minutes from the main old town gate. Plan accordingly, especially at sunset - it can take an hour to get to the top.The majority of the time is because of standing in line. There are taxi drivers at the cable car line that will take you to the top for a reasonable fee and you can get the cable car down. You either pay for your tickets at a ticket booth halfway up the hill or wait until you get to the cable car station and see the extent of the lines. To get the view and pictures you have to be outside and the table seating area in the restaurant does put the cable car lines in most of your pictures - although with photo editing software you can get some of them out. All in all it was a good experience, a little stressful on the front end getting to the restaurant but ended well.
I cannot find words to describe this experience. The food was amazing, the view was breathtaking and the staff couldn’t be any more attentive. Fabulous and a must do for anyone visiting Dubrovnik

A funicular trip to the hill facing down the old town is highly recommended. Especially if you want to take photos. At sunset a perfect location. 
Prices are rather high. Please make a table reservation even for lunch e.g. as the waiters ask for it. Crowdy in high season.

I booked the restaurant as a romantic birthday treat for my wife. I setting is stunning with great views both directions, you would have to search very very hard to find a restaurant with a more spectacular background. I booked early evening to get the sunset as we were informed that it is spectacular and we were not disappointed. 
The restaurant may have spectacular views but if the food and service are not there it is a real letdown, fortunately this was not the case. We had booked well in advance to ensure we had a table, I would recommend this, it was easily possible using the email address. Our waiter Drazen was very helpful and attentive without being overbearing. The food was excellent, both my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the meal.

I would happily recommend this restaurant to family and friends, sometimes being in a great location the restaurant feels they don’t have to put the effort into the little things that matter, this is not the case in the Panorama.

On a side note we used Uber to get to the restaurant, far cheaper than the cable car and you can arrange a time rather than waiting extra time at the cable car.
