We got an uber up to Panorama for €10. We had a booking for late lunch at 4pm.We had a beautiful table, staff were amazing, food was top class and well worth the price. We both had burgers and they are delicious and huge, washed down with a few cocktails of course. Highly recommend this place and we would gladly return again and again

We visited the Panorama restaurant last week during our Dubrovnik city break and we loved it.
We went there using the cable car. Trip was short and views were worth it. We then managed to get a table for 2 on the ourtdoor terrace, even if we did not book it in advance. The views from there were outstanding. 
I ordered the prawns and my partner ordered the squid. Both dishes were very tasty, perfectly cooked and full of flavours. We thought that for food of such great quality, the price was very reasonable.

Since I first read about this restaurant, I knew I had to go and enjoy the beautiful views of the Old City. As expected, the views were just stunning but surprisingly, the food and service were absolutely wonderful. As the sun was setting, the waitstaff began to bring out heaters and pass out blankets - they definitely recognize how chilly it gets after the sun goes down. Make reservations in advance and go.......
The cable car takes you to the best view on the Adriatic and the restaurant serves good, reasonably priced food and drink while you soak in the view.

Amazing view of Dubrovnik from this location.
you can feel cool breeze after hectic hot humid day.
food is average and bit expensive too.

Gluten free friendly! Great gluten free bread and I loves that with the great olive oil, balsamic, and cheeseboard almost as much as lunch. Had an excellent lunch with my boyfriend here for my bday on vacation. Excellent service! Really the best in Dubrovnik. We loved our wine and food and the view was top notch.Prices are high as would be expected with this location and quality but very worth the experience. I highly recommend and it was one of my favorite experiences for our vacation together. Very romantic setting! Also huge thanks to the waiter for plugging my phone in to charge. 
Wish I had downloaded my awesome photos of our food but will include the 2 I have of the view and us on my phone.

We were absolutely determined we were going to have something here so that we could sit & enjoy the stunning views over the Old City walls. Obviously the prices aren't the cheapest but there are really quote a lot of seats & the menu was pretty good. As it was only mid morning, we settled for a drink. A hot day so I treated my self to probably the most expensive beer I've had at 60kn & my mum had a gorgeous iced coffee. Despite the price however, we were on holiday & the views were priceless. The tip were were given was that you could look down into the walls & see where the busy areas were. Would certainly recommend takin g binoculars

Great view of the city and greater Dubrovnik. Food was decent, no better or worse than a lot of the restaurants in the old town but the view is what makes the trip.
Good cocktails if that's your thing.
Best place to view Dubrovnik. Prices are high but what would you expect however you get a good level of service and staff are prompt and friendly

I really enjoyed my birthday dinner and drinks with friends at this Restaurant. Spectacular views across Dubrovnik Old Town on a perfect evening. The location, table setting, quality food and drinks, and delightful waiting staff combined with a divine sunset made this a birthday I won't forget.

The place is fabulous and the views are stunning. However, they keep all the nice tables with the views for people who are eating there so it is not a good idea to go there for drinks. they are pricey, not exceptional and you will have to wait a long time because all the waiters give priority to those having food. On top of that,there is a little tortoiseshell Kitten living there and it looked so thin and malnourished. If you are planning to visit, please take some cat food with you.

We booked in June and arrived at 6:15pm ready to watch the sunset with our meal. This was absolutely stunning and the service was another level of great too. Really feel like you’re special dining here.

What can I say, this restaurant and bar is in an absolute prime location. It is just stunning. The tables are well spaced out, despite being incredibly busy the staff there were incredibly attentive, funny and lovely. The food and drinks are not cheap as to be expected in Dubrovnik as a whole and also where you are in this prime spot, however the food was amazing. I had the beefsteak from the main menu as, recommended by the waiter and I couldn't fault it. Decent portion size and presented beautifully. The birthday lady had a free dessert with a decent birthday sparkler thing. If you can afford it then book in advance (we emailed the restaurant a week in advance) and go!

Stopped here for a cocktail, ended up staying for food. Enjoyed the chicken burger and my hubby had the beef burger and both were lovely. Service great, staff friendly and amazing views including watching the sunset. A must place to come for all visitors to Dubrovnik.

If you don’t eat even at 16:00 in the afternoon you will not have the chance to see the sea. They prefer to keep all seats seaside free instead of filling all the nice view seats. Even after 1h they are still empty...The price of the drink of course is the same. I am very disappointed I have to say.

We visited after looking up this restaurant on trip advisor. We took the cable car up to it and had booked a table by email in advance. 
We had a fabulous table on the terrace with a view over Dubrovnik and islands. 
The staff were friendly, polite and knowledgeable. No faults with the service at all.
The food was of high quality, fresh and tasty. We all loved the flavours and presentation. 
We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and are sad we are now home and missed the chance to go back! 
You must visit whilst in Dubrovnik the views and food are amazing!

We just had tea (light lunches served from 11!).
Some tables offer fantastic views.
Waiters really friendly. 
Didn't eat but prices comparable with some restaurants in old town.

Visited here for some drinks at sunset, was not ridiculously over priced and a good selection of drinks. 
Definitely worth taking a cardigan or something as it gets really windy up there!

Cable car to the top of the mountain and unbelievable views at the top.

Seated right at the edge of the cliff with an incredible view over dubrovnik and sunset!

Waiter was very helpful and friendly.

To be honest the experience was overwhelming and they could have served anything for dinner and I would be struggling to criticise.

Food was delicious though which topped it all off!

5* experience and a must do when visiting Dubrovnik.

A little more expensive than other places in dubrovnik however it was worth every penny!

Food was average staff were very good and great views only if you book early and ask for a balcony view

Unless you’re traveling by car remember to add the cable car cost at nearly £20 a person return, nothing much at the top unless you’re going to use the restaurant
We took the cable car up for the view and decided to stop in and get a drink and take it all in. I think they serve all three meals. Beautiful setting.

Booked this restaurant for our wedding anniversary and emailed in advance asking for a table with a view of the old town. We got seated right on the edge of the restaurant with fantastic views of the town below. We arrived early , not knowing how long the cable car takes to get up and how busy it would be. We were seated an hour early after a beautiful sunset which meant we made the cable car back down which was perfect. 
Service was 1st class , you get a button to press for service meaning you never have to try and catch the waiters eye or wait to order, equally there’s no pressure to ‘panic order’. 
Food was top drawer and atmosphere was great, chilled out with lots of people celebrating birthdays, anniversary’s etc.

If coming here I would recommend booking in advance (and asking for a table with a view) , also recommend getting the cable car as the road up is apparantely awful, this was according to our Uber driver and a couple who drove up seated next to us. Having said that, on our way out we went up to the indoor seating area and the views from their are just as good if not better!!

This was the last night of our visit to Dubrovnik and was the perfect ending , great service, great food and very nice cocktails!

We stopped here mid-morning for iced coffees which were delicious. The service was exemplary and the view breathtaking. We would have liked to have had lunch there but you have to book at least a day in advance. Visit the War Museum while you’re on Mount Srd. It’s harrowing but very thought-provoking.
We had the most beautiful lunch with the most stunning view I can’t recommend going here enough loved it!
Very nice but very expensive for a drink. I think c. £25 for a beer, coke and spritzer. Sure you get what you pay for. Think hotel prices

My wife and I took the cable car up to the Panorama to experience the superb view of both sides of Dubrovnik. Whilst we didn’t experience the Restaurants menu as it was mid morning we did have a very enjoyable coffee. The restaurant did however become extremely busy at the lunchtime sitting and we subsequently noticed a lot of clientele using the cable car access early evening for meals.
If you have booked a table for a certain time would really suggest you plan ahead as there can be a 45min cue if using the cable car. 
A worthwhile visit during the daytime to experience the panoramic views beneath.

This was BY FAR the best customer service I received while eating anywhere in Dubrovnik. From the front desk, to the service inside they were impeccable. My reservation was for 9pm and I was brought in right away. I had an awesome seat on the patio with the most incredible view. I really like that they have the button on the desk so you don't have to always signal the waiters if you need something, you just press the button. 

I had the terrine, the squid and then the MOST AMAZING chocolate cake. You have to try it.

We took the cable car up to check out what is considered the best view of Dubrovnik and decided to stay and enjoy a cocktail and some dessert. 

I can honestly say I was very underwhelmed about the service at the resturant, the first server was very rude when we requested a table overlooking the view advising the remaining tables (at least 3) where booked at 5.30....we arrived at 4pm so ample time for a cocktail/cake before the booking and very reluctantly she gave us a table. 

I ordered the walnut/chocolate cake and it had a very bland flavour which was not impressive at all and my husband ordered the chocolate mouse which was also nothing special, cocktails were pina coladas and they were just ok, adequate rum but not enough pineapple so balance was a bit off but service was terrible, we had to wait almost 30mins for them to bring our order.

Considering the price of our minimal order (200kn) I would recommend saving your money and eating at a resturant in the old town as the quality will be a lot better and not as commercialised - there are a few viewing platforms beside the cafe/resturant where you can enjoy the view instead.

Visited Panorama restaurant for my birthday with a couple of friends. It was the best bday dinner I've ever had, not only thanks to the excellent food and breathtaking view, but to the staff. In general, the people from Dubrovnik are extremely friendly and welcoming, but the staff at the Panorama restaurant is on the next level. Thank you so much for the wonderful bday experience!
fantastic views. only came for drinks but pretty expensive but well worth worth it for the views and a one off experience

I had booked this restaurant via email for our last night. 
The email exchange was straight forward and very helpful- the manager even emailed on the day as the cable car was suspended for a few hours because of wind. Luckily it was back up and running by the evening! We arrived about half an hour early, went around the fort which is definitely worth a visit. It was a quiet time- around half 8, then we sat on the terrace and ate our dinner with an amazing view. 
The food was very good. The service very good. With the blankets and heaters it was very cosy! 
It was expensive but so much of Dubrovnik is, at least here you felt you were really paying for good food in a fantastic location!

Booked in advance to get a table outside next to the railings. Amazing food and service, along with stunning views of Dubrovnik old town. Must visit during trip. We got a taxi - if travelling by cable car for dinner at sunset, expect long queues (30-40 min wait). One of the best dinners we have ever had.

You need to make a dinner reservation at least a week in advance, but if not you can take cable car up and stand at high top tables for drinks. The only downfall is only the "front" 4 tables have a view really. (Well of the sunset). You can sneak or push your way to the front to snap a couple photos or just get there earlier. Or have a drink then post up on the public terrace above the cable car station. Also, don't forget the mountain view behind you! But place was lovely and service was very friendly and not pretentious at all!

Yes it was just that, perfect, on a hot day in August. The tables are set on a variety of different level, each with fantastic views if the Old City. The staff are smart, the tablecloths are crisp and the service is smooth and fast - all with a smile. Sitting in the shade of a huge umbrella and staring over the city to the ocean, I knew I was on holiday and enjoying every minute if it, I was at peace.

The menu was wide and food matched the surroundings, excellent.

Of course it was not cheap but average by Dubrovnik standards.
So, the view is amazing, the food is amazing, the service is amazing. Love the little button to call a waiter when you are ready to order. Price are reasonable considering the location
Although its very expensive it has amazing wiew to the town and very good service. Not for everyday tourist.

breathtaking views of Dubrovnik, and very good food as well, worth the visit. A pity cablecar was out of service, since the road up is not ready for 2 way traffic. Still great experience and highly recommended when in Dubrovnik. We went for lunch as evenings where fully booked so we missed sunset. Recommend to book. week in advance in summer

I visited Panorama Restaurant on a recent backpacking trip to Croatia, and the view certainly lived up to the hype! Make sure you book well in advance and request a table on the edge for the best views! The staff were extremely friendly and took excellent care of me as a solo traveler. As I was traveling on a tight budget, this was my big splurge on the trip and it was worth every penny!

As is our custom we wanted to have a Bellini to cap off our holiday. Although the restaurant was booked, the host offered us a table for a half hour to enjoy a drink and the incredible view. The service was friendly, professional and patient; our server must have taken 10 different photos of us to get the money shot. Unfortunately for us, we booked dinner elsewhere and had to leave. Next time we're in Dubrovnik we will be sure to book Panorama.
Lovely restaurant/bar/cafe. Not the cheapest place in the area, but you won't beat the views. We had a lovely table overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik.
Amazing food with beautiful view of both Hagia Sofia and blue mosque. We ordered lamb stew with eggplant and it was really good. We like it a lot!

My visit to the Panorama Restaurant on Mount SRD was completely unplanned. Initially, I had just gone up the mountain to enjoy the sprawling views of Dubrovnik for free, but the spectacular sunset that accompanied the views deserved a lovely drink to match.

So I decided to pop into this restaurant for that particular reason, however, because of its unmatched location with uninterrupted views of the city, my expectations were that it would be more expensive than the already expensive restaurants in the Old Town. I was quite surprised to find that the pricing wasn’t all that far off from the pricing in the Old Town and it just made more sense for me to pay the price with a heavenly view at least.

Although I hadn’t made a reservation and the best seats were taken for most of sunset hour, once people began to leave the staff was courteous enough to move me to the empty spots with a view without me having to ask.

From first impressions, it seems as though this restaurant makes sure that its patrons are well taken care of regardless of the amount that was spent and that says a lot about who they are.

I would highly recommend them!
We just stopped for drinks, the waiters were knowledgeable about the wines and brought blankets and heaters as the evening got a bit chilly
Went there in taxi as cable car wasn't running, quite a scary ride up but worth it, we went there at sunset, the views are incredible and the food was great, its a must to do

I absolutely loved this restaurant. My only pet peeve literally we’re the family of four cats sitting underneath my chair my whole dinner. The staff were really sweet to try and calm me down but maybe they should have offered me a free glass of wine or something to ease my sky high anxiety from severe fear of cats. My friend made a bunch of comments but they didn’t pick up not one of them. Other than that prepare for an awesome meal and the most magnificent views. Make sure to make a reso before your trip for first row. It’s the only place to be!

My husband and I ate here for our anniversary meal whilst visiting Dubrovnik. You can get the cable car up, which we did but just be mindful there can be a bit of a queue for it (I think we queued for about 35 mins) because everyone wants to get up and see the sunset. The restaurant itself is so lovely, helpful staff and really good wine. The food was nice, not amazing but good. The setting is just simply stunning. Ask for a table on the terrace so you can see the views to really maximise your experience. It’s quite an expensive restaurant so I wouldn’t go again unless it was a special occasion like this.

Just atop the cable car is the best view of Dubrovnik! We were there early in the day (kitchen doesn’t open until 11) but we had beer/wine and they have an extensive drink menu. We found the service to be good and they take credit cards in case you do not have cash on hand. The view is breathtaking and they have large umbrellas to protect you from the hot sun.

With our trip to Dubrovnik all planned I needed to surprise the wife for her birthday. From the instant response to my booking request from Anita, I knew we were in for a treat. What a treat it was. Friendly welcome, excellent service, magical view and superb food. After forgetting the wife’s birthday last year🙈 I am back on even ground. An incredible night for the six of us holiday makers. The highlight of our trip and a must for anyone going to Dubrovnik. Thank you team.
Great service, kind staff, delicious food ( especially the lasagne!!) and a fabulous view over the Adriatic! Would definitely return!!

This is a magical place for lunch set high on top of the hill with a spectacular view! The tables are perched on the edge of the cliff overlooking the ancient city and the entire bay but not closely packed together. 
The food was very good especially for a tourist spot. Light lunch fare from sandwiches to salads but fresh and very enjoyable!
A not to be missed experience!

This is a great place to have a meal with outstanding view of the d town. You would only want to eat there if you are planning to take tge cable car to the top. The food is great , the prices are higher but reasonable considering the location and the view. Friendly staff

My boyfriend took me up in the cable cart to this restaurant for my birthday! We were seated in “the best seated table on the mountain” overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik and it was completely breathtaking. I highly recommend anyone to take a trip up to here for dinner and especially at night time! Utterly amazing!
They gave us a buzzer to alert the waiter if we needed them, but this was never neccessary. Service was the best was have experienced in Dubrovnik and would recommend the octopus terrine!

We had lunch (dinner-like) at 16.00 with a table with amazing view over Dubrovnik. 
Really good food and drinks, and so nice staff! We booked a table 3 days in advance.

After lunch we went to the old city and walked on the city walls in the sunset. Great choice!

We took Uber to the restaurant (cheaper than the cable), and cable down.

Went for the view and this restaurant managed to fit me in. Great service. Note-100% get a reservation in advance. Ask for a view. Breath taking in evening .

Food was great. I had the veal in mushroom sauce risotto and ended up having second dessert after my friend said his was the best apple pie he’s had. Mushroom sauce was the best I’ve had. The deserts were amazing also. 

Service was great. Best service I had in Dubrovnik all trip. Always checking in on us. 

Prices for the light lunch are good the evening menu (6pm) a little more expensive same with the drinks. I had no issue with this because let’s face it we’re paying for the view. ( which is breath taking) The great service and great food are the bonus. Highly recommend a sunset visit.

Any trip to Dubrovnik must involve a visit to the Panorama Restaurant. The views of the Old Town, Lokrum Island and surrounding are are simply stunning! Also recommended that if you wish a Old Town view you book in advance. Should also mention that a visit to the war museum situated near the restaurant is well worth while and very sobering.

Hiked up...so was a bit sweat etc and thought this top class looking place was going to be expensive based on the views and surroundings + professional looking staff but very pleased with the food, staff and value for money.
The service was great, food was tasty but the servings were huge. We were there for the sunset. You must book if you want to eat, however, no reservations are needed just for drinks at the bar.

It's more than just an excellent dining experience. The cable car ride, the location, the views, the food, the service, the sunsets (obviously on an evening). All in all, a really great experience, highly recommended. So glad we did it. Need to book in advance, correspondence was excellent.

After rushed arrival into the city & cable car ride to see the sunset we just about made it & were rewarded with an amazing meal & service - best of our trip. The waiters & Ivana on front of house were fabulous & moved us to a table with a spectacular view for desert , unprompted & very much appreciated.. don’t visit Dubrovnik without trying this bar / restaurant

We took the cable car up around 11am (meaning it wasn’t too busy). There wasn’t a table available immediately on the side with the spectacular views of old town & Lokrum, however we were moved to a table around 20 minutes after arrival to enjoy the remaininder of our drinks. We had 2 cocktails for around 180 kuna, so not the cheapest of drinks but certainly worth it to sit and enjoy the breathtaking view! Cannot vouch for the food as it was a little too early for us to enjoy lunch here.

Had a lunch booking . The lunch menu had a good selection on it . I felt my choice chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries was only just average unfortunately . Others in the group really enjoyed there chicken sandwich’s 

The views the service was all excellent and I would still say you need to go

I got the cable car up which has a great view of the city to have dinner at this restaurant. The food was amazing (recommend the Tuna Steak), tasted some of the sea bass as well which was lovely, the service was great and it is expensive but worth it for the view of the sunset! There was a long queue for the cable car after the sun sets as everyone wants to go back down, so don't hang around!

The view of old town dubrovnik from this restaurant is stunning! Definitely make a reservation in advance! The staff are very pleasant and helpful if you don’t have one. I tried to make one for dinner (that’s when everyone says the view is the best, for sunset) but they were all booked up. We decided to do lunch instead and it was still amazing! Our table was a little too much in the sun, so the staff let us move tables to one more in the shade which was very nice. We got the cheese plate appetizer, seafood linguine and salmon main course, all very tasty. Of course the prices are higher than most restaurants, but the view and service make up for it.

Reservations are required to see the sunset. Leave at least by 7 pm to catch it as there is lots of traffic. Take a cab as the funicular line is too long; We took it on the way back down. Food is very good. Service was excellent. This is a must for your visit to Dubrovnick!!!
Well worth visiting as lovely chilled out music playing in background and nice to get a bit of shade and look down on the old town

This could have been the biggest rip off in town if they had wanted to. Instead they aim for great service and delivers some really nice food. Although we were only there for a light lunch and not there dinner, the hamburger and Greek salad were both nicely done. The burger might as well be best in town on a good day. Would come back for dinner even without that breathtaking view.

After climbing the mountain we went to Panorama restaurant for a light lunch. The lunch was really good. I had the Greek salad and the cheese was surprisingly good- probably the best cheese I’ve eaten in a long time. The staff were very service minded and super friendly. The view was amazing, it was breathtaking. Dubrovnik is really beautiful and to see it from above was a great experience.

The absolute highlight of our short trip to Dubrovnik, will definitely return to this restaurant. Amazing location, superb food and fantastic service from the staff. We were made to feel very special. It’s not the cheapest restaurant, however it’s absolutely value for money!
This is one of the best restaurants i have visited in Dubrovnik. It has great food and drinks. The panoramic view is breathtaking.

Came for a late lunch at 4pm. The restaurant is beautiful, make sure you book in advance to avoid disappointment! We got a fantastic table right at the edge of the terrace and the views were amazing. The food/drinks are great but very pricey (cheapest bottle of wine is equivalent to £35). The staff are lovely and very attentive. 

The experience as a whole is very expensive if you include the cost of the cable car ride up, but is definitely worth it. Was definitely one of my main highlights of my holiday.

This restaurant is really romantic and well worth the visit. It’s not overly expensive either compared to the old town prices. They made my birthday really special with cake and a song. Thanks for the great experience

Booked a table for an evening meal. This was our best meal of the holiday and only improved by the view. If you’re looking for a stunning setting with food to match this is the place. You need to book as it’s extremely busy. To watch the old town light up as the sun sets is incredible. This should be on everyone’s bucket list for Dubrovnik.

Amazing!!! I would usually expect something like this to be a tourist trap. Get you cornered, charge you heaps and give you terrible food. This was completely opposite. 4 tables ahead of us waiting but we only waited 10 minutes. Great seats, great service and the food was some fantastic. The view is unbelievable but do yourself a favour and have lunch and a drink there. You wont be disappointed.

I decided to come here after reading the reviews and wasn't disappointed!

When making my reservation, I specified that I wanted a table on the terrace that overlooked the Old Town below. I recommend finding out beforehand what time the sun sets so you can time your reservation so it coincides with the sunset. The views were amazing as we watched the sky go from blue to orangey-purple to dark navy.

We ordered a pasta carbonara and sea bass fillet with shellfish and leeks. The carbonara was just the right amount of creamy without being too rich. They were generous with the sea bass fillets and the leek and beurre blanc sauce paired perfectly. 

Service was fantastic and we liked how they came round to offer blankets to tables as the evening weather cooled. 

Would suggest getting an Uber up and down as it's cheaper than getting the cable car.
Beautiful views, wines, food...experience. The restaurant overlooks the city of Dubrovnik. There is not a bad seat in the house.
Must visit place in Dubrovnik - tasty food, very friendly and attentive staff. And of course very romantic place with stunning views.

Beautiful restaurant! Simply stunning views .
We had cocktails & my son had a beef toasted club sandwich which looked & smelt divine, cocktails were the best & having the “ buzzer” to connect with your waiter was great ... especially for a 12 year old!
Would love to have gone back for a night meal here.

The whole experience is simply amazing and definitely worth a visit. You have to make a reservation in order to get a good table with view over basically all of Dubrovnik, preferably around 6-7 pm to see the sun, sunset and Old Town by night. 
The food and the service is by far the best that we have experienced this summer. 5/5

To get a table with the best views I booked about a month in advance. I was able to secure a table on the terrace but not with a city view. A little disappointed but still the sunset would be amazing. On arrival we were so lucky. Even the waitress was excited for us. Someone had just cancelled, and we now had the best seat in the house as far as views are concerned. We had the table right on the edge, featured on the website and were absolutely over the moon. The staff were amazing. The food was delicious and worth every penny. The sunset was amazing, and Dubrovnik lit up as the sun went down. To top it off there was a firework display in the distance just before we left. The whole evening was a wonderful experience. 
Highly recommended

I booked this way in advance because i knew from the photos online this would be a great spot for dinner as it had the best sunsets overlooking Dubrovnik. We hada seat by the edge and the food was brilliant - we were up there from 5pm to 20.30pm so we had time to relax by our table and take in the most incredible views of Dubrovnik and afar. We had some lovely drinks to start, then some bread,, half hour later we ordered our meal, Risotto and the Steak, both were delicious!!! Then we turned around and relaxed taking in the incredble sunset over Dubrovnik. so luck to have the best seat in the house as many people were coming up the cable car to get pictures 

The staff were very good, great service, heaters and blankets for relaxing and enjoying the views. Please expect to pay good money but with good money comes great service, food and views. Please PLEASE put this restaurant and views on your list

After walking/crawling up Mount Srdj we decided to treat ourselves at the restaurant. A bit pricey but we felt we deserved it. The wait for a table was short, we were looked after very well by the excellent staff and the food was beautiful. We both had the Dubrovnik cutlet and a side of grilled veg, then a cheesecake and apple pie. The waiter also gave us a complementary pear liquor of some kind which was lovely. It’s not somewhere where you could eat every day but for a special occasion or a reward after climbing the mountain it’s well worth it.

Very nice restaurant, the food is so tasty; and non-alcoholic drinks were amazing.
Staff are very friendly and can assist you in choosing your favorite food.
Better to book ahead of time if you want to enjoy the sunset.
You can reach the restaurant by cable-car or by standard car through a unique mountain road.

You should never miss this place when you visit Dubrovnik. You will stay at least 3 hours

The views are obviously amazing! The food is good but it’s not the best ever. About an 8.2 on the food and the drinks were great about a 9.2. We had an appetizer and the prawns which were a lot for two people. Over all the service was great we spend about 100 US dollars but it was worth the experience.

Having walked up Mount Srd in extremely hot conditions, we were delighted to find this restaurant at the top. The view, food and waiters were all fantastic. The waiters were even kind enough to suggest that we move to a table with a better view when this was vacated. Would definitely visit this restaurant again.
Lunch was great and the view was amazing! Staff was friendly and accommodating. A very enjoyable experience!

We kept reading mixed reviews about pre booking etc...
We decided just to take our chances. We arrived at 1ish and asked if we could have a table for drinks. We were accommodated quickly and were happy with where we were seated. After 10 minutes a waitress told us that a table had become available with a better view!! We moved and yes it was lovely. We had our wine and coffees and were so pleasantly surpised.
Lovely, couldnt fault it. Views to die for!!!

Nice place, definitely book in advance. I didn’t realise that for a normal mixed drink you had to buy the spirit and the soft drink separate. So it nearly ends up basically the price of a cocktail which is silly.

Our 1st class experience with Panorama Restaurant began with Anita in Reservations. She was extremely helpful and flexible with our timing for dinner as we were delayed returning from an late afternoon excursion to Bosnia. The gentleman maître d' at the check-in desk (name began with S) was also most accommodating given our tardiness. Needless to say, we enjoyed a wonderful terrace dining experience at sunset with outstanding and attentive servers.

We arrived as a group of 4 here at the Panorama Restaurant after our cable car trip. We only had to wait 30 minutes before getting a table to have excellent food. Would highly recommend it. Delicious and great service.
We went up with the cable car to have some drinks prior to our dinner in the Old Town. Well worth a visit, the scenery is amazing and drinks very nice.

Make sure to make a reservation weeks in advance. Book for the 6.30pm dinner sitting to enjoy the sun set also. The food was delicious but on the expensive side...but it’s definitely worth the experience. Take an Uber up rather than the cable car, it’s way cheaper and you avoid the crowds jamming into the cable car. 

It’s a great way to unwind at the end of the day and take in some breath taking views.

Had a gorgeous meal a lovely drinks! Make sure you bring loads of money with you as the drinks and puddings will flow! Our waiter - Daniel - was amazing! If you have the time and want that awesome view, definitely come to Panorama!

Coming from Scotland where we have many good restaurants including seafood restaurants which are reasonably priced I have to give this 3 stars . The views were amazing and the waiting staff very attentive but the food was good but not excellent !

It was very easy to make reservations and receive confirmation as to date/time. The views are breathtaking. We had a mix of dining experience as the grilled salmon was very good but the risotto was quite poor.
Lovely spot to sit and relax for a few hours after the sightseeing. Service was fantastic, food excellent and the views breathtaking.

Booked table months ago by email and restaurant were very good communicating with me. We got an amazing view and we were able to watch the sunset from our tables . Staff were very friendly and really accommodating to take photos.

Food was nice but I do think the food is v pricey.

We had to wait for a table by the edge, which we had no issues with because we could tell it would be worth it and we were not wrong! We got as promised a table right by the edge overlooking the old town and the glorious surrounding landscape. We went at lunchtime, it was busy but efficient and the staff were excellent. Both got the Burger which was cooked medium and tasted great, that coupled with a pint and a glass of white wine and we were set. A little bit more expensive than a standard restaurant of course, but absolutely no complaints. It was the perfect end to our visit of Dubrovnik.

We booked this restaurant nearly a month before the set date based on the reviews it has. It did not disappoint. Amazing views from the top, great food and excellent service and reasonable priced. Highly recommended.

On the last day of our holiday, we decided to finally check out the supposedly amazing view from Panorama - we weren’t disappointed! The view was spectacular and really made the meal all the more enjoyable. The food was very tasty (if a little expensive but you pay for the view I guess) and our waiter was charming. We shared the apple pie for dessert and that was delicious!

We loved this restaurant. Even though we had a table on the second row, we had great views out to Lokrum and could also see the Old Town relatively well.

The food was excellent - my friend had the veal and I had the King Prawns Panorama - the prawns were possibly the largest I've ever seen and the sauce was incredible (thank heavens for the bib!) Service was very good as well. 

Would definitely recommend and would return to if back in Dubrovnik.
Fantastic spot for a bit to eat. Lovely food and attentive service. Amazing views over the city walls from our terrace table. Very peaceful. Well worth the 170kuna on the cable car to get here.

We booked a table before we arrived in order to guarantee a table as it gets rather busy in the evenings in the summer. Communication with them via email was very easy.

We caught the cable car up to the restaurant, the views were something else! Such a beautiful place for a restaurant. When we arrived we were surprised with a front row table with the most incredible view. We can’t thank them enough for this! 

The food was amazing, it all tasted so fresh and the quality was brilliant!

The service was great, we didn’t feel rushed at all but they were very efficient and friendly. 

We were happy to pay a more as it was our anniversary but for the quality of the food we would be more than happy to have paid more for it. 

We would definitely want to come back - we loved it!

"Fancy" restaurant with a semi tacky feel (piano versions of pop songs and classic Croatian interior) but really polite staff and its clean and nice inside. Ordered a burger and Greek salad, the burger was well well done and the salad small but good. The view is stunning the air con is brutal. 
I wanted to sit opposite of my boyfriend next to the window but was told that it wasn't allowed. So we had to sit really closely crammed together, there was a lot of space so I have NO idea why it was forbidden hahaha

I spent some time here since I was waiting for the sunset. I thought the food was delicious (ordered roasted vegetables - all were delicious). The view is priceless but that is really true of every place/activity in Dubrovnik.

We traveled to Croatia July 2019 and celebrated my Birthday Part II at the Panoramic Restaurant. We didn’t have a reservation but the manager was super nice and was able to find a way to accommodate us. 

The experience starts right when you ride the gondola, the ride itself was very memorable. We arrived before sundown and left right after the lights were turned on at the Walled City that we can see from our table. The view is absolute spectacular and hard to beat. The food maybe overpriced but everything we ordered from the appetizer to the dessert was super delicious and very well presented. The servers were polite and attentive. 

Highly Recommend!

We went here for a late lunch/early dinner, the serve lunch until 6 p.m which is great. The waiter was really serviceminded and moved us to a table with the best view as soon as it was available. Prices are OK, 130 Kuna for a really good burger is not that bad, add the splendid service and the fantastic view and it is actually really worth it.

No doubt we will be back when visting Dubrovnik the next time, the it will be for a late night dinner.

Great location, views are outstanding. Lunch menu was limited with very little gluten free options. Salad only really. The waiters were lovely and friendly but unaccommodating when asked to amend menu options to make them more gf friendly. Refused to serve dishes with removed or replaced elements making it difficult to choose what I would have liked to eat. Having said this, I had the blue cheese and apple salad which was nice. Need to pre book before you arrive which we did about 3 days before we wanted the table. Still give it 4 stars though as other people in our family had lovely food and enjoyed their meals

l booked the restaurant as a surprise for my girlfriend for Monday 1st July 2019 when we where on holiday. l book us a sea view at the terrace it is a must and l strongly recommend emailing in advance in order to get a sea view to watch the sunset it was absolutely stunning. 

The whole experience was outstanding, l wish we got our servers name who was fantastic. He made us feel so welcome and at the end of our meal he even recommended a special cocktail which was a lovely. 

My girlfriend and l agreed that this was the highlight of our trip

It is a must in Dubrovnik

This was the first of our lovely meals we had in Dubrovnik. We were lucky to get a table with a view as we hadn't booked. 

The menu was varied and they tasted divine. Service was impeccable and staff incredibly friendly. Not too pricey either compared to other establishments we'd eaten in.

We had a nice table with the view of Dubrovnik, although in the evening for dinner it is not as impressive as during the day. It can get chilly later in the evening. The staff was very nice and attentive. The menu is not very interesting, the dishes came so quickly that I suspect were prepared in advance and warmed up. Same with the desserts, they are all prepared sitting in the fridge, I did not enjoy a cold out of fridge apple pie. I can recommend this place for nice view and atmosphere, also you need to add 170 kunas per person for the cable car to get there, which makes the dinner expensive.

Amazing view from the top of mount srd but it’s very expensive so we decided to just have drinks. It was a little disappointing there wasn’t a great spot to view the sunset but overall enjoyed it. The cable car line can be really long so we took an Uber up and it actually turned out to be cheaper then the cable car one way down, but the road is pretty narrow and not for the feint of heart.

This is one of the most memorable meals I'll ever have. The setting and scenery are unreal and photos don't do it justice. The food was also excellent along with the service. We were a group of 9 celebrating our joint 40th with a trip to Croatia. We went here on our last night and it was the perfect ending to our holiday. I booked a table for 18.30 so that we would be there for the sunset. We were told in advance we had to leave our table by 20.45 but they kindly let us keep our table. Highly recommend for anyone.

This was one of the most memorable meals of my life. The experience from start to finish was nothing short of outstanding. The view is phenomenal, but was matched by the level of service, as well as the food. Frequently we've found that restaurants with a unique quality (like a phenomenal view/location) tend to be underwhelming in other aspects and do not deliver when it comes to quality of food. Every single person in our group of seven enjoyed an absolutely outstanding dish (I had the sea bass, my husband had the risotto and beef. We each scraped our plates clean). Their desserts (particularly the chocolate mousse they had that evening) were delicious. When the evening got a bit chilly as the sunset, they offered blankets to each person at our table. 
Special shoutout to Josip and Sinisa for their service during our experience, and to Anna for helping us arrange our reservation. This dinner was a celebration of two anniversaries, one birthday, and the final meal of our Croatia/ Slovenia trip. They made the experience unforgettable.

Can I just start by saying what amazing views are at the top of this restaurant. The name does not lie! 
Service was lovely, I wish I could remember the name of our waiter to give him a special shout out. He was so accommodating and even took pictures of my group with the views in the background. 
The food was lovely! We went for lunch and ordered three burgers and a greek salad and there are absolutely no complaints here! The food was lovely, and drinks were cold on a scorching hot day! 
We booked online for a 2:30pm lunch, on the day I still had not had a confirmation email of our booking. I checked my junk mail and there was an email from them confirming my booking for 3pm which I responded to say that 3pm was fine. When we got there my boyfriends mum went to check us in, only to be told that my booking had been changed and was now for 4pm. We complained and they accommodated us and we were seated by 3:10pm (with lots of empty seating round us, so why the booking had been changed, I do not know). From then on we had an amazing experience at this restaurant! 
The restaurant has a lot of lavender bushes around it which attracts bumble bee's, although they keep themselves to themselves :)
We took the cable car to the Panorama Restaurant and we weren’t disappointed. Fantastic views and lovely food. Great service and a relaxed atmosphere. Highly recommended.

We visited Dubrovnik from a nearby smaller town and decided to take the cable car rather than walk the wall as it was hot and busy. So glad we did! We hadn’t booked but secured a table for 4 with fantastic views. The lunch menu was fairly basic and we thought it might be overpriced but we were very wrong! The food was amazing, service was fabulous and the view was something else! Yes it cost £100 for a family of four for lunch but worth every penny and put a smile on our faces. Will be the highlight of our trip to Croatia which other than Dubrovnik has been pretty disappointing in terms of service, friendliness and food quality. Not this place though the service was fab thank you!!

Took our 6 and 2 year old girls up the hill on the cable car around 6 for a wander and sunset view. Managed to bag a great table without reservation and staff looked after us well. A great carbonara for the girls, superb sirloin steak and lovely tuna. Mango daiquiri also a huge hit in a beautiful spot. Gorgeous experience

In case you didn't know, it's pretty hard to find a decent restaurant in Dubrovnik. Everything is really overpriced and the level of the food is mediocre at best. And then there's Panorama. Obviously, it is not the cheapest choice but at least the food is prepared carefully and tastes great. Also the service is impeccable. We visited this place both for lunch and dinner, surprisingly enough we couldn't order a single disappointing dish - everything was good. The waiters had also good knowledge of the local wines and recommendations were spot on. So, if you end up in Dubrovnik and just feel mad about eberybody trying to rip you off, take the cable car to Panorama and at least you get one good meal on your holiday!

We arrived somewhere in the afternoon, after taking the cablecar. We didn’t know of the restaurant, but where stunned by the view. We first stopped there for drinks, but decided to also eat there. Since it’s quite crowded there (certainly places with a good view) a reservation was in order, which we didn’t have. After some shifting with chairs and tabels, a place near the side was created for us. We were very lucky and want to thank the staff for going the extra mile. It really made our day!

What a beautiful place! We took the cable car and stumbled over the restaurant with the most stunning views of Dubrovnik! We were in awe! 

The staff were welcoming and friendly. We managed to get moved to a better table upon request without any fuss, they were lovely.

The views were indescribable. The photos do not do it justice. This place is special. A perfect place for a romantic occasion, or proposal.

The food was delicious, we had salads which were great. If booking, which is advisable, try to get a table for sunset, so seated by 7pm. Tables 12, 13 and particularly 14 had the most impressive views. Here is the view from table 2...

We had read about the restaurant here and I tried to book a table overlooking the city for an evening meal a few days in advance but couldn't get anything earlier than 9.30pm. So I decided on a lunchtime instead. I had great communication with the restaurant t via email and secured a lunch booking at 12.30pm. 

We were a bit late as the cable car queue was a bit long so I emailed again and asked them to wait for is and they did.

When we arrived, we had the most stunning mountainside table with views over the whole city. It's a very romantic setting. 

The lunch menu was small but absolutely fine and we enjoyed some sandwich lunches with a couple of frozen pina coladas which were truly delicious.

We did not want to leave. Our waiter took lovely pictures of us with the view behind us.

This was a "once in a lifetime" location for a meal and I wont ever forget it.

The service, food and views of this restaurant are what sets it apart! A booking is definitely needed, we went on a Saturday lunchtime (booking was made on the Tuesday), as it is very popular which is unsuprising. No discount with the Dubrovnik card (although there sister restaurant/cafe at the bottom of the Old Town does offer a discount.

Their was one problem in that all of the sandwiches except for the Vegetable one (which one of our party ordered) come with chips. It doesn't really make any sense why the vegetable one doesn't come with them so one of of party had to pay extra for a side of chips. So not a full 5 star rating unfortunately. The seafood linguine was amazing as was the tofu dish, slightly pricy but expected as the service and views are amazing.

Go during the sunset! There was a big thunder storm that day and we were unsure if we wanted to go to the restaurant that night, we tried to change the date of our reservation as we got an email that we had been moved inside (to a table without the view) because of the weather. But as the day went on, the weather turned and the cable car opened and our reservation was moved back outside where we enjoyed the view and the sunset. The food was excellent as was the service. This was our best dinner during the trip and we were happy to pay for it. If possible, ask for table 31 (I think) it was the table next to ours and definitely the one with the best view.

We went up to the top of the mountain on a very warm and clear day. The views are simply spectacular, and even better we had a table at the restaurant right next to the edge. We stopped for a quick lunch and both had burgers. The food was good but nothing amazing. If you don’t like your burgers pink, make sure you ask for it to be well done. We don’t mind pink burgers but I’m sure others would have sent it back. Service was great.

It's a bit of a trek to get here. We found out the day of our reservation that the cable car hadn't been running for quite some time. However, Ubers are willing to drive you up to the top of Srd. The ride is a bit scary, but it's worth it. Food was delicious. Views are breathtaking. Service was on point. The only reason you shouldn't come here is if you have a fear of heights!

I couldn't imagine that in Dubrovnik (considered an expensive turistic place) you could visit a coffee-restaurant like this one, with this kind of view and eat well having an excellent treatment as a client.
The view is spectacular, the food is more than decent, is actually very good and the service is michelin. Great experience. Thank you.
P.S.: They offer blankets if you feel cold

Very romantic place to go. We didn't have a booking even though they found nice table with great view. Food was really tasty and my Tuna steak exceptional. Staff was friendly and helpful.
Recommended...

Panorama lives up to its name, a lovely place to dine high above the old city of Dubrovnik. Our first time taking a cable car to dinner, so do add a bit of time and do make a reservation. Wonderful experience and beautiful photos!
Went in for a much needed drink after climbing mount srd. Views are stunning, service was a little slow but can’t complain when you have a view like that.
Seriously expensive. Service was good but so it should be. Not much point being there if you cant get a seat with a view though.

Beautiful view and the food was delicious! Staff were very polite and courteous. Plenty of choice on the Menu. Would definitely recommend this restaurant, but the cable car ticket is a bit pricey to get you here!
Good restaurant,nice view,good food and average prices comparing to Dubrovnik. The linguine with seafood was delicious!
Great family lunch. Waiters where wonderful. Everything from burgers to fish n salads. So relaxing n what a wonderful view of the old town Dubrovnik

After catching the cable car to the top of Mount Srd which has an amazing view and cost 170 kuna per person: pretty steep for the duration you are on it. We stopped first for a drink at panorama before our descent and were wowed by the view and stone steps into the vast restaurant. Service was very friendly and efficient. However, watching the food come out, we were very tempted to order beyond our drinks. My partner ordered a classic burger which had a lot of salad and dressing on it and was tasty but quite pink in the middle. The chips were served in a small metal basket and were not greasy.

 I had the tuna salad of a lifetime served in a bowl with a light chapati lining it. The tuna was medium cooked and in large chunks laden throughout the layers of sliced spring onion, chunks of cherry tomato, cucumber, sweet corn chickpeas and borletti beans with fresh lime to squeeze...simply heavenly! Price was just short of 600 kuna with two cocktails, a water a beer and ice cream but worth it.

We went there to celebrate our 10-years anniversary and it was totally worth it! We got lucky and were seated into the first row at the terrace without reservation, which enabled us to enjoy breathtaking views throughout our dinner with sunset in the end. The price-quality rate was overall good: we had for starter a soup of the day with bread, main dish chicken Roustica (photo), dessert and glass of wine for 50€/each. And just for record, you can also get there by car, which would have been probably cheaper that a cable car which is overpriced.

We were recommended to visit this restaurant from friends and I’m so glad we went. I booked in advance as I wanted a front table for the full views of the old city and the coast. The reply’s to emails were quick and the lady couldn’t of been more helpful with my request when booking. I was blown away with the what can only be described as amazing! The staff were exceptional and so friendly and nothing was too much trouble. The food was beautiful and the choices were wide from light lunches to a full menu. If you want the full views I’d recommend you book in advance. You need to get to the restaurant by cable car and this can get busy but we waited about 20 minutes so wasn’t too bad, we just went a little earlier because of our table reservation. You can also get a taxi up if the cable car is busy but they do charge about the same. Can’t recommend this restaurant enough it was the best birthday treat .

Having discovered this restaurant by chance when visiting the top of Mt Srj for the spectacular sunsets, we wanted to eat here to mark our last night (of 14) in southern Croatia. However, we were unable to make a reservation as it was fully booked. But, we were advised by email that there be some cancellations, and as we were visiting the nearby museum of the war of independence, we went along anyway. The maitre d' explained there were no cancellations, but managed to find us a table indoors - not on the lovely terrace, but still next to the vasyt picture window with its magnificent views of the old town 400 metres below.

We were not disappointed. The food was delicious. I had the beef tenderloin carpaccio to start, followed by sea bass fillet, all of which was presented and cooked beautifully. My partner was equally happy with her octopus terrine and king prawns. We were also presented with complimentary locla liqueurs, which was a nice touch.

The service was excellent and attentive, by a young man in his first season at the restaurant. He was also more than happy to take photos of us with the beautiful view behind us. 

Yes, the prices are quite high, but when you consider the amazing location, the quality of the food and service, and the logistics involved in getting food up a 400-metre mountain with a single-track road that's not really suitable for large vehicles, then a premium is to be expected. The restaurant provided us with a lovely and romantic end to a wonderful holiday in Croatia.

https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g295371-d4586995-r690909322-Panorama_Restaurant-Dubrovnik_Dubrovnik_Neretva_County_Dalmatia.html#
Fantastic view, good drinks and okey food. The waiter was very nice. If you want a table in the front, you need to book long time in advanced.

We visited this restaurant for lunch after our Dubrovnik Wall Walk. We took the cable car up and there was a little bit of line for outside seats but we got seated without much waiting. (probably 5 min or so)
The view from the restaurant is absolutely wonderful.
After ordering and waiting for our food for awhile, we were informed that they forgot our order by mistake and apologised for the delay. So they offered us free dessert as well as 10% discount on the bill. 
Food was excellent. And although we got our orders late, they made up for it with their discount and free dessert. 
Highly recommend this restaurant!

Panorama is the super-popular restaurant at the top of Mount Srd, next to the cable car terminal. You pay premium for the location, but the food is excellent on its own merit, and the service is impeccable, nearly fawning. The downside is that you only get a partial view of the town below if you do not sit in the front row – and those best seats in the house are apparently reserved more than a month in advance (we reserved with only 3 weeks to go). Because Dubravka and Panorama are “sister” establishments, you get a 10% discount at whichever one you eat second, so we used ours here. We loved the beefsteak and the “Chef’s Recommendation” sirloin for the main plates, and the Dalmatian seafood platter for starters was also great. Really good apple pie for dessert.

Wow, amazing dinner in Dubrovnik with a view to match. I am so glad I booked a reservation here in advance, because we had a table in the first row of the terrace for 2 hours right around sunset and it was perfect. We took the cable car up (which is back up and running). Everything about this dinner was perfect! Our waiter couldn't have been nicer or more accommodating. He was always there when we needed something but gave us time to order and enjoy the views! We had spritzes and wine, which were both great. We got the octopus terrine, the sea bass with grilled veggies, and the veal with mushroom risotto. Everything was amazing. The sea bass was my favorite and came with other seafood in a light cream sauce. It was just so good! It was our most expensive meal of our trip but totally worth it. We had an amazing view of sunset and of Dubrovnik. This one lives up to the hype.

We took an Uber to and from this restaurant and had a great lunch! It was windier at the top but they had blankets on each chair and heaters (it was May). It was a beautiful day and we had a lovely view of Dubrovnik. Highly recommend
Amazing place with amazing view and charmy staff. I fall in love with this place. Prices is high... but this is sophisticated😫💗

This restaurant had both perfect surroundings as well as friendly service. Only reason not getting 5 was that one of the meals we had was way too tiny. To pay so much for one tomato and half a small mozzarella cheese was really overpriced. But the two other meals were nice, chicken sandwich and ham/cheese sandwich.

Very busy around 7pm onwards. Felt pressurised to order quickly without really being given time to look at the menu properly. Ordered chef recommended sirloin steak on risotto rice, but waiter disappeared without asking if I wanted any side dish or how I wanted it cooked. The steak was rare, which is how I like it, but I'd had a much better one the night before in lapad, also with much better service. The risotto rice was stoggy and reminded me of bad school diners. As it got busier, waited ages to get a second drink. If you are going for the food, go early. If you want the view, take a packed lunch!

Our hotel booked this for us in advance and we were allocated a fantastic view overlooking the Old Town of Dubrovnik. Dinner was full, but lunch had equally spectacular views. Food and service was great. We were a little irritated when told the chef would not take the tried egg off their main burger - seemed a bit diva-ish and not very customer focussed. So one of us changed to chicken instead. And the two of us who had the 'premium' burger thought it was great.
A very nice bonus was that the waiter was excellent and helpful. E.g. when we mentioned that we had eaten at the sister restaurant Nautika, he took 10% off voluntarily.
Really fantastic view of the old town. Staff welcoming and seemed genuinely pleased to see you. Went at lunch so will want to go again for dinner.

Didn’t look much from below, and make sure you get a front row table outside in the right portion of the restaurant. This was fantastic. Good service. Good food good wine. Special burger was particularly good sharing cheese and meat plates well presented.

We enjoyed an amazing dinner here in late June. The ambience of the restaurant is great which has a panorama top view of the Old Town. The portion of the dishes is small but it tastes delicious. I recommended the fish dishes. There are wide range of desserts available. I loved its cakes. Make sure you make a reservations through its website in advance (we made reservation 3 months ahead) in order to get a table in the terrace. Sad that the cable cars is not open in this summer. Therefore, the only way for you to get to the restaurant is by car or taxi. There are free parking spaces outside the restaurant. But the road up to the restaurant is quite narrow like 1.5 cars width. Be careful if you plan to drive there. Be prepared there will be a queue especially during dinner time.

We had read several mixed views about the restaurant so we were unsure whether to book this or not but we are so glad we did. It was the highlight of our holiday. The staff were amazing and the food was the best all week. It may at first seem a little expensive but you get big portions and you couldn’t fault the taste. We only paid a few Khn more then we did in some of the average restaurants downtown. We were lucky enough to get a table with a great view. Towards the end of the night there was a huge thunderstorm but the staff were so good in getting everyone inside quickly and reseated, they were so apologetic not that it was their fault! I would get a taxi to the top as it is far cheaper than the cable car. I don’t usually write reviews but I hope by me writing this people will visit as it will not disappoint!

Vedran was our server, and his knowledge of local wine and food was superb. I agree that it was the best food in the city, and the views made it an unforgettable experience. Server was friendly and accommodating. I had the veal and I would highly recommend, local wines were fabulous. a MUST DO.
Amazing food and even better view. Service was excellent, waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. Is definitely worth a trip up while in dubrovnik

The view from the top is spectacular, so we stayed much longer than planned. Waiters were very accommodating, polite and welcoming. Prices a little bit higher, but you pay for the view. Would definitely come back.
Just stop here... even just for a drink. The view is breathtaking and deserves some time to be enjoyed. Service was friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

I took my husband here for a pre 50th bday dinner. We had a beautiful table overlooking the cliff at 7pm. The photo I have of the both of us having dinner, is the probably the best one we ever took together! All because of the view of Dubrovnik down below.

Restaurant was worth every penny. Food and drinks were excellent . Cocktail list was creative. What’s funny, is that every restaurant we went to u. Dubrovnik, waiters kept reminding us “service/tip not included” . Panorama waiters were very professional and could not do enough for you. Not once did they ask or hint at tips. We did tip 20%as we would in the US. Service was tip notch!

Just incredible, we went for lunch because the lunch menu is more reasonably priced and it was near enough impossible to get a table with a view in the evening. But we got an amazing table for lunch, right at the edge with the best views over Dubrovnik. Steak sandwich and signature cocktail was insane. Couldn’t recommend this place enough - just make sure you book.
Stunning views and setting, food didn't quite match how great the view was. Service was warm and friendly. Go check it out at the top.

We went here for a cocktail while visiting the top of the cable car and did not stay for a meal. I would recommend booking if you wanted to stay for food as very popular. Good selection of drink choice. The view from the top is spectacular. The reason we did not Give it 5 stars is that we had to wait a while to order our drinks and we did not eat there so cannot comment on the food.

What a wonderful experience! The restaurant has amazing views of old town Dubrovnik and to top it off, the meals were truly delicious. We received amazing service. The waiters were so attentive. We highly recommend.

The tables are set out on the top of a cliff overlooking the town below. The view is breathtaking. The food is fantastic and surprising not really overpriced given the unique setting. Well worth a visit when you get off at the cable car stop beside it. Lovely friendly staff make it a treat not to be missed.

The restaurant is excellent and must see
From there you have the whole city in the plate
The prices are expensive but its the only one there...

I booked this restaurant for dinner well in advance as we wanted a table with a great view - we were not disappointed! The view was spectacular, especially as we were there for sunset. The food was nice enough but very overpriced and staff were attentive and friendly. Definitely worth going once just for the view but I wouldn’t go back for the food.

We had an early dinner on the 3 July, and the food was simply delicious. From starters to mains, it was all delicious. This is a must do whilst in Dubrovnik- remember to make reservations about 2 weeks in advance during the peak season, it has the most amazing views of the Adriatic. 
I had one of the best cocktails at Panorama
Although the prices are not given, you get this wonderful view of the old town, Lokrum and the sea. It is one of those experience that you must have!

Because it was located right near the cable car (which unfortunately wasn't working and required a taxi), I wasn't expecting much other than a great view. I could not have been more wrong! Panorama Restaurant exceeded my expectations in every way. The view CANNOT be beat. Make sure you reserve in advance to sit in the first row of tables to get the best view. It is stunning! I am so glad we made the journey up to the restaurant The food was great and very well priced. The drinks were delicious and the service was impeccable. Our dinner at Panorama Restaurant really was memorable. I don't ever think my family will forget the magical view of Dubrovnik from Panorama and the sun setting on the Adriatic. Thank you Panorama for a magical dinner.

We had a 9pm reservation with a Cliffside table, the preparation to book is definetly advised as it is so busy. 

The food and service were exceptional the only thing that topped them was the view. 

If in Dubrovnik definetly get food here. Although, I would advise an uber to get up since the cable car is very expensive.

What a restaurant. Views were spectacular at sunset and the shrimp risotto was delicious. Our experience was perfected by the outstanding service we recieved from our waiter Domagoj! He was extremely attentive without being over bearing, he was also very friendly and charasmatic, cracking jokes throughout and offered to take our picture infront of the gorgeous views. 10/10 from us!

We booked a table for 9pm which was perfect time to take the cable car up and catch the sunset. We arrived slightly early with the intention of having a drink at the bar but restaurant staff took us too our table upon arrival which was excellent! Staff were extremely friendly and very efficient considering how busy the restaurant was. For starter my boyfriend and I shared the shrimp and courgette risotto which was beautiful, honestly cannot compliment this dish enough, and the Sauvignon wine we had complimented it perfectly! For mains we both had a beefsteak with a side order of chips, which were also cooked to perfection! We had a table right next to a view of Dubrovnik Old Town which made our meal even more enjoyable! Would defiantly recommend this restaurant however I would suggest booking in advance as it seems very popular!

My girlfriend and I took the cable car up to the restaurant at about 8pm for 170 Kuna each (round trip, up and down the mountain) and we were just in time to watch the sunset and see the beautiful city before it was dark - Once the sun was down, the whole of Dubrovnik’s coastline soon lit up with light and looked amazing!

Now onto the food and drink - we arrived and ordered two cocktails (90 Kuna each) and a bottle of white wine (300 Kuna), Both were absolutely perfect!

We were sceptical on the portion sizes for the starters so we just ordered one shrimp and courgette risotto (120 Kuna) which was to die for! The best risotto I’ve ever eaten, the only downside was that we only ordered one between us!

For mains, we both had a beef steak with a courgette crisp, potato and various sauces and garnishes (250 Kuna each). The steak was cooked perfectly and all the additions on the plate complimented each other.

Throughout the night, the service was good, not phenomenal as the restaurant was very busy when we arrived so it’s to be expected but overall we had a fantastic time at the restaurant and would recommend it to anyone visiting Dubrovnik!

This fabulous restaurant is at the top of Mount Srd. Book early to get a table on the terrace facing the city at sunset. We went for the view, which was stunning. The delicious food and gracious service was a welcome bonus. This may be the best meal we had in our 10 day trip to Croatia.

Make sure to make your reservation well in advance for this Croatian treasure. As far as I know, the views are unparalleled. I made our reservation months in advance and we were seated right along the edge of the restaurant, looking right out over Dubrovnik-- it felt like we were flying. The waiter was one of the nicest we had on our trip (the service was just as spectacular at their sister restaurant Nautika). The drinks were lovely as was the food (I highly recommend the trio of sea food for a starter). The belle of the ball was, of course, the view-- which we enjoyed watching as the sun began to set. Wonderful evening!

I knew the views were the draw to this restaurant being at the top of the cable car, but I didn't expect the food to be so good also! Everything was presented so nicely, and service was exceptional. We were fortunate to be seated at one of the tables right next to the railing during sunset, just amazing!

Despite its lofty location and unparelled views across the old town and beyond, I was quite surprised how reasonably priced this place was, for lunch at least. It is by no means cheap, but it is certainly not extortionate either. 

Menu was quite expansive and included a good choice of lighter options for lunch – we both settled on the chicken burger which was nice and crispy, although perhaps a more standard shaped bun would have made it easier to eat as the chicken kept falling out of the bun when eating ! Drinks were slightly more pricey, but again not overly so. If you have visited one of it’s sister restaurants back down in the Old Town, you can claim a 10% discount

Big kudos to the staff who running up down all of the restaurant steps in the blazing heat in their somewhat formal uniforms.

I imagine coming here for dinner early evening as the sun sets would give some great views, but even just popping in for a drink anytime during the day would be worthwhile.

Well worth the visit. We had the prawn/tomato stew and octopus salad - both cooked perfectly and you can tell they use fresh ingredients. 
Our waiters were very attentive and happily moved us to get amazing views of Dubrovnik old town. 
Not cheap dining but definitely value for money given how good the food and service was.

My friends and I booked here for our last evening of our 40th birthday weekend away. It absolutely surpassed all our expectations. Our table was fantastic with a breathtaking view of the old town. The tables are cleverly placed so you have a fantastic sense of privacy. The food was amazing and very reasonably priced for the setting of the restaurant. The service we received was wonderful, they made us feel so special. We can’t wait to return.
This restaurant has amazing view and most important thing very officiant staff.Everybody polite and kind! I’m thrilled and impressed.Keep up the good work!

This is not only an amazing spot with fantastic views but also has delicious food.

We took the cable car up and a cab back down, took in the views at sunset before sitting down for our food.

The staff are happy to take your photo with the views behind you and even sang my friend Happy Birthday! 

The salmon was cooked perfectly and my friends also found their meals spot on.

Highly recommend this restaurant for great food and an amazing experience.

After booking this table almost a month in advance (which I recommend doing since it gets verrrrrrrry busy) we were sat on one of the best tables right beside the railings with the best view of Old Town and the Adriatic.

The staff here are extremely friendly and attentive. The food we ordered (one burger with cheese and a premium burger) were obviously cooked with care and tasted amazing. 

The desserts were also incredibly tasty and very rich. 

Definitely recommend getting an Uber or the cable car to the top - we were originally planning on walking up but decided against the idea (thank god we did).
Arrived at our reservation time. Had a lovely view of Old Dubrovnik but there were many ants crawling on our table. Had the Sea Bass which was tasty.

We took a break here after hiking up the mountain and they were very hospitable. They seated us next to the rail at the edge of the mountain...beautiful! We had beverages and a chicken and pumpkin seed salad which was very good and refreshing.

Fascinating. First to fall in love. Well in good wine, the food is excellent for every chef's cheek. The waiters are friendly and accommodating. Well done. You definitely have to come here beautifully
Really fun to see a great view! It’s quite hot so try to go in the cooler hours. Visit the Panorama restaurant. It’s reasonably priced for the high quality food you get!

Aside from the delicious drinks and food, people come here for the views. The view is honestly like no other and while getting there is now a bit tough while the cable cars aren't running, there are plenty of taxis and uber drivers waiting to bring you up or down. We found the staff to be incredibly accommodating and very friendly and the overall experience a total must when visiting Dubrovnik (especially first time). Added bonus: the 10% discount to their sister restaurants in the old town came in use and were much appreciated!

Just had a quick lunch here after going to the museum in the fort. I had soup which was delicious and my husband had a toasted sandwich and chips which was fine. Amazing views here well worth the visit and the service was good

Tried unsuccessfully to book a table online in advance, being told they were fully booked for each evening (we tried 3!)

Decided to go up before sunset just for a drink on the terrace while the sun went down, but while we were there, it looked like people were turning up unbooked and getting tables so we tried our luck and were seated immediately. 

The menu was unusual compared with other restaurants we visited whilst in Dubrovnik but the food was absolutely lovely, I had the pork cutlet, daughter had beefsteak (a good, perfectly cooked fillet) and both very happy with our meal choices. 

Our waiter was very attentive, suggesting we moved to a recently vacated table better placed for the view to enjoy the remainder of our wine after we'd finished eating. He also brought us a complimentary dessert for us to share which was unexpected and very very good, Apple pie with a crumble topping, with a pour over caramel sauce. 

Very pleased we went, one of our nicest evenings in Dubrovnik.
This place not only has amazing food and great service but also a view to die for and without the price tag to go with it, we would 100% revisit

We came here for dinner with a table booked for 6.30 so that we could watch the sunset. I emailed in advance as it was a special birthday for my husband and we were given a front terrace table which has amazing views over Dubrovnik. The food, cocktails and service were amazing and we had a great evening and would highly recommend. They even wrote Happy Birthday on my husbands desert which was a lovely surprise touch!

We took the cable car to this lovely restaurant perched above Dubrovnik with views to die for. A warm welcome and superb food and service. Our waiter went the extra mile to make our evening one to remember. If you get chance do book for an evening meal but be sure to book online in advance for premium view tables. We came away with a good feel factor. Well done Panorama!!

Visited here for our engagement lunch, we couldn’t get in for the evening as they are booked really far in advance however the views are superb day or night so we wasn’t disappointed. The restaurant setting is magnificent, it was very busy but you still felt comfortable enough despite being told in advance you have a two hour time slot then have to vacate your table. The food was okay, I wouldn’t say it was remarkable however the prices are quite unforgettable. The menu is absolutely extortionate. Two standard courses... soups for starters then lasagne and another pasta dish for our main with two drinks each came to over £120 gbp.... it was for a special occasion however we have had much nicer meals in the centre albeit without the view but for a quarter of the cost.
