It’s nice for a special occasion to sit and absorb the view but it’s not somewhere I’d go again for the food

What a view!! Staff are so helpful and attentive. The best place to sit with a drink. 
The ski lift is now working and so worth the trip up here. 
Didn't eat here but the food did look good.

Amazing views, unreasonable prices. Good food, well-present cocktails, good service. I would give this 3.5 stars, but since that's not an option, I'll go with three, because it also costs quite a lot to get there by taxi (too high up for buses, cable cars out of service).

we ate here after getting off a cruise ship, we had researched the venue and booked ahead of time. the weather was warm but a little windy so they gave us a nice heater and blanket ot keep us warm. the staff were truly fantastic. so polite and they offered to help in any way they could. then came the food ... Amazing! I went for the pork while my other half had the burger and both just had so much flavour. the food was priced reasonably and so were the beverages. I would certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Fantastic views, good service and excellent food.

Cable car is now working again although we got an uber as were not aware of this until we arrived.

Definitely worth a visit for views of the whole of Dubrovnik and surrounding islands. Looks stunning as the sun sets and all of the lights start to come on.

Book ahead and request a prime location table for the best views.
Excellent food! Excellent service! One of our best experiences in our travels! Drive up with an Uber and down on the cable car!

The service was exceptional. The food and drinks absolutely delicious and the view was breathtaking. We had a reservation and our table was ready when we showed up over an hour early so we could sit right away. Anita was great to communicate with before our arrival. Ordered Lamb Ragu for appetizer, pork and sea bass entrees also delicious. Seeing the city during sunset and feeling on top of the world was beautiful and romantic. Only complaint is they did not take discover card as advertised online.

We went for drinks as we could not get a dinner reservation. The cable car was out of service and yet the place was packed. By reserving in advance you ensure a table with a view of entire Dubrovnik. The mountain view is also gorgeous though and you can always take pictures of the view of Dubrovnik after. Prices a bit on the expensive side but the drinks were lovely. Service was a bit late but perhaps we wouldn't mind if we weren't in a bit of a rush. Overall definitely recommended!

We went here as a friends 30th celebration, and what a time we had. I’ll remember it for the rest of my life. 
Not only is the view incredible, the food was amazing and the service impeccable. They made my friend feel really special and we honestly didn’t have a bad word to say. 
It’s incredible value for money as well

The food and views were AMAZING!!! I was expecting this restaurant to serve that annoying expensive fancy food that didn’t taste good but I was so wrong! The food was affordable and actually really good! I got the steak and my husband got the pork cutlet. Both were delicious! We sat at one of the best tables there with an incredible view of Dubrovnik. Definitely eat here if you are visiting.

A beautiful place at the top of the mountains to pause for a beer or a cocktail. Absolutely first class waiter/waitress service. Stunning panoramic views. Great food and, surprisingly, not a great deal more expensive than down in the old city. Cable car not currently running but take a taxi to the old fort, explore that and then stop at 'Panorama'. Maybe even walk the windy downhill track back to the old city if it isn't too hot. Takes about one and a half hours.

We tried for days to book a table but this spot is a hard one to get into because it’s so well placed on the top of the mountain overlooking the charming city of Dubrovnik. 

None the less we showed up hoping a four-top wouldn’t show, and sure enough we got lucky. 

The soup special was delicious. The carbonara was not authentic and pasta over cooked. The steaks, both the filet and the sirloin were juicy and cooked perfectly. But honestly - croatia didn’t impress us with food anywhere. What’s winning about this place is the service. 

The manager was awesome. Friendly, funny and kind. The host Adriana (i think) was charming and sweet and our waiter was super. He made an EXCELLENT wine suggest (the black wine) and kept our glasses full the whole night. He made our experience extra memorable. 

Loved this place - and I would go back in a heart beat for drinks, nibbles, great service and amazing breezes. Something you really want when it’s SOOOOO hot out!
Unbelievable views of the city. Do not attempt to drive yourself. Take a taxi. The cable car is not functioning. The food was very good and the service excellent.

Stunning views down onto old town Dubrovnik. You probably need to book to be sure of a table; and it’s a long way up only to find there isn’t a table available when you get there!
Worth arriving a little early to have a cocktail, beer, etc to take in the views before you are seated.
Good menu and the food was excellent. The cable car was out of action when we visited (and I think was set to be that way for a while according to the locals) so a taxi is necessary; unless you are particularly fit and keen! I think the Tut Tuts go up there too.
Not cheap, but well worth the investment!

Made our way by taxi as the cable car was closed, meant to be re-opening soon. We booked through our hotel and got a front line table which we had requested. The view of Dubrovnik and around is spectacular. I thought my sea bass was nice, the choice on the menu is limited and it is best to have a look online in advance to see what the general dishes are. 
The waiter is called via a button on the table. We were not too sure about this at first but was very quick to come along as soon as we pressed the button.
Next door is Fort Imperial (built by the French) which houses the Homeland War Museum which gives some insight into the was that was fought here from 1992 to 1995. That also offers a great view.

WOW, can not say enough about how great this restaurant/bar is. We went up for a drink and a snack and of course to see the view but everything was so perfect we ended up staying for hours. The star of our visit was our server Drazen. He was the best waiter we encountered on our two week trip in Europe. Not only a great server but he gave us a lot of history about Croatia and Bosnia. Learned more from him than when I wikied the same info. Also, this restaurant has great food, indoor/outdoor seating and the BEST view in Dubrovnik. Go during the day and stay for sunset and to see the night lights of the Old Town. And be sure to ask for Drazen for you server you will be VERY HAPPY that you did. This was the HIGHLIGHT of our trip to Dubrovnik.

Would have loved to go here by cable car but that is not working at present so had a taxi ride which if you don't like heights is a bit breath taking but safe although a bumpy ride on a single track,but well worth the trip lovely restaurant the evening was windy we were offered a inside table what a view lovely staff Ante very informative we all enjoyed a lovely meal very nicely presented another moment to put in the memory box. You need to book they are very busy.

Food was really good and service was excellent but the star attraction is the amazing view of Dubrovnik far below. Having a meal here meant we could see the city from above before dark, watch the sunset and see the twinkling lights come on in the city. 

Definitely book ahead - we booked about a week ahead and could only get a back tier table. Even the front tier don’t have entirely unobscured views, especially in the direction of the sunset rather that Dubrovnik. There are great views from the adjacent viewpoint and we sneaked there between courses. 

As others have said the cable car is out of action at the moment but reachable by car or taxi.
Order the margarita pizza and a mimosa. Sightseeing and laughs with friends while overlooking the Adriatic. Cannot be beat.

This is the place where you have the perfect view of Dubrovnik.When we arrived we had not made a reservation for coffee but Anna Maria and Drazen managed to give us a table where we enjoyed the scenery.A great thank to both of them.
If you go make a reservation !
Yes, It is a bit expensive but between the service, the food, the drive to it and specially the views...All worth it! Do not leave Dubrovnik without going to Panorama. Do it at sunset, Fantastic!!

Our hostess for the house managed to get us a table at this place for my birthday. The service was amazing, beautiful sunset view and good food. 
Can really recommend this place, it’s a place you don’t want to miss! But so reserve in advance!

Had the most fab meal/evening with my husband here. We were seated in the prime spot right on the edge overlooking the awesome view of the old town. We booked but were early, this was not a problem, were shown to our seats, and given three hours to enjoy the experience, ambience and excellent food. Although not the cheapest, would definitely recommend this restaurant. Two courses of excellent food and drinks came to £80/800kn. The staff were excellent, nothing to much trouble.

We came to the Panorama restaurant as a birthday treat, expecting the food to be pricey but the views to be worth it. Instead we found that the food and drinks were equal to the views. I had the vegetable risotto and my partner had the Dubrovnik cutlet, and they were both absolutely delicious. The views are, of course, the highlight but staff at the restaurant and the food made the whole experience feel once in a lifetime. Would absolutely recommend to anyone visiting Dubrovnik, especially if you can get up to watch the sunset. Worth noting that the cable car is currently not working, but we were lucky enough to get a taxi driver who even stopped halfway up the mountain to show us some great picture spots! We would also like to say a special thank you to our waiter Thomir (spelling could be wrong!) who made my birthday really special.

Best experience in Dubrovnik. We made a reservation via email and Anita was kind enough to explain the various seating options/views available to us. She also emailed us the day before to advise the cable car wasn’t working so we would need a taxi. We sat in 2nd row at sunset, and had a wonderful view. We got up there a little early to take pictures of the view. The service - thanks Adi - was absolutely faultless and so so friendly. They couldn’t do enough for everyone, including taking photos. Food and wine was divine - recommend the fish options. Really recommend this to anyone visiting Dubrovnik.

FRIENDS HAD PRE-BOOKED RESTAURANT.
Access to the Restaurant was via Taxi, as the Panoramic Cable Car is out of commission. Exciting Taxi ride up single track winding road.
Absolutely Stunning views from Restaurant and surrounding areas to which you can Freely wander.
The Food served was Lovely, all in the party of 8persons had No complaints.
Recommended

We had the most fantastic evening at Panorama, the food was exceptional, the staff were so attentive and of course stunning surroundings. Nothing was too much bother, we were even told a brief background of the wine we ordered and they constantly made sure we were topped up. 

Yes, the restaurant is on the pricier side but we found the portions to be large and the whole experience was 100% worth it. I would return in a heartbeat. 

The cable car wasn’t running so we took an Uber and it was inexpensive as we had been told local taxis charge a bomb for taking you up

Drove up there not bad but need your wits about you . Single lane but with passing places best bet is to get behind a taxi that’s going up!!!
 Arrived keep going and you will find a place to park . Attended the restaurant got a great seat looking over the view of Dubrovnik and the see spectacular! 
 Ordered potatoes and barley soup very tasty and was served by Drazen a very smart waiter very genuine and appeared to be enjoying his job . Thanks Drazen 
 Definitely worth a visit to the top for the view and food

I don't typically leave glowing reviews and usually try to keep it as objective as possible with both good and bad, but our dinner at Panorama was tremendous. First shout out has to be for the service- our server Dom was GREAT. He noticed my girlfriend trying to get some photos as we arrived and offered to take her phone to get pictures from 3 different places on 3 different levels on the restaurant. He was obviously busy as it was right in the middle of the dinner rush, but he insisted and my girlfriend was ecstatic with them. 

He also recommended the Dubrovnik Cutlet (pork chop), which wasnt on my radar until he mentioned it. I ended up getting it and was very happy it was recommended. Good crisp on the outside and very well seasoned. Others in our group had the sea bass (also recommended by Dom), carbonara, and I think the last thing was a seafood linguine. All were very good, as was the Vegetable risotto we had as an appetizer. I was honestly surprised by how good the food was across the board, I had assumed that the real attraction at this spot would be the novelty/view, but it wasnt the case.

To give a good indication of price/value, we had a group of 4 and our total bill came to a little over 350 USD. Not bad at all considering we had appetizers, 3 bottles of wine, dinner entrees, and dessert. One of the bottles was ~$100, so kind of inflates the overall price.

The only negative will hopefully be something that others don't have to deal with, but useful to know for anyone visiting in the near future (our visit was June 16, 2019). The cable car going up to the restaurant is not running at the moment, so the taxis have kind of a monopoly on driving you home. Ubers will not come up the mountain to pick you up, so you're kind of at the mercy of the taxis. It's not terribly expensive, but more than it should be and the one guy we had to deal with was a jerk about it.

This place was lovely. We walked to the top and was well ready for a drink but felt underdressed in our sports gear. But feared we not the staff were very nice and accommodating. 

You do pay way over the odds for the drink but you have to imagine that and it’s worth the view.

We booked a few months in advance to make sure we got a reservation. We were second from the edge and still had a magnificent view of Dubrovnik. I'd you get an opportunity book closest to the edge. 
The food is lovely, nothing special, probably overpriced for what it is, however, the staff are so so lovely and really attentive. The surroundings really cannot be beaten for views and if you get a chance to come for dinner do it. 
Tuna steak was cooked really well but no bells and whistles.
After hiking up the mountain/hill, an excellent coffee and cake was well received by our trio, accompanied by excellent views of Dubrovnik and the bays 😀
Number one restaurant in Dubrovnik. You must eat here when visiting the town. The view is stunning. Make an effort to book this place for dinner.

I visited the Panorama Restaurant today along with some colleagues from a conference. We were served wonderful bread with oil and balsalmic vinegar and then fish soup with mussels. The main course was steamed fish on a bed of potatoes and greens, which was delicious. The wine was excellent as was the service. They were also very careful to adjust their menu for the vegetarians amongst us.

You neeeed to go here, best bet is to book for the evening around 7/7:30 to get great views of Dubrovnik! The views are amazing and the war museum is up there if you want to get there early and explore the museum (30 mins max). The food is brilliant and if you reserve they will make sure your seat is on the edge so you can get great photos.

On the top of Srđ hill, Panorama is a great place to grab any meal (or coffee) for the view alone. We did lunch before going to the fort and it was perfect. Two of us had the chicken sandwich, fried chicken with herbs, bacon, coleslaw salad, iceburg lettuce, tomatoes, onion and batata fries. I loved it, and I'm from the south so I'm pretty judgy of fried chicken. But this was super good! Also, the service was wonderful. When we arrived they had a table right by the window but it was reserved, about 3/4 through our meal they came over and said if we wanted to move we could because the people hadn't shown up and they felt bad that we couldn't sit with a better view — just such nice people!

Visited today with a group of 8 friends. Wow are the views worth it?! The scenery is absolutely stunning and definitely worth the trip. The service was very good, we were well looked after and attended to. The food was maybe the only slight let down, (and I say slight). Pasta was not hot. It was not bad, but also not very special nor impressive like the view. Still had pa great time at restaurant panorama and would recommend for the experience as a whole, but not the food alone.

We decided to walk up as it was a beautiful day so we were more than ready for the stunning views and a glass of wine. We hadn't intended to eat but decided it was too nice not to. Glad we did as the food was lovely, I had the tofu and cous cous very tasty.

Cable car was not working so we got an Uber up there. Totally worth all the hassle. We got here on our first night in Croatia and it was absolutely amazing. Breath-taking view with excellent food. We ordered the pumpkin soup as starter, sea bass and lamb as main and cheesecake for dessert. All of the staffs were very attentive and kind. We’ve booked a second row seat but the staff moved us to the first row and we were so happy. 

Will definitely come back! Thank you everyone in Panorama x

What a great place - taken there for a birthday meal by my wife.
Can honestly say I've never had a view from a restaurant like it.
The food was excellent too - we shared a ham & olive starter, and for the mains my wife had the sirloin steak & I had the venison risotto. All were of the highest standard, along with a local beer & house red wine.
A special mention to our waiter Blaz - he was informative, friendly & welcoming, a true professional. Best of luck to him & his family in Dubrovnik.

Booked this before travelling as apparently difficult to get a table with perfect view as they are in demand. Had an excellent table and the service throughout was exceptional, staff were attentive to everyone's needs; a couple got engaged there tonight, and wow what a setting. Wonderful views of Lokrum Island and the old town, that are only breathtaking. There as a group of three, food was fantastic, this is not a cheap place to dine, but the food and service were only amazing, if you are looking for a great night of indulgence, this is the place to visit, one to remember for sure. Cable car wasn't working, drove there, narrow roads up the hill.

We arrived without a reservation as we left booking too late but decided the view and a glass of something would be worth it even if we didn’t get a table. 
Luckily for us a table of 6 were late/no show so we had a fantastic second row table. 
The staff were polite and efficient with discreet service. 
The food was lovely and we all enjoyed our chosen dishes, although with the view over the Old Town we would have been happy with anything! And to top of our evening there were fireworks in the town which made our view even more spectacular. 
Make sure you book a table and come and visit, I’m
Pretty sure you won’t be disappointed.
Great service and excellent food resulted in a memorable night. This felt like a once in a lifetime experience. Book it.
Amazing restaurant with a perfect service! Stayed much longer than planned! Fully recommend! Service, Food, Location: TOP

Amazing views and it was a truly wonderful experience! Food was lovely but lacked real flavour. Sea bass melted and cooked to perfection. Waiters were very accommodating, polite and welcoming. Definitely worth a visit!!!

we had a wonderful sunset family dinner at Panorama! my sister was able to make reservations easily and the reservation team was wonderful to work with. when we arrived, we had a wonderful table waiting for us with a great view of the beautiful sunset. our waiter, Niksa, was the highlight of the evening. he was welcoming, knowledgeable, funny, and did a fantastic job with our large group of 9. the food was delicious and had great flavor. we could not have asked for a better experience!

Visited the Panorama restaurant for lunch - you MUST book in advance, particularly for evening time. The most amazing views I’ve ever experienced whilst out for a meal, at a nicely shaded table. Very pricey menu but lots of options, high quality food and attentive service. Keep in mind that the cable car is currently not operating so we opted to take the no.17 bus from pile gate to Bosanka and walk the remaining 25 minutes (steep and stoney path) to the restaurant which was a cheap alternative to a taxi and a more pleasant option than doing the full hike.

The drive up the single lane road to the top of the mountain is very challenging and I would recommend a taxi. The views are outstanding and a visit to the museum is very informative about the so-called Homeland War. The restaurant offers the same high service and food quality as it's sister restaurants in the old city. We enjoyed excellent food and wine while sitting at the top of the world (500 metres above the old city)

I enjoyed my climb up from my apartment and it was lovely to relax here afterwards. It was the morning and quiet in the restaurant, but staff were attentive and friendly. My coffee could have been a little warmer, but the apple tart with ice-cream was delicious and the view wonderful. Prices were reasonable despite the monopoly on refreshments up Mnt Srd!

Just incredible! We came to Dubrovnik in June expecting sunny weather, however it seems its unusually rainy. This had put a dampner (pun intended) on the holiday...until this evening. Although overcast we stuck to our booking and we weren't disappointed. We were given seats inside, still with a great view and the staff couldn't be more apologetic, even though the weather is out of their control. My husband and I were about to request to move by the window once another table had left, when they told us, the rain had stopped and they were preparing outside! We were escorted to the incredible mountain edge view, with an individual heater and blankets. The air was warm and the view was clear. The staff brought all of our food and drinks to us from our table inside and were happy to tend to our every need. We even got a complimentary liquer! And they were only too happy to take our picture when asked. The food was delicious, the view insane and the staff so welcoming and helpful! All in all the best restaurant experience we could have asked for! Thank you Panorama
Let's give it a five star. Great place. Incredible service. Tasty food. Very attentive service.. at the high end of the wallet section.. but overall worth the experience...

We ate lunch here after walking up the mountain and were lucky enough to get an amazing table at the edge with probably the best views I’ve ever had in a restaurant. The service was excellent and the waiters were all friendly and very attentive. We enjoyed the food and also loved our first bottle of Posip wine. Highly recommend!

My friends and I booked for a special occasion. We had booked relatively late so we’re situated away from the edge. For some reason the manager kept apologising for this, yet we didn’t actually mind as we knew we were lucky to even get a table at short notice. Then as someone didn’t turn up to their reservation, they moved us closer for a better view.

The view is incredible. We got there in time for sun set and it was beautiful. 

The staff were just great, very friendly, and even though we were there until late, we were never rushed. 

The food was delicious, although portion sizes were a little out. Our starters were quite large. But then our mains were the same size or smaller. But everyone’s were nice.

The restaurant is at upper end of cost, but I personally think it was worth it. 

Unfortunately, the cable car has been closed so we had to get a taxi up. My god this was a scary drive! The road is not designed to accommodate such traffic, and I was in need of a strong drink by time I got to the top.

All in all a great evening.

We recently went to the Panorama restaurant with friends to celebrate our mini moon. 

Book as soon as you can we made a same day booking for sunset but weren’t on the actual cliff edge until a previous booking had left & we were kindly moved straight away. This for me is was the sign of an excellent restaurant completely knowledgable in why people go there.

First thing to note is due to the fabulous location the road leading up is a single track with passing Spots DO NOT DRIVE YOURSELF. There is a rule that going up takes priority rather than coming down. The road was full of experienced taxi’s and the odd tourist causing absolute chaos leaving and requesting too much room to pass. If your like me with heights have a drink before you go!!!!! Or close your eyes!! It took us 30 mins to get 3.5km on this single track road. 

When we finally made it to the top there is a layered patio with white umbrellas and turquoise detail giving it a very fresh vibe with trees and plants to give it a garden feel. As it wasn’t high season they had plenty of heat lanterns and blankets for later in the evening when the temperature dropped. 

Each table is given a dedicated waiter and a buzzer to contact the waiter. The service was excellent and attentive and ensured the glass was always filled even if the wine was expensive and overrated. 

Food wise we had 3 courses each which we believe was a 4 star rating given that the main courses were the same size if not smaller than the starters. Starter choices included vegetable risotto, seafood risotto & Ragu. Mains included squid, salmon & veal. We all settled on the chefs special of chocolate mouse for dessert which got 5 stars. 

In total for 4 people, 3 courses, 2 bottles of rose, 3 glasses of red the bill came to just shy of £300. 

There are restaurants of a higher standard for food dotted all over dubrovnik therefore we would recommend the panorama as a great place to have a drink whilst watching the sunset and sample a dish (starter main or dessert!)

Oh what a lovely amazing evening thank you. We booked in advance and got a lovely table on the terrace with the most perfect view. Food was good And the staff are more then helpful and friendly. Make sure you book in advance to get a nice table. You can e mail for a reservation. The cable car is currently not working but we got an Uber which worked out just fine. Our reservation was from 18.30 until 20.45 so we got to see the sun set over a beautiful long lovely dinner and drinks. Wonderful dining experience

For the view alone, it deserves a 5. I've had better food for cheaper but it was still very very good. I had a beautiful prosciutto wrapped chicken with baby potatoes and my fiance had the seabass, both were cooked to perfection. The wine was a beautiful dry red wine. And we started with a substantial charcuterie platter. Always smother your cheese in olive oil! Yum! I didnt know whether to stare at my plate or stare at the view most of the time. We planned it for sunset and had the best seat at the corner of the cliff. Breathtaking, really. Our waiter was incredibly gracious and even though extremely busy, took the time to take loads of pictures for us.

We had a front row terrace booking that I had arranged for my wife and I months ago. Unfortunately, on the day the weather was against us and the rain set in an hour or so before our booking. As a result the terrace was closed which was understandable, but the disappointment is that there is no real alternative that can be offered to you. The indoor restaurant is small and has its own bookings so obviously not everyone can move inside. As a result there were a number of people in the foyer when we eventually decided to make our way back down the mountain to find an alternative restaurant for the evening. The staff were very good, very apologetic and even gave us a complimentary drink, nothing against them at all, but ultimately very disappointing that a bit of rain results in what was heading towards chaos when we left.
Another note, the cable car is closed. We heard as the result of tax evasion or government corruption, either way it won’t be open again anytime soon and this was all part of the appeal of the restaurant in the first place in our opinion so worth noting because the only way up/down now is via the single lane access road which becomes very chaotic in busy times.
Shame really, view from the cab was beautiful
A must see, can’t recommend how amazing this place was. We sat out on the terrace what a beautiful outlook. Staff are so attentive and the food was beautiful. Very reasonably priced too:)
We came here after a long hike up the mountain. The staff is really professional, but i have never seen such an expensive place.
It has a great ambiance, the staff are fantastic, very attentive without being intrusive, very reasonable prices and the Veiw is breathtaking, shame the 🚠 cable car is not working

I don’t know if we were lucky that the cable car is off as the restaurant was not busy. Although windy the waiter gave us loads of blankets and it added to the ambience. The food was so well presented. I had a tuna salad which was way more than some lettuce and tuna. Husband had a steak sandwich which he said was lovely. The prices were no different to elsewhere. The waiter was so friendly and attentive. I think his name was Dravac? Friendly and chatted to us for ages. Amazing views. Would definitely come back.

Can't beat the view from the top of Mt. Srd at sunset. Truly beautiful. The service was exceptional at the restaurant, and the pork shank I ordered was really unique and delicious. My fiancee ordered the carbonara and wasn't a huge fan, but still enjoyed the experience anyways. Decent prices and fun cocktails, too.

Incredible views from the top. Had lunch and drinks here and the service was impeccable; the staff couldn’t have done more for us. Gorgeous food with plenty of choice. 

I’d recommend booking in advance as it’s a popular choice. Shame the cable car wasn’t open but as we understand it’s not the restaurant’s fault.

Thanks for making our last day in Dubrovnik so memorable ☺️

What can I say... perfect dining experience.
I emailed the restaurant in advance and requested a terrace view and they did not disappoint, it is breathtakingly beautiful. We enjoyed a few drinks before ordering our food, the waitors were all very friendly and we didn't feel rushed at all considering how popular the restaurant is. The food was delicious and presented wonderfully with decent portion sizes. The cabin car wasn't working but we agreed a return price with a taxi driver near Pile Gate (approx £25 which worked out cheaper for 2 people than the cable car and no queuing in the heat)
Can't recommend the experience enough.

It was a really nice dinner for me. All of my familly satisfied with restaurant. A little cold outside but good enough . Nice food, kind staffs, reasonable price, and fantastic view. If u want a nice view seat, make a reservation^^ . Hard to drive but everything was perfect.

 운전해서 올라가는 길이 힘들었지만 정말 멋있는 경험이었습니다. 두브로브니크에서 잊지못할 멋진 식사를 원하신다면 추천드립니다.

This restaurant has everything, location, service, food, value for money!!

Service staff was very attentive and friendly. Food was very good by Dubrovnik standards but not exceptional by International ones. The bread was the most ordinary as was the olive oil it was served with. Ditto for the salad! Tomatoes didn't have any taste and we are across the Adriatic from Italy!! 

But the main dish (Sea Bass & Veggie Risotto) made up for everything else. They were fabulous. 

Follow that up with your heartful of unforgettable view of Dubrovnik in the palm of your hand and you have a perfect dinner night out.

We had an overnight in Dubrovnik and decided on this venue and booked ahead. We asked for an outside table and the weather didn't disappoint. We took a taxi from our hotel ( I wouldn't fancy driving up to here). Lunch menu very good, reasonable prices and fantastic view of the city. Care with taxi's, we stayed at More Hotel outside the city and were charged 200 Kuna to drop us there, there were taxi drivers waiting up there for our return and we were charged just 100 kuna for the same journey back, agree your fee before you leave.

This restaurant's view is unparalleled, but that hasn't let it get complacent in quality by having a monopoly on location. We came here for drinks in the afternoon around 3pm, when most food eaters were starting to leave, which meant we were able to find a table. For lunch I think you'd probably have to book. I had a mango mojito mocktail which, upon discovering it being one of the most gorgeous drinks ever (subtly flavoured with a sprig of thyme), I instantly regretted for choosing the non-alcoholic version. A very grown-up mocktail. We sat here playing card games and reading for a couple of hours without any pressure from the waiters to move as we'd finished our drinks.

The food was very mediocre tasting and expensive for what it was. However, the staff were very friendly and attentive, and the views were of course jaw dropping.

So if you're looking for fine dining, this is not the place to go. But if you're looking for the best view in Dubrovnik and you don't mind basic, over priced food, then book a table! (Maybe just go for a drink, they did a cracking mojito!)

Called restaurant and had luck to reserve table only 30min before arrival. Cablecar from downtown out of operation (legal thing with town), should work in a month...
Road is not very wide but couple of minutea driving to top.
Staff very polite and proffessional, excellent service.
Prices little bit high, but it's one of the world's most famous views,
And food was excellent, beefsteak and rumpsteak for main dish, for desert chocolate muss and orange cake... 😋😋

Drove up as the cable car not running. Beautiful drive through sage and broom in flower. Fantastic location overlooking Dubrovnik. 

Friendly fast service. Delicious cake. 
Have a look around the photographic exhibition of the war afterwards. Really brings it home.
Views from this restaurant are amazing! Lovely setting for a romantic dinner or lunch. Cheesecake was delicious.we both enjoyed our meal in this restaurant

The food was very good, and the views are amazing. I would recommend going at night and making a reservation; additionally, when making a reservation, ask for the right side (as opposed to the left side), that's where the views are. The portions are small, and the place is expensive, but worth a visit while in Dubrovnik. NOTE: as of May 26, the cable car is not working so the only way up is taxi or walking.

Was a bit of a mission to get to as the Cable Cars weren't running and we took the bus up which didn't go the full way up the mountain, but oh boy it was worth it! 
Extremely friendly staff, tasty food and stunning views. Started drizzling half way through our meal but they were quick with offering us heaters, put up the parasols and gave us blankets.

At the moment the cable car is not working so we hiked up to the top which took about 1 hour. Sometimes tourist spots like this can be hit or miss, but this was a hit. 
Very attentive service and excellent food with a good drinks menu. The view is stunning but can be a bit windy due to the height but hey ho.
Sun shades are provided if it's hot, blankets and heaters if a little cool so everything you need for a nice spot to eat and drink.

The view is extraordinary 
The staff can not do enough to help you 
The food was super 
Sun shades if it’s hot , heaters and blankets if it’s cold. 
We had a great table with amazing views and The manager came and asked if we would like to have our coffees at an even better table with a better view. So much trouble taken to make our experience enjoyable. 
Going back 100%

Amazing view, food and drink. Wait staff were very attentive.The cocktails were delicious as well as the food. Unfortunately the cable car is not in service at the moment so we drove up. The drive up is a bit difficult in places as there is mostly a one way road so I would not recommend it for novice drivers but when you get up there it is more than worth it. Best views in Dubrovnik, definitely not to be missed!

Should have known better, I have a rule when travelling. Never eat in the square or anywhere near a cable car however our friends had been told they must eat here as the food was amazing! I’ve never met their friends but when I do I’ll be sure to let them know. Food barely warm, menu unimaginative and definately overpriced. May be I went on the Chefs night off. This was what we experienced in most restaurants in Dubrovnik, food was very dissapointing and waiting staff didn’t smile or have much idea of customer service

My wife,I and 5 other friends visited here on the last morning of our touring in Croatia. Since the cable car closed, we went up there by car. The road up to the restaurant is small and serpentine. I recommend anyone who want to go there must find an experience driver. Never drive there during raining. Fortunately my driver is great. And the weather is so nice. The panoramic bird eye views over there is super awesome. We saw the beautiful whole town with the ancient wall from here. Besides their coffees are great. It was very impressive experience for us.

Must admit was recommend by friends from a previous trip, not disappointed,
Very nice service followed by good food, reasonable wine prices by the glass,
A WONDERFUL day by the sea!

The best experience in the holiday 
Fantastic 
Service little slow but staff were busy as a wind crept up so , they were running around moving heaters and parasols all to accommodate the diners .
Food delicious 
Views amazing 
Mountain climb up in car quite entertaining 
Lot of passing places as one car at a time busy.
Shane cable car not in action or that would have been a great add on .
 A star highly recommended

Aside from the breathtaking view, the staff in this restuarant are polite, attentive and very helpful. They called a taxi for us from the old town when there were none at the top and allowed us to sit in the restaurant for 30 mins whilst it was raining like mad outside. 

They also do a mean negroni and mojito:)……. If you are planning to visit try to make a reservation if you are allowed to avoid the wait as it gets busy as people are enjoying the views and don’t leave in a hurry.

We had booked a table here before we left the UK and they kept in touch with us once we arrived asking us to confirm our booking and contacting us on the day of our meal to inform us the cable car wasn't running and that we would have to take a taxi. We were given a very good table with views of the old town. Staff were friendly and service was efficient. We ordered the Mediterranean Style Squid and Chicken Rustico for the main course and cake of the day for dessert all were tasty. As I mentioned earlier the cable car wasn't running so we booked a taxi from the office opposite the cable car station (where you get the tickets for the airport shuttle) and they told us they would match the price of the cable car but charged us over double this for a return taxi, so if the cable car isn't running make sure you book one of the independent taxi drivers. Others have said you can walk down to save money, but not sure if this is a good idea in the dark.

We visited this restaurant after a hike up the mountain. The staff was friendly and, even though it was quite windy (and not very warm), we had a great lunch there. Heaters, blankets (and when it started raining even parasols) kept us comfortable. The view from up there is unreal. A must visit when climbing the mountain.

We walked up to this restaurant on a cloudy day when the funicular wasn’t running. The staff where lovely ensuring we had blankets and heaters to keep warm. We had a lunch of steak sandwich and shrimp risotto. Both where great. Would highly recommend and the walk built up and appetite!

スルジ山頂にあります。予約を1日間違えたので、旧市街を遮るものなく見える席は座れなかったですが、それでも素晴らしい景色でした。私はビールしか頼みませんでしたがメニューは普通のレストランでした。寒さ対策用に毛布もあってほとんどのお客様がくるまっていました。青い海と、旧市街は本当に綺麗でした。絶対予約して行ってください。
You can see very beautiful landscape from the restaurant. You should reserve the table before you go .

Excellent visit to Panorama, even if you aren’t great with heights! Views from the restaurant are phenomenal. We took a taxi due to the cable car not working. The staff couldn’t have made more of a fuss during the visit, ensuring we were warm enough with heaters etc. Food was excellent too! Definitely recommend when visiting Dubrovnik.
We were here only for coffee, but had a lovely time in the sun. The view was impressive. It was worth stopping there for the atmosphere.

We visited here for a drink after a long hard walk up to the summit where this place is located. The staff were friendly and helpful and the beer was tasty. We didn’t eat, although tempted. But will be sure to next time as the menu looked amazing. Bit on the expensive side but there’s no competition once you’re up there! Would recommend.

Had dinner here last night really nice food and a good waiter,was not pleased with one aspect there were better seats available not reserved,and I asked if we could move only to be told no without reason but people without a reservation seemed to be given preference

When we visited the cable car wasnt running... it made for a walk up the hill....

By the time we got to the restaurant we were hungry and thirsty and weren't disappointed. The speed of service was excellent and the food (I had the sea bass and the wife had the carbonara) was excellent. We were in off season so they had no problem seating us next to the nice view. The cocktail was really good too... and the food came out under quite nice metal trays

The food here is outstanding. But be aware that due to the amount of other people, you may not get "the best seat with the best view". 

The food is great and the breeze up there is wonderful. I highly suggest coffee and lunch, but make sure you walk around the entire crest to get pictures as your table may not be the best photo opportunity.
Great restaurant, a bit cold outside, but really worth the view! Had hamburgers, and they were really good after the hike up!

I think part of the experience is the cable-car sins it was not running we came by car, there you have a nice view over the old town, food was nice, service depends on the person, waiters nicer then reception.
all in al we had a nice time

The food was amazing and it was certainly the best way to celebrate Birthdays and the highlight of our trip in Dubrovnik.

We reserved a terrace table for 6.15pm to ensure we catch the sunset. It was windy, but blanklets and heaters were provided.

The view was spectacular!!! Definitely a must do.

Please note: You have to book in advance and reconfirm on the same day. There is also a 1.5-2hr seating time.

I had a sparking wine and shared a cake with my partner while veiwing Dubvonik from the top of the world.
How memorable was this wonderful experience. My highlight. The restaurant was lovely. My cake was devine. Service welcoming and very helpful and friendly. I wisk we've gone there for dinner, but time didn't allow this, for us.
Do yourself a favour and go, it's one of those once in a lifetime moments.

Visited the restaurant on the last night of our trip to Dubrovnik 08/05/19 and had a fabulous time. The service was great, Thomas in particular was attentive and made us feel welcome and truly looked after us. We sat on the terrace wrapped in fleeces and with a patio heater to keep us warm. Whilst we could not get a reservation with a view over the city once we had eaten and were enjoying our wine the team offered to move us to a table with a view over the city at night. They carried everything for us and got us settled again with both blanket and heater. Food was fabulous, wine lovely & cocktails great too. The combination of food, view and staff made this a great end to our trip. Highly recommend.

Undoubtably, the Panama is a beautifully located restaurant with views overlooking the city of Dubrovnik and the surrounding countries of Bosnia and Montenegro.

I just stopped for a coffee and a break, so unfortunately I did not have time to eat so I am basing this review on location and staff,
Both 
10/10

Had to walk to the top due to the cable car being closed. Hoping that there was a kiosk at the top for a cuppa or cold drink and we found this amazing place. The staff couldn't have been better - a seat right on the edge of the platform - cocktail and a cuppa - and the most fabulous piece of cheesecake!

Amazing views over dubrovnik. We turned up on a quiet day (cable car was not working - recommend walking up if you can). Got a seat with an OK view. Staff were great - offered to move us to a better seat as soon as one came up. Food was good (steak sandwich and chicken sandwich and a bottle of wine). We spent a long time sitting in the sun - it was lovely.

Went here in first day in debrovnik. We were fortunate it wasn’t to busy due to cable cart not operating, pleasant experience, staff were very accommodating, stunning views on a clear day, would recommend a local taxi going up there, the track to the top in places is difficult.

Amazing restaurant and panaramic views in every direction. We arrived here for lunch after the War museum. Nothing was too much trouble for the serving staff. A delight at the top of Dubrovnik. A must do visit
With a view like this; literally at the top of Dubrovnik; who bothers about the food... anyways the food is decent and compliments an extraordinary location with an amazing view

Must Make Reservation! We were taken to an amazing table with incredible view of Dubrovnik. The service was the best in the city and were very attentive. They even gave us a free dessert for our honeymoon! The beef tartar was the best dish of the night. I would highly recommend to anyone going to Croatia!

Although the cable car isn't running - shame on a government that isn't recognizing the importance of their tourists!- the Panorama restaurant is a wonderful experience - delicious food, professional service, and a spectacular evening view of Dubrovnik.

Had evening drinks and nibbles whilst watching the sunset. Absolutely stunning views. The staff were very attentive and lovely. Prices were only slightly more than those down below which wasn't bad considering they have a monopoly up there!

The restaurant has excellent city views and we stayed there for dinner. We did not have a reservation, still were one of the best tables. Probably in high peak season, you may need to reserve. We were there in April end so not very crowded. They offer blankets and lantern to keep you warm since it can get quite cold and windy after sundown. The food was excellent. We ordered the seafood risotto, prawn soup and lamb. Everything was amazing.

Everything about our visit to this restaurant was amazing, from the stunning views over the city, the delicious food and the attentive service we received. Worth booking in advance to get one of the tables on edge of the mountain with the best views.

After an exhausting walk up, I was treated to a great meal here. Started off with a pumpkin creamy soup which was absolutely delicious. Then moved on to the Mediterranean squid dish with a side of roasted potatoes. The food was very good and have absolutely no complaints in quality. They also provide blankets and heating lamps to help keep you warm as the wind is quite a bit stronger on top.

To tell you the truth I initially thought this place would be a total tourist trap with mediocre food, but I was proven wrong! Firstly the view is incredible! 

I traveled to Dubrovnik with my husband and another couple, we went to the top of Mount Srd and knew we wanted to at least get a drink at the Panorama Restaurant. We didn't have a reservation and were able to get a table quickly. Keep in mind, our table was not at the coveted edge area, we also went to Croatia in April which is not the busy season, I can totally see this place get packed during high season requiring a reservation. 

The first thing I noticed when we sat down was that they offered blankets for you to cover up in case you are cold, great idea!! I'm always cold! We ordered Aperol spritzes for the table which were delicious! Then we ordered lunch, I had a fish salad with octopus, anchovies and shrimp, WOW SO GOOD! I can't remember what everyone else got to eat but I know that they enjoyed their food. The staff was super friendly and accommodating, although everything was a little pricy but what do you expect for a place like this. Overall I would highly recommend this spot.

After walking up the mountain we decided to have lunch here. Wow! The food!! The view!! Everything from the service to music to the price was amazing. If i didnt have to hike up the mountain again i would be back tomorrow 😂😂
After checking out the tremendous views from the peak it was nice to sit down relax and have a drink and snacks. Great location overlooking Dubrovnik. Friendly staff and prompt service.

The sort of place you MUST book in advance, if you want a seat on the edge...
Using the 10% discount card, we had a few cups of coffee and a lovely cheese platter. Quite cold when we visited, so blankets provided and also heaters were switched on to max!
Aside of the good food, just a stunning view!
If it's not too busy - ask for a seat overlooking the ocean. Beautiful! We had cocktails and steak sandwiches and lingered for ages enjoying the atmosphere. Fabulous.

On Easter Sunday we took a cable car ride up to panorama restaurant . The views were amazing . I had already reserved my table and we had s lovely spot over looking the old town . It was a little chilly due to the wind but blankets and patio heaters are provided . The menu was fairly small but I had a lovely Greek salad and the rest of the family had burgers which they enjoyed . They also tried the desserts which were good . The local fraught beer was excellent . Service wasn’t rushed and we had plenty of time to savour the view .We were given a 10% loyalty card which I later used at their duster restaurant Dubravka

Ate dinner on the terrace in the evening. Superb views of the coast and old town and wonderful to watch the sun go down. Very grateful for the supplied blankets and heater as it was quite chilly in the breeze. Staff could not have been more helpful and were brilliant with our kids aged 11 and 8. Food and wine were excellent, can highly recommended the chicken rustica with lentils, beautifully done. Absolutely worth the cable car trip and completely made our holiday.

Had lunch and a few drinks here whilst soaking in the sun and enjoying the fab view. Took the cable car back down which was fun. Staff were very polite and helpful. Would recommend for the view alone!
after long day driving around needed some tee time. place has excellent views even late evening. service was also great not to mention the desert.
Ok food but the view is worth sitting and having lunch. Not an extensive menu. We had the steak sandwich, risotto and a pasta dish.
Stopped here for morning coffee after wandering around Mount Srd. Lovely coffee, delicious cake and fabulous views

I would only go to this place for drinks. The service was poor and the food was cold. I had the steak sandwich and it was really bad, the bread, the cheese, onions and tomato. My girlfriend had the pasta carbonara, which was alright, but it was served cold.

We had a lovely meal simple menue, bar snack type food burgers salads etc. however given the location and view well priced and good quality service was top they even moved us to a better table without being asked when one became available 

Lovely way to have to have lunch looking down at the old town
We went for a lunch one afternoon in this restaurant overlooking entire old city of Dubrovnik and food was great, drinks were cold and view was breathtaking.

Me and my wife used the cable car to go up the mountain to fort imperial while there we went for a drink in the panorama restaurant we found the staff friendly and the prices not too bad but the view was absolutely stunning looking one way into dubrovnik or the other way Serbia you can book a table and I think it is open at night looking down on floodlit walls of the old city well recommended

My wife and I visited the Panorama restaurant for a couple drinks after making the trek up the hill (we arrived before 5pm).
We were greeted by the front of house and when we advised we were after a couple drinks she quickly lost interest. We were taken to pretty much the worst table in the restaurant (no view), can only assume this was because we were buying drinks not food as there were a lot of tables overlooking the ocean that were vacant. 
The staff were quite rude, which is disappointing considering the reviews and the premium pricing, perhaps they don’t value customers who only purchase drinks.

We decided to eat here after our Dune Buggy trip, I was a bit dubious as often you pay for the view however, I was pleasantly surprised. The food was good- we were very basic though (burgers & sandwiches), the service was excellent & the view, though cold (complementary blankets help) was stunning! Highly recommend!

We didnt eat here, took the cable car up from Dubrovnik and had a few drinks and a snack, red and sparkling wine w french fries (comes w mayo and ketchup).
This place has a lot of staff, not much waiting time. Very helpful to move you to a good table with better view.
Its extremily windy (doooh) so be prepared, the blankets at every table might not be enough. Probably a good place to enjoy the sunset if you have booked a table in advance.

The view here can't be beat (request table 12!) but we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food as well. The menu is small, but that's probably for the best as they can focus on doing a few things well. We had the steak and the local branzino and both were delicious. Overall a great experience and highly recommended when in Dubrovnik.
Sunce we took the Cable to top of the hill we went for a little snack in the restaurant there and it was great both the service and the food

I really wanted to have dinner at this place and wanted the table near the glass view. Manager was not helpful at all even though I was willing to wait and come back in an hour or two. Still he wasn't willing to give us the table found that extremely rude. Me and my friend then decided to go outside and sit in the cold and rain and have coffee.
The staff outside was really lovely and very kind and the view ofcourse is breath taking. However feel really let down about the dinner.
We are at the hill top restaurant of Dubrovnik next to the cable car station.The restaurant can fetch good sunset view. It provides variety of pasta and steak meal with choices of beverage.

This restaurant has the most amazing vista out of any we’ve visited. Not only that the service was impeccable and the food excellent. Slightly limited menu but definitely worth a visit. Would recommend booking to get a table ‘on the edge’.

Went to Panorama for a early lunch. We made reservations for 10:30am but the kitchen didn’t open until 11am so we ordered cappuccinos and enjoyed the view! Since we went so early we basically had the place to ourselves! The staff were super friendly and accommodating! It was a little cold so they turned on the heaters and gave us blankets! This is a must try in Dubrovnik!!

What a stunning location - money cannot buy an experience like the panorama resteraunt ! We took the cable car up and we're a half an hour early for our table , staff were really accomodating and we got a table with fantastic veiw. Although it was chilly you are provided with heaters and blankets. The food was delicious and really good quality and fantastic service from the whole team. I'd recommend this place time and time again ! Thankyou

The views from this terraced restaurant are stunning,looking back down over the Old Town. It was sunny but windy when we visited, so the provided blankets and heaters were welcome! We just stopped for a light lunch (steak sandwich) and a beer, which was fine - premium prices, but understandable with the prime location. Service was attentive, and credit cards not a problem. Glad we visited but this wouldn't be a regular lunch slot.

Went here for breakfast on our last day. Fantastic. Had the classic which was beautiful fresh fruit, juice,hot drink, croissants, bread,jams,honey . Lovely fresh food. A view to die for. Lovely pleasant staff. Did not rush us at all. Would Def. Recommend the breakfast.

Great view and staff went out of their way to get us a window seat as although there were plenty of seats out on the terrace it was very windy. The waiter was excellent and also volunteered to take our family photo. The cheesecake was one of the best we have tasted and beautifully presented with a strawberry pouring sauce. My daughter and I had chocolate mousse bombe which had a separate chocolate sauce. My husband and I visited last year and they gave us 10% off the bill as we were returnees ! Recommend 👍

We chose the nicest sunny day to go up in the cable car and although it was a little windy we were offered blankets and a heater whilst we had our drink. A member of staff offered to take our photo which was great. 
A lovely view of the old town where you can just have a drink or something to eat.
Clean and tidy with friendly staff and great service

I had lunch with my family at the Panorama Restaurant at the hill called "Srđ". Food was amazing also the staff, young and professional waiters. We even get 10 percent discount card of their fellow restaurants at the old city. HUGE RECOMMEND!!

We were lucky to spend the afternoon enjoying the fantastic weather and drinking some fine beers with the best view of Dubrovnik. We even splurged on a couple delicious desserts of apple pie and cheesecake! Totally worth it! Such a great experience!

I would thoroughly recommend travelling up Mount Srd in the cable car late afternoon, taking in the incredible panoramic views & then eating dinner at this excellent restaurant while watching the sun go down over Dubrovnik & the Adriatic. The views from this restaurant are just stunning & to enhance this amazing experience, both the food and the service are excellent. We stayed for a few hours & loved everything about it! I would suggest boooking if you want a table at the front for the best views - we didn’t but we were moved to one fairly quickly when it became available. We expected this restaurant to be excessively expensive given its location but actually the prices were good by Dubrovnik’s standards & the restaurant quality was far superior to many in the old town. (As an additional bonus, you will be given discount at the two equally good sister restaurants located close to the east & west gates of the old town after visiting this one). Delicious food, great service & stupendous views ... what’s not to love?!

I visited this restaurant earlier tonight with my daughter. The cable car cost 170 Cuna return for an adult so I was really hoping it was worth it at the top. There are great views and I’m glad we reserved a table in advance to make sure we got a seat. It was a little cold but there were blankets provided and heaters. The food was good, service was great and views were spectacular. A memorable experience from our first holiday in Croatia 👍☀️🍷
Never have I ever visited such a beautiful place! View is amazing. Had an amazing time with my family. wonderful

Visited as part of Birthday weekend with my daughters.
Booked ahead requesting terrace with view but need not have worried- spectacular views everywhere. Not too busy at this time of year but think you would need book in summer.
Great table- heaters and rugs provided which kept us nice and cosy.
Food good- I had steak sandwich and fries,but daughters fillet was gorgeous. Complimentary fruit brandy very nice.
Nice view, beautiful atmosphere. Like eating and drinking in the sky above one of the beautiful cities of the world.
We ate lunch here and found both the food and service to be great. We chose a table with a great view and the weather cooperated. Couldn’t ask for a better memory.

The service was spectacular and the staff was extraordinary! We have got the best place (corner table) and the waiter was very kind and professional. My partner proposed me at this place and everything was just perfect and amazing. Thanks to great organization and support of management and staff of the Restaurant. As a sign of attention, at the expense of the house, we have got a bottle of beautiful champagne. I'm sure, without the help and organization of the staff of this restaurant, our engagement day would not be the same. I am sure that we will come back again to visit this place many time in the future. Thank you once again for making my engagement day unforgettable! Greetings from Sarajevo!!

What a place! Fantastic view of the old town and harbour, the service is unobtrusive- there is even a buzzer on the table to call the waiter when you need him. Relaxing music, amazing food - we got the steak sandwich and a cheeseburger. Very relaxing. 
We took the cable car up and were lucky with the weather. 
With 10% discount from the cable car ticket it was a great way to spend Sunday lunchtime

If you are in Dubrovnik do not miss going to this point. The views are magnificent and it would be best to do sundown for the full effect and beauty of this place. Great drinks and excellent food! Take a Uber to the top as it is cheaper and faster. But then take the tram down if you wish.

The restaurant is just in front of the ocean which it is very appealing.
The food was good and the service also was good.
Great views, good service, gets very busy and a bit pricey as would be expected, if you would like a meal here book in advance

Had a wonderful coffee here on a blustery day in March. The views are stunning and the coffee was very good. The food being served also looked very enticing.
Its also well worth visiting the museum next door!
Quiet and romantic evening, perfect food, excellent service, lovely restaurant... my high recommendation for this Restaurant.

We have really loved our visit at Panorama Restaurant. The food is excellent with a great service, very professional. The view is just unbelievable.. The entire city of Dubrovnik can be viewed from the terrace. Absolutely a must for your visit.
Rode the cable car for a breathtaking lunchtime view. The restaurant was wonderful with plenty of outdoor patio seating. The food was good, but the view is great.

Group of 3 females, we booked a table on the terrace with a view and believe me, the view is STUNNING - you will be blown away! I chose the beef, which was incredibly tasty and very well presented might I also add, as it arrived within a silver dish. All 3 of us, very impressed with the food and the service at Panorama Restaurant. Food 4*, 5th star for the location. Would recommend this to be your extra lavish meal of the holiday and go all out, cocktails galore!

[please note, this review did not for some reason appear when I first wrote it, so I am having to remember, several months down the line.] The previous week we had travelled on the (much longer) cable car in Sarajevo, and were disappointed to find there was nowhere to eat at the top, In Dubrovnik, someone has clearly realised there is a market for tourists to sit down to eat and enjoy the view. And indeed it is quite spectacular. We were situated right by the panoramic glass windows and had a fabulous view over Dubrovnik, with the cable cars coming and going near us. It actually gave me a bit of a sea-sick feeling. The food was good; we only had sandwiches or salad between us, plus a drink, which worked out at £17 per person, a bit more than I would usually expect to pay for lunch, but you were getting a spectacular view.

Panorama Restaurant has the best view if you want to see the Old Town of Dubrovnik from the top of the mountain. The food is good, a little bit expensive, but you have to pay for the fantastic panorama.

Words not photos will do justice as to how beautiful this place is. The staff were extremely polite and attentive and the food- well, it was one of the best ribeye steaks I have ever had! 
Repeatedly tried to get the red wine we were drinking in the UK and have been unsuccessful. 
I cannot wait to come back again.

We celebrated a friends birthday here and the views are truly spectacular and we saw the most amazing sunset (I would recommend you check the time the sun sets and watch it from here)
The food was lovely and the staff attentive and friendly
We visited the end of October and had asked for a cliff side table and whilst the views were fantastic it was also a little windy and chilly.The blankets provided by the restaurant and the table heaters provided enough warmth as the sun set but I can imagine in the summer when it is hot this would be an amazing place to be

Restaurant with one of the most beautiful views of the Old Town where you can truly enjoy while drinking coffee or eating a tasty meal at any time of the day. The recommendation is to book a table as soon as possible (for a better view) because it often happens that they are overbooked. Excellent local food and exceptionally helpful staff.
Fabulous views. Great menu esp thé desserts!!! The cable car doesn’t work if it’s too windy so beware!

The adventure to go up to a restaurant is what excited me the most. When you reach up the view is amazing. Complete view of Old City from the Top. I had my Booking done from before or evening time its little hard to get a table. My advice BOOK IN ADVANCE. Food and service was amazing. All i can say its a must visit place in Dubrovnik.
P.S. Order your food as soon as you get there. They take time to prepare the food.
It was a nice albeit small restaurant. Service was on par and food tasty. A tourist destination, it isn't the most atmospheric but a nice resort. Would recommend

There are a few excellent reasons for eating at Panorama, the first are the views - simply spectacular. You just can't ask for a nicer vantage point to share a meal while enjoying the sight of such a beautiful city by the sea. Lots of staggered outdoor seating with umbrellas for diners' comfort, they also have an interior small dining area with floor to ceiling windows. 

The second reason is the staff, incredibly welcoming and kind, the servers spoke a variety of languages and exhibited a lot of good humor and grace during a very busy lunch time. Management obviously does a good job of hiring the right people and training them well. A manager even offered us a better table by the window when it became available - a very thoughtful gesture which was much appreciated.

The food is good if you keep it simple. we shared a very nice cheese platter and the toasted ham & cheese sandwiches were fine. The burgers weren't appealing to my beef loving husband. He thought there was too much filler in the patty; I didn't have a bite of his, so can't really comment.

We saved this restaurant for our last night in Dubrovnik and it didn't disappoint. The views are spectacular. We were greeted by Vedran who was great and our waiter was Josipa. It is 2 months ago now, as our internet was cut off by new neighbour and I have been very busy, but I had made a note in my diary to write a review about how good they were. It really was a spectacular way to finish our time in Dubrovnik and can only highly recommend. Book early, so that you get a table with a great view- as we had. 
The photos are not great as we had an inside table, as I booked too late for an outside one with a view and so there is a reflection of our meal from the glass of the window.
Enjoy!!

We were not sure whether this was a tourist trap or not but we are so glad that we took our host’s advice to ride the cable car so that we could experience the breathtaking aerial views of Dubrovnik. The food and drinks at the restaurant were good but it was the view that made the experience. A must during your stay in Dubrovnik.

During our stay in Dubrovnik we got the recommendation to have lunch on top of the hill at the Panorama restaurant. The food was very good but the views were amazing!! Recommended! Try to get here in sunset time :)

I went here with my sister as part of her birthday celebrations and it was really lovely. The view is where it is at although the service and food were good, the views are amazing! Managed to get a table in the sun as even though it was really warm the wind can be quite cold so would recommend this, but they do keep the brollies up most of the time if you prefer.
enjoy!

On low season the outside terrace doesnt open so i made a reservation in the morning for the view.
But once i arrive there (arrive 5-10minute) late they didnt have my reservation or have a spot.
I was very unhappy but they told me to wait till the seats were available.
But i thought it was not right because i can clearly see that people just came in and sat. So we decide to leave but the manager followed us and apology for the misunderstanding and ask us to wait till the seat were available. So we decide to come back and sat till the table was available . They were nice enough to give us the complimentary drinks and we were able to change to window seats on time.
If the manager didnt came to us when we went out of the restaurant and apology i would have gave zero stars but they had acted very well and gave us really good services. The food was little salty but the shrimp rissoto was fairly good. But the view you get is just purely amazing.
With the quick act on the service and food and view i will definitely come back.

We were there having out break for a drink and the view was amazing!
Staff was very nice and they served on time!

We saved this restaurant for our last night in Dubrovnik and it didn't disappoint. The view can't be beat. We had a lovely table right on the edge so the view was truly spectacular. While our waiter could have been friendlier, we certainly didn't let us dampen an otherwise great night. Dinner was delicious and price was about what you would expect when it includes such beautiful scenery.

This must be the best view I've had from a restaurant. Great food, friendly staff, amazing views!

The photos speak for themselves. Such a relaxing experience.
Called in for some drinks after visiting the museum. Very good service and reasonably priced. However try and get a table at the edge as the views of Dubrovnik are really special.

It was really a highlight to enjoy a delicious lunch at the Panorama Restaurant at the top of the Cable car stop. Beautiful scenery below and amazing to see the entire walled city of Dubrovnik. The food was very good and comparably priced to many dining options within the Old Town. Relish the gorgeous views as you enjoy a lovely meal.

The restaurant is at the top of the cable car in Dubrovnik and offers wonderful views down over the old town and port.

We had drinks and cakes and whilst not cheap we’re certainly not as expensive as other areas in Europe. Service was great and we were provided for blankets in case we were cold.

The cakes were superb and with the view gave a lovely experience and definitely worth the money

This won't be a cheap meal but it will be freshly cooked, tasty and served by friendly staff. Arrive early or book if you're sitting outside as it gets very crowded. They do have blankets and some electric heaters if you are sat on the seaward side so its always best to go for them if you can. Should they not be able to accommodate you, they do have other locations in the city as well. If you are going out of season, make sure you take a coat as it is always a few degrees colder up the mountain and much more exposed to the wind.
An absolute must. The view is amazing and the restaurant first class. The service was very good indeed, the food very tasty and ,considering the location, good value.

Had drinks and also a dessert at panorama and its views were beautiful! Can get chilly if the wind is up but they supply blankets!! Staff friendly and try to seat you at the best seats possible to enjoy the view! Prices aren’t the cheapest of Dubrovnik but the view is worth it!! Dessert was gorgeous as well as the cocktails! Definitely worth a visit!
Perfect service, food, drinks and view to the old town and see. That’s the place to go for unforgettable sunset!

Have to admit was a bit sceptical due to the location. We only had a snack lunch and drinks but the food was great and well presented. The views are amazing and only the same price as in and around the Old Town. It was slightly overcast so we were offered a heater and blankets - only like a typical summers day in the UK.

What can I say - the view over Dubrovnik is to die for and the cheeseburgers as good as any of us has had anywhere (including New York)! A trip to Dubrovnik wouldn't be complete without a ride up in the cable car to this restaurant overlooking the beautiful old town of Dubrovnik. We also went to the museum of the Homeland War which is next to the restaurant, and both right next to where you get off the cable car. A great day out👍

We spent a good couple of hours here just having drinks as the views are amazing. The staff are courteous and there’s a good cocktail menu🍸 🍹. As it got a bit windy we were given blankets and there is also patio heaters. Whilst it is an indulgence, it is a beautiful way to unwind.

We waited for a table outside at sunset, but when we got our table the wind was so cold, they offered to let us sit inside which we happily agreed to! Food was good too, had chicken rustica and club sandwich. Fries and salad were tasty too. The true treasure of this place is the views though!!

There on a windy day in October so the outside terrace was closed. Food was good although more expensive than average. Staff was pleasant. Views from inside restaurant were good although photos are somewhat spoiled by gondola cables. I wouldn’t make a special trip just for the restaurant but it was a welcome stop after our climb up the hill.
This place awaits you at the top of the cable car ride, and what a welcoming place it is, great food and drink, with terrific views of the walled city.😜

We visited Panorama Restaurant last night to celebrate our first wedding anniversary and our final night in Dubrovnik. I emailed the day before to reserve a table and requested one at the edge so that we could get the most out of our experience and we were not disappointed. We were seated in a corner table with outstanding panoramic views, it was windy when we first sat down and as well as having blankets provided, one of the waiters immediately brought a heater over to us which we were very grateful for. We reserved our table from 5 pm to make the most of our evenings and enjoy the sunset. Shortly after we were seated a waiter came over to take our order, we asked if we could just order drinks initially and then food later which he was more than happy for us to do. We were pleasantly surprised by this as it made our evening more relaxed. The waiters were not pushy trying to make us order, we just gestured over when we were ready. The food itself was superb, both my husband and I had chicken rustico and the flavour and presentation was amazing. We also ordered 2 sides to accompany our mains which were both delicious. The restaurant is a little more expensive than places we would normally visit but it was totally worth it for the quality of the food, the service and the amazing views! This was an absolutely perfect way to celebrate our anniversary and round off a fantastic few days in Dubrovnik! We would definitely recommend Panorama and would advise booking ahead to get the best seats/views! Thank you!!

A great place to relax and take in the amazing views across the Old Town of Dubrovnik and beyond. Menu caters for everyone. Those who want a quick snack to a full on dinner service. Well worth booking a table right on the edge to get the full experience. If we were visiting for longer we would have definitely visited a number of times.
Great quality food and just stunning views of the old town. Good service and a place to relax and take your time sipping wine.

On our recent trip to Dubrovnik we took the cable car up the mountain to find this restaurant,after a little wait we were shown to our table .well worth the wait as the view alone was magnificent .the food was also very good ,served by lovely staff .not cheap but then worth every penny .

Came up here with my family to celebrate our daughter turning 1, we’re glad we did because it was better than option 2 which was McDonalds.

The views here are some of the best we’ve see. In Europe, really nice staff too and nice food.

Well worth the visit.

We were recommended to try here by friends who had previously visited. The food was good but expensive. You are definitely paying for the view which is stunning. Plenty of outdoor heaters that meant even in the cooler evening, we could still sit and enjoy a cocktail after dinner.

We popped into the panorama restaurant for a quick coffee/beer after visiting the museum in the fort at the top of the cable car.
Two hours later we found we had stayed for cakes and a steak dinner, wine and cocktails.
This is a beautiful restaurant with beautiful tasty food great ambiance and fantastic staff.
Our waiter Rajko (???) made us feel like long time friends.
Whilst enjoying our drinks we were able to study other people’s food. It all looked so delicious and well presented. It’s a good place for people and food watching. 
We asked Rajko about the dishes. He was very knowledgeable about the food and accompanying wine. He described them perfectly and we were not disappointed when we received the food we eventually ordered.
Portion sizes are adequate, menu variety good prices reasonable and service swift but not rushed. They are aware of the time of the last cable car so no need to stress about finishing your meal in time.
Price guide:- the two of us had coffee and cake, a couple of beers, a cocktails each, 300g fillet steak 
and a glass of wine each for the equivalent of £110.00.
Thank you Panorama, we had a fantastic time

Pre-booked for a table of 10 via the website. Great communication. 
Had an early start from the uk so booked here for late lunch. Short trip up the cable car which is just outside the old town wall. Gets busy so give yourself plenty of time to get up there. 
Stunning views. Food, service excellent. We had been warned we could only have the table for 2 hours but in the end they gave us 3, were very apologetic that we had to move but set us up a couple of poser tables with our wine & watch the sun go down.

After travelling up in the cable car I had a lovely relaxing lunch with a perfect view. I booked a table in advance and was given a great table on the edge of the terrace with views down on to the old town and Lokrum island
