The food was definitely a little pricey but no more than expected, I did google the menu in advance so was well prepared 
I choose the club sandwich and was delicious
As a solo diner I wasn’t rushed at all and had a lovely break from sightseeing while taking in more amazing views

Maybe it’s just me, but there’s something special about sitting in a restaurant at the top of a mountain in Croatia overlooking the Adriatic ocean on a clear day drinking a cup or Earl Grey tea (yes I know..tea..vacation).

After some walking and more steps we get to the cable car at Mt. Srd, Dubrovnik..and when we had put our jaws back in place after they had fallen from the view we went to the restaurant “Panorama “. 

We hadn’t eaten since breakfast so were a little peckish at this point, so we thought we’d give this place a go. We both had the club sandwich and it was fresh and tasty. The fries were good too. I had a cup of tea and my wife had a latte. I had read that this place was pricy, so we were kinda ready to be shocked,but really, considering that Dubrovnik is what it is the prices were ok.

For me at least this was the highlight of our trip. The staff couldn’t have been nicer and the view was to die for. We weren’t rushed even though they were busy enough. We spent a few hours here, but personally I could’ve stayed all day. Highly recommend this for the views alone.

Lovely restaurant on top of hills overlooking Dubrovnik old town. Food is great and not overly expensive. Service was faultless and the view mind blowing. It's a fantastic day out. You need to get to the top of the mountain. While it is possible to drive (or walk) by far the best way is to take the cable car ride. Between 2 to 3 minutes in total gets you to the upper cable car station. I would certainly go again.
the view is without a doubt one of the best in the world .... We had lovely food and coffee also. Service was great and it wasn't too expensive.

After waiting in line for 45 minutes for the cable car, we were ready for refreshment when we got to the top, and the restaurant did not disappoint. Great panoramic views over Dubrovnik and the Adriatic. My wife enjoyed an iced coffee which was better than dessert and I had a coincidentally appropriately named Pan beer. Though we didn't eat, others around seemed to be enjoying their food. Prices understandably reflect the unique surroundings but were not ridiculous.

This restaurant is in a wonderful location with views that are out of this world. Having travelled up in the cable car to visit the Homeland War Museum we decided to have a light lunch. We both opted for salads which were very tasty indeed and washed down with some local beer and wine. Not the cheapest place we found whilst in the area but well worth it due to the fantastic setting.

This could easily be a tourist trap, but is actually a very good restaurant. The kitchen delivers tastynfood with a ery good presentation. The waiters are skilled and very polite. Some times during the day may be a little crowded, so you will have to wait for a table if you have not booked. But it sorts out with a smile.

Decided to take the cable car to check out the views, which were amazing, and decided to chill out at the Panorama for coffee and cake. I had the chocolate and walnut cake and my husband had the apple pie. Both were absolutely divine. So divine in fact we're going back today. 
Well worth the 150 kuna ticket for the cable car!

food wine and experience fantastic. The weather made the view more special. Worth the cable care ride. Not the cheapest place to eat but staff are friendly and helpful. Food is good and choices for vegetarians.

Had lunch here after driving up! It was only a toastie with salad and fries but tasty. My husband had a club sandwich with salad and fries which he said was lovely. Can't remember what it cost. It was Probably more expensive than your normal light bite but we were on holiday and enjoyed the view. It sat inside as it was very windy outside but there was a lovely outdoor terrace.
The perfect place to enjoy a meal and a bottle of wine whilst taking in the beautiful views and the warmth of the sun. We will definitely be returning...

The views are outstanding, and the food was surprisingly good. For all that it’s a tourist trap, and you are a bit of a captive audience, they don’t exploit that too much and, although a little pricier than normal., the food was good and service excellent. Great experience sitting having lunch, watching the cable car, and looking out over the old town.
Very good food and service was excellent. The waiters helped so much with everything. Would definitely recommend

Having been recommended this place by a host of friends, we left it characteristically late to book (in the taxi on the way in from the airport for that afternoon) so were we found out incredibly lucky to get a fantastic table high on the cliffs overlooking the city for seven people.

And the incredible vertiginous views are just part of it. Although towards the upper end of pricey, the food, service and general ambiance make it a hugely enjoyable experience.

Over a leisurely three hour late lunch we enjoyed excellent seafood, fish and meat dishes in the late Summer sunshine, with excellent and attentive service. Portions are generous and the presentation second to none.

Too often restaurants in such unique locations think that all they need to do is exist. With the Panorama, nothing could be further from the truth.

We were subsequently told that this restaurant often has a two month waiting list, which is easily understood. If you are coming to Dubrovnik, book now if it’s the only thing you organise.
Food was good. Staff were excellent, polite and attentive. Prices slightly elevated due to location but you get that everywhere and the view was well worth it. Definitely worth a visit!

Was recommended this restaurant before travelling so prebooked the communication was very good and because i booked a month before on arrival at the restaurant we were allocated a great table. The food was excellent and the drinks were too, the meal was very good value. If you want a decent table pre book.
We tried to make reservation, but we were told that they were booked. Went anyways and were able to get a great table. Spectacular views! Lunch was good ( not great) but the view!!!!!! Recommend

The most important place to visit and eat if you take the cable car in Dubrovnik. Best views and phenomenally and absolutely best views!!!

We had fruit salad and one chocolate walnut cake that was amazing.

My friend and myself went and had a drink here and one of the best pieces of cake we have ever had. 
The service was great and staff very friendly. But the best bit was the view. WOW. Absolutely amazing view over Dubrovnik. If you are up there it’s definitely worth a visit .

We hadn't booked (error!!) but the staff accommodated for us and we were able to enjoy a nice drink (I highly recommend the Croatian Sparkling wine!!) while the sun set... before the rain came! 

The restaurant provides blankets and heaters and nice relaxing music.

All staff were friendly, and we were able to use out 10% off voucher which the restaurant partners provide. 

Very nice experience!

Absolutely the best view down and around the coast as well as to the Bosnia hills. Fenced off area is still containing landmines to the east. Busy place as the cable car ends nexr door but tge prices steer people away. 4 coffees for us 130kn = €18 so savoir the moment.

We expected this to be a pricey couple of drinks so we were prepared. Views were amazing, as expected, and drinks were lovely. We also ate some olives which were delicious. Staff were a little hassled looking, maybe, but all of them friendly and polite.

We expected prices to be expensive as this is a major tourist attraction and we were pleased to find they weren't 
There was a good selection on the menu.
Service was good and staff were helpful and friendly.
We had cheese and ham toasties which were well presented and came with fries and salad 
The views are excellent so it's a really good place to relax and enjoy lunch

We had our evening meal at the restaurant while we waited for the sunset. 

The food is pricey but the view is amazing and everything we ordered was delicious. 

The staff were friendly, helpful and attentive.

My wife and I ate here on our first night. The views are amazing, and the food is not bad either. Our server Rajko was very helpful and friendly from figuring out wine pairings to suggesting places to visit during our trip.

Went up the cable car ( a must for all visitors to Dubrovnik) to see the view and visit the Homeland museum.

We then stopped off for a coffee at Panorama, what a sensational place.

Perched on the top of the mountain the views are spectacular over the Old Town , Lokrum and the rest of Dubrovnik, the restaurant is tiered along the edge so everyone get a great view.

We just had coffee but the thought of coming for lunch or dinner was very appealing.

Prices seemed ok remembering you were enjoying one of the best views on the planet.

Service was good friendly and attentive.

This is long overdue review from me .We went here with my partner and what an uincredible experience. sunset, meal the air, o and the services from our waiter BLAZ ( hope I got his name right) was second to none...he really did spoil us with something we didn't expect. 

We will definitely be returning in the future next year!

I would highly recommended this place, all staff were extremely helpful and polite.

Excellent food good service

Price much better that the ones in the Old Town 

They want a 100 characters well this is a 117

A Cable car up to the hill costs 150 kuna. On the hill is a very good restaurant, espesially if you get a table near the window. The wiev is wonderful towards the city of Dubrovnik and the sea. The food, a beefsteak, was also tasteful. The cost for two was 700 kunas.

I recommend this place.

One of the best experiences in Dubrovnik 
Cable car was one unforgettable experience with special view on Old town and whole Dubrovnik.
Restaurant Panorama... you have to try it to believe it.
Amazing food and service. Take a coat if you go up in the evening, and check when last cable car back is too

We had a light lunch there. Prices were similar to nicer cafes in the Old City. We really enjoyed the relaxed setting as it was very crowded on the viewing decks so it allowed us to sit, relax, and enjoy our time at the top. The inside dinning room was a break from the winds and they played a low level of "soft jazz" renditions of classic rock.... it worked for us :-)
Managed to get there for sunset, beautiful view of the sunset and the city. You will need to book earlier to get a table with a view.

We took the cable car up to see the beautiful sunset while on holiday here. This restaurant (the only one at the top where the cable cars stop) is very nice. Very pleasant staff. Nice menu, plenty to choose from. Delicious desserts. Would recommend

We got the cable car up at 6pm for a dinner reservation at 630pm and the sunset. The views are truly remarkable and the food and service were worth the trip also.

Great seafood and drink selection and blankets/heaters for when the wind gets up and the temperature goes down.

Even if the food isnt for you, the chance to see the Old Town from the dinner table is worth the visit alone.

Travelled to Dubrovnik for our honeymoon. We booked in advance to get a front row terrace seat overlooking the sea and city. We had booked for 7.15 but arrived early and asked if we could get a drink. The staff were incredibly helpful and advised that our table was ready if we wanted to be seated that was no problem which worked out great as we were there for sunset. Our waiter was very attentive and polite. The food was fantastic - I thought it was nice the Panorama don't just rely on the view they offer and actually provide great food and service. It's not the chepeast meal but I would confidently say it constitutes as fine dining and was well worth the money. Anyone saying it is overpriced was clearly expecting a cafe which this is not. 10/10 and an absolute must if travelling to Dubrovnik. Sorry only pictures of the sunset I got included me!

It's a short gondola ride up to Restaurant Panorama, and from here you'll get some of your best photos. Absolutely brilliant view over Dubrovnik. I made our reservations for 6 people months in advance, so we were in a prime spot to enjoy the views. Our food was great and the service was excellent. A great night was had by all!!!!

The customer service was slightly on the down side, however the view was amazing and I love the iced coffee as it was made with vanilla ice cream, not too sweet yet refreshing.

Cakes were also very nice
One of the best restaurants I visited ever the views are spectacular exceptional food and great service we went one way by the cable car and back by a cab worth it
Service and food were amazing!!..and the view is just breathtaking!!! It is high end restaurant but it is worth it. You won't be disappointed it is a unique experience.

Perched on the top of a mountain overlooking Old Town Dubrovnik, it IS possible to catch a taxi up (or down), but the best way to get to Panorama Restaurant is by Cable Car.
We decided to try both methods of transport - and the ride down was a white-knuckle ride that rivals Queenstown's Shotover Jet.
Transport issues aside, the view was spectacular and the food excellent. Free WiFi was included - and outside, solar-panelled benches with free phone charging outlets (even wireless charging pads) were available for anyone to use. VERY switched-on for such an ancient setting!
Great views and cocktails. This bar is lovely but take a wrap over as can get really windy! Even if you don’t eat go for a drink 👍🏻

First time in Croatia reviews looked good for the highest cafe/restaurant I have ever been too.
Great service great view and good quality food . A pleasure all round
I feared that this would be just another tourist trap - but it is nothing of the kind! This is a fantastic place to lunch or dine. The view is like nothing else. The food and the service is excelent.
It was very good to have the chance to visit that restaurant. The view was amazing and the food was good too. I was satisfied.

Visited Panorama in August 2018 with a group of friends - we pre-booked (advised!) a table requesting views off the edge. 

Pros:
- Views(!)
- Service from waiters 
- Food - portions are large, starters would be enough for most as mains 

Cons: 
- You must book 1-2 weeks in advance to 
secure a good table, esp. if you’re a group of 3+. Email them before your trip...
- Food menu choice could be better to suit varying tastes 
- Queues to get up there (air lift) - would recommend getting a private taxi if you can 

Would recommend overall - views are a definite must see!

The food and atmosphere are wonderful at the Panorama Restaurant. The ride in the cable car is enjoyable but the view of the old town from there is obstructed by the cable car. If you forget to bring a light jacket, the restaurant offers blankets as it can get chilly up there in the evenings.

As my friend have said, that was the most beautiful view ever in any restaurant that we have been and table that they gave is was perfect. We felt like celebrities...and service...amazing...so...full recommended!!!
If you ever visit Dubrovnik and not go up hill with cable car to visit Panorama Restaurant, you will for sure miss something extremely valuable!!
The best view of Dubrovnik and the sea. We went up for the sunset and dinner the view is amazing and the restaurant was good but the service is slow.

It's been said before but views are amazing and we managed to get a table no problem about 5pm. The staff were courteous and helpful throughout and even deducted the cost of one of meals [with no pressure from us] which wasn't cooked to our liking. Overall food was very good and resonable enough. I'd certainly plan on eating there again if in Dubrovnik.

Even though the cable car gets really busy, the best views are from here and it doesnt get that busy. Best of all the prices are actually pretty reasonable considering the location. 

We chilled up here for a few drinks and took in the sunset. Was worth every minute. 
Oh and now have some fantastic uninterrupted photos of Dubrovnik from above.

The food was amazing and the terrace had a great atmoshpere. Service and the staff was really friendly and super nice, helpfull. Domestic guests have a discount on food, which is very commendable. It will provide us with many happy memories. 
Highly, highly recommend.

There probably isn’t a better restaurant view anywhere. And the menu is good and fairly reasonable. But it’s a super busy place and the staff seems stressed out and overly busy which translated to average at best service and was the reason I rated this place at 4 instead of 5

Breathtaking views, amazing food had lunch opted for inside as had air conditioning, I had steak sandwich melted in the mouth, partner had club sandwich again excellent, good choice for drinks and cocktails, we had prosecco served by pleasant helpful waiter who was not phased when all the restaurant became busy. Would definitely recommend our only criticism is for our selves who failed to get back in evening to see sunset or to try the frozen daiquiri!!!must therefore return to Croatia again!!amazing beautiful country

We booked for dinner on the last night of our stay in Dubrovnik. It was the most beautiful setting on top of the mountain! With the most beautiful view of the dubrovnik dazzling in the moonlights! There were a variety of different meals on offer and our waiter made some great recommendations! The food was beautifully cooked and very tasty! This was a mid September evening so could get a little chilly, blankets were provided which was a great touch!

Very easy process to book a table, directly on the internet, you have to confirm your booking the day of your lunch/dinner.

Waiters were very king, polite and paid attention for all of our requests. Dishes were delicious and the view is just amazing. 

We came late so took the cable car to go up (You have to do it to enjoy the view) and then an Ubber to go down which is almost the same price than the cable car.

I will definitely recommend this place to everyone going to Dubrovnik !

The cable car ride in Dubrovnik is not to be missed. Once at the top the views of the town are breathtaking.
This restaurant has a prime position at the top of the hill. If lucky you can get a table at the outside so you can have uninterrupted views of the town and coastline.
We had the cake of the day which was delicious as were the other pastries. A full menu is available for dinner. It was not cheap to eat here but given the views and the excellent service that was to be expected. You can get 10% off if you have promotion card. Ours was given to us free when we bought the cable car tickets. Overall a perfect setting.

This was rated as one of the sixth most romantic restaurants well I beg to differ.
The Views were great but was it worth the money the short answer is no. Having eaten in numerous restaurants in Croatia on my 19 day trip this was okay but it was massed produced.

We took the cable car and after loads of pictures we decided to seat down at the Panorama restaurant. We ordered for the cream caramel and coffee to go with it. The presentation, the taste were just to die for: truly amazing. Their coffee is wonderful too. We managed to seat by the window which made the experience even more special!!! It’s so tranquil and with stunning views of the old town!!! Service was amazing and the waiters are very polite and helpful!!! The suggested to book if we would like to have dinner and seat by the window for sunset!!! A must when in Dubrovnik

As many things in Dubrovnik it’s quite pricey but it’s still quite okay for the location and the “tourist trap” it is.
Professional staff and beautiful view.

Lots of signs abouts reservations. We had none. So they went looking for a table and we got one. Later at sunset it would be busy as lots of tables getting reserved. Go early 2 hours before sunset. Lots of people coming and going. Worth asking for a table. Club sandwiches good. But small lunch portion. Great cocktails.

I was visiting Dubrovnik with my friend and we had seen this restaurant in some guides and decided we had to go. 
I emailed a few weeks ahead and suggested how amazing it would be to be seated at the edge of the terrace, not expecting anything as of course these tables are in high demand. When we arrived we were shown to our table on time and it was one of the most amazing views. We are so grateful that they reserved this table for us. 
This would have been enough alone but the food was amazing, it’s not just a fancy location, these guys really do have it all. 
I highly recommend the lamb shank ! It was incredible ! 
Thank you again, you helped to make our trip special. 
Michael and Alexandra

You come here for the views! This restaurant sits at the top of Mount Srđ overlooking the Old Town and Lokrum Island. The view is spectacular and its a great place to watch the sun set. It is tough to get a reservation, so book in advance. They will give you a seating "window" and ask you to leave by a certain time, although we never got kicked out and probably over-stayed our welcome. We went for dinner, and the food was great (but a bit pricey). A good alternative would be to go during the day for lunch and a drink. It is also accessible by the cable cars, which is another experience in and of itself!
Book in advance by email! Amazing view coupled with great food and service. Great value for money. I will repeat every time i go to Dubrovnik though the cable car ride fee is over priced and short.
With the stunning view of the old town of Dubrovnik, this restaurant has great food and great service. Very friendly staff, ver entertaining with our three year old daughter.

You pay a premium to eat and drink here, but it is worth it.

Pretty sure we had the best seats in the house looking over the coastline.

A great experience

With a view like this, they could serve crap on a stick and people would pay for it. But surprisingly the food isn't just delicious, it's surprisingly well priced. The salmon and roast vegetables side dish were particularly tasty. We didn't have a reservation and were able to get a table with a view, though it was around 4pm. My only complaint is the bees -- though harmless, they were annoying and made it hard to eat at times.

The view from this restaurant is breathtaking. Simply amazing to watch the city from the top... food is good, just the desert that was a disappointment, nothing special. But we enjoyed the dinner and the restaurant

This restaurant is owned by Nautika and the menu is roughly a subset of Dubravka 1836 (where we also ate), so you can compare the prices directly. Yes, Panorama has a mark up, but considering the unique location (even by Dubrovnik standards) it feels quite reasonable.
We arrived some time before the 11am lunchtime (after visiting the museum - highly recommend the view from the Fort's roof!) when no food is available. However, the canny thing to do seems to be to bag one of the tables with an A1 view for a coffee and then just segue right on into lunch - which we did. 
The food and service were up to scratch for the price and we had an extremely pleasant time eating lunch and admiring the view.
(The expensive part is actually the cable-car ride, but for the experience at the top it is well worth it).

Amazing place! Stunning views, we didn’t eat here but had a drink whilst up the cable car! Special thanks to the manager who let us have a seat at a table for 20 minutes between there reservations so we could soak up the views! Definitely worth a visit
It's essential to book to get a table on the edge overlooking the old town. Food is good and service fantastic. The sea bass was superb.

We only had a light lunch (having travelled up the cable car) - just a Greek salad - with a beer and G&T. However, it was well presented by a courteous waiter and very appetising. It also included the ubiquitous oil and balsamic vinegar with a couple of rolls.
We did have to wait a short while for a table, even though it was well past 14:00.

Take the cable car up to the top and you will be rewarded by the most amazing views of Dubrovnik old town. We had a great table on the terrace which was great to admire the views. Once you are seated there is a button on the table which you press when you are ready to order and your waiter will appear at your table. The food was amazing, a bit pricier than we would normally pay, however was definitely worth it and we wanted something special for our first time in Dubrovnik. The total bill came to around 820 kunas (£102) for a bottle of prosecco, 2 x steak sandwich, apple pie, cheesecake and 2 bellini's. Everything was so delicious, staff very pleasant and helpful and would definitely return. I would definitely recommend booking beforehand to guarantee a table. I contacted them beforehand via their website and requested an outside table on the terrace at the barrier and received an e-mail within 10 minutes to confirm. I had to e-mail again on the day of the reservation to reconfirm and again received a prompt response. Excellent service all round

What an amazing experience.

Amazing food, amazing views!

If you are visiting Dubrovnik, this restaurant is an absolute must. Booking a few days in advance is recommended, to ensure a table with the best views. 

We took the cable car up and arranged for an Uber taxi to pick us up and return to our hotel. Uber is by far cheaper than local taxi firms!

Our food was lovely, the prawns were HUGE and portion sizes were great. 

Meals are pricey, but you are most certainly paying for the view. Out of season the restaurant offers discounts.

Highly recommend.

We chose to eat at this restaurant for my birthday, firstly make sure you book a table as the place gets busy. Is the restaurant overpriced, yep but was it worth it, certainly was. The service was impeccable and the food was lovely but what you pay for is the view. We were seated just before 7pm so got to see the last of daylight, watched the sunset and then watched Dubrovnik light up. Definitely worth a visit for a special meal. Panorama would have got a 5 rating if the meal had been slightly cheaper.

I had the foresight to book his restaurant after reading reviews of it. I had booked for 630pm in time to see the sunset and as we arrived before there was already a queue of people who hadn’t booked. We waited for our table in a drinks area so we could admire the views.
Our waiter left a bell on our table to call him when we had decided on our dishes.
The staff were very helpful and advised on dishes and wine.
As for the food...it was good but unfortunately our main course arrived cold. We sent it back and the replacement was only a little bit hotter. From our table to the kitchen it was a fair distance and if the food was not picked up immediately after cooking it obviously got colder by the time it got to our table. However it was tasty.
We were offered free desserts...which were delicious...and ten per cent off our bill, which was fair.
It was a pricey meal...even with the discount...but it was to be expected from this type of venue where the main attraction of this restaurant are the views of the old city and they didn’t disappoint.
In order to get to the restaurant you have to take a cable car and at times there are long queues so if you book a table make sure you leave extra time to get up there. It is worth booking ahead and asking for a table at the edge at sunset.
There were people waiting who hadn’t booked but had to wait for a while. There is a time limit of one hour and three quarters on your table. However because we had sent back our main course we were not thrown off and only left when we were ready.

This restaurant sits on top of the hill overlooking Dubrovnik Old Town with fantastic views.
You reach it by the cable car that also gives great views as you rise to the top.
The food here is 5 star we had the beef fillet and fish of the day which was Tuna, both were superbly cooked. Our waiter told us all about the food Choices and advised us on the wine the dessert was orange and almond cake I though I had gone to heaven when a had a bite.
We also had lunch here this restaurant is very full every day so it is advisable to pre-book.

This is without doubt one of the best locations in the world to have a coffee and cake or a meal ( and although we did so during the day I am sure an evening meal would not disappoint either). The food is good quality for Croatia and has a more varied menu than you would generally find in the restaurants in the Old Town. the fayre we had was brilliant. I would suggest that you get the cable car around 10.30 and have a coffee or a drink before you explore the museum which is very interesting in itself. The queue was lengthy and you can buy your ticked from a booth prior to boarding so get in the line. A full ticket is worth it - return and museum. Having said that there is the option of a ride down the mountain by caddy - but you will need to explore that yourself. When you have done this you then get a voucher ( well our experience anyway) for a 20% discount if your go to the restaurant again. We then booked a table for lunch at 1.00 and just ate and relaxed until 2.30 and we were not rushed. We were able to get table 26 which overlooks the whole of the Dubrovnick harbour, walls and old town. For four with a drink ( and we could have done desserts which looked exceptional but did not) about £70. Drinks were quite expensive. Go on line to look at the menu. You will also have to book the table by phoning a reservation agent ( not sure why they cannot do it at source) but that was relatively simple also.

We didn't reserve a table, and had to wait 10 minutes for one to become available...which wasn't a problem as there's plenty of views around to kill some time.

The views from the restaurant were the best in Dubrovnik, what better view would you like when having a bite to eat or a drink.

Service was very slow. Each table had a buzzer which supposedly alerted the staff to come to your table, but this didn't seem to work straight away. It took 4 buzzes over a 30 minute period just to grab someone to pay our bill. It's also a little pricey and I couldn't help but feel we were paying more for the view than the actual food/drinks themselves.

My daughter and I had lunch at the panorama restaurant this afternoon. The views, service and food were fantastic. I would give it a five star rating but for the fact that the prawns in the king prawn dish we ordered still had the intestinal tract intact. It was very disappointing and not what one would expect from a quality restaurant. It really did put a slight damper on an otherwise fabulous visit.

After two hot days in the old town, we walked the wall and jumped on the cable car. So glad we did, the view is to die for, the beautiful breeze, coupled with some fabulous mojito’s and a delicious lunch make it a “not to miss” event.

We arrived without a reservation, however we only had to wait a few minutes and we were seated right on the terrace.

Lovely attentive staff, beautiful location, cold drinks and great food. This is what holidays are made of! 

Don’t miss this when in Dubrovnik, a day/evening to remember!

My wife and I caught the cable car to the top; as all tourists do; and thought what do we do now.
This restaurant has a cue and is worth the wait. Generally I find tourist spots have no service and the worst food. My wife and I both tentatively ordered salad, dicey in Europe, but thank the maker both were awesome. Watered down with a few Long Island ice teas, service is by pressing the button on your table and a waiter magically appears. 

I just wished I’d stayed all the way to dinner as it would have been sensational to see the old town at night.

Go and enjoy this tourist spot.

We booked in for a sunset meal for 4 on reccomendation of a friend. The Food and cocktails were very nice and it's one of the best places to see the sunset and a view of old town. Get up there early so you have time to look around before hand. 

The cable car to the top is quite expensive, 150 kuna return for a 3 minute journey after what can sometimes be a 30 minute wait. maybe pay one way if you really want to ride it but there are plenty of taxis for alot less.

First of all, book a table a few days in advance, and ask for a table on the terrace with a view. The view itself is out of this world, without doubt the best restaurant view I've ever had! The food is excellent too, and the service is quick and friendly. Be prepared to pay night prices, but I guarantee you won't regret it when you see the view from your table. I would go back in a heartbeat.

A must for any visitor to Dubrovnik,
Everything was just "Unbelievably fantastic".
View, Food and all the staff,
Best night of our Dubrovnik holiday
Restaurant with the best view in Dubrovnik.We had a lunch there. It was superb. We did not have prebooking but after waiting a while, we got the table with an amazing view.
Food was good and service speedy. The location is terrific and it seems because of altitude it’s a bit cooler than the heat in the city. Had a great lunch and the view made it memorable.

Arrived without reservation but after a little wait organized a nice table with a beautiful view.Food deliciously prepared, fresh groceries, beautiful tastes and nice signature of this kitchen. Service casual but very professional, our waiter Stjepan was great.The whole story of this restaurant is great, the view is unreal and is really worth to visit and enjoy it. Well done again.

Incredible customer service, amazing views and delicious food! 
Not over priced and an experience I won’t forget. 
Book in advance to secure a row 1 table.
Just had a drink and cake here. Amazing views, service was slow, but the quality of cake and drinks was great.
Great view of the old Town from panorama. Food and service was great. Only issue was couple smoking next to us, but that is not a fault of the restaurant. Would highly recommend

Got engaged just outside the restaurant before going in to celebrate - we had the best time. Was told before while making the booking that we couldn't get a seat right next to the terrace but when they seated us we were taking to a table right at the edge. It was amazing and received drinks on the house when seated. The food and service was great - it is a little pricey but you pay for that view. Would definitely go back. Thanks Panorama Restaurant for a wonderful experience - you made our engagement very memorable

We enjoyed our food but service was very slow and we needed to put our name on a waiting list for a table as we couldn’t prebook. Prebook if possible. 
Our wait was understandable as it was a popular time and there were lots of people. 
It’s a very romantic place to eat and the sunset is stunning.

We sat in the front row overlooking the Meditteranean Sea and Dubrovnik. It was fantastic. The service and food was excellent. We could have been in a dream it was so unreal. The atmosphere was romantic and the view was overwhelming. It was truly a night in paradise.

I have included a paragraph about this in my review of the cable car.

We choose an ice cream cup which took absolutely ages to arrive. Bearing in mind how pricey this restaurant is, the service should be second to none.

They gestured us the ice cream on the house, which was very fair, but I would not return.

We had a lovely meal here. We didn’t get there for sunset but the views of the lights was very impressive. 
The food, wine and service were all perfect and by 10.30 when we left, the cable cars were nice and quiet. 
Not the cheapest restaurant but we’re more than happy to pay a little bit extra for the right occasion.

I heard lots of great things about this restaurant and the reviews are pretty positive so I had pretty high expectations. I made our reservation about 6 months in advance which I assumed would guarantee us a front row table. We were seated in basically the second row so our views were obstructed and I was immediately frustrated. We paid 300 Kuna (round trip) just to get to this restaurant and then umbrellas, other guests, & distance significantly blocked our view. The food was fine, but not worth the 700+ kuna we paid. I had the pork chop special as recommended by the waiter with potatoes and bacon. Again it was just ok, nothing to brag about. Bryan has the ribeye and it was overcooked. The cheesecake dessert with strawberry sauce was pretty good and our waiter was wonderful! He was busy but very attentive and helpful. What would I change in the future? I’d skip the restaurant, bring a picnic basket and grab a spot on the rocks to enjoy the sunset with an unobstructed view!!! 

Also we got to the cable car 45 mins before our dinner reservation to find a ridiculously long line. Luckily taxi’s are standing by and we jumped in the taxi for the same price as the cable car. Let me tell you, the drive is an experience that you may not want to miss!! I’m kind of glad we ended up in the taxi and not the crossers cable car!

So so glad my friend recommended this restaurant to me- and now I recommend it to you!! 
To get to this restaurant you’ll need to take the cable car to the top of the cliffs, the round trip ticket cost 150kn (£17). If you just do the cable car alone I feel it’s a bit of an anti climax, as there’s little else to do. 

We visited in September, and booked a table for 7pm, there was no problem. My friend who visited in August said there was a big wait, so depending when you’re travelling to Dubrovnik you may find the peak seasons are full. My advice is to book as early as possible to avoid disappointment. 

Views are sensational here, you can see all across the iconic red rooftops of the old town, and the night we went there were fireworks in the harbour, which was the icing on the cake! 

Food was beautiful, even something as simple as roasted chicken and vegetables was cooked to perfection and so well seasoned and presented. The staff cannot do enough for you, you get a buzzer on your table and the minute you press it, a lovely waiter is there in seconds. 

This would be an ideal restaurant for an anniversary, proposal maybe, birthday - anything you’re celebrating, or if you just fancy a lovely evening. There are patio heaters and blankets too, a nice thoughtful touch for when the evening turns a bit chilly. 

Enjoy!
Both food and service were excellent. Wechad light lunchtime snacks with beers. Recommend the smoke salmon & cream cheese sandwich with salad

We went up on the cable car and admired the view strolled around and on passing just happened to ask if they had a table on the edge . Because we were only staying for drinks they were able to get us a table , fantastic and the price wasn't rediculous

I don’t here and watch the sunset and had a great time. Usually restaurants located in one of a kind spots like this are not that good, this is not the case with Panorama. The service and the food were both over the top. I had the veal risotto and loved it along with the capresie salad and both were delicious. It is a bit pricey but considering it’s location l you get with dinner it’s well worth it to me.

We went for a late lunch during the summer. The ride up the cable car gives an amazing overview of the city and once you reach the actual restaurant, you are in awe of the beautiful panorama (no pun intended) of Dubrovnik. The restaurant has a beautiful setting, with the ocean and old city on one side and mountains on the other. The staff is very friendly and you can call the waiter with a buzzer since the restaurant has several levels. The food is also good - what seems to be traditional Dalmatian food with a couple of other elements.
Fantastic views which are reflected in prices. Professional service from the staff. Ideal for a drink/snack while you’re at the top.

A great holiday in Croatia - BUT not a good visit to the Panorama, having read a lot of the reviews before booking we decided this would be great place to Dine and Eat good food, as the weather was changeable we book a table inside.

We arrived early and decided to have a drink in the BAR - not sure why this was called a BAR, this was a small area next the outside Dinning area, with a few tables and way to many people standing about, tables but no seating, NOT what I would call a BAR.

We were called and shown to our table which was lovely and the view was FANTASTIC, we ordered a glass of wine each and our starters, both really nice, we decided to order steak, (only reason for this is we had been eating sea food all week) 

Thinking this would be a great place to order a steak, I ordered the Rip eye (Medium) and my wife the Fillet (Medium Rare), the steaks arrived and they looked great, well presented with great service, BUT having started my steak I soon found this was not as I ordered - it was very Rare and my Wifes Medium Rare was Medium, My wife could eat hers but the was no way I could eat a Raw steak I spoke to the waiter who was great and extremely sorry, I was offered and new steak but my wife had nearly finished, thus not wanting to eat on my own I decided not too.

Overall Good Service but the STEAK was NOT good, hence not being charged for them. 

I'm Sorry to say, having read the reviews and deciding to book and what we thought would be Dinning Experience with a view, we had wasted and evening dinning here.

This is a Restaurant with a FANTASTIC view BUT failed to deliver on the Steaks.

Had such a lovely lunch with fantastic views, yes it was more expensive than maybe some other restaurants but was very much worth it, the food was very good and the service was fab !! very friendly and attentive, would definitely recommend a visit.

This could be the most gorgeous dining views I have ever experienced. Wait for a table with a view. The service is excellent. We had a salad and club sandwich, both tasty. But the food doesn't matter. The view makes it all worthwhile.

- Approximately $50 for lunch with no alcohol
- Expensive? Yes
- Did you pay for the cable car ride just to get up there? Yes
- Are you worth it? Yes!!

Enjoy!

We visited for dinner to watch the sunset. You can’t beat the location and the views. The service was good, press a button and a waiter comes over. It did feel quite rushed, we were enjoying a pre dinner drink and were asked several times if we were ready to order. The food was good but not amazing and pretty average, particularly for the price you’re paying. I’m happy to pay more for the location but the food didn’t match up to the prices or the quality of food we had in Dubrovnik in other restaurants. I’m glad we went and experienced it but wouldn’t really go again.

Relaxed here to take In the stunning views, we were not hungry so just had desserts and cocktails and both were amazing.. will definitely be back here for dinner on my next visit as the food looked really good, staff were friendly too.

I'm sure you will have seen the photos but it is really worth making the trip as the views are better to see in person than in a photo.

You can buy the tickets at the Cable Car but it is not always open as we found out so if you can, buy the ticket at your hotel or before turning up.

I would also highly recommend having a drink/lunch/dinner at the restaurant at the top as its really good, slightly expensive, as most restaurants are in & around Old Town, but worth it. Just sit there and enjoy your drink/meal overlooking the city. Wow! Try to pre book the tables but the edge for a better experience. Dont worry if the weather is a bit nippy as it can be, they will provide blankets at no extra cost to keep you warm :-)

Whilst this may be a bit of a tourist trap, it is definitely worth having a meal here. There aren't many restaurants in the world which have similar vistas. We were there for lunch and food was quite good. Make sure you have a reservation otherwise you may be disappointed.

Views are amazing, staff are very friendly, atmosphere very pleasant. A tad bit expensive for the standard of food on the lunch menu but I guess it's all about the views. Definitely worth the trip, would recommend.

Stunning view, nice place and good food. We were in Dubrovnik just for the day and took the cable car up to this place, don't miss the chance to do both. You will never have a better view and service at the restaurant fast and friendly.

We only dropped in for coffee but as everyone says the views are fantastic. The staff were also very friendly & professional. We'd had a meal at Dubravka 1836 the previous night (owned by the same company) & the food there was very good so on the strength of that I'd have been happy to eat at Panorama - we just weren't ready for a meal at the time.

As we visit Dubrovnik again we decided to try this restaurant and it was fantastic we with great views and warm blankets when that cool night breeze comes in, service was excellent and the food was great tasting a must to do when visiting Dubrovnik and when you’re up there it is also good value to visit the war museum as it’s next door to the restaurant.
Amazing views, especially from the terraces-apparently it is booked out for dinner well in advance but we enjoyed a coffee and the stunning views. Menu looks good so go early or book ahead!

The panorama restaurant is located at the top of Mount Srd next to the cable car. Seating is limited so if you don't have reservations you will need to wait until a table is free. We waited 15 minutes and got a great table for 2 on the railing. We had drinks, Rosemary potatoes and olives. Highly recommend this place for a relaxing afternoon. Hope you found this review helpful.

We had drinks which were overpriced but you are paying for the view. Staff were very friendly. Food menu is expensive. The restaurant is perched on several levels with expansive views of Dubrovnik and coast lines. Worth visiting for drinks. Catch the cable car down for food. I’m rating 5 for the views.

This is one of the only two, and the more casual of the two, restaurants at the top of the cable car above the old walled city of Dubrovnik. 
Being outside you should dress for the weather, and being on this rocky crag/crest, it is on many many levels and in no way handicapped-friendly. However the waitstaff is eager to please, professional, and quite prompt. Because of its many levels you have a button at your table that you push that calls your servers to your table when you have need. The menu is a bit large so hard to believe they can really do it all well but people seem to be relatively pleased with what they got for the price.
We wanted to be fast because the weather was changing and we did get in and out quite properly and promptly.

We stopped here for lunch because we knew we couldn't miss an opportunity to eat with such a fantastic view whilst being here. We chose to eat inside as there were quite a few wasps lurking outside so it's just our preference. We immediately got in and got one of the best seats in the house right by the window. Our waiter was brilliant and made us feel right at home. When the food came out we were so happy as it was just what we needed. I got the vegetable toasted sandwich as I'm a vegetarian which was made up of slightly mashed up potato, red and green peppers and melted cheese. Also ordered some chips on the side which I would highly recommend! My boyfriend got a burger which was basically the size of his head, to say the least it filled us up. Friendly service and great food!

The meal here was absolutely lovely. I had Vegetable Risotto, Steak with Potato Gratin and Lime Cheesecake with Raspberry Compote. It was delicious!!! Nicely presented, with decent portions. I had a great cocktail too (Strawberry Caipiroska).

The service really was excellent!!

I booked ahead and was informed of my table when they confirmed my reservation, which was a row back from the edge, and still had a good view. I could see a number of couples arrive, who hadn't booked, that clearly had their nose out of joint because they weren't getting the best seat in the house. The staff were very busy but dealt with each situation admirably. This is my BIG TIP, book ahead, and you can go knowing what to expect.

The prices of food and drinks are what you would expect from an excellent restaurant.

The sunset was amazing, and could even see Jupiter and Venus as clear white spots in the twilight (I've now been reliably informed).
We took the gondola up an hour before sunset. Great pictures and dinner was excellent. The views are breathtaking.

The views speak for themselves when visiting this restaurant, they are completely phenomenal, however the staff overall were quite rude.

The food was lovely, however slightly expensive.
Visited the restaurant for a drink having watched sunset from the balcony - very pleasant but expensive - one round only ...

Only restaurant and bar on top of the mountain (big hill?) so prices are high. The staff know they will not see you again so service not exactly top notch. Great views from the restaurant but we would not go here for the food/drink offer - only used the place because it was there and there was no alternative.
Spent the morning here having breakfast and taking in the gorgeous city below. Book in advance and enjoy a piece of calm in a bustling tourist season.
We had a lovely lunch at Panorama restaurant, the food is good, service attentive and friendly and the views breathtaking! Simply a must if you’re visiting Dubrovnik!
The service and food were fine. We had a light lunch (sandwiches) and and a cold drink. It really is all about the view which is spectacular!

We booked a table at Panorama for our last night of our honeymoon, I didn’t book till a couple of days before so didn’t get a table till 9pm but drove up to the restaurant earlier on the day to see if they could move our table earlier and they told us to come back at 8 to see. We did and were seated right away, there was also a storm coming so they stopped seating people out doors but we had a table by the window in doors, much warmer! The food was AMAZING, also bigger portions than anywhere else we had eaten in Dubrovnik so even though more expensive, it was definitely worth the money! The service was fantastic too! Thanks so much Panorama :)

Waiters and waitresses are the most polite people we have dealt with in dubrovnik. Drinks are a little pricey but it's the only place at the top of the cable car so it has to be expected. Views are astonishing. Would recommend reserving a table so u can get a great view of the city from your seat

I had my hotel book myself and my new wife a table here at 7pm. It was a great choice for a special meal for us. 
We were given a table right at the front when we arrived and mentioned we were on our honeymoon. 
Tomato soup starter was lovely and authentic. 
The Beefsteak main course was fabulous - we both had it. The steak was to die for. 
Our waiter (Josip) was attentive and courteous. 
We were offered blankets when the sun dipped, to keep us warm. A lovely touch. 
Even though we didn’t order a dessert (we were pretty full), Josip brought us one with ‘Happy Honeymoon’ written in chocolate on the plate. 
The bill was very reasonable for a meal of this quality in a location as stunning as this. 
.. we’ll be back !

Travelled up to the Panorama restaurant by cable car & arrived early for our 1pm reservation.

We had cool refreshing drinks as we waited for our table to be set.

What can I say.....breathtaking-we were seated right at the edge & had fabulous views of the old town & the coast. Even my husband was speechless & quite taken aback.

The food was the best we had in Croatia & wouldn't have missed this experience for the world.

The service, waiters, food & seating were exemplary & I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant to anyone.

We did try to get a reservation but they were fully booked - perhaps try to book before you fly! That being said we put our names on the list around 6:30pm and it wasn't long at all until we sat down - we had a drink and waited a short while. Note that you can only sit at the front tables with a reservation, so you are further back from the edge but it is still lovely. The waiters are attentive but also leave you to it and do not rush you. I had the Salmon and my partner had the Prawns. Both were lovely. It isn't cheap but actually it wasn't our most expensive meal, and it was worth it. This company owns 3 restaurants and once you have eaten at one you can get a 10% off voucher for the others so make sure you get this! We also ate by the Pile gates and this was my favourite meal of the trip.

We were positively surprised by this restaurant. We expected some tourist rip off on top of the mountain as we have seen in some other places. But this restaurant can really be recommended. Very friendly and fast service, well organised. You have push buttons on your table to call for service, and they use radio communication between them. Once you have seen the restaurant you understand why. It is build into the hill and has different levels. We had no reservation and were 5 people. It took a while to get a free table. So if you want to go for lunch i would advise you to reserve upfront.

Food was good, and you have a fantastic view over the old town.

We only had a drink at the restaurant as they were fully booked for lunch (book ahead if you want to eat) but the food did look amazing. The staff were very attentive and the drinks delicious-try the cocktails. The view was unreal, I could have sat there all day. We had a table quite far from the edge but it still had amazing views over the city and the bay.

Pricey as expected. Views are excellent. Staff kind and quick. They don’t rush u on your meal. 
Good food and good juices. Orange juice, smoked ham, club sandwiches and chicken salad was all nice .
We only sat here for a drink. The staff seem to be very friendly and speak excellent English. The prices are high but it is worth the beautiful views of the old town!

Panorama was the best restaurants we've been to in our entire 10 days trip in Croatia, we ate out twice a day so we do have a good comparison. 

Food and drinks were above average with breath taking views of the city. (If you want to get a table with views you need reservation this place is often full!)

Service was good everyone waits tables with a smile it was pleasant to see. In our experience Reataurants in Dubrovnik are more service oriented than the islands. We had wonderful time in Bol but most waiters dont seem to even care. So its very pleasant for a change to have friendly waiters and waitresses. 

There was plenty of places near the restaurants to explore for amazing views you can easily spend half day up in the mountain.
Great view of course with great escape from the heat. The food was really good. I recommend to reserve before you go coz it gets quite busy

Food is delicious and so well prepared. The view is obviously breathtaking and well worth the money to get up there. However, the wait between finishing your food and waiting to be seen to for a dessert menu or for paying is ridiculous. It must have been about an hour roughly after finishing our meal until we were even approached or looked at. Staff are super friendly when dealing with you but wait was a little bit frustrating. Overall I’d say worth it.

On our final evening of our holiday we splashed the last of our cash here. Beautiful views and we were sat right by the window as we booked in advance! On the pricey side but the service was exception and they has a very good vegan option, although only one option. Was tofu and cous cous. Lots of vegan sides, Lovely cocktails and wine, thoroughly enjoyed!

Myself and partner booked dinner for sunset a few weeks in advance. Unfortunately the weather turned the night of this and we were unable to get the cable car up as it was closed. We got a taxi instead which was slightly scary due to the one way road but the views at the top made it so worth while. It was absolutely stunning and well worth a trip. The restaurant itself was so busy as they couldn’t seat anyone outside so we had a wait for a table and when seated were not in a good viewing spot. The staff could not have been more accommodating though and the food and wine was lovely. Such a nice touch that as our main came out the staff asked us to follow them and seated us in the best possible seat to continue our night. Complimentary cocktails were given which was such a nice touch and it was a wonderful night. We were able to use cable car back down and the whole experience was just terrific.

Just kept lunch simple me and my wife both had the Cheese and ham toastie with chips and a few beers, and it was very enjoyable not the cheapest meal or drink that you will buy but the location and view makes up for that.
It has become very busy over the years with reserved bookings so go for lunch that little bit earlier and have a drink first to guarantee a table.

Went here on 6 August as part of our 30th wedding anniversary celebrations and we weren’t disappointed.

We had pre booked and asked for a table near the edge and for about 6.30 so we would be there for the sunset.

When we arrived we were shown to our table and was the nicest table with stunning views looking down at the Old Town.

The food was amazing, decent portions and the bill for 4 of us which included a few drinks was more than reasonable and good value.

The waiter that looked after us was also very friendly and nothing was too much trouble.

The main reason for going here was to see the sunset 🌅 whilst having a celebratory meal and the views were just amazing. 

I’d recommend this to anyone, and advise to pre book especially if you want a good table near the edge.

My wife and I here had midday drinks here on our recent trip to Dubrovnik.

Purpose of our visit to the top of the mountain was to see the war museum.

Before going down in the cable car we stopped in here for a drink. I have to say the location is perfect and the layout of the restaurant is fantastic offering stunning views of the old town and bay on one side and the Bosnian mountains on the other.

Can't rate the food as we didn't have a reservation but the waitress kindly gave us a table for 45 minutes for drinks which we appreciated.

I would have loved to book a table for around 6.30 to 7pm in the evening to dine and watch the sunset over the old town but unfortunately we didn't have time to do to.

Booked this restaurant in advance before our holiday and was already quite limited on availability especially as wanted front row (best view). Travelled up by cable car, had table at 7 and allowed an hour to get there. Is a definite tick box for a holiday, beautiful view, lovely cocktails and good food. Had a vegan in our party and she would suggest choosing the starter of smoked tofu as a main dish. Had to cut our evening short unfortunately as a storm was coming, the restaurant and cable car shut early. We got the last cable car down but restaurant deducted 10% off our bill because of the rush. A thoroughly enjoyable evening.

This restaurant has amazing views, very attentive staff and lovely food! We arrived early to the restaurant after hearing about the long cable car queues , so went to get a drink. However we were shortly called and seated 45 minutes earlier than our booking, which was excellent! Tasty food with a great chef's recommendation, and we also were given complimentary drinks after dinner. Fantastic, peaceful evening overlooking Dubrovnik. A perfect end to a lovely holiday.

This restaurant made my birthday very special - as well as the stunning views over Dubrovnik, the service was top class (even at an extremely busy time) and the waiters sang Happy Birthday to me and presented me with a lovely cake, which was so special! The food was excellent - steak sandwich was a good portion size and also the cocktails are great. Brilliant restaurant with friendly staff and AMAZING views! Definitely recommend going if you are in Dubrovnik.

The views are the best you will ever see! The wait staff is elegantly dressed with white hats and black and white uniforms. Spectacular! The service is 1st class all the way and the food is exceptional. Did I mention the views? This is a must do in Dubrovnik. Actually this is at the Top of your list or should be. Enjoy it now because unfortunately this will continue to be more and more frequented making it longer and harder to get in because it so SPECTACULAR!!!

Visit this restaurant if you want a relaxed meal with spectacular views over Dubrovnik from high above the city / Bay. The food is average though and pricy. If there is long queue downstairs for the cable car, then you can go up by Uber. It is also much cheaper if there are few if you. All the 4 stars are for the views and atmosphere.

We were at the Panorama restaurant this evening for the final meal of our visit. As a party of 4 we had booked several days before and it definitely lived up to our expectations. The setting was amazing, the food beautifully presented and tasty and the service exceptional. We sat on the terrace overlooking the city at night. 
The meal was a similar price to other restaurants in the old town but we had to also factor in the cost of the cable car trip. As we ate at 8.45, we came up on the cable car at 8.15 with a handful of others. As mentioned on other reviews, the queues for going back down were extensive- presumably after the sunset rush. We manage to catch the tail end of the sunset and after our meal caught the cable car, with again only a handful of others, at 11pm. Would definitely recommend as a special occasion meal.

We were two adults and two teenagers. We timed dinner so we could watch sunset. We had a superb table overlooking the old city of Dubrovnik. The food was better than we had expected but expensive. The service was great but the views were so dramatic, they won.

Our table was perched in a secluded area with fantastic views of the sunset. The food was good, as was the service, but you go there for the views.

Top tip: Book! If you are dinning while sunset takes place, add up to 1 hour for the cable car! If you don’t have tickets or you have a voucher for the cable, go to the kiosk at the head of the line rejoin the back or where join a companion who has got in line.

Make a reservation and take the cable car up to this spectacular restaurant! We had a delicious meal and great service from our server Daniel. Local wine is great. The view of the Adriatic and of Old Town Dubrovnik is spectacular!!

We took a trip on the cable car and visited this restaurant for lunch. Some of the tables have spectacular views but these were all booked. I suggest if you know what time you plan to be there that you book one of the tables with a view. If you haven’t booked you give your name to the maitre d and wait in a waiting area which has parasols and you can have a drink. At lunchtime the wait was around 15 or 20 minutes. We got a nice table looking towards the mountains. Service is efficient with a bell to call the waiter when you are ready to order. We had toasties with fries and beer and iced tea. Tasty with a nice breeze on a hot day.
It’s quite expensive place to go, but worth just because it’s on the top of the hill. At least for getting some drinks.

Lovely surprise to find such a great restaurant at the top of the Cable Car ride. Managed to get a table overlooking Lokrum island and ordered a chicken salad and a beer; both were delicious. Just pressing a (silent) button on the table brings a waiter quickly to look after you; really efficient and classy.
The cocktails bought by others looked fantastic, can’t comment on how they tasted.

We tried to book here in advance however it was fully booked, we were advised to try our luck on the night still just in case there were cancellations, so we did. Luckily we were seated immediately, visiting around 7:30pm. Those who had booked in advance were given the best spots, we were sat further back but still watched the sunset over the old town. food was lovely, comparable prices with other restaurants in the Old Town. £80-£90 for 2 mains, and a few alcoholic drinks each. A little windy but the staff offered people blankets/shawls to keep warm. Would recommend as a holiday treat and experience if visiting Dubrovnik.

It was the first time that my girlfriend and I have dined at Panorama and may I say that it was, by far, the best experience we had yet! The view that is overlooking the old town and the sea was exceptional. Absolutely breath-taking. A stunning view of the sunset and the romantic atmosphere in the evening as the city lights are on. Our waiter Blaž was very friendly and knowledgeable about the food, always checking on us and making sure everything is perfect. Food was really great and bursting in flavours, and really reasonably priced. If I could sum it in one word, it would be exceptional! I highly recommend to all to dine at Panorama as it is a time that you will forever remember!

It s the restaurant you can reach by cable car or taxi (10min) or by feet(55min) the view is beautiful .if it is full you can enjoy a drink by the subset or a lttle snack .a gift shop is available.
The food is delicious and you can enjoy the vie wof dubrovnik and the elafitis islands from the top of the mountain.

Four of us took the cable car to the top where the views ate stunning. I did not do much research in advance of the trip but I would expect a restaurant at such a location to attract a premium price. We hadn't booked but got a table for a light lunch. The eating area itself was clean and employed an innovative setup with fans fronted by coolant to keep the eating area cool. It was perfectly comfortable despite the hight temp. Two Steak Sandwiches, a Club Sandwich and a Ham & Cheese toastie, all with fries. The best photo I could offer was of empty plates. Two large bottles of water and one beer, 578kn. Maybe consider booking especially if there are large cruise ships in port.

Lovely staff, excellent service. Tried to book for sunset meal but fully booked for the next 4 days, so changed my plans and went up during the afternoon and was able to walk in as a group of 5 and eat without any problems.

Food was lovely, staff lovely, professional and looked great in their black and white uniforms. 

Once seated they leave you a call bell to press for when you are ready to order. Many people just came in for a drink and to soak up the view but the food is well worth having.

We had a steak sandwiches, chicken salad and cheeseburgers which were the best we’d had in Dubrovnik. Also one member had a chocolate pot ice cream (homemade). 

Definitely recommend.

I was to nervous to sit at a table so close to the edge but there are plenty of spaces to sit further back.

One word of warning though. I would not visit with a toddler that is prone to running off!

Lots of reviews using the word 'wonderful' that's because it is.Wonderful service, wonderful food and wonderful views. A world beater in terms of location - we were lucky enough to be seated right on the edge with a fantastic view over, not just the old town, but the whole of Dubrovnik.

We pre-booked from the UK and confirmed on the day as requested - our one misgiving was the possibility of the cable car (its a long walk) being queued up but booking early saw a respite in the wait and we were in very good time. On the way down the queue snaked around the street so caveat emptor.

The food itself was superb, perfect steak for my wife, a sumptuous and delicious veal risotto for me, washed down with a crisp and dry local bottle of Posip. 

The view is just amazing, the beauty of this place is that one can relax, enjoy a great meal, with great service but there is always that view, that astounding view to admire and enjoy. We've been to Dubrovnik many times but this was our first visit to Panorama. It will most certainly not be the last.
The cable car ride to the top is a nice way to arrive. Unbelievable views from the top. Great food and drinks. A bit pricey though.

I was there on August 17th with my friends. We ate cold starters Dubrovnik trilogy and prosciutto and afterwards we ate risotto with shrimps and tuna steak. Everything was just perfect. Incredible service, amazing food, impressive view. Thank you for the perfect night. Would most certanly reccomend this place to my friends and family.

This place is truly unbelievable. We booked a table which i highly recommend! And we were situated on the front with the most amazing view you could ask for. We booked a few weeks in advance and upon booking you are asked to confirm your booking in the day which is very straight forward to do. This may have helped with the good table but i am unsure. 
All of the staff were very friendly and helpful with recommendations. All spoke very good english

I am a sufferer of coeliac disease therefore often worry about eating out however the waiter knew all about what was gluten free he was able to suggest meals with making alterations which would suit and there was even a gluten free pudding which was to die for! 

I highly recommend this restaurant but would certainly say book to enjoy the experience as a whole!

We visited Panorama at the end of June 2018 and WOW what a fantastic experience.
We never booked a table and luckily there was space for us to eat outside however I would highly recommend booking a few days prior. I found prices very reasonable for the quality of food we were given - and what great quality it was.The chicken dish was beautiful and the side of chips made it just the right portion, the cocktails were also fantastic and we slowly worked our way through a few of them whilst watching the sunset. Lovely that the waiters provide blankets as it gets cooler - with it being on top of the hill it can get very windy so i would definitely recommend all ladies take a spare hair bobble!
I think what made this such a positive experience was the service carried out by the waiters - we were made to feel very welcome from the start and even though they were so busy all evening our glasses were never empty - a table with a view over the town became available after we had our meal and we were offered the opportunity to move to this table to have our drinks which was very thoughtful. 
Absolutely fantastic experience at this restaurant and I recommend it highly, it certainly is a must whilst visiting Dubrovnik. 10 out of 10.

My partner and I had lunch, toasted sandwich for him, tuna salad for me. Food was fresh and tasted wonderful. Service was great, friendly and attentive. As for the view, well you have to see for yourself! Would thoroughly recommend.
Excellent food, helpful, efficient service all with stunning views. Only downside was you were unable to chose the table you sat at.

Given the excellent location and high quality food, you expect to pay for it and you do, however it is entirely worth it. The food, service, location and atmosphere simply could not be faulted. I cannot recommend this place enough but be sure to book well before if you want a seat overlooking the town - I booked a couple of months in advance as I was unable to get the table I wanted on my last visit.

The panorama restaurant is best to book a few days (at least) prior to going in the peak summer nights. However at times you can get a table. 

The service was fantastic, very attentive and helpful. My friend had the mussels which she thoroughly enjoyed. I had a pasta. It was good but could have had a bit more flavour. 

Stunning views and ambience. Fantastic cocktails.
After travelling up in the cable car we had ice cream and drinks here, fantastic service and views! A lovely treat

Excellent view and menu. Up by cable car or car down by path, cable car or car. The staff were very friendly and helpful; no rush. The facilities too were clean and accessible. We spent two and a half hours for lunch in an idyllic location; the views were spectacular. A visit was recommended to us and so we do to you!

Excellent location, great views of sunset.
Seafood trilogy was great - octopus salad especially.
Good selection of cheese from cheese board.

Steak was good comes with mash
Squid mains had great flavour.

Recommend this place for their 6.15 seating for the sunset around 8!

Be aware that you need to take the Cable car to this venue. If you do not have tickets, it could take 45 minutes during peak hour to buy them.

Having said that, it’s worth a visit.
Service was excellent. 

Views of the city are great.

Food was good, a mixture of local and international cuisine.

Recommended.

Our last night in Croatia and we booked ourselves a treat. It was amazing. Our waiter Vedran was brilliant. And the food was so so good. Even with a second row seat (which I actually preferred) the views were stunning. You have to pay for a return cable car which is about £20 each so it’s not a cheap meal all in all but it’s worth it. We went up for 19:00 and watched the sunset. It does get quite windy after 19:30 so ladies bring a hair bobble. My friend didn’t bring hers so one of the other waiters gifted her his hat and even let he keep it. Highly highly recommend this place.

Just the most beautiful location. Stunning views of the coast, islands and a back drop of mountainous terrain.
We decided to have a cold drink as the temperatures hit 33. Sadly the beer was warm so it didn’t hit the spot 🤨.
Worth the £13 to use the cable car to get up here though for the views.

Myself and my girlfriend visited the panorama restaurant and it certainly did not disappoint! The view is breathtaking, the food is beautiful and the staff are extremely pleasant. We didn’t book a table but I would recommend that you do just in case to get the perfect seat. We were very lucky though as we got a cracking table! 

Make sure you take some photos though, you won’t regret it!

Had a fantastic time for an evening meal here. All the staff were lovely and welcoming and we were impressed with the information about the wine we had selected. We were a little worried that the portion size would be tiny, however it wasn’t at all and was plenty and delicious! Would definitely recommend the cable car up and down as this adds to the experience!! What a lovely spot with incredible views! 💜
My boyfriend and I came here yesterday and had a lovely lunch. The staff were friendly and attentive and the food was beautiful. I had the tuna salad and Paul had the cheese burger.

Me and m girlfriend tried to book at this place but unfortunately it was fully booked up. However, we chanced it and turned up and they were able to accommodate us. We managed to get an amazing mountain side view. We were greeted and served by a gentleman called Rajko. He was very polite, informative and made us feel very welcome. Me and my girlfriend went for the chicken dish which was absolutely delicious. However you need to buy side dishes such as vegetable and potatoes as the portions aren’t big! Overall, definitely worth chancing your arm and turning up to try and get a table (if there’s just 2 of you), may be more difficult for more people). Food - delicious, service - excellent, views - amazing!

We emailed this restaurant to make a reservation a few days before we came but were told they were fully booked. The email also said that we may like to try on the off chance of a cancellation. Having hiked to the top of Mount Srd(thoroughly recommend this beautiful experience) we were not overly confident of getting a table - especially as we were dressed in sports gear from our hike and the restaurant looked a little on the posh side. How wrong could we be! We were immediately given one of best tables overlooking the Old Town of Dubrovnik - absolutely stunning views. The restaurant was full so we were delighted with this. We ordered lunch from the “light meals” section of the menu. My chicken and pumpkin seed salad was delicious as was the complimentary bread. The service was great - efficient, pleasant and even included wasp removal!! - the only downside to an otherwise perfect lunch.
You won't be disappointed whether it's lunch or dinner sitting here and taking in the views spectacular .
Depending on where you sit you either look out over Dubrovnik town or the other side shows views of the surrounding countryside - good spot to have a drink or bite to eat after riding the cable car

The restaurant has an absolutely breathtaking view and really tasty food. Service is really friendly and if you make a reservation in advance they give you a table with a better view (from what I could gather). Our reservation was at 5 pm which was the perfect timing as it got extremely busy at the cable cars queues downstairs when we returned at 7 pm. 

The courgette risotto was to die for!

I made an evening reservation in advance and requested a table outside. Our flight was delayed and we ended up being very late, in fact were not even sure we'd get a table at all. The hostess was very accommodating - found us the perfect table and our waiter took over from there. His name is Niksa and he was exceptional (coming for a hotelier - that means a lot!) He made recommendations, encouraged us to try local wine and after dinner drinks, was attentive but not hovering. The food was incredible - we had squid terrine, beef steak, rib eye and king prawns followed by dessert, coffees and drinks. The view was amazing. We went back the next day to see the view in the day time. Would definitely recommend.
Perfect location with great view down to Dubrovnik, Food and Drinks also excellent and last but not least great staff, very friendly and perfectly organized.

If you plan to take the cable car up to enjoy the panoramic view of Dubrovnik, would highly suggest also have dinner at the Restaurant Panorama. Sunset, ocean, old town, sea breeze, panaromic view, and good food, that's vacation. Don't forget to make a table reservation first. A table at its terrace may not always be available.

Went there as the last night in Dubrovnik .there was a long queue to the cable car but we got there in time . We were given a wonderful table with breathtaking views . The waiter was the best I had for years ! The food was delicious , big portions and the drinks we had came quickly and were great . The only thing that was negative was a very loud German lady who just got engaged and was so excited she spoke on her mobile phone to family and made it difficult for us to talk to each other ! Congratulations !!!! 
The bill was very small and surprised me very much !
If you are in Dubrovnik a magic place please don’t miss the panorama restaurant !

I reserved a table for lunch to celebrate my husband's 60th birthday and we were so pleased to be seated at a table with amazing views. The service was amazing, all of the waiting staff were smiley and welcoming but our particular server (Raku?) really gave us first class service. Nothing was too much trouble, and he told us if we needed anything at all then we only needed to push the button on the centre of the table. The food was lovely and we had cocktails to start, which we all really enjoyed.
