We'd also been told we had a two hour time slot from 1pm to 3pm for lunch when we reserved the table via email, but we ended up ordering champagne cocktails just before 3 and so went over our alotted time. Raku didn't mention a thing and even brought over some delicious liquers for us on the house and joined in with us singing happy birthday. An amazing experience and we can't recommend this restaurant and their lovely staff highly enough. Thank you so much!

Had planned the cable car trip to catch the sunset, and then decided to eat at Panorama at last moment.
Whilst we did not get a table with a view, it was so nice to sit outside on a pleasant evening, with great food and service, and enjoy the leisurely time chatting as a family.
We had both main course and dessert and both were fantastic. The pork chef's special, steak, see bass and lamb main courses were all without fault, and both cheesecake and apple pie desserts were well presented and tasty.
Yes the pricing may be somewhat more than some restaurants but given the quality, presentation and taste of all the food, we all left very happy and would recommend.

We split our two family group up, half walked to the top, half got the cable car, and we dined in Panorama.
The view is breathtaking, especially as we had coast on one side, and a thunder storm over the mountains on the other.
The service was friendly and quick, and the food was great for everyone.
I ordered fillets of sea bass, and it was probably the best meal I've had in the region - certainly not a typical tourist type of place.
This restaurant has amazing views over the old town of Dubrovnik and it’s riviera. The service was first class and a great choice menu for all.

Stopped in following a read of trip advisor reviews and would highly recommend this restaurant!

The staff are friendly, view is great (indoor air con welcomed in 34oC) and food was fabulous.

No wait (Thursday lunch) but understand it gets busy in the evening for sunset (we can understand why!) and booking is recommend.
Book to get a fabulous view on the terrace of this lovely restaurant. We had a lovely lunch overlooking the old city.
It was so hot within the City walls, but up here during the sunset, we had to ask for a blanket. It was glorious. The food here was good, but you come for the view.

Having enjoyed the cable car ride and the fantastic and informative museum at the top, we had lunch here. Yes we had to wait 20 minutes for a table but as the scenery is so wonderful that was not a problem. We had the steak sandwich which was tasty and just enough. Service was efficient and friendly. Pricey but value considering the spectacular setting. Well worth it.

Stopped in at this restaurant primarily to have a drink and enjoy the view. I scanned the menu and nothing really caught my eye so ended up with the drink of the summer--an Aperol spritz. I will say the place was very busy but seemed to be primarily tourists. Not sure about the quality of the food.

Took the cable car to view Dubrovnik Old Town from above and the views were amazing. We decided to lunch up there too and it didn’t disappoint. Our waiter was attentive and funny, the food was refreshing and light and the Strawberry Caipiroshka was to die for.
Well worth a visit for sure

We rode the cable car to the restaurant with low expectations because this was an obvious tourist attraction and not some nice neighborhood bistro. We were very pleasantly surprised by the food, wine, full bar, and service. The only thing that was not a surprise was the stunning view of Dubrovnik below us and the shining Adriatic beyond because that fully expected it and we were not disappointed.
We started with drinks and delicious bread, then moved to a salad and a delicious pasta carbonara that our waiter, Luka, recommended. Luka also guided us through an impressive wine list. We had a window seat with a magnificent view and it was a highlight of our stay in Dubrovnik. 
Finding where to board the cable car was more difficult than we anticipated, but once we found it, the boarding procedure was first class. 
The date of our visit was March 24, 2018.
A good place to get a front line table as the views of the city below are stunning. The food is good and the staff very friendly. Bookings needed well in advance in high season.
Very popular restaurant so you have to que to get in but it’s worth it when you’re there the views are amazing and the food is great! Waiters are very friendly too!

A great restaurant, located after the cable car which is a must visit in Dubrovnik! Great fruti di mare linguini and salad! Also the plates are really good. A little bit overpriced, but not something exceptional and definitely worth it! Make a reservation so you dont wait ( we waited ~ 40 minutes for table for 4 for dinner, which was bearable given the view)

I love this place,atmosphere and spectacular views!
Excellent service, very welcoming.
Highly recommended!

We decided on a trip up the cable car to visit the restaurant, unfortunately the queue for the cable car was 2 hours long so we rang the restaurant who were very helpful and changed us to lunch the next day which we really appreciated. The next day we went at lunch time the food was fab and the view was stunning! We sat out on the terrace and enjoyed our meal our son had the steak sandwich which he said was best he had ever eaten. My husband had the prawns and they were huge i had a lovely mojito and the chicken and pumpkin salad which I would thoroughly recommend. If you get opportunity visit because this restaurant is well worth it !

My family and I stopped at this restaurant while we took the Cable car ride to the top of the mountain in Dubrovnik. The panoramic views from the restaurant overlooking the city and the sea are one of the most beautiful sights that I have ever seen. The waitors and the staff were very friendly and provided good service. We had drinks, tea, coffee and desserts there while we relaxed and enjoyed the lovely weather and took photographs. I highly recommedn this restaurant!!!

My partner and I enjoyed a dinner here after a trip up the mountain on the cable car. We had not made a reservation but we were able to enjoy the views from the inside restaurant. Our waiter was fantastic but it appeared he was the only one taking orders, serving drinks, serving food and taking payments. I was unable to grab the waiters name but credit to him for remaining so professional at all times. We were served bread on the house which is a positive. Our mains were delicious, I had the chicken rustico and my partner had the veal risotto. A little bit pricey but I think fair for what it is.

During our stay in Dubvronik we got the recommendation to have lunch on top of the hill at the panorama restaurant. I was first unsure if such a touristic spot would also have really great food, but was positively surprised ! I would recommend to everyone to make the trip: either by cablecar or taxi and have a reservation on their terrace. Food and view are just great.

Went up on the cable car - fab views at the top. We had booked a table which was fantastic. Food was good and we watched the sunset whilst enjoying our meal. We thought out waiter Blaz was really helpful and made our meal even more enjoyable. 
Recommend this restaurant for a special occasion or for a lovely meal whilst staying in Dubrovnik.

location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom
review:
We visited this restaurant on our second anniversary and I could not have picked better. The service and food were simply divine! Nothing was too much trouble for our waiter and he could not have been more helpful!
The food was gorgeous, I had the chefs special for my main which is the best pork I have eaten! In fact the food and the ambiance was so good I ended up proposing to my girlfriend whilst overlooking the view of Dubrovnik!
 I forgot to mention that view! The restaurant is on top of Mount Srd and has stunning views over Dubrovnik and the Dalmatian coast. Make sure you book in advance so you get a front row seat and if you can book so you can see the sunset!

Definitely worth a visit if you're in Dubrovnik and fancy somewhere romantic or just a chance to see the view!

This is the only restaurant on the mountain. I was there with my son 4 1/2 and two of his cousins aged 13 and 10. The menu would cover most tastes imo and we all left the restaurant quite content and definitely stuffed. The indoor bit of the restaurant is more fancy than the outdoors bit, I felt slightly awkward being there in shorts and t-shirt but no one batted an eyelid so it was my personal experience. Get a window seat to optimize the lunch or dinner!

The view is fab and while the cable car is expensive so go up for the view. 

The restaurant is ok. It should be better. Menu is basic and limited and on plastic sheets (all it lacks is photos of the food although there are some).

It also unsurprisingly isn’t cheap but you are paying for the view so it isn’t awful but go with your eyes open

For two people sharing a starter, a main course each and a bottle of wine (no dessert, coffee or apperitif) it cost £120.

For total naffness and to maximise the money they make you are given a buzzer to call your waiter 😀. A first for us....

It isn’t terrible and if you go with your eyes wide open and understand that it isn’t cheap then it is fine!!

Everything from begining till end was perfect!
We had amazing table,amazing view and two great waiters!
Food was perfect!
Lamb was soft as butter,Tuna steak was cooked perfectly and shrimp rissoto was creamy and full od taste.
We feelt special having evryone running around us and trying to do our evning magical.
Thank You Josip and Siniša,thanks to all staff od Panorama,this night will be a wonderful memory !
Very good grills and very good service. We appreciated the stay. The waiter was very patient and willing to instruct and help. The grilled meat was very tasty also.
Amazing view! Lunch was tasty, service was great, they managed to squeeze me in for a front view table which was so kind of them!

After taking the cable car and enjoying the sunset views, we decided to eat in the Panorama restaurant. There were no tables outside so we chose to eat inside the restaurant which was nice and cool with air conditioning and had only a few tables so the staff were attentive. We ordered prawn risotto and chicken breast, and they were both very tasty. This restaurant is slightly more expensive (399 kuna for glass of white wine, small beer and two dishes) however it was tasty and the surroundings were nice. Top tip - book a table well in advance of your visit and ask for a table at the window.

My partner and I ate here for our anniversary and did not disappoint. The views were stunning, the staff were polite and attentive and the food was fantastic. We only had a main course each but stayed at our table to have a few drinks. There were lots of people waiting for tables but we were not rushed and so were able to enjoy our evening watching the sunset. Thank you to the staff for making our anniversary so special.
a perfect getaway on Mount Srđ, a view of paradise, a food served perfectly and delicious, the best staff in Dubrovnik. a recommendation for every guest visiting the city of Dubrovnik
I had the tuna steak which was very good and a starter dish that was good too. Service was good. White wine is better than their red. I tried the Sav Blanc which is good

Having paid E100 to get there and a further E130 for lunch in an economy were the average hourly wage is less than E5 leaves a slightly sour taste.Good waiting staff and decent food but worth the prices.

Food, drink, view, cool breeze...amazing! 
We went up the cable car for 12pm and had lunch up here. It was SO hot, but they have umbrellas up so it is just the perfect place and experience. The staff are so lovely and we had drinks, lunch, and then more drinks, just to stay there a bit longer. The cheeseburger tasted incredible and the chicken Caesar salad was tasty too. 
You can book tables right on the edge so you will need to do this in advance if you wanted this, but we just rocked up and got a great seat! 
The view is absolutely stunning!!! You’ve got to go! :) 
(Barba and Lady Pi Pi too!)

Amazing view! Amazing service!!! We had the best waiter ever, concerned about us having a good time. They even remembered that it was my bday (we booked 4 months before) and offered a dedicated chocolate cake. 
Food is very good but not excellent for the price but the view and the service are worth it.

My husband and I enjoyed a ok lunch here after taking the cable car up. However, after paying a fortune for return cable car tickets, it was disappointing (but unsurprising) to be expected to pay a lot for lunch as well. Nearly 100kn for a simple ham and cheese toastie seems a lot to me?

We sat inside to get the benefits of the air con as it was very hot outside. Considering the restaurants selling point in the view and its name is 'panorama' you would have thought theyd have bothered to clean the windows...

The food was good but the views were FANTASTIC!! You can sit outside on terrace overlooking Adriatic or can sit inside looking out full length glazed area, a very nice atmosphere. The drinks were expensive we paid over £5 for a local drought pint & same for small bottle of apple cider!! I had the tuna salad which was well presented in tortilla lot’s of peppers/tomatoes/cucumber/tuna really enjoyed it, my husband had ham & cheese toasted with fries & bit salad he said it was ok nothing out of the ordinary. We ate at lunch time & were served quickly staff quite pleasant we had not pre booked table would think if going on evening it may be advisable to book.

Restaurant Panorama is a must. The setting for your meal is stunning, overlooking the old town. We booked a couple of weeks in advance for a table at 20.30, just as the sun set. We got one of the best seats in the restaurant so definitely try and book in advance! We started with cocktails and the Dalmatian ham and olive starter, which is enough to share between 2 or 3. For mains, we enjoyed the sea bass and rib eye steak. Portions are large, we ordered two sides (grilled veg and potatoes) and could have easily just had the one but the food was delicious!

We didn't had a meal we just ordered drinks and desserts. the desserts are lovely it is best to reserve a table before hand if you want to have a great view as it could get very busy during peak seasons

150kn per person to use the caple cart, not much of a waiting time. Once you have been taken to the top you are shop, sit around or eat at the restaurant either inside or outside with great views! Food pricing is reasonable.

We decided to take the cable car to enjoy the view, have a beer and a meal at the top during our stay in Dubrovnik.
Unfortunately, just as we stepped off the tram, the fog came in an pretty much obscured what could have been an amazing view of the old town.

Prices were abit above average of those of the "tourist-traps" but nothing too expensive.
Had our drinks, waited abit for the fog to lift and when we asked for the check the waiter gave us 10% discount due to the weather being so bad. Did not expect that.

The fog lifted periodically (seconds at a time), so I can only imagine how awesome it would be to enjoy a meal and/or drinks when the weather plays nicer. 

I can only imagine how awesome

Sadly the day we had booked a terrace seat at the restaurant it decided to rain so the terrace closed. We decided to go anyway and sit inside, the restaurant staff respected our booking and had us sat right by the window overlooking the old town- which we appreciated. 
We both ordered cocktails and they were so tasty - would recommend doing this as it really is a drink with a view. The tuna salad was a great choice and it tasty healthy yet delicious! My partner went for the club sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed that also. 
Our waiter was attentive and friendly and even offered us a discount as we waited slightly longer for our bill - another gesture we greatly appreciated. 
Would definitely recommend coming here if you are visiting Dubrovnik. It is worth booking ahead and asking for a terrace seat by the edge. Just a shame about the weather!
My husband and I really enjoyed our meal and views at this lovely restaurant. We stayed for lunch and drinks and found the prices very reasonable and the views were breathtaking.
If you love great food, great service and a view that defies all other views go here! Also I recommend the steak sandwich :)

As soon as we arrived my family and I were greeted by extremely kind and helpful staff members. The view was absolutely gorgeous! The food was delicious and service was on point. The overall experience was amazing!

We were super warmly welcome! The service was wonderful, everybody was very nice with us! The panorama is just amazing! Food is very good and very good in terms of value for money ! Definitely a go-to place if you re visiting Dubrovnik!

The setting of Panorama is simply magnificent. We visited at lunch time on a very hot day and I was concerned about the temperature. However, the restaurant has lots of parasols which provide plenty of shade, and the breeze at the top of the mountain was very pleasant. 

The food at lunch time is mostly salads, sandwiches, pasta dishes etc. It is reasonably priced, and not much different from the prices found in the old town. The food was nice and service was good. 

Pre-book if you want to guarantee a seat with a view!

Some friends and I decided to take the gondola and enjoy the view over Dubrovnik. We knew there was a restaurant at the top so we asked if they had a table available and fortunately they had. If I visit against, I’ll make sure to make a reservation! 

We ordered the rib eye steak with rosemary potatoes. The red wine suggested by the waiter complemented the meat very well. The meat was perhaps I little over cooked. I asked for a medium/rear, I I got what I expect a medium should look like. My friends asked for a medium, and look more like a well done.

The Irish coffee we had for desert with our apple pie was kind of lacking on the ‘irish’ part. The apple pie was delicious.

The meal was enjoyed with the most stunning view! The staff was helpful and was spot on with their suggestion. Would recommend.

This cafe/restaurant is very close to the upper station of the cable car on Mt Srd.
The view of Dubrovnik are spectacular.
Unless you have booked a table, the chances of securing a cliff-edge table are slim as it is very busy up there. But once you have a seat, you can stay as long as you like to enjoy the view and lovely breeze to cool you down.
Very friendly service.

Just out of the cable car, Panorama Restaurant is the place to enjoy the best view of Dubrovnik. A little pricy, but it goes with the territory. Make a reservation if you want a table just above the city. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful. Our server, Ratio, was the best. A memorable experience you should not miss.
Ask for a top near the view. You’ll welcome me later. The food was amazing. The staff was friendly. The view was breath taking.

The food here was ok but as you would expect a little pricey. But service was great with very friendly staff. It was worth paying a little extra to sit and watch the world go by. A great way to spend a couple of hours

I booked this restaurant before arriving in Dubrovnik as I wanted a front row table on the terrace in time for sunset - what an experience. The food was great. The whole experience was the highlight of our holiday.

We came here for lunch after paying for the cable car. We had no idea there was a restaurant and as it was lunchtime why not. We didnt book, asked for a table for two and we were seated immediately right on the edge. Its a fantastic view, they haven't crammed tables everywhere to exploit the location which is great as it feels you have space.

Neat little buttons to call the waiter ensure speedy service, cocktails are excellent and they have a light lunch menu if you do not want a heavy meal in the midday sun shine. highly recommend this as a memorable spot for a good meal but expect it to be busy in peak times.

After a quick ride up the mountain on the cable car were lucky enough to get a table for dinner overlooking the old city. What a stunning location with excellent food and great service. We were even given a blanket to wrap in when it became a bit chilly. Unfortunately this was our last night otherwise would have come back again and again.

This place is well worth a visit for the views alone. Request a front row seat and book in advance. Amazing views over the old town of Dubrovnik. All of our food was cooked perfectly but all a little cold when it got to our table, a small downside however.

This place definitely has the best views - we booked for 7:30 so that we could take in the sunset. I booked a few months in advance and could only get the ‘second row’ so I would suggest booking as early as possible! Food was great, a little pricey, but absolutely delicious!

I booked a table here for my partner's boyfriend and I couldn't recommend it enough! The staff were brilliant the entirety of the meal and every member of staff we spoke to knew it was my partner's birthday which was a lovely touch and they also ensured we had a brilliant table in the corner.
The view speaks for itself. You will not get a view like that from anywhere else, which made it so much more special.

The selling point for this restaurant was the views which are fantastic. The food was ok although we did only have a sandwich and burger. My only criticism is that we got our food before our drinks. But we enjoyed our lunch here.

Panorama restaurant can be reached by the Dubrovnik cable car and it overlooks the old town and the port of Dubrovnik. I made a reservation to this restaurant for a table on the terrace. The day we arrived in Dubrovnik it rained in the morning. When we arrived, the restaurant kept my reservation for the terrace and saved a table for us indoor in case we preferred to sit inside. The host and the servers were incredibly attentive. We tried prawns, lasagne, octopus, and chocolate cake. The presentation was beautiful and the food was delicious. The view of course is out of this world.

We had an impromptu lunch here after getting the cable car up to the top. The view is amazing! 
The drinks menu looked extensive and some of the cocktails coming out looked really tasty, it’s a shame I couldn’t partake as I’m pregnant! 
Hubby had the steak sandwich, which came with fries and was a good lunch portion. I ordered the tuna salad which was not quite what I expected, lots and lots of tuna with some small chopped salad in there. I then found a hair in it...so this was sent back to the kitchen. As the salad is pre mixed I switched to the tuna sandwich instead, which was a little disappointing. It was essentially tuna mayo on white bread and came with no fries. The service was faultless, our waiter was great, really friendly and very apologetic for the hair, even giving us free desserts.
I would definitely return here again, although this time maybe just for drinks and the view.

Arriving at the cable car we were worried that the long queue could mean us missing our table reservation at the Panorama restaurant. No problem - the cable car's 5 minute turnaround quickly moved everyone to the top of Mount Srd, just in time for an amazing sunset.
Some restaurants are all style and no substance - not this one!
Amazing location and view (we got a balcony table), really friendly, helpful staff and food that was delicious. It was also cheaper than I envisaged , helped by a 10% discount as we had the Dubrovnik Card. Another thing I like was that we weren't rushed, time to enjoy the view. When you want the waiter simply press the button on your table.
Friends recommended Panorama to us - really glad they did.

A real treat watching the sunset whilst eating the most amazing food with a delicious bottle of wine. The views of the city and sea make this the perfect place for an early evening cocktails and dinner
Take the cable car and take in the views and the drinks. Linger, they are patient. The view is unbelievable.

My husband and daughter went on the buggy safari while I enjoyed the beautiful views and great food. Staff were friendly and helpful. It's hard to find a 'bad' table as views great from all of them. It's not cheap but worth the price if you like to eat with a view.

Okay so the thing is, we didn't actually get to eat in this restaurant. However I am writing this review to advise you to book and book early. They were fully booked up to five days in advance which was unfortunately longer than our stay in Dubrovnik. When we got to the top and saw how amazing the views are we were gutted about missing out on the dining experience. Don't get me wrong - you can have a great time up the top of the mountain but if you are looking for a romantic spot for a sunset dinner then this must be the best around.

We went for dinner here on our second last night. We had booked for the Saturday night (which would have been our last) but storms were forecast so we opted for the Friday night. We were seated at a table overlooking Dubrovnik right on the edge of the mountain . It was the absolutely perfect setting for our final night. Unfortunately the storm began whilst we were waiting for our food to be delivered. We had to relocate inside just as our plates were being served as it was so windy and we lost several slices of garlic bread on the way in due to the wind (which were very quickly replaced!). Dinner was delicious, particularly the prawns however the inside restaurant was definitely not the atmosphere we hoped for on our last night. It felt quite corporate and built for daytime diners rather than dinner guests looking for a special meal. As soon as a window seat became free we were shown there and we finished our meal with cocktails, which were tasty! Recommended for the fish and seafood dishes and the views! Best to go on a calm night!

So this was my friend’s birthday dinner she didn’t know where she was going until we got there. 

The views are amazing and we were there for sunset which was fantastic! 

When we got seated we had one of the best tables right on the edge so you can see the whole of Dubrovnik and when it is light up at night it just beautiful. 

So the food and drink were lovely we had to start the cheese and olives. Delicious! For main we had lamb and that too was delicious. The drinks we had were so nice and tasty. 

They really made my friend feel so special on her birthday. Thanks so much for this it was lovely.

We booked a table on the front row so we could have a beautiful view of Dubrovnik on our final night of our holiday. The view was phenomenal, and staff were so friendly and more than happy to help out taking a photo or two for us! Enjoyed a few glasses of wine, and my pasta dish was really good, and my boyfriend enjoyed the veal. Would really recommend a visit, not just for the view (which is so beautiful) but because the staff and food are brill too!

Delicious food - but the view is what really makes you want to enjoy a meal here. The service is great, price ‘normal’ for Dubrovnik- I paid around 220KN for a glass of champagne & the prawn risotto.
Well worth it though.

We just showed up late in the day and decided to have a couple of apps and a drink. Well worth it. When we showed up, there was a lineup, but they had a waiting area with bar tables and served drinks.... with a very nice view. Tables are either city-view or moutain-view.... there is not a bad view in the place. Book in advance if you want a table looking at the city to get the sunset. Apps were freshly prepared.

The atmosphere was relaxing with great views. Definitely book a table as I believe this means you can get closer to the sea and therefore get a better view. Quite pricey but totally worth it and we discovered later on in our holiday that actually the food wasn't as expensive as we thought. The food was delicious and would recommend just for the experience.

I cannot recommend this restaurant enough and it was the highlight of our trip. We booked months in advance and had a great table on the terrace to watch the sunset. The service was fantastic and the food truly exceptional. We bought our tickets for the cable car from the Tourist shop in Old Town and were given a 20% discount voucher for Panorama Restaurant. Although obviously a tourist attraction you will not be disappointed with the experience, everything was 1st class and prices reasonable given the incredible view.

If you want to see the sunset you need to eat before or after sunset as the best sunset views are west of the fort from the scrub land. However the restaurant has great views of the old city and the port and the sea. You can dine outside or inside. We ate hot food outside but the plates and gravy jug weren't hot so some of the food didn't stay hot enough for long enough. Lovely meat and veg.though and a good choice of drinks. Often need to book but we picked a quiet evening and just turned up.

Our wedding planner booked us a special family meal here as part of our trip and true to their word, we did get a fantastic table for the 6 of us. Whilst the prices are pretty high (especially for the wine), the service was absolutely fantastic. Our waiter was prompt, cheerful, spoke great English and had a good sense of humour! The food was delicious, although if you're seated outside it's unavoidable that it will go cold quickly!
For a special treat I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Panorama for an evening you won't forget.

I pre-booked this restaurant before our holidays for a birthday treat for myself and my twin and was so glad I did.
The taxi ride there was nail biting stuff - uphill cliff side roads. The view is worth it.
We were seated immediately to our table (#12), the staff were very attentive, buzz service on the table. 
They brought over a slice of chocolate cake when we had finished eating - I had completely forgot I mentioned when booking it was for an occasion. Really nice touch.
Amazing views and definitely a highlight of our trip to Dubrovnik.
Had a group of us, went there for a birthday dinner. The view was fabulous, the food was delicious. Recommend booking a table prior to going.
My husband and I had a wonderful table (31 I think) it was set on a corner. The service was very good, the menu slightly sparse but apart from that the views made the occasion.

Is there a cafe/restaurant anywhere in the world with a better view? Dubrovnik is so far beneath that it looks like model (of the perfect medieval city). Understandably there is a premium on the prices but it is worth it to spend half an hour drinking a coffee in this superlative setting.

Nicest restaurant we visited during a week in Dubrovnik. Reasonably priced, c.£150 for two including drinks and food. Amazing scenery, booked a table for 18.30 and watched the sun set over the Adriatic Sea. Highly recommend.

Arrived early for reservation. Greeter was friendly and they sat us in a premier spot. Not sure if having our hotel (Hilton) Call to make reservation had anything to do with we we were seated but it probably did. Food was very good. Seafood was excellent and well presented. Friendly server. Beautiful sunset. This is a must do if are in Dubrovnik.
Our family of four had a wonderful time at Panorama Restaurant. Food was good too! The view was incredible, of course. Highly recommended!
The restaurant has nice dishes and the view is probably the most attractive there is. The lunch was very nice and if you are a little bit avanturistic you could have a nice sun ten there
Stunning view and delicious vegan option. This place is an absolute must! Would definitely come here again

Don’t hesitate to book this restaurant - it’s an amazingly high class but reasonably priced experience. Now, you don’t find that very often, do you?

The attentive and charming team made our visit such a joy - every single member of staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful. The chef and their team delivered our best meal yet with great wine and fine wine glasses, too. 

It’s was quite an extraordinary evening, with the beautiful sunset and warm sunshine thrown in for good measure. We thought it may be a little touristy when we booked it in London, but not at all - truly impressive and great value. 

We thoroughly recommend The Dalmatian Trilogy and the risotto with prawns & courgette & rosemary for starters and them the king prawns - king? More than that surely! These were huge sweet and succulent - seabream with mussels and clams - and the grilled squid, which was as fresh and tender as I’ve ever tasted. Side dishes were perfectly cooked and presented. The rose St Hills wine was excellent - as were the G&T s to start with. 

Thank you to everyone for a truly memorable evening. We shall not forget it!

In fact we would book again for our next visit. 

We love your work, guys! Xxx

Julianne, Viv and Fiona

Stunning location with superb views. Went there for our anniversary. Had a wonderful table for two. Excellent food, attentive service, good selection of wines. Thoughtful staff as they provide blankets as the sun goes down and it can get chilly. They need to put larger parties away from couples wanting a quiet meal together as our romantic evening was partly spoilt by the nasal yapping of a party of Americans who didn't shut up and moaned about the view /:-):-? . They sounded like demented parrots on speed. It was so bad we didn't bother with a dessert or coffee and liqueurs as originally intended but left and sat with the crowd gathering to watch the sunset from the rocks.

On our first full day in Dubrovnik my wife and I climbed Mount Srd, desperate for something to eat and drink we visited the Panorama Restaurant. After a short wait for a table as we hadn't booked, we sat down to a large and varied food and drinks menu. My wife was delighted to find Vegan suitable dishes and ordered the Tofu which she thought was fantastic and sent her compliments to the chef. I ordered a vegetable toasted sandwich but was given a ham and cheese toasted sandwich, I could have explained and sent it back but as we were new to Croatia I just decided to eat it. The waiter who took our order, he seemed in charge of proceedings, didn't write down our order which I'm sure lead to the mistake. We also had two cocktails which were great. Would recommend this restaurant, maybe book ahead to be safe. The views are excellent and food very good.

I would highly recommend this restaurant whilst visiting Dubrovnik. The views are stunning, the staff are informative and pleasant and the food is delicious. We used the cable car to get to the restaurant, this costs 150 kuna pp and takes approximately 5 minutes. It’s certainly worth it for the views of the old town. I would also recommend booking a table as it is a popular place to eat.
A beatiful setup at the top of mt. srđ overlooking Dubrovnik and nearby islands. Expensivs drinks(0.5 local bottled beer costs €9) and delicious snacks. The service was good. 10/10 Would come again.

Myself and 9 girlfriends decided to make the trip on the cable cars to Panorama Restaurant without a reservation, on the off chance they could accommodate our group.
The cable car is an experience itself, the views are amazing! 
Unfortunately we were unable to get a table outside (as expected) but we were seated all together inside the restaurant and were really happy with the service. The food was lovely, I had the ribeye steak which was cooked perfectly. The wine and cocktails also went down well.
I'd highly recommend Panorama - the views themselves are worth making the trip. The great food and service is an added bonus!

We booked here well in advance whilst on holiday and were not disappointed. I had the best pork dish that I have ever had and some great service from Vedran who helped us with our wine choice. The day was cloudy but we still had a great view and the food was very tasty and as promised they put us by the window. The only slight issue is not with the restaurant but with the price of the cable car to get up there. Nearly £40 euros between us which i think is very unfair. The wine we had was a local one priced at around £35 pounds and my Pork dish was around £20 and we felt it was good value.

A well run restaurant with amazing views. Lots of small tables for couples to sit and enjoy the view. They have larger tables set out as well for larger groups scattered on the terraces. Lots of steps here as well.
Food and drinks had good choices and the staff were very attentive.

We had reservations that I made in line two weeks prior. It was for 6:45. We took the cable car up. The food was delightful. The view was to die for and the sunset was perfect. What a great way to end my trip in Croatia.

We went for lunch and the whole experience was amazing. The view was spectacular and the food was pleasant. We had the Violetta salad and the beef tagliata and we both enjoyed the food. I sent an email earlier stating it was my partner's birthday, so at the end of our lunch our handsome waiter who was very sweet and helpful brought out a cake with her name on top which made our experience perfect!

The views were breathtaking. As soon as you arrive you are met with the most beautiful landscape with different platforms for you to take pictures. It can get super windy so ladies, try to refrain from wearing a dress that blows up easily! I was holding onto mine for dear life. The food was good, i had the beef carppacio to start followed by the beef pasta which was average. Wasn't badly priced considering the views. 
You can get an uber up to the restaurant for people who arent keen on the cable car.

We went for my mother's 70th birthday, lovely restaurant to spend it at. Wonderful view of the old city and sunset. The prawn risotto was exceptional as a shared starter. I had the rib eye which was okay, if I was to go again I would have the risotto as my main. The restaurant brought out a cake for my mother's birthday on the house and sang happy birthday which was a nice touch. Would definitely go back.
Like everyone else, we went for the great views but also enjoyed the food, which was reasonably good.

Discovered almost by accident, what an experience. The cable car is worth it just to experience the view from the top of the ridge, but if you get the chance to eat here take it with both hands. The view is stunning, the location amazing and the staff are friendly and welcoming. There weren’t too many options for vegetarians and vegans on the menu, but the couscous and smoked tofu we had was probably the best meal we had while in Croatia. Not over expensive, even though you may pay a little of a premium for the view, which is well worth it. Did I say it was amazing? Choose a nice day though as I believe it closes when it is windy or too cold, but if you can do it, make sure you do, the memory you take home will be unforgettable.

I wasn’t expecting much food-wise but the food was delicious! They have a smoked tofu and couscous appetizer that I had along with a salad and amazing grilled mushrooms. The view was one of the best we have ever experienced and the service was friendly and helpful- a must!

Brilliant quick service from all staff, nothing is too much. They even gave out blankets on a chilly day!

Views are obviously incredible being at the top of the cable car, seating on the edge is amazing and unforgettable.

Portions were big and the food was tasty!

The staff were kind and caring, giving warm blankets to customers who were chilly as we were at the restaurant on a dull day. The view down to the old town is superb. Although prices are not low, well worth a visit for the situation.

This is a really special location - one has to book in advance to get a decent time slot, but well worth the visit- superb meal (the chef special, pork, is outstanding).
Great attention from the waiting staff and spectacular views over Dubvrovnik old town and the sea.

Thought this would be something of a tourist trap, but the food was the best we had in Dubrovnik during our week there - and we tried most of the highest rated restaurants. Service as well was impeccable, and the view... When in Dubrovnik, don't miss it!

We visited Dubrovnik in June and decided to dine here and we are so glad we did. The views are amazing and breathtaking, I would recommend going at sunset as it’s truly magically and opt to sit on the terrace. The food was exceptional and the service just as good. The waiters were happy to help and very pleasant. The restaurant is expensive but worth every penny for the views while you eat. Just be aware that you have to take the cable car up to the restaurant and that is €20 per person and in bad weather they don’t always run. I would book and ask to sit on the terrace near the edge to get the full view.
The sunset views are absolutely spectacular. Unfortunately the service at the restaurant was very poor. We waited over 30 minutes just to order 2 drinks, then another 30 minutes for the check....

It's worth stopping here just to enjoy the view, but next time I would maybe do a drink and dessert or something cheaper instead of a meal. The food was overpriced because it's a touristy area. We had burgers and they weren't very good - tasted like tourist attraction cafeteria food.
The perfect place for a coffee after touring the top of the hill. The cappuccino was excellent and the service very pleasant.

Thier food is Asian seafood mainly, good at Thai and Italian too.
Located 50th floor which you can enjoy skyline, because this is the highest building around this area.
Close to entarance window side is the best veiw. You can see city, Dame and lakes.
In summer, 8:30 to 10:00 is great time for sunset and twilight.
At summer, here sunset star like 9:30.
Food is not like a Michealan star, but surprisingly good as Russian local's.
Actually, this restaurant is one of the highest class restaurant as the top of 5 stars hotel, but for us, price is a quite resonably. I and my wife had 2 entrees, 2 main, 2 deserts, 2 coffee and large draft beers. Total was about 80 usd.

Could not fault this restaurant - excellent presentation and customer service, quality tableware, setting was outstanding and the food was simple but delicious and superbly presented. We had no expectation as this was at the top of the cable car in Dubrovnik. Highly recommended.
We visited the restaurant for drinks and the staff were very welcoming. They even moved us to a better view when another table became free. A lovely location i'd recommend.

We booked in advance to get a table on the side with view. They have two seatings in the evening 6-8:15 & 8:30pm. We took the 6 pm & saw the beautiful sunset. It’s quite windy in the evening so a jacket might be necessary even in the summer. Both the service and food is good.

After not being able to catch the cable car to the top due to bad weather the view of the storm did not disappoint. Was spectacular to see all the lightning bolts over the sea whilst enjoying some really nice food. The service was a tad slow but it mean't staying up there longer to see the amazing view. We ended up getting the cable car down so got to experience it in the end.

After catching the cable car to the top of Dubrovnik to view the "Old Town" we decided to eat outside at the Panorama Restaurant. Sitting outside with the hills on one side and water the other direction the view was magnificent as was the food. It was hard to fault anything, the food, the view and the service were all excellent. A nice touch was also the rugs that the restaurant leaves on on your seat to use when it cools down in the evening. Special mention to our waiter, Josip.
Srd offers spectacular views and the Panorama restaurant is a great way to enjoy them as you sip on a cocktail. The amaretto strawberry was my personal favourite.
Stunning views over Dubrovnik, amazing cocktails and lovely food. I had the fish of the day which was tuna - definitely the best tuna steak I've had!

Not many places you can eat and drink with a view like that. 
Not only do they have great views they do great food at a reasonable price. 
Don’t forget after a few beers you still have to get the cable car down. 
Must visit place though.

I booked a table at the Panorama Restaurant back in April to ensure we had a table with a view over Dubrovnik and I am so glad that I booked early! The views from the terrace of the restaurant are incredible! The staff are very attentive and were very welcoming. They organised a high chair for my baby boy in advance and had ensured that the table that they had reserved for us had plenty of space for the pram. The food was fantastic. My dad and sister had the steak sandwich and both said that it was very tasty and that the meat was very tender. My husband had the seafood risotto which again he said was delicious. I had the king prawns which were cooked beautifully. The sauce was also very tasty! We had an absolutely lovely afternoon and would highly recommend!

As with the majority of our fellow cable car passengers we opted for a table in the restaurant at the top. A beautiful setting. Quick food service and top service from quality waiters who one in particular had great chat and helped with some special cocktails and banter 
A must visit
Take the cable car around sunset and book a window table to make this very special, as you eat great food and take in Dubrovnik from above

Next to the cable car with an outstanding air view over Dubrovnik, one would assume this place would be a tourist trap. Not all, food is very good and service excellent. The view is breathtaking so this is a highly recommended restaurant.

We came because we’d seen so many pictures showing amazing views. We took the easy way up bu taking a taxi. It was early enough before the lunch hour so we got a table with amazing views overlooking the Old Town and the cable car.
Since it was lunch we ordered a steak sandwich and a club sandwich and a big bottle of water. The food was good (nothing amazing but not bad either) and both came with fries. Prices were reasonable considering the overall feel of the place. Service was friendly and efficient.

The trip up in the cable car is weather dependant and the wait in the queue can be overly long due to the hoards of tourists, but we managed to time it perfectly. 

The view is wonderful as was the food and service at the Panorama Restaurant. One can go up on the cable car and walk back down or vice versa.
Got the cable car up to this restaurant. Massive terrace with great views over dubrovnik. We just stopped for a cocktail.

The food was well presented and delicious. The service exceptional once seated - they dealt with a change in weather admirably (from outside to inside!). Had the pate and meat special and could not fault it! Washed down with a local pale ale!

We had heard great things about this restaurant and got a reservation for 9pm as this was all that was available. 
It’s a small dining room with panoramic views over the city and the sea. Or at least it would be if it was light. When darkness falls those beautiful glass walls turn into mirrors and the small dining room feels even smaller. The other guests at the time were noisy and too close to the other tables. 
the food was excellent but if you are going for the view don’t accept a later reservation!

After our cable car ride to the top we were amazed by the views but disappointed with the volume of people. There’s something not so spectacular about a view when there’s loads of people in front of you. As it was a special occasion we decided to check out Panorama not thinking for one second we would get seated near any views (maybe in the middle.) However when we arrived we were greeted by a warm and friendly host. I explained it was my partners birthday and we would love to eat here. She said no problem and we will of course get you seated by the edge with this she did explain it could be a longer wait. Which is fine with us - good things come to those who wait...she took us over to the right of the restaurant we’re there is 3 bar tables and what luck! There was no one to little people there for our waiting time. This meant a great photo opportunity and the chance for us to soak up the views of Dubrovnik with a drink. The staff were then happy to take us to our table. WOW. What a scene! It was the most incredible lunch setting. I highly recommend sitting on the Dubrovnik side if you can. You may be able to make a reservation but I’m just commenting on our experience and I’m so happy with how helpful the staff were. All the waiters were attentive and pleasant. On the menu there is plenty to choose from including vegetarian and vegan food. It is delicious! I highly recommend the side of mushrooms with your main.yummy! So to sum up I would highly recommend you to go! Not only tasty food and great service but views that will stay with you a life time. A very special place.

We came here just for a cooling drink and some chips but it was a good experience and nice environment. I had a tasty strawberry amaretto cocktail and there were fans keeping the area cool on a hot day. We did not have a view from where we sat as most of the sea view tables had been reserved in advance but I imagine the view would make the experience even more special. The staff were attentive and friendly and offered to take our photo which was kind when they were quite busy.

Attempted to book early dinner for 3 nights in advance but only available at 2130 hrs - to late for us.
Lunches sitting outside & cold wind whilst in the Old Town it was hot & sunny.
Pretty average meal but once again - as at ALL restaurants used - excellent service.

Had a really lovely lunch a bit pricey but the views are incredible we got there by 11 and waited for a seat near the edge glad we did its much cooler and a lovely breeze. We were not rushniut which was nice. It's one of things that if you can do not do it. Early on when they first open many people were only having drinks

We called early in the week (we were there for 8 days) to reserve a table, and were told they were fully booked, lunch and dinner, every day. We asked the concierge at the hotel to book on our behalf and she received a reservation instantly. LESSON! Even more annoying though was that they were seating people WITHOUT reservations the entire time we were there.... They even seated a party of FOURTEEN people without a booking.... Could the reservation person MAYBE have said, if you come by, we will try to seat you, it just might be a small wait....? So I have a hard time being happy about this place. We did have nice food (not memorable, but nice) and we had the nicest waiter ever.... The view is spectacular but pay no attention to the woman on the phone - oh, and we tried the on line reservation too....

Visited end of May. We hadn't booked and the restaurant was busy, but the lovely lady at reception found us a cliff side table within 5 minutes. 
Great friendly attentive service, the most amazing views looking down on the city and gorgeous food. 
So glad we visited. I

I was a little nervous about the cable car ride ..but only took about 90 seconds!

Views! Views! Views!

We had read that the views from this restaurant were good but didn’t realise they would be this good!!! Absolutely breathtaking.

The food here is good-nothing more! 

Service is first class!

But it’s all about those views! Make sure you book a table well in advance as people were arriving and getting turned away!

A must visit whilst in the old town

We tried to book a table with a city / sea view for the sunset but they were fully reserved for the whole week we were there. However, we turned up on the night and sat at the other side of the restaurant and it was still a really lovely spot overlooking the mountains. We only needed to wait about 10mins and ordered a cocktail while we waited. The food menu isn't extensive but the quality was very good and reasonably priced. The cocktails were excellent! The service was exceptional (our waiter was a very friendly guy called I think Rajko) and the atmosphere was relaxed. I had a walk around the restaurant and the tables on the edge did look like they had incredible views so I would recommend booking in advance to try and get one of these, however if you can't then the rest of the restaurant is definitely still worth it! There is also a good viewing area just past the restaurant (by the cross) so that may be worth a stop for some pictures before you go into the restaurant. 
Another nice touch was that they hand out fleece blankets to keep you warm as the sun goes down. It is obviously much colder up there than in the Old Town!

Firstly I must say that even though we felt the food was very average, we did not regret going to this restaurant at all.
We received a warm welcome on arrival & were shown straight to our table which was amazing!! Wow what a view!! 
Our waiter was very nice, really attentive, gave great service, no complaint there.
We just felt that the food was very, very average. I ordered a ribeye steak & it was just completely tasteless. Desserts were pretty much slices of cake that resembled & tasted like shop bought goods.
Maybe we were expecting too much? But the restaurant really has the wow factor when you arrive, the views are to die for....it’s just such a shame that the food itself didn’t match up to the rest of the experience.

We were three girlfriends visiting Dubrovnik and made a reservation here for the patio after taking the cable car up the hill. It was an extremely windy night but they still offered us to sit on the patio if we'd like. We had tried but the wind was so extreme it was blowing over glasses and bottles. We chose to move inside and were accommodated very quickly. We were so happy our server Josip was able to continue serving us when we went inside as he made this experience at the restaurant the best! He was so attentive and helpful throughout our whole meal. We never had to ask for a thing! The food was the best I had during our 2 weeks in Europe and Josip and the other staff members gave the best service I have ever experienced!!! I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a fantastic meal with amazing service. We couldn't say enough good things about this place after leaving!

I would recommend you book in advance as there is no guarantee you will get a table on arrival. I tried to book but was told they are fully booked and due to bad weather the terrace will be closed. We took a picnic up the top with us, however when we got there, we were quite lucky that the terrace was open and we were able to get a table for 2 without booking. People that tried the same after us were told there is a long wait.

The food is amazing, there is no doubt about this. We ordered 1 beer, 1 cocktail, 2 mains and a side. We had the Dubrovnik 3 day card and this restaurant is included on the list, however I was not aware of this. The waiter kindly asked if we had these cards as we would then qualify for 10% discount, our bill dropped from 536 to 482 Kunas. 

The waiter also gave us a card for life that gives us 10% off all 3 of their restaurants in Dubrovnik.

Fantastic service, breathtaking location, amazing food.

Love the Panorama Restaurant so much! 

We visited Dubrovnik last year, and loved it so much we came back again this year! And the Panorama Restaurant had a lot to do with that decision. Our experience this time was even better and the food again was excellent. Service was very good and of course the view, superlatives alone don't do it justice. Sit back and just relax and enjoy one of the best views you'll ever see! All in all, a great experience and we will always come here when in Dubrovnik.

We were recommended this restaurant by a friend and my goodness it didn’t disappoint. It’s a must when in Dubrovnik. Such a lovely meal and amazing views. Get there just before sun set to see the views of the Elaphiti islands and then watch Dubrovnik light up at night. Don’t miss the last cable car!

The food is good, but the view is what you are paying for. The service is a bit lax, but they do give you a button to push if you need anything. I feel terrible doing that tho and would rather just have an attentive waiter.
The best view in the whole Dubrovnik!Waitres Rajko is brilliant!5 stars from the couple from Belgrade!😁
The view is amazing, try to reserve a table by the window in order to see the view lile I did (image I have posted). Food and the waiter Rajko made the experience amazing as well

My partner and I came for the sunset, with no intentions of getting a table for dinner. Luckily for us we got a table near the bar and sipped on espresso martinis whilst the sun went down, after a while a table freed up- which had an amazing view! We ordered the seafood risotto and lamb raggu pasta. The service was spot on, so attentive and friendly. The view is hard to beat!! Had a wonderful evening at Panorama and got pretty luckily getting a table with no reservation!

Sitting inside or outside at the Panorama Restaurant is an excellent way to take in the view of the entire old city. The breeze at this hill top location is refreshing. The service, for us, was excellent -- wait staff was there when you wanted them but left you to linger over the view with no pressure to turn over tables. But the food was iffy. My hamburger tasted like a microwave reheat of a frozen patty. But my wife's green salad was fresh, flavorful and, she tells me, very tasty. Stick to simple dishes, enjoy a cold beer or hot tea, and enjoy the view. Prices were very reasonable considering all the customers appeared to be tourists.

The view certainly helps but the food and service were exceptional. We travelled up on the cable car and although we had not booked got a table of two while we had a few sips of our drinks in the waiting area. 

My wife had the Tomato and Mozzarella starter (92 kunas), I had the Mafaldini Beef (118 kunas), followed by Salmon Fillet (188 kunas) and the Chefs Special which was a beautifully presented pork chop with crispy onions (216 kunas). Pity it was a bit too pink in places for my taste.

Rose wine at 54 kunas for 15cl and draught beer at 52 kunas for 50cl was very reasonable given the location.

One of the best views you will get at any restaurant around the world, Panorama is simply stunning.
A cool breeze atop the mountain is most welcome on a hot day and you would never tire of eating up there.
We were pleasantly surprised by the price as well. A restaurant with a location and view such as this would normally be extortionate, however the menu is broad and fairly priced.
I would highly recommend this restaurant if you are to venture up the cable car (also a must see).

We loved this restaurant with its amazing view! It is a little pricy but well worth it as food is of a good quality. Tip is to book so you get a front line table where you can enjoy the uninterrupted view.

We booked ahead through their website as soon as we knew which day we planned to be (about a month in advance). We did ask for a table next to the cliff and got the best views of the city. By booking ahead, you take a gamble of the weather but unless it's a stormy day, it won't be bad. 

The food was not crazy expensive compared to the view and the location, but the portion is small, so you will likely have to order more than you typically do on the ground. 

Also, you can drive up if you have a car (to save the cost of the cable car rides).

We decided to splash out and treat ourselves on our last night and booked a table a couple of days in advance. They were great, giving us a cliff side table with great views. It is fine dining, the service is very personal and the food is delicious. But it is the views you pay for and getting a table around 7pm meant we could relax and watch the sunset while sipping gin and tonics and nibbles before we even thought of ordering. They did not rush us ad the table was ours all evening if we wanted.

I had probably the best tuna steak I have ever tasted and my wife had a perfect seabass. It was all perfect and the perfect end to a great short break to Dubrovnik.

You need to go by taxi or the cable car. Taxis were charging 300 Kuna, the same as two people return by cable car. The only thing to remember is the last cable car leaves at 10pm but we were really slow and easily ready to leave just before then.

Go for the food, the service, the experience but especially for the views of the town and sunset!

We took a chance when we went up the cable car and hadn't pre-booked a table so were lucky getting one but it wasn't with the fantastic view of the city, it was a mountain view which is still nice - they were insistent that city view tables were all reserved! However we were served quickly and the food was good and we felt so relaxed and not rushed that we indulged in desserts too and although small portions they were delicious. 
It was a very enjoyable lunch.

We took an Uber up the hill with some pretty hairy sections. First seated on the mountain side which would have made this experience not as great. Luckily we were able to move to a seaside table shortly afterwards. We ordered the lamb shank and the chicken along with grilled veggie side. All of the food was very good as was the service. Soothing music, nice breeze and gorgeous views made this a fantastic experience.

Restaurant is located atop Dubrovnik. You can take a taxi to the top but we took the cable car. The view of Dubrovnik and surrounding area is fabulous. Breathtaking sunset. The menu is terrific and very reasonably priced. I love the fresh seafood.. My wife ordered a steak . Generous in size and cooked to perfection. The wait staff was very polite and very attentive. We had visited wonderful cruise ports and ate at some good restaurants but this restaurant with the food and spectacular views was the highlight of our trip. Email them for a reservation. They reply very promptly. This is an excellent choice.
A bit pricey lunch but spectacular view. Excellent risotto and very good king prawns. Staff was very nice.

Definitely recommend going for dinner to see the sunset. 

Remember to book in advance, and take the cable car just by the walled city. 

Spectacular views, attentive staff and wonderful meal. Great evening!
Great food, great setting, great service. We couldn't ask for anything more. I've been wanting to go back since we left.

walked all the way up it’s a great walk and 400 metres high an once you get to it it’s a lovely view you can see the cable car going up and down..I had the club sandwich which was lovely with chips then i had cheese cake and coffee it’s so peaceful sat out high up. The staff are great friendly and you have a button on your table to get in touch with the waiter if you need anything.. it’s slightly more expensive but not massive to say it’s where it is i would love to go back

It would be so easy to serve mediocre food when you have a captive audience but this is not the case with this restaurant. The waiter was excellent, the food was good and served at a leisurely pace which suited us as we were not in a hurry and happy to enjoy the view.
.

We had booked a table for dinner at 9.15 but arrived early and were seated straight away at a table on the Terrace. The view is incredible, simply stunning! This was matched by the food and the outstanding service, the staff were absolutely amazing. The total experience, from catching the cable car, the restaurant, staff and view - it will be something we will always remember and was the icing on the cake for a fantastic 4 nights in beautiful Dubrovnik.

Wow!! Stunning View Sensational Food and excellent friendly service! A HUGE MUST SEE AND DO! I Highly suggest going about an hour before sun starts to set so you can see Dubrovnik Old Town in both lights! Very reasonably priced! You MUST book early and go to Tourist Bureau by town entrance for a 10% discount voucher!

Enjoyed a tasty lunch here with the stunning views. Allowing for the location i found it not to be too expenive...usual club /steak sandwich,fish dishes, light salads...very appropriate menu. Highlight dish was the beef carpachio. Place was packed but staff organised the queue very efficiently and once seated we didn't feel rushed. Worth stopping here!

This is my first poor rating review of all the restaurants I visited across the globe. Undoubtedly the view is beautiful overlooking the old town over sunset (provided you are given equal treatment to be seated based on availability and first come first served basis, instead of race based treatment), the food was not bad and a little overpriced for its quality, but the most disappointing aspect is the differential treatment given and inconsistent excuses given to justify their decision to sit us elsewhere from the “western” crowd despite the tables were empty and not reserved.

We saved this for our last night and were blown away by the views, the service, and the food- wanted the night to last forever! Josip took such great care of us, the craft cocktails were incredible, the salmon and cous cous, and walnut chocolate cake for desert. So highly recommended - I'd give 10 stars if I could!
A fantastic experience. Stunning views, food, service and atmosphere! It was the best way to start our trip in Dubrovnik.

Went there as a couple end of May. The view was fantastic, the food was decent albeit not something to shout for.

What cause this an upset visit was the differential treatment we received based on race and the inconsistency in how they handle reservation request. We had specified a month prior for the table by the side, we were told it would be a first come first served basis - fair enough. However what happened next was what caused the upset.

We arrived at the restaurant early, with 2 tables by the side available. The caucasian couple in front of our queue were led to the side table immediately but on our turn (less than 10seconds later) we were told to wait, and was subsequently led to the table in the middle, far off from the side whist the side table still being available.

Consistently we noticed all the asians were seated on the inside while the whites were seated on the side table without hesitation. We inquired again as to why the side table was still empty and we couldn’t sit there, the reply given was different from that of the email- the waitress replied a customer had specified the table number for reservation- seriously?

First, such option is not available nor offered, second upon our insistence (4 times, each with various inconsistent reasoning) we were seated there and no new customers arrived nor anyone making any noise as to why the table we were sitting on were occupied, which invalidates the excuse that that table was reserved with the number 

We were disappointed with the lack of respect and differential treatment received

Had a wonderful experience 
Lovely views and great food 
Would recommend dining in time to enjoy the sunset

I booked a table in advance as I heard it was a busy spot. Good weather is a must to enjoy the stunning views and I would advise you book a table for 7pm to make the most of the sunset. The cable car costs about €20 and takes 3 mins. A bit pricy for the quick journey but worthwhile if you’re having dinner up there. The service in the restaurant was great, we arrived a half an hour early and they were able to seat us. Just to flag that I had asked on reserving for a table on the terrace and we certainly weren’t disappointed with the view. Our waiter was lovely and very helpful. The food was lovely, I had the beefsteak which came out over cooked and they brought me a new steak shortly after that which was cooked to perfection. The truffle potato daphinoise was incredible, I literally savoured every bite. The strawberry dacquiris were one of the best I’ve ever had. Bill came in at €50 for steak and two drinks which I was more than happy with. My friends also thoroughly enjoyed their food and the evening out. Would highly recommend!!
We reserved the place to make sure having the best view to old city. We had an Excelent service and good food as well. Definetly highly recommended!!!
We didn’t eat here but did enjoy a couple of drinks after watching the sunset! Would definitely go back to eat if and when we are in the area again
Best views, excellent food. Best to go at sunset and ask for a table with best view. Steak was perfect and the service was 5 star.

After a cable car ride up from the 'old city' Dubrovnik (150HRK/each), we enjoyed a fabulous meal at sunset. 
The service was impeccable, the food was very good and the views were 5-star! 
I'd recommend that you make a reservation as the restaurant was very busy (both inside and on the patio)> 
360 degree views from the top (enjoy)!

We went there to celebrate our wedding anniversary. 

The cable car to get to the restaurant is really a rip-off, considering you have to pay for an overprized meal afterwards. 

The views are obviously very nice from there, but only if you get a table at the edge of the restaurant. 

Food is just average and expensive for what it is. 

We had to wait 30 minutes to be seated even though we had reserved in advance. 

Only worth for the views on the city.

Make sure to get up the cable car early enough to be seated for lunch or dinner at this amazing restaurant - better yet - book a reservation. We just stumbled onto the place and it was amazing. While the view is breath-taking, and food delightful, the staff are so wonderful. This is a MUST DO in Dubrovnik

We were really looking forward to eating at the Panorama restaurant, but it was a real disappointment the views are amazing but we had to wait 45 mins between starter and main course which really spoilt the occasion.
I just got the feeling they totally relied on the view rather than the service or the food.
Food was ok when it arrived but due to the long wait the moment had gone

We went to the panorama restaurant to celebrate my wife's birthday. It is definitely pricey but well worth it. Ambience is astonishing especially evening times. Quality food and drinks, efficient service. You may have to wait before being served, but given the location, it isn't not surprising! Definitely would recommend it.

I booked the Buggy Safari for my son and I and also reserved a table for early dinner at Panorama for the rest of my family (4 of us). We had plenty of time to kill before the buggy safari so went for a wander before requiring some refreshments. There's only the Panorama to buy anything so we went there... very busy as you can imagine and it took a while to get a table which was a bit frustrating. I suggested to my wife we should probably leave as our buggy booking was approaching - the waitress made a comment I found a bit rude/ insensitive, and it was clear they felt my displeasure. After my son and I downed our drinks and left, my wife stayed with our daughter and told me the manager came looking for me to take feedback. He also gave my daughter a free ice cream. I found the service a bit poor initially, and was less than impressed... but when we came back for dinner at 4pm it was a very different experience. Excellent service, really nice waiter and good food. Our table was overlooking old town and the view was incredible. At the end of our meal, the waiter brought each of us a free desert and said he was aware we'd been in previously and had a poor experience. He said he wanted us to leave with a good impression... and we did. I felt bad and realise they'd been busy, and maybe I expected too much. I left a decent tip (at least I hope it was) and off we went, very happy. I believe we are all entitled to bad days, but the Panorama Restaurant really showed how much they care about providing a good service, and listening to customers when it doesn't work out. Excellent in the end!

Although they were all booked up we travelled up the cable car to catch the sunset from up on Srd. We thought we would try out luck in case of a cancellation at Panorama and lucky we were. We had a wonderful table with a beautiful view. The service was fantastic, surpassed only by the amazing food. Highly recommend booking as far in advance as possible.
Best sandwiches we've found in Dubrovnik. Enjoyed whilst admiring the view. Greeted by waiters who were very efficient. Definitely recommend.

We sat outside although it was a scorcher of a day but the breeze up there was quite nice. We didn’t have to wait too long but I think that’s because there was just true two of us. The view from our table was just stunning! It’s such a beautiful place to just wind down and have a drink or an ice cream or even have a meal. There are butterflies out and about. The service was lovely and the food was delicious! I got the lamb ragu and the portion size was just beautiful, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Thank you 😊

We only had drinks at the high top tables here so I can’t review the food. View is awesome as expected. Drinks were good and pretty fast to get. We came before sunset and took the cable car back down as the sun was setting. Was totally awesome to see the sunset this way. I highly recommend it!

This was so good and amazing value. The food was the best we had had in weeks, and that is saying something. the staff were incredible and attentive. I'm not sure where those negative reviews come from, they are certainly undeserved. Thank you Daniel and all other waiters we had contact with, you made our night very special.
After taking the cable car you can find this lovely restaurant with a lovely view. Prices are reasonable and you can watch the sunset here :)

This place is just beautiful. Food was ok, very expensive, but the views are just out of this world. This was our last meal in Dubrovnik and it was just magical. We sat down for dinner at 7.30 and watched the sun setting behind the mountain, it was absolutely unforgettable. Highly highly recommended.

Outstanding view. However we were placed at a table without a water view when there were some tables open! Hostess was uninterested in trying to accommodate us. Then we had a very rude waiter! Not only was he rude to us but multiple other tables. Despite waiting for some time he never brought us our bill. We had to check the menu for costs and leave money. We only had drinks so can’t comment on the food. We would likely have eaten there if we were given a view table and had
 better service!

This place is the prettiest place on the world, I think. That view is hard to describe... food was great, waiters are very kind and proffesional... and desserts.. oh! Stunning! Definitely a place to recommend!

Arrive by cable car, experience stunning views of Dubrovnik Old Town and the islands and then enjoy amazing food, good service and one of the best views in any restaurant anywhere. 

We took the cable car but it’s also possible to go by car or taxi. We hadn’t booked a table but we were lucky as we wanted to eat early. Definitely best to book, especially around the time of sunset. 

Service was superb and the bill not too expensive considering the unique location.

We did not make a reservation so we were not initially given a table close to the east side with a view; but once a table opened up, they came by and asked if we would like to sit at a table with a view. This was very generous of them to ask, and of course we accepted. We had the Prawn risotto, which was delicious.

We looked at the crowds in the outside section of the restaurant and considered the heat and decided to eat inside, where there was almost no one. We secured a table right at the window and enjoyed a very nice meal while also watching the cable cars come and go and enjoying the view of Dubrovnik; squid was particularly good. Service is not lightning-like as in the US where waiters want to turn over tables to move to the next group and rake in more tips but that is all to the good. Everyone could operate at a human pace, guests and staff alike. And there was air conditioning! As Dubrovnik gets hotter and hotter for the summer, that is a real plus. If you are inclined to sit inside and see that there is a good spot, don’t hesitate. It may not be there later.

I have been yesterday with my friend, and we were thrilled with it. Great food, lobster was very tasty, and vegetables were also good. Nice atmosphere, good-looking interior and nice service, very helpful in terms of choosing the ideal meal. Perhaps a bit too expensive by my opinion.

This is a must do! The view was breathtaking and the dinner was fantastic. Our server was Josip and he was attentive and very friendly! Call early and get a reservation for around 7pm so you can be there for sunset.

We had no reservation in late May but still managed to walk in and get a table without a wait. As none were free along the curved window with the panoramic views, the waiters moved us when another table became free within minutes, and then again to an even better table before our food was served. The food itself was absolutely delicious. We had veal/ porcini risotto and rib-eye steak. We shared a cheesecake for dessert which was beautifully presented and also delicious. It’s not cheap, but in comparison to other more average meals we ate in Dubrovnik, we thought it was better value for money.
It was a tad chilly with the air conditioning on, so take a cardigan/ jacket. Well worth a visit.
The view from the restaurant is breathtaking. The restaurant is fairly priced considering the view. Would recommend to book well in advance.

The food was not fancy--I had basically a grilled ham and cheese sandwich--but it was delicious. The service was so much better than I had expected. The tables are sitting on various levels (there are steps up and down involved) so everyone has a great view. I was very pleasantly surprised by the whole experience.

My husband and I had a rare night without our daughter and tried to book a table earlier in the day for this restaurant. We got an email back saying that they were fully booked but to try our luck and turn up. We decided it was worth going up the cable car anyway. We arrived at the restaurant to find that there were numerous free tables, albeit none at the very edge with the best view. We sat down and ended up just having a drink, they did an amazing Kia royale which was brilliant!! Would recommend you come here even if it’s just for a drink, service was laid back and we ate at both sister restaurants which had great food.
Beautiful location. Service could have been better but over all food and location in regards to the amazing views of Dubrovnik make this a must do while in Dubrovnik.

Me and my partner stopped here for a quick cocktail as we had come up the cable cars. Even though we just had a cocktail each they took their time a little to take our order and get the bill. But I’m sure this isn’t a common thing. Cocktails were great and the location of the bar couldn’t be any better. 

People around us were eating and all the food looked great.

Would reccomend
This restaurant have the best Panorama view of whole city of Dubrovnik Croatia. Its also offer good food like Goose liver, Seabass plater and also have good deserts
