We visited the upper cable car station to get a panoramic view of the Dubrovnik city. Upon reaching we were so captivated by the magnificient views that we requested for a table at the restaurant. Being an extremely popular restaurant, it is very difficult to get a table; guests make reservations months in advance. in spite of not having a reservation, we were lucky. ____ went out of his way & arranged a table for us, right at the edge of the cliff with the most magnificent view of Dubrovnik. Highly appreciate the gesture of polite & helpful staff who made our visit most memorable! Food is delicious too!

We arrived at Panorama restaurant for predinner drinks and were so captivated by the spectacular views that we requested a table for dinner. Little did we know that we should have booked as this restaurant is so popular. Sinisa, the maitre de went above and beyond to accommodate us. Our food was excellent and the magnificent panoramic views made this such a special night for us

We took a taxi from our hotel (Valamar Lacroma to top of cable car - 154 kuna). Had a drink in the morning at this Panorama restaurant and so impressed with the staff and view that we reserved a table for lunch. Had tuna salad and club sandwich. Tuna salad was a bit sloppy but ok, club sandwich was brilliant. Views from this restaurant must have been some of the best if not the best in the Adriatic area. Not to be missed. Museum was interesting. Spent much longer than we had intended here because of this view.

The location is exceptional and must be seen. Preferable during summer for the clear views.
Panoramic view of the city and surrounds...
We dined at this restaurant after hiking up mount srd for a late lunch. The staff, food and views were exceptional and I would recommend this place to anyone.

This is a most wonderful restaurant the staff are fantastic. We saw the restaurant when we went up on the cable car and decided to eat there. There were no tables available on the side with the views but when one became available they offered to move us. When they found out it was my sister's birthday they bought her a cake and sang happy birthday. The view from this restaurant is breathtaking, the food is excellent and the staff are wonderful.
Came up for a few drinks as the food looked a little pricey. They were delicious! After getting past the maitre de who ignored us completely for a while, our waiter was very friendly.

I booked a table at this restaurant for my birthday lunch and made a special request ... the table with the best view. And they got it for me!

Aside from the stunning view of Dubrovnik, the food was delicious! The service is extremely professional, friendly and at an affordable price. 

Highly recommended!
Amazing restaurant, great location and fabulous service. The waiting staff couldn’t have been more helpful and the food was super.
We just had cocktails but they were good. An amazing view over Dubrovnik and the countryside inland. Definitely a must if you’re visiting Dubrovnik. Smooth cable car ride up.

location: New York, New York, United States
review:
We tried to book On line 24 hours in advance, which wasn't enough time. 
We were advised by the restaurant to try our luck on taking the cable car up as there may be a cancellation.
We got lucky. Very lucky. Got a table with a view in time for sunset. 
These guys know how to run a restaurant and look after the customer.
The food was incredible and very reasonably priced given the meal quality service and view.
Were given a discount card for their two other restaurants in old town for the rest of our stay ( which we subsequently visited - see review).
Cannot fault this place-food was gorgeous, staff were extremely helpful and accommodating. Could spend hours here in the restaurant overlooking the views of Dubrovnik.
We had a mixed experience but bottom line was great view and good food. Would visit again and a great stop off at the top👍

Romantic dinner overlooking dubrovnik. We arrived without a reservation at 6:30pm and thankfully someone canceled so we were able to get a table. Josip was our server and was the best service we had in Dubrovnik. This is a must go to restaurant while in town.

The Panorama Restaurant has the most amazing view of Dubrovnik. It is a short cable car ride from the north part of Dubrovnik's old city. The food at this place is also very, very good. The prawn stew is exceptionally delicious.The service was friendly and nice. Please take note that when the sun goes down, it can be cold. The restaurant provides blankets.

I was in Dubrovnik so many years ago, but I’m glad I did come back,....the views are stunning of the old city, in a sunny day you can seat in the terrace but is fully book and very busy. I chose to be indoors, for the heat and allergies to pollen. Glad I did it was calm and empty....

Good service, prices are expensive but not over the top. 
You must pay the cable car or a taxi to come to the restaurant. 
This place does not have a private toilet you have to do the line with the others that come just for a ride in the cable car and not for dinning. 

Definitely nice spot to take pictures. 

Can’t comment much of the food I asked for a salad and juice, it was tasty and a good size portion.

We arrived in Dubrovnik and headed up the cable car straight away with the hope of grabbing a quick lunch at the top. We were expecting an overpriced snack bar - we were very pleasantly surprised!!! A small wait of around 15 minutes and then we were given a table with the most spectacular view. The food was lovely (we chose lovely salads) and the service was attentive but not rushed - we spent a good two hours enjoying lunch and the view. It's a great place to go when you first arrive as it really gives you a feel for what is where in Dubrovnik.

Took a trip up on the cable car and decided to have some lunch. We had a window table with a magnificent view and the friendly service complimented the outlook. Good food and wine and we were allowed to take our time over the meal. A little pricey, but well worth the experience.

My husband and I booked a table for dinner to enjoy the sunset and whilst the weather didn’t cooperate the food and service were outstanding!! Vedran our waiter was very attentive and made excellent recommendations for which dishes to have with our wine. The food was delicious! The view was spectacular and we had an amazing experience.

It will take your breath away as you sit and enjoy a libation and yummy food. Take the cable car up and have incredible scenery the entire ride. Our waiters were helpful friendly and cute. It was a nice break before the trip down and a tour of the walled city and the old town. Great start to our day.

We had just came up by cable car and had a nice look around and thought we would have a bite to eat.
The Staff where so helpful - we were lucky to have a table by the window and the views are amazing.
The menu is not huge but a good range of food - we had a steak sandwich which was really nice and a nice cold beer.
Worth the visit you will not be disappointed. For a tourist hotspot the food was reasonably priced.

A cable car ride takes you to the door of the Panorama Restaurant. Stunning views surround you..... the old walled city of Dubrovnik is layed out before you a jewel in the ocean that surrounds it. The staff at this restaurant can't do enough for you. The steak sandwich was fabulous.

Excellent food, funny waiters alongside stunning views. You'd think that a restaurant occupying such an impressive location would rest on its laurels and overcharge. We were pleasantly surprised to find fair prices and good food. Made for a very special lunch. Make sure you book a table or get there early.
Incredible views, great food & service all for a reasonable price. Would 100% recommend Panorama Restaurant but make sure you reserve a table in advance as queues are lengthy otherwise.
Beautiful place for a little lunch, beer and relaxation. Stunning view which is nothing to do with restaurant. That bit is free

The staff were friendly, and the view is obviously stunning. We ordered hamburgers and they were not that good. A very dense patty of meat. The fries were good. We would try something else on the menu if we went back.

We went here today for a drink and a small snack. When my glass of prosecco was poured there was a tiny amount of cork in it. The waiter immediately took it away and said that he would sort something out. We all received free desserts and liqueurs. The food was all lovely and the button on the table was a great idea but we were really blown away by the fact that they wanted our experience to be perfect. 

Great views, amazing food and service - would really recommend. Wish we had time to go for dinner before we leave.

Visited in May, planned to have lunch outside overlooking the city. There was a long wait so we went to the indoor restaurant instead. Same food just indoors. A little overpriced for burgers and fries. But couldn't fault it. I highly recommend making a reservation if you want to sit outside with the views

This is a must for anyone taking the cable car up to the top to soak in the views of Dubrovnik. 

My boyfriend and I only stopped off for a couple of drinks but the staff made you feel as important as those having a 3 course meal. We didn’t feel rushed even though the place was constantly full and had people waiting for a table. If you don’t want to wait and are wanting a meal, I’d suggest ringing ahead and reserving a table. 

Fantastic cocktails... would have been rude not to :) if we had more time, I would have loved to have returned and had a meal as the food looked amazing and the prices were really reasonable

We got the cable car up to the restaurant, which is very quick, but we then stayed up there for several hours. 
Sipping on fizz, drinking cold beers and having lunch looking out on to the most amazing view was just spectacular. 
The food was gorgeous and the service was fantastic. 
One of the best places I have ever been fortunate enough to visit.

The best views ever. Fabulous food for reasonable cost I would have expected to pay more because of the views absolutely stunning. The service was excellent. You can eat indoors if you prefer. You can ride the cable car to the top or take a taxi. However if you're going I would strongly advise booking well in advance.

You can’t fault the views and service of this place, out of this world. 
The food was ok, I had the lamb and it was very fatty. I don’t think it was worth the price that we paid. Cost us about £120 with only a bottle of wine, shared starter and a very small main each. Also didn’t help that we had loud obnoxious Americans near us who loved the sound of their own voice and ruined our romantic atmosphere.

We booked a table here as it was recommended by a friend. We were on our honeymoon and the staff put us right by the window with amazing views across Dubrovnik. We could not fault a thing, the staff were friendly, attentive and couldn't do enough for you. The food was perfect, absolutely delicious and cocktails awesome. This was a highlight of our visit and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anybody.
We just had some drinks up here. It was a good place to sit and just enjoy the view. The service was great and the coffee was excellent.

If your going to Dubrovnik you have you make this a place to eat. The view is breathtaking!!! The staff are very friendly and our waiter (Daniel) was amazing. The food is outstanding, we both had Lamb Shank which melted in the mouth. The prices are very reasonable. Definitely a must for anyone going to visit this beautiful part of the world.

The views are incredible so if booking make sure you ask for a table on the terrace overlooking the edge. 

Food very good. Great fun. Service first class. Cocktails and wine list all excellent. 

If possible try to schedule your table in line with the sunset. You won’t be disappointed.

This will always be special to me now as my partner proposed to me here! It’s a beautiful restaurant with views like nothing I had ever seen beautiful. Food and wine delicious. Lovely attentive staff. Patio heaters everywhere for your warmth and comfort at night as well as little blankets the staff give out to the ladies should they require them at night. Atmosphere is so special here and lovely soft music plays in the background. Cannot recommend this place enough.

A friend and I decided to sit down inside the restaurant for some cake and coffee. 
We ordered 2 caffe lattes which were okay but should have been hotter and a bit bigger. My friend had the cheesecake while I had the apple pie. The desserts were presented well and looked appetising however were nothing special. 
Staff were pleasant although despite the inside seating area being quiet, the service was slow. 
However, if I were to go back again would be a lovely location for a drink.

After the climb up the hill (absolutely worth it for the breathtaking views) we stopped for a well deserved spritz/beer and snack (I.e. local meat platter) and we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of offerings and service when the restaurant could rest on the laurels of its location alone. We would highly recommend.

We was staying in nearby cavtat and got the boat over to dubrovnik a couple of times. We was waiting for a clear day to go on the cable car and it was worth it. The restaurant looked so inviting and was lucky enough to get a table with a view. We had pre lunch drinks and i had chicken and sunflower seed salad my other half had tuna salad. We was both very satisfied food was lovely fresh and very tasty. Our waiter was very polite and could not do enough for us. I can not wait to return.

Sometimes when you really enjoy something you feel compelled to write a review. This was such an occasion.

We took the cable car in Dubrovnik, not expensive - €20 each - and because the restaurant looked so inviting we decided to stay for lunch. There wasn't a table in a prime position, they had been reserved. However our table was fine. We were served by a most charming waiter, Rajko, and had pre-lunch drinks. A better table became available and we were asked if we would like to move which we did. We had lunch and coffee, all extremely good. Not mega-expensive either.

It was just one of those occasions during a holiday which we will always talk about. Highly recommended.

God view of Dubrovnik!
Good food on a little bit higher prices than in the city understandable by the view. They missed half of our order but the waiter was kind enough. Then the rain came. A mess happened. We tried to enter the inside room. After 5 minutes of conversations the manager let us in. The presence is that if you go without reservation you're nobody.

Visited here one evening after a recommendation by a fellow guest at our hotel. You can get to the restaurant via cable car or by taxi. We took an Uber which cost approx. £165. We stayed at the Rixos, approx. 20 mins away. 

We arrived at the restaurant at 730 and it was fairly quiet. The waiter showed us to an available table and made us aware that the kitchen was closing at 8pm - it is out of season. The waiter then kindly offered us a table with a better view as it became available. 

My wife ordered Prawns and I ordered the salmon. Both arrived quickly and tasted amazing. The waiter kindly provided a bib for my wife as the prawns arrived with shell on and also provided a bowl for shells - something that is often forgot about in some restaurants. 

Service was impeccable. I strongly recommend the restaurant.

The staff couldn’t have been more friendly, personable and professional. Highly recommend this restaurant for this reason, not to mention the good food (at reasonable prices given the location). 
You need to book if you want an edge table; we turned up without a reservation but still got a good table. 
We then walked down the stony zig zag path- very doable but wear good footwear!

After a long walk up the hill, we needed a cold beer for refreshments. But it started to rain and all looked like "Mordor", so we decided to stay for dinner. It was amazing dish, recommended from our waiter Rajko. It turned to be the most delicious experience for our gums in a long time, served with smile and expertise of their staff. Highly recommended!

Definitely a must-do if visiting Dubrovnik. Recommend going towards the end of your trip so you can see everywhere you’ve been with the view. Worth requesting a table with view of the old city and take the restaurants recommendation re timing so you sit at sunset. Good value food/wine and photo opportunities!

Scenery was beyond description and meal as well.
Hospitality was marvelous. Especially, host named Blaz was really nice.
He allowed us to be seated near the sea view. He was really kind and we had good time there! I strongly recommend you to visit this nice restaurant.
He took pictures of us, which was well taken. He also has a good sense of taking picture:)

What a great experience for a first time visit !

Views are unbeatable in dubrovnik and staff very efficient and friendly .

Drinks food all great served with a smile !
Could not find faults on this first visit great!
Amazing view, tasty meals and lovely atmosphere. Service was good, not impressing. It`s worth visiting :).

Went for a deserved drink after walinkg to the top of mount sdr. Staff very nice, large variety of options and good presentation. Only spoiled by to smokers in the table next to ours and which smoke was coming directly to us...I know its outdoors but specially because of the wind maybe it wouldn't be a bad idea to have smokers area separately.
this restaurant is located at the top of the cable car so the view is beautiful. The tuna salad and hamburger were very good and the coffee excellent. Niksa was our excellent waiter.

Quite expensive, for a bit of cheesecake and 2 drinks (1 beer and one iced tea) we paid about £15, but when you're sat at a gorgeous table overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik, The price seems worth it! The waiters and waitresses are so lovely and helpful, Nikash(?) Was brilliant and very professional! We ended up staying longer than expected just because we could see every single detail of the city, and it's breathtaking. Great spot for taking photos, and for relaxing. Would definitely recommend getting the cable car and coming up here for a walk around the mountains and some lunch at Panorama. It was a highlight of our holiday.

The view is excellent and food is amazing. I like fine dining, but this was unexpectedly great. Service is great, too. 
I recommend this place, for sure. Top choice of Dubrovnik. Prices are absolutely reasonable considering where you are and what food you eat.

Managed to squeeze in without a reservation (booking probably recommended though!), very surprised to get seat at a table with a gorgeous view over the city! The service was very good, staff all very friendly. The food was good quality and decent portions, so decent value all in all. Highly recommended, we’ll definitely go back!

Restaurant at the end of the (overpriced) cable car trip. Professional & friendly staff compliment the great views, which actually can be had anywhere at the top.

Drinks are hugely overpriced and cocktails are weak. If you’re happing paying for the location, probably worthwhile.
Cable car up to the top. Fantastic view in all directions. Superb service, blue sky, warm sun, fantastic, relaxing!

I visited with a group of 7 (I’d advise booking in advance though as we did have to wait) & once we got a table, the staff looked after us very well. Customer service here was exceptional. The food was also great. We had some meat, cheese & seafood cold dishes to share & then main courses, which were delicious including the prawns, sea bass, risotto & pork rack. They have a great wine selection & also really good mocktails (I recommend the virgin mojito). And of course the views!!! With great service, great food & great views - this is the perfect place to visit!

We after reading the reviews went for the choice. 
And were not disappointed at all. 

A spectacular view, one should wait till it gets dark after the Subaru and the town gets lit as it gets even more romantic. 
And you can also sit on the rocks just besides the restaurant for better views brake the sunset.

And extraordinary staff, highly hospitable and courteous.
Sadly though that did not have many vegetarian options, we belong pure vegetarians don't consume meat, fish and eggs, but the stagg tried to accommodate us after all. 

A good time spent.
Recommended to all sunset lovers.
The view was great, food was pretty good too (had a beet soup and couple drinks). Make sure to check the gondola time and if it is open. Had we gone the next day it would have been closed.

We stopped up here for coffee, ice-cream (price is for 3 scoops) and a beer, even tho it looked more like a restaurant than a cafe. But it was fine. Friendly staff and quiet atmosphere. They made us feel very welcome. 

The menu was extensive and the restaurants had many reserved tables for the dinner service. Would be a nice option if we had more days here. 

The view was gorgeous up here. Just take care with little ones as the tables are just beside the steep slopes which are not closed off. 

We left at sunset just as the sun was casting everything in a beautiful orange hue. But it was too late for us, we were already in the cable car going down. 

Just a tip, if the cable car station is covered by clouds, or looks blur due to very light fog, do not waste your time going up.
We went for a sunset meal. Beautiful food location was amazing for the views! Staff were great. It does get a little windy but worth it!
The view was good until the sea mist came in, service is great as you walk in but after that poor service, worth having a drink but nothing more....... took 15mins for the bill to arrive

Amazing birds eye view of Dubrovnik, ask for a table by the railings! Food is ok, you are obviously there for the view, so factor in that for sure. We took the cable car to the restaurant and back to the city so that was easy enough. The ride was really scenic as well.
Can’t beat the view on a clear day, expect a wait for a table on busier days, early in the day is a safer bet. Take your camera and sunglasses.

When we arrived, we asked whether the restaurant had the edge seating available. They told us they had; however, they let us seated somewhere else even we saw many edge seating available. They claimed they were all reserved. Later, we noticed that the tables next to us got moving to the reserved seats and they did not make a reservation. Then we asked again, they committed that they would got us moved as soon as they had the table. We did not get any move until we finished.

We travelled by cable car to reach the Panorama restaurant and Fort. The cable car tickets cost 170 kuna each, approx £20 each. The cocktails were a tad expensive at around £10 each but were lovely. The food on the other hand was fairly reasonable, in my opinion. I had the beetroot soup for starter and omg! it was absolutely gorgeous. I could have eaten more! I had the chicken rustico, which was chicken rolled around spinacha and cheese, with potatoes and a sage sauce, it was really tasty, I particularly enjoyed the sauce. DH had the Pasta Carbonara, which he said was nicer than many others he had eaten. Worth eating here for the views alone but the fact that the food is so nice, is the cherry on the cake!

As we were going on a food tour shortly before, we had a couple of drinks and slices of cake whilst on top of the mountain. Little bit chilly in the wind, but that have blankets and outdoor heaters. Waiter was very friendly and offered us some tips as it was the start of our holiday. We worth the spectacular views of the city, I can see why it would be very busy during the summer. The waiter gave us a 10% discount card for their sister restaurants, of which we used at the Dubravka 1836 near the Pile Gate (reviewed separately)

Fantastic restaurant, primarily due to their friendly staff. My wife and I shared fries, garlic mushrooms, and olives, which came to a very reasonable price. We were given free bread, too! The views were great and I’d love to return.

When taking the cable care be sure to have some time in your planning to visit te Panorama Restaurant. You can enjoy a lovely view while getting just excelent service. Grab something to drink accompanied by a nice piece of cake. Satff is very very helpful and their policy is just graet. We certainly will go back if we visit Dubrovnik again and this is one of those places you have to recommend to your friends.
Hotel panorama has the best view of Dubrovnik. The dessert that we had there was excellent. The staff were very friendly.

I knew when we took the Cable Car up to Mt. Srd to see the amazing panoramic views of Dubrovnik and the Adriatic Sea, that we would want to have a meal up there, so we booked a window table at 6pm to enjoy the sunset. Sometimes you end up just paying for a nice view but average food, but the Panorama Restaurant provided excellent menu entrees and top-notch service as well, so we ended up staying till closing time at 9pm and adding some drinks and cheesecake as well. A memorable place and experience.

We had a hike up to the top (approximately 45 minutes fast walking) and was really exhausted when we got on the top. We were so excited to find this amazing restaurant with serviceminded waitresses, lovely food (had a pasta carbonara and a salad) and the prettiest view of Dubrovnik. The walk up was definatly worth it, but you can also drive here by a car or use the cableway.

Whatever the quality of the food, the views are totally worth it! We walked from Old Town so were hungry and thirsty when we arrived. Staff were welcoming and polite, ready with blankets and heaters to mitigate the chill of the winds at the top of the hill. Drinks are expensive even compared with Old Town, but food is on a par cost-wise, although bog standard.

We visited during the off season, so reservations were not really needed. But a reservation gets you the best table with the best view! I had the lamb shank with potato purée which was cooked in a red wine sauce and amazing. My husband had the pork chop special with roasted potatoes. Both were so tender and fell right off the bone.

Food is probably a 3 out of 4. The view is 5 out of 5. Try and book a sunset meal in advance and ask for an ocean side table. If not you'll be tucked away from the ocean/island views. 

Take a jacket as it get's breezy.

We came in March. the views were amazing, the weather a bit windy (sit inside the views are still amazing) the staff were very helpful and attentive - or 8 month old made a terrible mess and the came over to do me trying to clear up and played with her. The good was good and the drinks were reasonably priced considering the view - around 35-40kn for a couple of beers. We actually tried to go back but the weather defeated us.

Hostess and waiters are very friendly and accommodating. We were sitted on a spot where exactly I desired to be. Prices are not too bad considering that you get to eat and drink on top of the world. Comfy chairs, heaters and blankets were provided as it was chilly but sunny when we visited. We were given a discount card for their affiliate restaurants in town.
My husband and I went here with our friends, we went because of the wiew but the food here is very nice..
I had a nice time in Dubrovnik and the one of the highlights was restaurant Panorama, the food was amazing and for not that high of a price. Recommended

This restaurant has the most beautiful view in Dubrovnik, great experience! We eat cake and coffee and it was normal, nothing special but enjoyable. It is not cheap but it is worth to spend some money on a great afternoon :)
Really enjoyed the food, booked the table before hand and got a perfect view over Dubrovnik Old Town as the sun was setting. The food was expensive but very tasty.

This was genuinely one of the best experiences of my life. We were seated right on the edge so had a fantastic view of the sun setting. It was absolutely magical. The food was delicious and fresh and be cocktails were fantastic. The staff were so lovely too! It’s a true experience, not just dinner. I think everyone who goes to Dubrovnik should come here to see the sun setting. It’s probably quite pricey in comparison to other places to eat in Dubrovnik but it’s worth every single penny. Perfection.

We got there early (maybe 10:30 a.m.), started with coffee, and moved on to a leisurely lunch. The view over Dubrovnik is spectacular. Although there is a ton of seating, the restaurant is built into the hill so there were only two or three other tables in our immediate area. The restaurant provides a little button at the table that you can press for service. We thought this was a great way to handle different cultural expectations about how often servers should check on diners.

A couple of years ago we were in Dubrovnic and decided to take the cable car up to the restaraunt/bar at the peak, there was eight of us and when we arrived the the place was pumping. Even so the staff were very helpful and found us a table, we had some cocktails and snacks, the service was good and the ambiance, music and views were nothing short of sensational. definitely a place to visit if you are in the area.

This is not fair that nobody inform about the fact that kitchen closes in November and December and....???
So you take the funicular hoping for a good meal and you learn once in the top that there is only a cake of the day. If you don’t like chocolate you leave with empty stomach and 350 k less. This is how to deal with tourists....

We booked a table with a view one evening and were not disappointed. The cable car journey up was fun albeit short. And the views were incredible. We timed it perfectly as we got to see a glorious sunset. The atmosphere at the restaurant was excellent - very relaxing. It felt surreal having such a splendid view of the old town lit up whilst we ate. Both our meals were delicious and beautifully presented and the service was great too. Our waiter was really friendly and attentive. Highly recommend this place, it was definitely one of the highlights of our holiday!

A wonderful terraced restaurant above the walled city of Dubrovnik with amazing views. I had heard you had to have reservations way in advance, but we walked right up and got seated. Wonderful meal with an unbelievable view. An exceptionally experience.

I booked the restaurant weeks in advance before our trip to ensure we were there just before sunrise. We had the best table on the terrace. This is certainly a bucket list restaurant when travelling around Europe. It did not disappoint. The food and wine was delicious. The service was excellent. But what you are really going for is the magical views of Dubrovnik. It is an absolute must when travelling to this great city.

Took the cable car up to the top and the views were spectacular. The restaurant offers a variety of drinks and desserts, however, no actual meals. Which is fine because the chocolate cake of the day was absolutely delicious. Wasn't too expensive either. Well worth the trip up top and sip some coffee.

Booked a table before our holiday to ensure we got a table with a good view. Glad we did as the view was fantastic. We also timed it so that the sun was setting half way through the meal. Service was also very attentive. Couldn't fault the meal but wasnt the best we had on holiday for the money. The view however made it all worthwhile.

We called and reserved our table well in advance. Great prices & great food!! I would recommend this to everyone! 10/10! Really good drinks & amazing service from the waiters. There’s also a call button at the table to let them know you need something. 😊👍🏻
This restaurant had the best views of the town and coast. The food was deliciou and the service excellent.. Book in advance!

Beautiful location and what a perfect place to enjoy a light lunch, as we did.
The lunch was fresh and tasty, the parasols shaded everyone from the very warm sun very effectively - a very nemorable eatery for all the right reasons

On our final day we did the cable car and thought we would chance our luck of getting a table for some drinks at the panorama without booking. Though busy they were more than accommodating and gave us the best table available, looking right down onto the Old Town. It is a little pricey but worth it for the view. I had a lovely cocktail, made with plenty of alcohol. All tables have a buzzer too, to call waiting staff should you require more drinks etc. A very well restaurant with amazing views.

We visited during the day and managed to be sorted straight away and at a table overlooking the old city.

The staff were friendly and helpful, and the food both well priced and good quality.

A must place to eat with such a fantastic view.

As you get out of the cable car, admire the view, then proceed to Panorama Restaurant. The prawns are delicious, the service attentive, and the view of the city hard to beat. A good place for romance as well if you are so inclined.

Food is good (tried their local dishes like squid and beef pasta ), and service is quite good too. what's really going for them is the fantastic view of the whole city as the only restaurant on Mt. Srd. 

I would go back again if I go back up on Mt Srd. Cheers.

The views from the top of Mt. Srd are incredible so we were going to eat lunch at Panorama Restaurant anyway. But we were delighted with the quality of the food. We had a seafood risotto that was delicious and sphagetti carbinara that was the best I have ever had. The service was good and the prices were reasonable. Far exceeded my expectations!

Had dinner her on our first night we had made reservations but still had to wait a bit for a table, but it was no problem as they brought us drinks and we enjoyed the sunset . The view really is spectacular. I dose get a little chilly up there at night but they have heaters and blankets to make you comfortable. The food was very good and the service was fantastic. thanks for a great first night in Dubrovnik.

We'd been looking for somewhere to spend our last evening prior to our flight home when we remembered there was a restaurant at the top of Mt Srd. Expecting the usual tourist look of a restaurant, we were pleasantly surprised at the modern feel. We hadn't a reservation but we're allowed to sit at a window table which was reserved for later that evening. The food was delicious, the view simply stunning, the waiter, so sorry, we didn't ask your name, was very attentive. We offered to move to another table as our time was nearly up but he said no, you can have the table all evening! We watched an amazing fireball of a sunset, and so generously, we were given dessert on the house. A very memorable and enjoyable last night in a beautiful city. Thankyou!

When visiting Dubrovnik in October we took the cable car up the mountain in order to get the best view of the city and I'm so glad we did.

We had planned to have lunch in the Panorama Restaurant whilst we were up there and I'm so glad we did. Unfortunately I wasn't smart enough to book in advance but after a short wait we were given a table. It then transpired that the reserved table right on the edge with the best view was no longer required so we were asked if we wanted to move forward - BONUS! 

The view is unbelievable - you are literally in the clouds and have a view of all of Dubrovnik and Lokrum Island. 

The food and wine/beer was great and was extremely reasonable prices.

I can't recommend this place enough!

This is at the top of the hill overlooking Dubrovnik, accessed by the cable car. The views are amazing. The food looked good, with home baked traditional cakes on display, but we only had some good coffee and took in the views. Tends to be a little breezy there so the blankets they offer come in handy. Recommended

Well clearly the most amazing views in Dubrovnik - and we were lucky enough to get a table on the sea side both times, But not only that - the food was delicious too. The service is fast (considering all the steps and the climbing that the waiting staff have to do each shift) and the staff are all particularly friendly and helpful. There are blankets on the back of each chair which was particularly useful the first night we were there - and we stayed long enough to watch the sun go down. And when it starts to get dark and chilly the patio heaters come out. We did not feel rushed at all but had a very and relaxed meal with a delicious bottle of wine - both times. The view is stunning and makes for some lovely photos - and lovely memories. Thank you to everyone.
Well worth popping in for lunch. Can recommend the club sandwich but others in the family were equally enthusiastic about their choices. An essential ingredient to a Dubrovnik holiday.

Had a short wait for a table but not a problem.
Good choice of food and huge portions!
I would say overpriced but I guess that's because of the view! Worth it for the experience.

We visited on a Sunday at lunchtime. It was a little chilly but the blankets provided make sure you're warm and cosy! The food is lovely which we found surprising for an attraction with no other competition and we were pleasantly surprised. Would definitely return.

The best view in Dubrovnik with great food, drink and good service. A great place to while away the hours, looking over the oranges tiled roof tops of the old city and the sun kissed Adriatic coastline. Well worth the price of a cable car trip which is exciting and breath taking.

Seeing the views from the top of Mount Srd is an experience itself. Then this delightful restaurant, with amazing food, surprised us all. Most definitely not a tourist trap.....the service is excellent, and the food fantastic. We enjoyed a great meal, looking at the beautiful views of the old city and the sea.....spending over 2 hours there with 3 bottles of Prosecco! Would definitely return.

As a place with a fantastic view I don't think you will beat this. You'll think that having a captive audience that it would be overpriced. We found that its priced in keeping with those in the old town. The views are breath taking. The service was good although it did take them a little while to bring the bill, but this gave me more time admiring the view. Oh have i mentioned the views.
we were very lucky, visiting in October, the weather was perfect and the view spectacular. The food was great and the staff really friendly and helpful.

Only had coffee/drink/cake (which were lovely), however, we were treated as though we were their most valued customers. Excellent service - we were originally seated at the opposite side of the restaurant from the spectacular views. Without asking, when tables became available overlooking Dubnovnik, we were invited to move, with the waiter carrying our drinks,etc.
Unrivalled views over Dubnovnik and the Adriatic.
We visited in October and the place wasn't too busy, maybe different in the height of summer.

We arrived in Dubrovnik early afternoon, as soon as we got rid of our luggage, we headed straight for the cable car. We didn’t have to wait, bought our ticket and got on the next cable car as it arrived. When we came back down a couple of hours later the queue for the cable car was very long. I can imagine it getting very busy just before lunchtime as well early evening. We were very surprised at how busy Dubrovnik old town was for September ( so called out of season) I dread to think how busy it is in June, July and August. This seems to be because of the cruise ships that arrive daily. We didn’t have to wait long to be seated in the restaurant, we were seated at a table with amazing views, most tables are positioned so that you can enjoy the fabulous views. The food was very good, a bit pricey but it’s the location you’re paying for. Staff were friendly, efficient and attentive. There is a bar, in the middle of the restaurant for those just wishing to have a drink, so I do think it’s a little unfair of those who just want a drink to sit at a prime positioned table when others paying for a meal may end up sitting at a table with less of a view. It was a beautiful sunny warm day but still a bit breezy. There were blankets on the seat should you get chilly. It’s a must visit if you’re in Dubrovnik! I can imagine it to be just as beautiful at night.

Any visit to Dubrovnik should include a cable car ride to the top of the mountain and preferably including lunch/dinner at Panorama. We booked a table for 10 on the terrace to celebrate a 60th birthday. We all agreed it was an unforgettable and memorable experience. The view is quite jaw dropping - almost without peer in my experience. Food and Service also excellent, although would have preferred more local content. Suggest book ahead for a table on terrace at cliff face.

With a prime location like this you would think that panorama would be more exclusive. The menu was very underwhelming so we chose to eat elsewhere. It was chilly but there was no offer of a heater or a blanket.

We took the cable car and had booked the restaurant at 5.30, to be ready for Sunset. We were lucky with a table for 2 at the side, so perfect view on the city and the sun going down.

We started with cheese platter and then had Tuna steak and Chicken. Very nice all meal. We finished with Bailey's coffee.

Very friendly staff and just perfect location.

Had dinner with my wife and 8 year old daughter. We booked through our hotel for 6pm to catch the sunset which was fantastic. The staff were spot on from the moment we arrived, assuring us we had a good table booked and being very attentive. But it's the view that makes it here, it sits right above Dubrovnik old town with the sea behind in one direction and mountains in the other...fantastic! Great food too!

While the food at this restaurant is good for both local dishes and dessert we found that its view with the sunset and Dubrovnik old town is its truly climax and worth the meal already. It is surely will be anyone's unforgettable and memorable moment for the lifetime. Book ahead for the cliffside view for the dinner.
Incredible view in the super restaurant on the top of the mountain. We took a taxi up and the cable car back down to the city. This is an absolutely no miss place. Bring your camera.

We loved the views of this place and had a great lunch. The sandwich was such a great choice for us for a quick lunch. It’s a little on the higher side but with the views of old town, it’s worth it. Do book a reservation especially in the summer months.
You can't go paat the view at this restaurant - the food is much like the same as most of the restaurants around Dubrovnik (pastas, sandwiches, seafood, etc). Pleasant enough lunch.

Location is just beautiful. We got there this evening at around 4.45pm. We just wanted a beer. We stood at a table near the railing which had a lovely view over the old town and the sea. 

We figured a beer might be a little more than usual, but I nearly passed out when the bill arrived.... it was almost €16 for 2 beers!!!!! 

Despite being quiet, service was scatty and we had to go look for someone to take our €€. 

If the prices had been reasonable I'd have awarded a higher rating.

We went in not expecting too much as this is the type of restaurant that could probably simply live off the stunning views and the one-off tourist trade, but we were pleasantly surprised. Staff initially seemed a little stern-looking but in fact they were thoughtful, friendly and very efficient. Our simple lunchtime burgers, steak sandwiches and beers were very good indeed and good value. We had a big dinner lined up so didn't try the desserts, but the cheesecake looked superb. Strongly recommended.

Beautiful views of old town Dubrovnik, the food was really good, although it can be very crowded. The price point is moderate to high, but well worth it. I started with a seafood trio of shrimp, sardines, and octopus salad. It came with the capers I have ever had, and could be shared for two. My main dish was a stuffed chicken in a brown sauce with roasted potatoes and grape tomatoes. The portion was larger than I expected, this made for great leftovers. If you time it just right you can enjoy your meal and the beautiful sunset.

Lovely view from up above👌 Take the cable car to get here and have some yummie cheesecake. Once you’re suitably refreshed, head outside to the various terraces to get another good look at those views. There’s one on the cable car level, and one upstairs with panoramic views over the mountains. You can also go downstairs to see a big cross which bears over the city.

Came at sunset and had a local white wine. Spectacular views, great service (gently asked if we'd like to move to a table with a heating lamp that just freed up since the temps dipped a couple of degrees), good selection of wine. Blankets provided too, that looked and smelled fresh and clean.
We had lunch here and really enjoyed it! Our meals were amazing and the staff was great. When it was a little chilly, they brought heaters out and provided blankets. A beautiful view of the city!
Well worth visiting for the view alone. Taking a Cable Car to the top of Mount Srd, breathing in the views & dining al fresco is an experience you will never forget.

A visit to the Dubrovnik region would not be complete without a trip to the Panorama restaurant.

My other half booked a couple of months in advance (not necessarily required but it paid off), as we got table 12 which were the tables with an incredible view over Dubrovnik and the sunset.

The staff give you a buzzer, so that you can enjoy the view and when you are ready to eat you can just call the staff to order. The menu had a lot of choice and we went for the Prawns (which were enormous) and the steak which was great. To protect my other halfs dress, the staff provided her with a napkin / bib necklace that went over her head. It was a nice touch as the napkin had a necklace printed on it which made it quite novel. We also had pudding, an apple tart and a hazelnut cake (the best puddings we had in Croatia). Yes we probably paid a slight premium to be up there for the view, but it was not more than a nice meal out in the UK that does not have the same view!

The view speaks for itself, amazing views over Dubrovnik old town, harbour, port etc. including the sunset! Don't just turn up on the day as you will get a seat without a view!

A once in a lifetime meal with a view that is definitely worth a visit!

This restaurant as the name implies has a breathtaking views of the Old Dubrovnik City as well as the islands around . Prices as expected for such a place are on the steep side but is compensated by the friendly staff. Must visit .

Stopped in for lunch after taking the cable car up. The restaurant has spread out since my previous visit and now has a larger number of outside tables. The view is always excellent and the steak sandwich with fries was very good. Quite a bit more expensive than two years ago though.

We went here on the recommendation of a friend and it didn't disappoint. We sat and had a drink while we waited for a table on the edge of the restaurant, other tables were available, but that was our preference so we waited. My husband had the burger and I had the steak sandwich on the recommendation of another trip advisor review and it didn't disappoint! We both had cheesecake for dessert, it was simple but amazing! The views are beautiful from Panorama Restaurant. We ate in the afternoon so was a little cooler and a bit windy, I would advise taking a jacket just in case, there is also the option to sit inside. We felt the prices were reasonable, no more expensive than most places in Dubrovnik.

We had no reservation yet we were given a table with one of the best views. The staff brought over heaters and blankets which was lovely as the temperature had cooled a lot since the sun went down. Plenty of food on the menu however I settled for a salad and more wine. Bread was served also. Bit pricier than the old Town but that is to be expected for the views

This restaurant is up the top after your cable cart ride. Perfect location and awesome service..A short wait to get a table- probably best to book..Perfect waiting area overlooking the old town..The restsurant - excellent food- drinks- service..And spectacular views of the city..Definitly a high recommendation. Take a jkt as it gets quite cold as you are high up. They do have blankets which is awesome. Perfect night during the cable.cart ride,.up and back.down to.old town. Treat yourself

From the booking to when we finished our meal, everything was excellent. £ weeks in advance, I booked a table for 2 in the terrace for the sunset my 2nd yr anniversary with my bf. Anita, the sales manager, was very prompt and patient in responding to my email and questions. She also gave us a 10% discount since we booked a table in their sister company (restaurant) Dubravka. When arrived at the restaurant, we were greeted by the staff with a smile and escorted to the table which my bf and I think the best table in the restaurant! 
 
 The view was amazing! The weather was glorious and the sunset was lovely! It was so romantic! The service was over the top, they gave us blankets and turned on drop light to provide us heating. The waiter was prompt to our needs and very polite and friendly. 

 My bf said to me that, most restaurants that offer a view like this usually fail with their food but NO! He loved it! the chef proved him wrong this time and he really liked what he ate. From starter to dessert! we were so full and it wasn't even expensive as we thought it will be when we saw the bill.So even without the discount, we are okay to pay the normal price which we did. Even on our way out, all the waiters are thanking us for dining in Panorama and they all have smiles on their faces! Overall is my experience with Panorama was unforgettable, Thank you for making our anniversary extra special! I will recommend this to everyone I know whos going to Dubrovnik! AMAZING!

We were here for lunch, so had sandwiches and burgers from their quick bites menu. All were really tasty, but perhaps not spectacular. What instead was spectacular was the view and the service. The place was almost full and we had not made a reservation. After a short while they had arranged us one of the best tables, just by the railing with unobstructed views to the city! It was busy, so we waited a bit for our food, but the service was very attentive and they were great with the kids too.
You cannot visit Dubrovnik without a trip to this fantastic restaurant. Amazing view, amazing food and amazing service...Good job guys see you again next year!

We had a fantastic lunch here and loved the amazing views over Dubrovnik and the coast. In early October getting a table with a great view was no problem and the waiters will happily move you if an even better view becomes available.

Like so many of Dubrovnik's restaurants the fish and seafood were great while my husband had no problem getting a delicious vegetarian meal.

As the wind picked up the waiters pass around offering blankets to those who, like us, had dressed for the bright and sunny morning. In the evening we realised that the red glow we could see from the town below was the electric heaters over the tables so, whatever the weather, you can be sure to enjoy the restaurant with what must be the best view in Dubrovnik - if not the Adriatic.

Pre booked a table here for my girlfriends birthday and were really looking forward to the experience but we were left disappointed.

Once we were sat down our waiter took a drinks order and removed our menus without asking if were ready to order food. After flagging down his colleague we ordered and it was brought to our table promptly (it was delicious). Our waiter gave us a button to press when we needed him which obviously didn’t work as we had to again flag down his colleague to order more drinks. Once we finished our main we waited and waited for our plates to be cleared so we could order dessert, it became clear this wasn’t going to happen any time soon. We pressed the bell to call the waiter numerous times without a response, we asked his colleague who said he would pass on the message but still nothing and finally after 40 minutes we got the attention of the maitre d who instructed him to clear our table. By then we had changed our minds about ordering dessert and asked for the bill. 

It must be noted that during this time two other couples who had been seated in our area had walked out as their food order hadn’t been taken. There were couples in other sections of the restaurant who entered long after we had but had been seen to much more efficiently.

All in all a disappointing experience.

My wife and I are currently on our honeymoon touring the Croatian coastline and decided to book a table (two months in advance) for this lovely restaurant as our one 'expensive' honeymoon meal to celebrate.

We were greeted at the front entrance by a lovely and knowledgeable hostess who let us know our table would be ready shortly. It took under five minutes and we were given the best seat overlooking the Old Town of Dubrovnik and treated to excellent service throughout the meal. Our server, a younger, local gent, recommended our dishes and drinks and we began what was a very pleasant meal.

We started with the Dalmatian platter that consisted of thinly sliced prosciutto, fresh black olives, and an assortment of fine cheeses. The portion was sufficient for us to share as an appetizer and definitely lived up to the reviews we read online.

My wife had the chef's special recommendation: pork chops with mashed potatoes and crisp onion frites. She enjoyed the mash and meat, albeit somewhat overly salty. My main was the tuna steak (the fish of the day), served with a side of rosemary seasoned potatoes. I had no qualms with my meal and found myself sharing some with the mrs as she was having some difficulty with the amount of salt in her main dish (I, on the other hand, gobbled her meal down, salt or not!).

The view is absolutely exceptional and one of the best we've been treated to, although I feel as though this is incorporated into the price considering the meals were not the absolute best we had while in Dubrovnik. 

Four stars for the service, the view, knowledgable staff, and the location.

We simply loved the spot. Getting tables with view onto The Old Town is probably impossible without a reservation, which we didnt have, but got a table on the other side facing all the mountains, unreal! We absolutely enjoyed every bit ot the evening on our first day of stay in Dubrovnik. Starting with lovely spot, lovely food, finishing with the staff. I regret not asking our waiter for his name so I could say a good word about him as he was very nice, helpful and always with smile on his face. I think that even tho the food is pricey it's absolutely worth it (I had a ravioli and my boyfriend got a steak sandwich). We dined in their sister restaurant right after our arrival and got a little discount from one of the waiters for a dinner in Panorama, which we appreciate a lot! (treat the staff well and you will get one as well future customer as well!😊😊) Thank you very much for such a lovely experience! Would deffinitely come back if we are in Dubrovnik ever again!

We had a lovely table right next to the railing. Unfortunately, it was for 8:00, and sunset was at 7:00. Though we were able to enjoy the sunset on the way up the cable car, to make this visit perfect you should make a reservation well in advance for sunset. Just keep in mind: everyone is taking the cable car up to the top at sunset, so allow extra time for that. I attempted to make a reservation 1 week prior, and that wasn't enough time (they were booked for sunset). The food was good not great, but good. Not that expensive when you take into consideration the location of the restaurant. I believe our bill was around $90 USD for 2, with a bottle of wine. It was a chilly evening, and each table had a heater, and they gave you blankets. Nice touch.
Not only the view was spectacular but also the food was good, the wine was nice and the staff were very helpfull

I love this restaurant. 
We booked days before we went, and were walked past the queue to the best table with the most stunning view of the city. I ordered the king prawns and they were the size of dragons. The water brought me a paper bib so I could dive in as messily as I wanted. Excellent wine as well. 
Everyone was happy. 
OK, so the winds were so high we got trapped up there for a few hours, but we enjoyed a good cup of tea while waiting. 
Use the cable car to get up and down when not windy. Taxi takes ages.

We visited on a glorious sunny day and had a seat looking at the mountains and a bit of sea. Hindsight, we should have made a reservation as soon a we got to the top, if not earlier. We lucked out and got the last available table.
 Service was very good, they have call buttons to flag your waiter after your first order.
We only had drinks and light snack, but if I ever return, I will make reservations for dinner and request a table on the railing - city side, timed to be there for sunset. Based on our snacks, the entrees should be absolutely wonderful and the views can’t be beat.
Would repeat, even with the cable car fee to get here.

It’s simply incredible! We actually booked lunch months in advance as we where so excited to visit this place! Love, love, loved it! 

Yeah it’s expensive but who cares! Look at that view! Not to mention the food is fantastic too! 

BOOK IT NOW!

We hadn't intended to go to the restaurant but it was such a glorious day we couldn't resist. We sat outside with a cocktail and cheese platter and soaked in the view. We thought it might be expensive but it was very reasonable. 
They even had fleecy blankets on every chair in case anyone felt chilly!!
If you go up in the cable car, don't rush down without at least having a drink here. Highly recommended.

We just called for coffee as it was only 10 am. But the layout of this place is great with the maximum of tables at the cliff edge for the view. I wish we had had time to come back for a meal. The staff were excellent
Went just for a drink during the sunset time. Service was fast and professional and beverage offer good. This is one of the best places I ever had a drink. Views are unbeatable.
A must do.Its best to book before going otherwise you might have to queue,the view are amazing,the service was was lovely as was the food,it may be a little more expensive but so worth it.

We ate here for sunset and it was beautiful. The waiters were very attentive providing blankets and heaters to prevent a chill. It was very expensive with my chicken and potatoes main costing just under £20 and my partners lamb shank costing £30 but it was a special occasion so we were treating ourselves. I just felt the food, although nice, was a bit underwhelming for the cost versus other meals we've eaten round Dubrovnik. So all in all we spent nearly £100 for a perfectly "nice" meal but felt we'd paid it for the view. 

Top tip - its 140kn per person return on the cable car but a uber is only 100kn each way without being squeezed into a glass box for a 3 minute journey!

Oh my God, this place is stunning, one of The Nicest places I've ever sat down to eat, the surroundings are just breathtaking, we initially went for a drink, but just could not leave after one, so had a few then ate a really tasty tuna salad, wife had Cesar salad. Staff was really warm and friendly, and too damn good looking. 😂 . Would have happily spent the week here looking down the mountain at the beautiful old city of Dubrovnik. Highly recommend this little slice of heaven.

We stopped in here whilst at the top of the cable car due to the rain and not being able to get the cable car back down until the storm passed. We were seated straight away and the waiters/waitresses couldn't do enough for you. A nice selection of food and drink and arrived quickly. Great views of the whole city from the restaurant.

Lovely restaurant. Didn't intend to go here as I thought it may be quite expensive but once we arrived we knew that we wanted to eat there. They were extremely hospitable and the food was delightful. The view was amazing and I would go back time and time again if I could.
We came here after using the cable car. Variety of drinks and the food was amazing- great lunch and homemade cakes. Its a must!

After a day sunning ourselves in Dubrovnik, we walked up the steps from the Ploce Gate and took the cable car to the Panorama Restaurant at the top of the Srd. I must say that I think more should be made of this restaurant - the views are stunning, the food was good and the staff were very friendly. The only downside (the restaurant may be a victim of its own success) was having to wait half an hour for a seat.
As it is atop a mountain, blankets and heaters are laid out later in the day.
In all seriousness, even if you only go for a coffee, the views alone are worth it...

We enjoyed lunch here which was well cooked and beautifully presented . The view and cool air was such a lovely break from the humidity and although the dishes are expensive, it's worth it just for the view and respite from the heat in Summer.

I was a bit confusing even though we booked well in advance and the fact that it started raining half way thru dinner didn't help the experience either. Not their fault I know but eating the rest of your expensive dinner in a cafeteria style room wasn't that great for what you pay. Will I go again, even IF the weather was great - most probably not sorry.

This restaurant provides an incredible view of Dubrovnik, which is primarily what you’ll pay for. My husband and I rode the cable car to the mountain top in the early evening, and ended up staying for dinner to watch the sunset. We ordered the octopus carpaccio, lasagna bolognese, and another pasta dish. Everything was fine, but not wowing. But the view made it a beautiful and unique dining experience.

A special meal to reflect a special occasion should have 3 things; good food, good company and a good location. 

Two are within control of the Panorama restaurant and two they pull off. 

The food is good, not amazing if you’ve eaten in New York, London or Chicago but it’s well done and not over complicated and pretentious. It’s simple well made food. 

Considering the location it could come at a high price but it’s not. Make no mistake this is not cheap but you won’t feel cheated.

The only off thing was the desert. A frozen cheesecake with a soggy bottom let down an otherwise great dinner.

The staff could do with scrubbing up on recommendations and wine suggestions. 

Then there is the view...you feel like true royalty overlooking a kingdom and the view justifies the price alone. There are not many cities in the world you can eat over and Dubrovnik is a city to truly feast both eyes and belly on.

Obviously fantastic location. But all the seating is well placed, I don’t want to sit near the edge🙀. Relaxed atmosphere. We didn’t eat but we did have a few cocktails very nice indeed. The staff were very nice, friendly and helpful. You get a voucher for 10% off next visit too. It’s a must do when in Dubrovnik!

Remember to book in advance, by two weeks for the best seats, a week for 2nd row seats. 
Sadly some people reserved the best seats then ignored the sunset! 
When busy the service is abysmal, waiters often ignoring eye contact to avoid having another job to do. Drinks would take over 30m
to arrive. We got ours 45mins into
Service. But - the food was great, waiters knowledgable, and views to die for!
We had a table at 18:00 knowing the sunset was 18:45. I had the chef's recommendation - a £26 236g pork chop cooked to perfection. I advise ordering more drinks when the ones you want arrive. Or getting a bottle of wine :-) total bill around 1000kuna for two with sparkling rose cava and starters.

We just had drinks here but for the location the prices was reasonable
There seem to be a good menu and a good selection 
Would be a stunning place at nightime

We came without a booking as we just wanted to have a few drinks at sunset. They were well organised at moving people through the tables so that everyone got a chance to sit and enjoy the view. The service was efficient and friendly. If you want to have a meal I would highly recommend that you book ahead and request a table with a view of Dubrovnik. Some tables have views to the mountains. Even if you can't get a table, they will serve drinks while you stand in the area just next to the restaurant.

I'll state the obvious here but this restaurant has a totally unforgettable setting. The views across the coast, over the town - and the terraced layout of the outdoor seating are quite spectacular! 
I would also note from scanning other reviews on this place, that our experience may have been an exception - rather than the norm. 

We showed up on Saturday evening after the sunset, with no reservation - but the friendly host had us seated within 20mins. On our way down the terrace the staff were all welcoming and upbeat. We were seated and given blankets by a pretty and enthusiastic lady (who I noted did nothing more for the entire evening!) 

The waiter had brought us drinks as we waited for a table at the top, and then as we went to be seated we were told assertively "leave your drinks here, the waiter will bring them" (we had just hiked up 1mile of steep hill so were feeling a little attached to them!) 
So even though I thought better of it, we went down to our table and .... you guessed it, our drinks didn't materialise. Nor any chance to make an order for more, or food. My girlfriend had to ask twice before finally fresh drinks were brought over unapologetically.

I got the impression at this point that service MAY be a little bit relaxed!

When we finally got the chance to order food (after a few attempts to get attention!) our main dishes arrived promptly and we were not disappointed: I had the Beefsteak with potatoes and my girlfriend had the Lasagne Bolognese. Well presented, fresh and filling. 

The it went a bit wrong again. 

No one really offered us any chance to get more drinks, and we sat for ages after our mains. If only we had known to request the dessert menu as soon as our man arrived to clear our plates...... but no - we missed our chance!!

I had grown a beard by the time the guy came back, and my girlfriend looked somewhat browbeaten. 

He asked if we wanted desserts but we'd already made a pact that we just wanted to get out of there by that point. He seemed surprised and disappointed when we said no thanks!

(Quite strange... but payment was taken very efficiently)

On the way out, all the staff smiled and thanked us for coming. I felt a bit of a warm glow, and noted again how stunning the terraced seating looked. I looked over at the cheesecake that I had secretly lusted after.

We got the cable car back to the Old Town and got something sweet from the supermarket ;-)

We couldn't work out whether our waiter was just really busy, or whether he assumed we were just going to be happy and amused for hours because of the view. Either way, it was a little frustrating. Assertive customers will do better here, and don't rely on being "waited on".

Out of all the meals we had in Dubrovnik this was the most expensive. You literally are paying for the view. Its a nice touch with the heaters and blankets and beautiful views but lets be fair you go to the restaurant for the food.
I had the Octopus whilst my girlfriend had the Prawns. Octopus was ok without being spectacular whilst my girlfriends Prawns had loads of grit and a soggy bit of toast in it. All for a very expensive price plus the price per person to get up there on the cable car makes for a very expensive meal. Would not recommend personally. There are far better restaurants around

This was the most wonderful experience for my time in Dubrovnik.

Food was amazing, Soo tasty and not too long to wait.

Strawberry Daiquiri, the best ever....
Sat in the sun with spectacular views,
Truly amazing.

Highly recommended a visit..

Helpful very pleasant waiters..

This place has to bo on your "to-do" list for Dubrovnik. If you are looking for the spot with stunning view, the Panorama Restaurant is ideal for you. Located on the upper cable car station, at the top of the Srd Hill, the view that stretches from terrace on the historic city centre of majestic Dubrovnik, the Island of Lokrum and blue Adriatic is simply breath-taking. Panorama offers not only spectacular view but also friendly welcome to everyone who is searching of a tasty meal with the jaw-dropping scenery. "The restaurant with the best view on the Adriatic coast" someone wrote... and it really is!!!

I have been there 2 times in 3 days
Gorgeous view 
Staff are very professionals, friendly and kind , this is the most common thing I can say for Croatia 
All the food we try is fresh and delicious 
You can go with your children too 
Don't miss out

The food here is excellent but very expensive. What you are paying for is the view for dinner which is just incredible. We went up and queued for a table. It was only 30mins for sunset. They gave us blankets and the service was extremely good. They also serve The Botanist gin!!!

We were here last year and for sure wanted to visit again . This restaurant is at the top of the cable car location . Views are spectacular! Drinks are a bit more expensive than other restaurants but the view is well worth the up charge . Even if you font eat here , stop for a drink and soak in the view .

The staff was incredibly friendly. I made a reservation a month prior. We had a seat overlooking all of Dubrovnik at 6:00 and it was lovely. The food was good too. The entire experience - heating lamps, blankets, good food and the view made it an amazing night.

We visited the restaurant last year and were so impressed that my other half chose to visit again for our engagement.
Firstly, the view here is absolutely spectacular. If you are able to get a seat by the edge (and don't have Vertigo!) make sure you DO, and if you can go for sunset then even better!
The staff here are very friendly and attentive, and helped us with food and drink recommendations.
I had the lasagne for my main followed by the cheesecake for dessert, both of which were beautifully presented and tasted gorgeous.
The service is lovely, and they even come around and offer you a blanket once the sun is setting to ensure you are comfortable and warm!
Also, if you are partial to a cocktail (which I certainly am) then their Cosmopolitans are fabulous..!
We will definitely be visiting again, a very special place for us both now.
This restaurant offers stunning views of the old town, there is a varied menu that caters to most tastes. We had lunch here and found the staff very pleasant with helpful suggestions.
Great food, drinks, view and service. Cafe restaurant but of a great standard with good staff. Arrived at 10am for coffee and waited untill 11am for restaurant to open. Well worth it
The Panorama Restaurant has the most spectacular view of Dubrovnik. The cakes are delicious. What a lovely way to spend an hour or two

Went here on our last night (Wed 13th Sept). It was fully booked when we phoned but with some help from our hotel, we manged to get a cancellation and what an amazing table - the first one in the front row - had a perfect view of the sunset. We arrived a little early so had a drink in the bar first. There was no feeling of being rushed even though they had queues of people enquiring about tables. Our food was all cooked beautifully. Service was perfect - not too pushy but enquiring if you needed anything and then let us get on with eating. They provided everyone with fleecy blankets as it got quite chilly once the sun went down. It wasn't cheap but considering the setting, service and high quality of the food, I felt it was value for money and would go again if I was ever in Dubrovnik

You can't get much better views than this. After a cable car ride to the top (or walk if you are up for it!) you have Nautika in front of you. We went for lunch and was a spectacle. Great views over the city and the food was pretty good too. High priced but to be expected for the location. Would recommend.

https://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g295371-d1116083-r525225317-Nautika_Restaurant-Dubrovnik_Dubrovnik_Neretva_County_Dalmatia.html#

This restaurant offers the most outstanding view we have ever been to! The sunset is breathtaking & attracts a lot of people up the cable car. We had a beautiful meal sitting outside- was coolish evening so heaters were on & blankets too if required!! Excellent waiter - very helpful with our wine selection & his local knowledge of the area.
This is definitely a must visit venue

We went to this restaurant tonight as it was our last night in Dubrovnik after getting married here a few days ago.
The view is beautiful but the good is amazing too and the staff could not help us enough definitely a must go to whole here!

Absolutely the best view I have ever experienced while dining, you can see all of the Old City and past the islands. 
I ordered the beef salad with rocket and parmesan, my brother ordered the BLT and chicken sandwich served with chips. No complaints about the food, however the permanent guests (wasps) were quite the fans of the sandwich. I mentioned this to the waiter in a comedic way and he discounted the meal by 10%. 
Service fantastic, waiter happy to chat and share information about the area. 

We will return when in the area next! 

I will review the cable car ride (necessary to reach the restaurant) in another review.

Spectacular view. Kitchen doesn't open til 11 so only beverages til then, but what a view! Adriatic coast and islands with Old Town and the rest of Dubrovnik spread out below. Service better than I would expect, even quick.

The best restaurant in Dubrovnik in my opinion. The views from the tables were stunning, just perfect for a late lunch with time to spare. The restaurant was clean, with very quick and excellent table service. The food and drink was very well priced and all tasted amazing. I cannot express how charming this establishment was. Would highly recommend!

Really lovely location, just next to the harbour outside of the city walls.

We booked here rather last minute and in hindsight we wish we had done more research as the restaurant seemed to cater for the big coach parties meaning that attention to detail and high standards were somewhat lacking.

The service was impeccable; however the food just wasn’t up to scratch; plain, greasy and lacking in flavour which wasn’t altogether surprising given the food (sea bass and chicken) arrived within 5 mins of ordering suggesting it wasn’t cooked to order.

We wouldn’t return and we won’t be recommending to friends.

We booked about a week in advance to secure a table right at the edge of the restaurant overlooking the old town. We were there for dinner, and the food and service were first class. Attention to detail was exceptional, including blankets on the chairs for when it got a bit cooler. The sun setting over the nearby islands was an added bonus. Do get there early to visit the Homeland War Museum located in the Napoleonic Fort at the top of the Chair Lift

After a trip on the cable cars you will not be disappointed at the top, the views are stunning! 

We had booked a table in advance (highly advise this as a lot of people were turned away) 

Before the meal we had a few drinks in the outside bar which offer views of Dubrovnik. Our table for the meal was right on the cliff edge, I would recommend booking a table just before sunset so you can watch it whilst you have your meal.

The food was amazing and yes it was a little expensive but you're also paying for the view.

We weren't rushed through the meal and had a very enjoyable evening, anyone who is staying in Dubrovnik must put this place on their to do list. I will be returning!

I can't quite put my finger on what I didn't like here. 

Surroundings: we had a central table but was moved to a window seat when one became available. It was a dark / windy / raining evening and where we sat we could see that much of the Old Town, however I would think a day time view was better. The atmosphere was just very strange. 

The starter was lovely, but the mains let the meal down. Just didn't do it for me. I wasn't excited by the food and didn't come away thinking "oh that was really nice". Potato mousse - mash. 

Friendly staff. 

Location a fair hike if cable car not working.

I had read many reviews before deciding to book a sunset meal at Panorama. With the mixed reviews we decided to go ahead and we are delighted that we did.

A few weeks before going I made my reservation by email and the correspondence with the restaurant throughout was excellent. I also re-confirmed on the day.

Our plan was to go up and down the mountain using the cable car (140KN each), visit the War Museum at the top, enjoy the daylight views and sit down to watch sunset and the lights of the city come on.

We did not bargain for the delay getting on a cable car as ticket holders took priority. So you should buy tickets in advance to "skip" the queue. This meant that we had to skip the museum which was a pity and we were ready to sit slightly early. We were informed that we would have a short wait for our table and we were soon shown to our spectacular seats. I a sure this was due to pre-booking and good communication. We had huge grins as we sat delighted with our fabulous seats with the most wonderful views.

We both had very nice starters, my wife the delicious local ham and I had a carpaccio of beef. My wife then had a nice spinach lasagne and I had squid.

Service was very pleasant throughout and whilst I found the buzzer we were given to call our waiter a strange practice, I liked that we were basically left alone to enjoy each others company, the food and of course the views.

The prices - yes it is expensive. We paid 800 kn which included a decent bottle of wine and two courses each. We did not go for most expensive items on the menu. The food was good without being fantastic, but in all it is well worth it for the view and experience.

If you want to spoil yourself or a loved one then go for it!

My tip: don't be lazy, don't use the cable car. Use the walking trail to scale the fort on the top of the mountain. 20 turns, each single one is a beautiful place to take pictures of the amazing land- and seascape. Around 350 height meters, the track will challenge you. In the end the look compensates you for all strains. Take a seat and enjoy your drink , your lunch, or dinner. This view you will never forget.

From the minute I booked the table the restaurant have kept in contact. Arranging a birthday cake for my friend and making sure we had a good seat. 

We arrived just as the sun was setting and it was absolutely stunning. The staff were extremely attentive making sure we had blankets and heaters for when the evening got chilly.

Great selection of food and everyone ordered different things. 
Lovely cocktails and even a bottle on the house for the birthday girl.
