Had such a fantastic evening cannot recommend this restaurant more highly. Thank you all

You can't beat the view, it is spectacular. My wife and I had a front row seat for the sunset, which was magical. However, it's a shame the restaurant doesn't match the view. My wife and I shared a Croatian meat and olive platter to start, she had the chicken rustica and I had the lasagne. 
My food was luke warm at best and my wife didn't rate her's either. The service was also reliant on you pressing a buzzer to get their attention, which felt like you were imposing on their work. 
Finally, within 2-3 hours of eating here we were both ill with vomiting and stomach cramps. Although, I can't say it was definitely something we ate here, it seems odd that this is the only place where we ate the same dish and more or less simultaneously got taken ill. I wouldn't wish that on anyone.

Even if you don't fancy something to eat, it is worth the cable car ticket just to get to see the view from the top. 
The cable car cost about 140 kuna per person, the station is just outside the city walls at the top of town. There's a bit of a queue to get into one at the bottom. 

Panorama restaurant was delightful. If you want a seat by the edge (with the best view) make sure to book ahead of time and reserve a table! They provide blankets and heaters as the aid can pick up there. The atmosphere is wonderful, as was the food. We had a light lunch, the club sandwich and the steak sandwich. Both were very tasty. 

The view of Dubrovnik from the edge is just lovely and the sea stretches as far as the eye can see, from the other side you can see mountains which I am assuming is Montenegro.

I came to Panorama with three friends and we had a wonderful two course dinner. I specifically booked a table for sunset so we could make the most of the views of old town and the coast (mind you I did this 3 weeks in advance of our holiday). 

It was worth the cost of getting up the mountain (we had hiked earlier in the day so opted for a taxi). The food was delicious, I had the prawn and courgette risotto, one had the seabass and two of them had the ham and cheese tortellini (I was quite jealous as the cheesy sauce was to die for!). Three of us then had a scrummy cake for desert. 

The staff where friendly and attentive from the online booking (email response was very quick) through to the service and sining of happy birthday on the night :)

I would highly recommend a visit to Panorama anytime of day for lunch, dinner or just drinks!

We booked our table for 8:30pm (around 3 weeks in advance after reading reviews) and so glad we did. Managed to get spectacular views of Old Town on the way up in the cable car, see the amazing sunset, and then dinner with an amazing view of Pile light up at night - stunning. Was quite cold after sunset (due to the wind) so maybe take a jacket. They also have blankets available. The food was only a little more expensive than other places we'd visited in Dubrovnik. We got the grilled beef steak and chicken rustica - both were delicious and well worth the price given the quality as well as the view. Staff were lovely and spoke excellent English. Only downside was the length of time we were left waiting with empty plates after we'd finished our meal - planned on getting dessert but didn't as the cable car back to Old Town closed at 10pm and we were concerned we wouldn't make it in time. Overall we had a great experience and would highly recommend!
We had booked in advance and had a front view table. The view was spectacular and we were there for sunset. Food was good and atmosphere was relaxed. Worth a visit!

We only had coffee as we got to the cable car early to miss the crowds that will always be attracted to this restaurant due to the splendid views it offers of the city below and the surrounding coastline! The coffee is good but the views are stunning, get there early and it really is a pleasant experience!
Didn't have any food but the menu sounded delicious - we did have a fair few cocktails though and they were lovely. Fantastic scenery and views, great service too - well worth heading up to!

And amazing staff. Run under the same umbrella as Nautika - they must have the best customer service training ever!

I had the steak sandwich and my husband had the club sandwich followed by chocolate and walnut cake to share. All was devoured swiftly....

Great views over Dubrovnik - been before and would go again!

Usually you find little out of the way restaurants in crowded old cities. That option seemed to sparse during our morning in Dubrovnik. We choose, instead, to head up the cable car for an overview of the old city and hoped to get a snack. We found the panorama restaurant to be a great option. Burgers, sandwiches and fries joined risotto, steak and salads and good looking deserts to provide a complete set of dining opportunities. The accompanying photo shows the view that accompanies your meal. Good dining option.
Can't really put into words the marvel of this vista you must go and live this experience the cable car ride to get to the restaurant is a great experience in itself

A very expensive and pricey restaurant (we paid approx £50+ each for one course plus a drink and one side). The service was also quite slow and a let down, even more a let down after the price you pay for eating there so expected much better. 

However... the food was incredible and the views were out of this world. Extremely romantic and serene. It is a must to book far in advance and would highly recommend booking a table around sunset. If you don't book you will end up with 1hr plus wait on a table and will not be guaranteed a table with one of the best views. 

Blankets are provided if needs be... an added bonus to the place.
Excellent meal, not too much more expensive than rest of Dubrovnik. Book in advance as those who had not booked waited quite a while and can be cold after sunset. Could not fault the place.

Amazing trip up to Restaursnt by Cable Car stunning view of Dubrovnik old Ztown and Islands. 
Beautiful sunny day with slight Breeze. 
My 2 Year old Grandaughter thoroughly enjoyed the experience. 
Reccomend a visit. Food lovely, staff excellent.
Evening to remember.

Arrived at the top of Mount Srd a little after 1 pm. After taking in the sites of Old Town we stopped by Panorama for lunch and a drink. The host who took our name should look for another job. When asked about how long it would take to get a table for 4 he said with an attitude it could take 10 minutes or an hour. Eventually we were seated in about 15 minutes, not so bad without a reservation. Our waiter Roberto was entertaining and everyone like their meals and drinks.

After riding the cable car for the view we decided to stay to have dinner. The service to even get a table was appallingly. We were left standing at the door for over 15 minutes without any acknowledgement while the maitre de tried to sort a very demanding local that wanted the tables rearranged, even when she had to call the manager he didn't bother to acknowledge us or the many others that were waiting to be shown a table. When they allowed a customer to bring their dog into the restaurant, not a seeing eye dog, we decided that we would find a better place to eat. So pleased we did, check out my reviews for a far better recommendation

Went there for my 22nd Birthday meal and it was amazing, the views were beautiful, the food was delicious and the staff were lovely! Took pictures for us and service was fab ☺ you also have blankets on the tables to keep you warm if the wind is a bit nippy in the evenings but we were completely fine and in a nice sheltered part!

We has an early lunch here yesterday and I really didn't want to leave, it was so relaxing! Stunning views! and laid out with quality everywhere..... from the friendly professional waiters to the tables and furnishings. You even get a remote "call button" in case you want your waiters attention! Good coffee and Fruit Tea's. Excellent Burger, although my partner found here ham and cheese sandwich a little dry. They even bring round Blankets if a wind picks up. A truly memorable experience. Of course its a little more than average price but so is all of Dubrovnik ... what else would anyone expect? BRILLIANT RELAXED AMBIENCE!!

This restaurant was absolutely perfect for our anniversary meal. The food was delicious, we both had the risotto to start with which was huge and very filling. We then had the steak to follow which was cooked to perfection and the service was very friendly, attentive and perfectly timed. Not to forget the spectacular views over the beautiful city of Dubrovnik. Thanks for a fantastic night:-)

I want to give a big rap to the manager of the outdoor sections of the panorama restaurant at the top of the cable car ride for his outstanding ability to handle some spoilt badly behaved customers with courtesy, always genuinely smiling and to their satisfaction. A lesson on customer relations par excellence. Top job.

This restaurant was expensive - but worth splashing out for. Go for the location, not the food and you won't be disappointed.

The food was ok, nothing special. However, the breath-taking views, the experience of eating on top of a mountain and the excellent service made the experience a pleasant one. We made a request for a table at the edge of the terrace with a good view of the old town and got it despite arriving early. The waiting staff were very friendly and the food came fairly quickly. This was our most expensive meal of the holiday but we had expected that due to the location.
Such a beautiful restaurant- the staff were friendly and polite and the service was fast. A lovely place to stop and relax while in Dubrovnik

Hard to get reservations (need to book weeks out). So it you don't have a reservation, try lunch -- arrive early -- by noon if not before and try to get a table like we did. Everyone wants the "view": side thus the wait. We were seated in @ 15 minutes, great food, spectacular view and a "Must Do" from my standpoint if you are going to the top! It is probably incredibly beautiful at night. View it takes it form 4* to 5.

There are certain things you have to do on holiday. In Dubrovnik one of those activities is to take the Cable Car to view the Old Town in all its glory.

Do it. 

But unless you have a body part to sell one atop, avoid the restaurant. 

I'm fully aware that tourists are fair game in an area that has this as its primary industry - but this place takes the mickey with sky high (pun intended) prices. 

Avoid.

We arrived at the restaurant terrace outside at around 6 pm and were fortunate to get a table, albeit not at the front with views over the Old Town but with a view along the coastline. We were content with this as we hadn't made a booking. We ordered our drinks and food but within a short space of time it became very windy so much so we thought our food would soon go cold. We asked if we could possibly move inside (as it happens just as our food arrived). Without a blink of an eye 2 waiters moved our drinks and food inside to a table right at the front of a full length window with 180° views over the Old Town, coastline and with a superb view as the sun set - perfect. My husband had a fillet steak, cooked exactly how he liked and I enjoyed a very generous portion of beautifully cooked sea bass with vegetables. We then couldn't resist a delicious dessert and coffee. Our waiter was very helpful, friendly and efficient. A real treat after some disappointing eating experiences in the Old Town. It wasn't cheap but we felt it was worth it.

We had tried to book a table for our final night in dubrovnik, however we emailed too late and missed out. We went up the cable car around 6 to watch the sunset and asked at the restaurant about a table for later, told to return at that time. 
After the sunset when we returned to the restaurant they had reserved a table for us from a no show. And wow what a view. Looking down onto the old town with the bright coloured sky and the lights starting to shine below. 
The food was also great, my partner had octopus carpaccio to start and I had the tuna salad. The octopus was beautiful and we'll matched flavours. The tuna salad was massive as a starter and very well flavoured, for someone who loves dressing I didn't even need to add any. 
Mains were equally lovely, my partner having the chefs recommended which was beef cheeks and again amazing and clever flavour combinations, I had lamb shank which was tender and flavourful. 
Sure it's not a cheap meal, 2.5 courses each and a bottle of wine between us was 1000 kuna but you pay for good food and the experience. The staff were also attentive and respectful, and actually remembering and saving us a table shows the level of service they aim for.

We tried to reserve this restaurant for dinner but were told they were fully booked for lunch and dinner for the remainder of our stay. They did, however, say to come anyway as they always have cancellations and we'd be able to get a table after a short wait.

Cue a long line waiting for the cable car and disorganised queue for tickets which meant we lost the place we'd had in said line. We got to the top a good hour after we had started queuing. We then had another queue to the restaurant only to be told there were no tables and there was a waiting list of over sixty people in front of us and so no chance for dinner... Fine but obviously very frustrating to have wasted all that time waiting when we had been told by the restaurant to come up!

Views are great; personally not sure the time spent queuing to get up (and then a long queue to get down again) was worth it. 

Can't comment on the food but I did like their sister restaurant/cafe Dubravka 1836.

Fabulous views of Dubrovnik and the Adriatic and a lovely restaurant as well - book in advance as it can be busy but we were lucky to have the staff squeeze us into a slot - beautiful food and drinks but it is a touch on the expensive side - cable car up and down to round it off

The view is magnificent.
The positives end there. Staff were rude and the food/drinks are very expensive. (35kn for a coffee).
Expensive food is fair enough, but poor service is not.

Stunning views, amazing location, excellent food, lovely wine and superb service! 
A great evening ! Make sure you book in advance and request an outdoor table with a good view!
Came here for drinks in a sunny afternoon! The staff was helpful when I had questions and recommend a drink that I ended up loving. Would definitely recommend the BBC cocktail here.
At the top of the cable car, lovely little spot, with great views and good food. We had salad and wine. The desserts looked great! You may need to wait/queue for a table.

We had reservations for dinner at sunset. Took the cable car up and had a table right on the edge of the terrace on the top of the mountain. The food was pricey, which was expected, but unfortunately just OK. You definitely pay for the view!! The drink menu was very nice and service was good. The view was incredible and worth the trip but dinner was just average.
What an amazing view from here. We were lucky and had a table overlooking the old town and lokurn. Service was excellent, food was good but not really to my taste.

We stopped here after arriving on the cable car and although we only had drinks, we thoroughly enjoyed it. The tables are set at lots of different levels and all with that beautiful view and served by lovely staff. Had we had time, we would have loved to come back for dinner another day but sadly we didn't. Will definitely try next time. A must-do when in Dubrovnik!

It is at the best location to have the panoramic view of the city (as the name of the restaurant suggests) with the cable car in the picture, in a good day you can a beautiful sunset at the far right. Restaurant price isnt too bad and certainly cheaper than those many overpriced restaurants in the old town, and yet this is a trendy restaurant at the prime location. If you make a reservation you will have a chance of getting those tables overseeing the city. Food is decent and proper, service is very good imdeed. We had an excellent evening dining with family, relaxed and took many sunsey photos.

This is a terraced restaurant with views over Dubrovnik old town and the sea. Book a table if you want to ensure a table with a view. You can just have drinks but are less likely to get a table with a view if you do. 

The food is decent quality with a wide choice but is expensive for what it is - you pay for the view. And you will need to pay Kuna 140 for the cable car journey to get there of course. 

We were a little early but happy to wait and joined those who had not booked on a pleasant terrace BUT were not offered drinks nor were any forthcoming despite being eventually told we would be served some. 

Staff were friendly but seemed quite harassed due to large numbers of people waiting for tables. 

Generally pleasant and the views are excellent.
Tried to book a table here but it was full, and apparently it books up days in advance during the summer! Nevertheless- we visited for cocktails and they were incredible...as were the sunset views!

The real gem here is the view and so worth getting a table on the coast side. We sat in the centre so had a reasonable view of both the coast and inland. Lots of plinkie plonkie music in the background, by just helps add to the relaxing atmosphere.
Food comes at a premium so we settled for beer, light lunch and coffee. Simple, but tasty
Service was very good. They run a waiting list if they are busy

Think is a bit overpriced but the view on the top is amazing... you can reach the place by cable car or by car and is worth the trip with an amazing view over the old town... on the downside there are a lot of wasps that love to bother you exactly when the food reaches the table .... but that's life :)

Like most tourists we went to Panorama after going up with the cable car. Hostess was friendly and we got a table quickly. Ordered a lovely platter of octopus/ prawns and fish fillets all in a olive oil/ vinegar marinade. Also had a side salad. Food was most fresh, tasty and presented beautifully!!!! 
I would def go back there again.
Fantastic views over dubrovnik. Best to book for lunch for best seats at edge of cliff. Medioca food and service but worth a visit for the experience.
Good food but as to be expected it was very pricey but worth it for the view. We had a steak sandwich, side salad and chips with water and a beer it was 320 kuna.

On top of Mount Srd overlooking Dubrovnik this is a great spot for a restaurant. Good range of dishes from snacks to dinner menu. We waited for a table with a view and were not disappointed. However, 56 kuna for a pint is completely ridiculous, that's £7.50!!

A must go if you're in Dubrovnik! Head on there early to secure a table with a view (don't think you can book). 

If you're into ATV riding, the meet point is right next to the restaurant so plan ahead to save the cable car ride (costs about 140kn return)

This was our first time in Croatia and it will not be our last ! the people are welcoming, the scenery is a fairy tail, the food is incredible !

Panorama Restaurant & Bar offers an incredible view of the city, the wall around it, the fort, the ocean where all those magnificent ships sailed by as we enjoyed a delicious plate of local cheeses and cold cuts accompanied by an outstanding local white wine. 

We will be back !

Definitely a must when you go to Dubrovnik 
Book your cable car tickets in advance to avoid the queues. Try to get to the restaurant for sunset as views are breathtaking 
Food was excellent not one person in our party of 8 had a bad meal

After a rocky start (they had no record of our reservation), we sat at a table just next to the cliff, overlooking the old city. We were told that we had 2 hours to eat, but it took over 20 minutes to order a drink. The best dish we tried was the Octopus which is served with crispy potatoes. Try the local Malvasia white wine, it was quite nice. Afterwards we took the cable car down just as night descended.
Excellent restaurant with great food and service. It has a beautiful view to Dubrovnik city and great atmosphere. I would highly recommend everybody to visit this great restaurant!

The drinks were great, the food was very tasty and the views are to die for. The service was also notably good, we were moved without request to seats with a better view when they became free and the waiting staff really seem to care about the quality of their service. 

I'd recommend going at night time in the summer, and you can request a blanket from the staff if you get a bit chilly!

Dubrovnik is a VERY expensive city. Something every visitor should do is take the cable car to the top of the mountain (400 m above sea level) that overlooks the city. There are amazing views. There is a restaurant, where you can enjoy, for a price, coffee, desserts, drinks, and meals. Service is somewhat slow and prices are on par with the touristy areas of cities like Rome, Florence, or Barcelona. We enjoyed relaxing with a (small) creme caramel and coffee, but some visitors might enjoy sitting on a wall with water and snacks they've purchased at a shop.

First, let's be clear...the view is amazing from the top of this hill. The restaurant has been able to capitalize on this and has an excellent location. 

We emailed for a reservation, but they were none available for the evening, so they advised we go to the restaurant to request a table on standby. We arrived and stood in line for about 15 minutes, upon which we were asked if we would like dinner or drinks. (Note: they will not allow you to be seated unless having dinner.) Since we wanted to have dinner, the hostess told us they ONLY had ONE table available. Also, we could ONLY have the table until 7PM, and it was currently 6PM. We took the offer, but after we were seated, the two couples behind us (who also did not have reservations) got better tables and were told they could have their tables until 7:45 and 8:15 respectively...mind you they were only seated 5 or so minutes behind us! The waiter who provided service was absolutely ... flat... no hospitality whatsoever. 

For dinner, we had the cheese tortellini and the beef tagliata. The food was certainly OK, but not at all up to par with the caliber that the restaurant claims. 

Ultimately, one should go here for the view. If you are seeking hospitality and excellent quality cuisine, I would recommend talking with locals who are able to recommend wonderful alternatives. We received excellent suggestions for our next night here that I cannot wait to try!

We took the cable car up and would have maybe regretted it a little bit if we didn't sit down for coffee and cake at this truly amazing restaurant. Nice atmosphere, music in the background - truly a place to lean back, take in the view and enjoy your vacation. 

A little pricy maybe. I think we paid around 30€ for two cakes, a large bottle of water and a large beer. But as I said, it was worth it and only taking the cable car up would have been a bit of a waste. 

It's hard to get a reservation. Just go there as a walk-in guest. We waited around 10 minutes to be seated, which gives you enough time to take a couple of pictures.

We had taken the cable car and wandered around the museum, and decided to get some drinks at the Panorama before taking the cable car back to the Old Town. 

The Panorama is the only restaurant available at the upper cable car station. It's an outside based restaurant with parasols.

When we arrived, there were staff 'guarding' the entrance. When we said we just wanted drinks, we were treated as though we were an inconvenience. Although the restaurant was quite busy, there were a number of tables available. We were given a table, ordered our drinks, and waited. 

After about 10 minutes, a waitress came over and told us that we were no longer going to be sitting there, as it was a "table for 4" and "you have to sit somewhere else, as this table is only free for an hour". Despite insisting we were only having drinks and then leaving, we were told we had to move to a table at the other end of the restaurant as "it will be better, as it is for two people". It then took an extremely long time for our drinks to be served.

The experience was unwelcoming and quite rude. It would have been better if we'd been asked to wait, rather than be moved from table to table. 

Although the views from the restaurant are lovely, it was spoiled by the staff.

We tried to book earlier in the week for the side of the restaurant with the views but it was too busy so we rebooked later in the week. Anika was so kind when I emailed to double check that our reservation was all ok. 
The service was outstanding and we were seated just in time for the sunset which was incredible! 
Anika went above and beyond to make that meal so special for us and our waiter Martin was very knowledgable about all the dishes and able to advise. From start to finish we were saying just how amazing the whole experience was. 
We had lots of really yummy fresh bread brought to us complimentary and when it began to get a bit cooler we had a blanket brought out to too! This was the most special meal that we have had and we wouldn't change a thing about it. 
We will definitely visit again! 
We actually used uber to go up and down the mountain the second time as it was cheaper - that would be my tip but that was only because we had experienced the cable car earlier in the week. 
Thank you so much for such a special evening - one we will remember forever
Perfect restaurant for a summer dinner. Perfect view, excellent food and service 11/10 would always come back.

We got up to the top late and had to decide to ride down or eat in the Panorama Restaurant. We were skeptical as many such places are much more known for the view than the food BUT I had one of the best meals on our trip. It was also the only restaurant that served a warm Octopus dish (most only serve it as a cold salad). My wife also enjoyed her meal and the service staff was excellent. If I did not have to pay/wait in line to ride to the top, I would have gone back. It is quicker to get a table inside than outside and we ate inside. In our case, the women seating outside was really slow to receive or even acknowledge the people on the line before us so we gave up after ten minutes during which time she sat 1 table so we went inside and where hosted by an excellent wait staff (which also made for a great meal).
Lovely cool view, stunning relaxing vibe with excellent food and service. Truly memorable and a brilliant family event!

After a cable ride you can relax and enjoy the panoramic view in breath taking maybe the best a resturant can offer workd wide. 
We had coffee and snack good preparation and quick service. btw try and make advance reservations as they are full.
Also maybe the only resturant world wide to hand out blankets to patrons when it gets chilly and windy !

When were were seated - there were several open tables along the rails. We we told we couldnt have those if not ordering food - so sat in the middle of the verandah. The waiter asked us if we would prefer a table with a view and moved us. Don't get management sometimes! The view is spectacular- nice place to sit and have a drink!

This is our third time we have been to this restaurant, we make at least one visit per trip to Dubrovnik. We have not been disappointed. 
The view speaks for itself....stunning. We always find that the photo's really do not show the full beauty of the view, in comparison to when you are up there in person. 
The food in the restaurant is simply delicious, they have a variety of seafood, meat and vegetarian options. Everything we have tried has been superb. My personal favourite is the Prawns in a tomato sauce with garlic bread, a must try if you like seafood.
My main reason for writing this review is the staff, we have had Roberto the last two times we have been and he remembered us and that we were coming here for a wedding. The little details really made us fell welcome again. He was welcoming, friendly and knowledgeable about the food and wines. Nothing was too much trouble, he was really attentive with topping up our glasses and replacing cutlery, napkins etc. He really did make our last visit there something special. 
Thank you Roberto and thank you to Panorama restaurant for the continuous excellent experience.
Good views and it all works pretty well. 100 Kuna for a beer and a bitter lemon was the most we paid anywhere in Dubrovnik - but I think waiter ripped us off when we said we would pay cash

We visited the Panorama restaurant for drinks and were given seats in the bar area as tables were reserved for customers who were eating. This was fair enough and we were very happy sitting on high bar stools with our own private table as we could still get a great view of the Old Town below. 
This restaurant is upmarket but not pretentious , has a relaxing atmosphere and the staff and managers were very pleasant and welcoming . We had expected a long queue as had read in other reviews but we walked straight in and were seated straightaway. 
Yes the drinks prices are ever so slightly more expensive than the Old Town but what's a few extra kuna when the surroundings are this beautiful ? 
Treat yourself!

Stopped off for a snack after getting the Cable car,was disappointed that they did not have anything breakfasty so settled for the cheesecake which was excellent-my son had the ice cream-as usual in Croatia the coffee is very strong.Lovely setting,excellent service-we sat inside to take advantage of the air conditioning.

There's no denying that the views from this restaurant are fantastic, but you certainly pay for it! We had been on the cable car and decided to take advantage of the scenery up the top. We ordered two cocktails which were really expensive. It would have been okay if they had been strong but they really weren't. Paying so much for fruit juice is not ideal. The staff were nice and friendly.
Very enjoyable lunch sensational view absolutely breathtaking. and very good view a must place to eat when in Dubrovnik. Prawn dish with garlic bread excellent.

We made reservations for 6:30pm to have dinner while watching the sunset. They accepted our reservations but asked that we vacate by 8:45pm. I loved the communication.

We arrived to find the restaurant busy with people waiting to be seated. They had our table ready and we were on the front row as requested. The food was delicious, better than expected. The views and atmosphere could not have been better. I was a hero to my family for planning such a wonderful dinner. 

After dinner around 8:15pm we left to walk around the corner on the other side of the cable car to watch the best sunset of our lives.
Lovely surroundings with gentle music and attentive, friendly staff. The star of the show was however the unrivalled views of Dubrovnik Old Town from Mount Srd.

Ofcourse the location of this restaurant is stunning. You can see all over Dubrovnik and it's really gorgeous.
The restaurant itself, well, for us that was a little bit less impressive. The staff was friendly but the food was not nice, but really expensive.
If you get the chance: Grab a drink at this wonderful location but think twice before you order something to eat.
I ate there 2 nights ago. Stringly recommend it!! Beautiful setting and breathtaking view!! Staff is amazing, tentative.
My wife and I had a very enjoyable dinner here recently, if you want a cliff edge table with uninterrupted views of the old town it is imperative you book in advance and you will not regret it.

Took the cable car about 6.45pm. Beautiful, stunning views of the city and the sun going down. Hadn't booked a table but thought we would have a drink in the terrace bar area. Again stunning views. We asked if there was any chance of a table and were put on the waiting list. 10 minutes later we were sat down watching the sun setting. We had a great view and the staff were so accommodating and friendly, especially with everyone asking to take pictures, which they did without hesitation. The food was delicious, as was the wine. This was such a romantic setting and I would recommend it to anyone going to Dubrovnik. Amazing!

We visited just before 6pm in August. What annoyed me was the lady (blonde hair) at the desk seating people told us that we were unable to sit down as we only wanted drinks and that we needed a reservation and that they were only seating people for dinner. We had a few drinks at the 'bar' area, with a few high tables. This turned out to be ok as we could take photos of the view.

However, a new lady (brown hair) started working at the desk and was allowing groups without a reservation and for drinks only to sit down. I did not think this is fair - one rule for all please! 

Be prepared to pay over the top for the drinks/food and book in advance If you want a table on the edge.

Fantastic views and setting - a must even if you just have a drink. 

Our waiter was very friendly and offered to take a photo of us both with the view.

The only thing that tarred it for me was being told we were unable to get a table and then hearing others being able to - be consistent!

We arrived by cable car before 7:00pm. We had tagliatelle with lamb, King Prawn Panoramic Style and two glasses of Zlatina. The sun was setting on our table. We were enjoying our dinner overseeing the old town of Dubrovnik. The experience was great.

Outstanding view, good food and perfect service. Martin our waiter was very kind and attentive all the time. He recommended a special local wine and good dishes. The hostess was nice and got us a table for a large group with an amazing view. Good place to et and chill out with a good wine.

We visited panorama for dinner on our holiday to dubrovnik! We had a bit of confusion with booking the table via email but managed in the end and requested to sit at the front of the decking for the view which was so worth it as was spectacular view! Our waiter was extremely friendly and kindly explained to us the different wines and where they were from and what they were like which was very helpful of him. To start we had a mozzarella and tomato salad and a ravioli which was with cheese and ham in a cream sauce. Both were delicious. The mozzarella was lovely and creamy and the pasta was wonderful! Then we had the special which was beef and I also had the steak. Again both were delicious and all the sides were lovely also. We assumed that this place food wouldn't be great as could sell itself on the view alone but we were so wrong as it was probably our best food in Dubrovnik! Additionally our waiter was extremely good and attentive! Would highly recommend! We walked up to the cable car though and would say that in clothes for dinner was a bit hot!!

Service was excellent. We spent several hours here eating and drinking. 
Try get a table next to the wall for the view. 
Cocktails were the best I had in Dubrovnik. It was good value for money. The cable car up to the restaurant is worth it.

The photos do not do this restaurant justice, if you want lunch with a view this is the only restaurant in dubrovnik to visit! Amazing views which we did not have to wait long to be seated for. The food was tasty, with the restaurant having lots to offer for our lunch. The menu is slightly more expensive than other places we ate, but for the view it is worth it.
The service was excellent, and once i mentioned it was my birthday our waiter brought over two complimentary aperitifs which was a nice touch!

We didn't know at the time that the cable car goes right to the restaurant so we drove but my goodness....what a stunning place to eat. 
The food was incredible, I had the panorama king prawns. Yummy!
There's also some kind of ruin up there but we didn't get to look as it was 47 degrees!
Worth every penny

We came here on our last night and it was a perfect end to an amazing holiday. We didn't book but the waiters were keen to help us and after a short wait managed to accommodate us. 
Both food and drinks were good and they happily accommodated our vegan and vegetarian requests. While we finished up our meals they even offered to move our table to one where we could see the views and finish off our drinks.
Couldn't recommend this place any more, must go, just make sure you book!

Anyone visiting Dubrovnik must take the cable car and visit this restaurant,make sure you book a table on the edge and be there during the Sun Set.The staff excellent the food delicious and the view of the Sunset utterly memorable.

The view is phenomenal, the food was very good. The service was also very good. The rib eye steak was very good. The rosemary potato was excellent. Deserts were average.
I would recommend this place, mainly for the view!

This was a very nice place to have dinner: exquisite cuisine and gorgeous view. I would recommend booking a table with view ahead of time. For 2 ppl, with 2 cocktails, 1 starter, 2 main courses and 2 bottles of water we paid about 128 US dollars. We felt this was very reasonable pricing considering the quality, location and view.

We came to Panorama restaurant for a quick snack and a drink, since we had dinner reservations downtown. We ordered olives, mushrooms and some drinks. My boyfriend and I were the only ones who took fresh orange juice. 
The view is fantastic but more can be expected from both service and quality. Once we got our order we asked for the bill so we could pay pretty quick and wouldn't be late for our dinner reservation. The waiter said "I will give you some time first". There were lots of people at the restaurant so when we had finished our drinks and food we still had not seen the bill and it took a long time to get it. We were late for our dinner downtown. So next time, please let the guests have the bill if asked for.
And upon that my boyfriend and I were food poisoned and had to stay in bed our last day in Dubrovnik. It was the worst pood poisoning I've ever had. After a week I still felt nauseas and couldn't eat normally.
We were a party of 6 people travelling, and we ate the same thing all of us the whole day, except the orange juice at Panorama Restaurant. So there is no question where the food poisoning came from. Probably a dirty cutting board, which is not at all tolerable at this kind of place with these prices. One orange juice was 49 Kn, not the cheapest juice in town, and still this happened. We will NEVER go back and will tell all our friends to never go there. NOT OK!!
We had a terrace top table overlooking Dubrobnik with a lovely waiter who was very friendly. Cost of two local beers with the best view was good value

Panorama is a great spot for either a first night or final meal in Dubrovnik. The view is fantastic but the food was okay - the lunch menu looked more appetizing than the dinner menu. We had our 5 year old daughter with us - luckily, dinner was on the early side for us so we were able to order her burger and fries. Otherwise, not much choice for kids. I can't really remember what I had - so, that is how unremarkable the food was. But, I give them an A+ for service. Accidentally, showed up on the wrong day for dinner reservation - it's a far way up, so I could t believe how stupid I was. However, they found a spot for us anyway even though they were booked.
We enjoyed a lovely meal here watching the sunset over the Old City. I had tropical cocktail & chicken, while my partner enjoyed Steak & beer.

Fabulous views, excellent service and lovingly prepared food.
Had a fabulous lunch here which we have all been raving about ever since.
I had a delicious steak sandwich, my partner had a fabulous tuna salad and my daughter tucked into a smashing club sandwich - the bill was very reasonable and we recommend to all

The best service in the city... Martin was the best waiter and suggested good wines and foods.. He was a really nice guy that gave us very nice tips. The food is very nice and the local wine excellent. Thanks martin

Amazing setting for a restaurant. You have to get the cable car up there, but it is definitely worth it. You literally feel like you are setting on the edge of a cliff. We had a great time there, and the service was friendly. Even though the place was busy, we weren't rushed and could enjoy the views for as long as we would like. 

Definitely recommend, but please book in advance.

This restaurant sits at the top of the hill overlooking the old city of Dubrovnik. You can get their by taking the cable car. You need to reserve early to get a seat at the edge of the cliff in the front row. The views are incredible and if you get it around sunset time, you will be treated to one of the great sunsets in the world. You would think with a location like this, they don't even have to churn out good food but the food is actually awesome!! This is a must go restaurant in Dubrovnik!

We had to book ahead for this restaurant but it was worth it as we had the most amazing view and were seated right at the front for dinner and watched the sunset. It is very expensive but the service and food were great. We wanted to have a special evening with great views and this ticked all the boxes for a lovely evening. Highly recommend a visit
A must do, very exspensive, but worth it, I booked 2 months in advance to get the best seat,food was good but,was not the best for the price.

Book ahead, we booked 2 months ahead and whilst there saw many turned away. We had the 6-8.45 sitting perfect as we saw the 8pm sunset. We were lucky enough to have a great table right on edge. 
Amazing amazing views !!!! Absolutely breathtaking scenery, lovely atmosphere in general. Waiters were lovely and was well priced, not as expensive as expected ! 
Very romantic, would recommend for couples, friends and families had a lovely atmosphere for all!! 
Definitely try a frozen cocktail !
The good thing about this place is you can go for coffees, drinks or Food. The most important is the amazing view of the town and the sea. Staff are quite friendly
Impressive view of Dubrovnik while eating good food. Come early to get a table with a view, or better yet, reserve one in advance.

The restaurant is located at the top of the cable car and has a monopoly for dining on the summit of mount Srdj. Despite that the food was very good and the service excellent. 
We tried to book by email a couple of days before our visit but were told that there were no vacancies; many restaurants would have left it at that but the Panarama emailed again to suggest us going a little earlier and asking at the entrance.
The staff at the restaurant were attentive, friendly and efficient, the food was very good.
The views from the restaurant are stunning, if you intend to dine there at sunset I suggest booking in p,entry of time, perhaps even before your holiday.

I had the squid and my wife had the sliced beef, both were wonderful. The view was the real reason to go to the restaurant and it did not disappoint. The waitstaff were great. Would definitely recommend to anyone going to Dubrovnik.

Arrived without a reservation but managed to get a table . Open air restaurant accessed by cable car with fantastic views of city and mountains. Served by Michael who knows what service is all about. We had a cheese plate to start which was just OK. Lasagna for main was just perfect . Wine cost more than normal but you have to pay for the view I guess . Shared cheese plate 2 lasagna and wine cost kn 675 , we would have stayed for more wine but it got very cold after dark despite the nice blankets provided .

Beautyful view and great service! Can strongly recommend it, but the food was not awesome but everything else make me too vote 4 of 5. We took a Uber taxi too the restaurant and that was cheaper than the cabel station for two person.
Nice restaurant with good food it a little expensive but the quality is good for a change we had beef which was cook perfectly to our requirements vegetables were roasted and potatoes great

Because of the great location I expected the food here to not be good and tourist trap prices. I was totally wrong. The food was great, prices were not sky high and it didnt feel like a trap at all. In addition, my friend and i had reached early, so we watched the sunset from this great vantage point. We even managed to get a great vegetarian lasagne here! The view of course is the best in all of dubrovnik - so try and get a reservation before going!

Good simple fare if you stick to simple. The fish soup is yummy. Club sandwich good for light fare. Great views going up and coming down in cable care. Not as great a surcharge as you might expect. Kristian our waiter was attentive and went out of his way. Try the Malvasia Tezoro wine he recommended. Light white crisp. Good meal. 👍🏽

The views are among the best I've seen, an incredible medieval City surrounded by the Adriatic is a must see. The service and attention to detail were perfect, the food was fresh and delicious, we just had a small lunch of seafood and drinks and spent maybe 2 hours just taking it all in.

Dubrovnik was hot that day and we thought the inside restaurant with solid glass on the very edge would be nicer, but reservations were needed so instead we eat outside which turned out to be great with the breeze and view. The tram up the mountain costs about 20-25 euros and was fast and easy. We will have to go back and spend a lot more time there.

We have rated at the Panorama 5 or 6 times and it is always fantastic. Nice selection on the menu , staff are always friendly, great wine selection and the views over dinner are breathtaking

You need to book unless you fancy a long wait and you need to leave time for the cable car ride up to it as this can also be very busy

This is not a cheap restaurant but not silly prices so we think it's good value

If you don't fancy the cable car trip you can get a cab from the old town up the mountain road which probably will take half an hour or so 

We also tried it for lunch this year and service is just as good as in the evening. It's a must for us every time we go !
We stopped for drinks as the restaurant was full - this would be an amazing location to eat. Stunning views and good service.

Had a lovely meal here at sunset and would highly recommend it. The views are amazing! Staff are very attentive. Food was really delicious, and wine/cocktails were great too. It's a bit pricey but worth it!

The views are one thing, and they are amazing here, but hands down the main thing that won us over at this restaurant was the service. After a small mix up with our reservation, the owner made sure we were looked after. The food is amazing, best steak in Europe, and the creme caramel is to die for. Every person working there had a smile on their face. It's nice to come to a restaurant that treat their customers so well. All in all we had a fantastic evening and will definitely be back next time.
This is the place to have lunch, a snack or a drink. We sat with bread, cheese and olives and beer and prosecco for at least 45 minutes admiring the view and enjoying the breezes,

Let's be honest from the start: you come here for the views and you pay for the views. Which is not to say the food, drinks or service are in any way lacking, but the prices on the menu are still as steep and breathtaking as the vista over Dubrovnik Old Town. They're worth it though: it's one of the most unforgettable settings I've ever dined in. The place operates as both a restaurant and bar, and you're asked whether you're there for food or drinks when you arrive and seated accordingly. The menu offers quite a range of food and drinks. I had the tortellini with Dalmatian ham and goat's cheese, which was very nice, and a frozen pina colada, which was refreshing but not the best I've ever had. The complimentary bread was very nice as well. My partner, mum and brother chose from the 'quick bites' menu (not what it was actually called; I can't remember now) and had a club sandwich, ham & cheese sandwich and cheeseburger, and while none of them complained about any of it, I didn't hear any rave reviews. With other drinks the total came to about €40 per person, and like I said, most of that was for the stunning location. Service was generally very good and very friendly, although the waitress who initially served us was rather unhelpful to me when I asked directions to the toilets (which are right up in the cable car station/upper restaurant building). The drive up to the restaurant is an experience in itself, with more than just sea views, although obviously you can take the cable car up from the town below as well (€20 return for adults).
The view is amazing, if you are in Dubrovnik you should go to see it. Food was also good, I can recommend. Book your table in beforehand, the place is very popular.

Relax lunch over looking the entire Dubrovnik. 
excellent food and service, not cheap but well worth, 
recommended!

I booked this restaurant as a birthday treat for my wife
From beginning to end it was wonderful 
I reserved over the internet and they reserved us a beautiful table overlooking the old city
Roberto was great the food was really good and good portions 
The wine was good and to top it off my wife got a birthday cake and sing song
You get what you pay for and it was memorable 
This is a must

We visited the panorama for a drink after driving up rather than taking the cable car. I'd recommend taking the cable car as the drive isn't for the faint hearted !!
It's well worth visiting for the superb views of the Dubrovnik coastline.
We didn't have anything to eat but the food that was being served looked nice.

The restaurant is accessed by the cable car. The views from the terrace are overlooking Dubrovnik town and the sea. Good choice of food, wines, beers, spirits and soft drinks to suit all tastes and nationalities. Service is good and friendly. If you want a table with a good vie, booking is essential.

My husband and I arrived by cable car at approximately 9.30pm after the crowds were starting to descend having viewed the sunset. We didn't have a reservation but the staff there were very accommodating and gave us a table without a view, as all the others tables had been reserved. It was windy so nobody was outside. After our main, we were kindly asked if we wanted to move near the window, to which we were delighted. We had the best seats in the house! The staff were very friendly, and the food was good. Well worth the price!

The food is good, but for the price you are paying for the view. Which is absolutely breath taking nonetheless! Would recommend for a quick drink but maybe not to eat as there is better food for half the price in other places. The staff were all fantastic and really accommodating however.

Located at the top of the cable car ride in a great location enjoying panoramic views. Subsequently very popular and there was a small queue to eat, but we were happy simply having a drink sat by the bar. Our two soft drinks cost 39 kuna each (about £9 in total) so you are clearly paying a hefty premium for the location, which may be considered worth it. The tables are under the cover of large shades and there was a welcome breeze. Unable to comment on the food, but it looked good. No toilets on site but there are free public toilets at the nearby cable car station.

My husband and I took the cable car to the top of the mountain. The views really were spectacular. We walked around and took some pictures, and wished we had wifi so we could connect with home. Yay! The restaurant had wifi! We stopped in about 11:00 a.m. and were seated immediately. We ordered a couple of iced coffees (delicious and refreshing) and enjoyed the wifi. Other people started to fill up the restaurant, so I suggested to my husband that we leave to free up the table. We paid the bill and left, but sat down below the restaurant to continue using the wifi. A minute later our waiter said, "No! Come back! You can stay here until 6:00 when we close!" I was very touched. A minute or two later, he brought us a liqueur on the house.

Caught the cable car up to catch the sunset and decided to have dinner so glad we did. We got great views great service and assistance plus great food. Our waiter Marijo was great and made us feel very welcome although we didn't have a booking or seated in prime spots we still managed to get some great photos and yummy food. Thanks very much.

I'm a low budget solo traveler but I decided to splurge just once at this restaurant and I really enjoyed it. I was alone but the waiter was very kind to me. Offered to take pictures of me and even gave me a free shot at the end.

Visited here at lunch time just to have a few drinks! Firstly the ladie at front of house was little bit rude but showed us to table not with the view I asked if a table became available on the edge if we could move and she said they were all reserved! The couple that got seated before us got given a table on the edge they took a few pictures then left then to my surprise the couple that came after us got seated on the table that was quite annoying as we already asked to be moved! I understand we were just having drinks but we probably would have stayed and had lunch but instead we finished our drinks and left! I probably would return but would definitely make reservation beforehand because the view did look spectacular!

Amazing cakes glass of wine and quiet 10 minutes enjoying in a exeptional sinset view
.... realllly worth going

Fantastic place for a lovely relaxing drink. Service was excellent with a great selection of drinks. Didn't have time to stay for dinner but the food looked good too. A must if you are visiting Dubrovnik, it's the best view of the city.

Fantastic views, great food and drink with superb staff. 
I booked my holiday in January, with the express intention of spending at least a part of my birthday sat on the outside terrace of this restaurant with a mojito in my hand and gazing down over Dubrovnik.
I did this and it was everything I could have wanted.

So glad we booked ahead. We arrived a little early, but ordered cocktails and our table was available ahead of time. Fantastic table, amusing waiter and great food. We had a mix of Seafood and Steak all of which were first class. I think this restaurant is one not to miss if you visit Dubrovnik. You can get to it by Taxi or the Cable Car. This was a special meal slightly more expensive than our average but well worth the money .
Very friendly and polite staff as always. Location is great. This is a must while you are in Dubrovnik even if you want just a cup of coffee. Views are amazing. Highly recommended!

Eight of us took the cable car to the top of Mount Srdj to watch the sunset and eat dinner at the Panorama Restaurant. We all agreed this was our finest meal in Croatia.
The setting is wonderful overlooking Dubrovnik.
The service was great and the wine was excellent but the real star of the show was the cuisine. My meat lasagne was outstanding and my wife loved her spinach lasagne. 
I am glad we visited this excellent Dubrovnik restaurant.

We only came up to the restaurant for a quick coffee and to enjoy the view - which is seriously unbelievable! 
Definitely worth a trip, we drove up and took a cable car down, which was awesome! 
Unbelievable photo ops over there

What a view! We arrived early evening as we had taken the cable car. It was too early for dinner and besides we had not booked but they arranged a table for the four of us to enjoy a sundowner. Will certainly arrange to book a table for dinner here if ever back in Dubrovnik. However I am to,d one needs to boom at least 3 to 4 days in advance. Ideally you want one of the front ocean facing tables to enjoy the best views.
This place offers great views of the city, very nice and very romantic place. Come late afternoon and enjoy the sunset with good food and wine.

We went 2nd week in June and got cable car about 10am. After the sightseeing we had no trouble getting a table with a great view. They happy for us to only order a drink. Attentive waiter, good beer and just perfect location. Get a 10 % off voucher given for sister restaurant or to use again here. A must when in Dubrovnik
Seemed unusually formal. Also expensive. Staff not helpful. Curious atmosphere, perhaps because they have got you! If you want to go here, I suggest you book a table on the edge, with a view.

As learnt this place is always full and thus we booked a table via email well advanced. Reply is prompt. We then made our visit ON FOOT. Yes, we hiked up there from the old town. Though the Imperial Trail is not clearly mark and starting somewhere at the highway but Google Map does its excellent job on this. We took about an hour on this trail and really nice walk. We are there with sweats but glad that arrived precisely for our booking of 6pm. Very glad that they arranged us a table at terrace with stunning view of old town and Adriatic Sea. It's really enjoyable especially while sun setting. 
We have drinks with a trio appetiser. All are nice and in fact you will feel everything is excellent with such a view. In addition, the service there is friendly and welcoming. 
Highly recommend but don't forget to make reservation in advance.

We hadn't intended to eat here as we'd just come up for a pre dinner drink but the setting was so perfect and the views were so spectacular that we couldn't go back down on the cable car before trying to get a table . As luck would have it there was just one left so we took it and didn't regret it. The food was very good , if a little overpriced but so is just about everywhere in Dubrovnik. But watching the sunset overlooking the old city was just perfect and made up for the meal price. The wine that the waiter recommended wnet perfectly with our sea bass and the complimentary dessert wine was superb . All in all a very very good night and I would recommend this as a special treat whilst in lovely dubrovnik

We ate here on a flying visit to Dubrovnik, after visiting the old city during the day, the city walls just before closing. We arrived at the restaurant at about 8pm, and it was about 3 quarters full. 

We joined the queue for a table and realised that everyone was being offered a choice: sit on the left side of the restaurant immediately, or wait for a table on the right side. The left side has a view into the countryside and mountains, the rights side a view of Dubrovnik, the old city, the sea and the sunset. Everyone in front of us chose to wait. We said we'd sit on the left, and we're seated straight away. The view of the mountains was still stunning. The service was not the best, it was quite slow but not unbearably so. Strange given the number of waiters and waitresses walking around not doing much. We ordered drinks (a glass of local white wine each) and food (octopus for me and sea bass for my partner). After waiting for our food for about 10 minutes, the waiter then told us that a table had become free on the right side of the restaurant, if we wanted to move. We accepted, and the waiter carried our drinks to the new table. Our food arrived shortly afterwards, which was tasty but nothing special, but equally nothing to complain about. We were quite happy eating, drinking, and watching the kaleidoscope of colours as the sun went down. 

One word of warning: it is not warm once the sun sets. You are on the top of a mountain, and even without wind the temperature drops quickly. We had been out all day so we're dressed in shorts and t-shirts. They do provide blankets if you're cold, but this did take a while after we asked. Bring a sweater (maybe even wear long trousers if you can change before visiting) and you'll be fine.

We thought twice about using this restaurant when in Dubrovnik for the day because as it is the only one at the top of the cable car we thought it might be very expensive. But we were hot and tired and it was lunchtime so we gave it a go. So glad we did. We had a short wait for a table and were initially given one with not such a good view but as soon as a better table was free we were asked if we wanted to move. The views are spectacular and the cooling breeze very welcome. We had steak sandwiches which were absolutely delicious. The staff were very attentive and pleasant.
If we had been staying in Dubrovnik I think we would have visited again for an evening meal. A lovely experience

Reserve a table in advance if you'd like a spot with a better view. Food is pricy but good. Location and ambience is romantic and you can see the sun set over the Adriatic with all of Dubrovnik while you sip your grappa.

The view is stunning, the food was lovely and the service impeccable! I would definitely recommend the lamb and strawberry cheesecake for dessert, both were very tasty! Would advise pre-booking a table before visiting and request a terrace view so you can sit outside

The view from this restaurant is amazing. You take the cable car up and the restaurant is right on the front. Lunch menu is until 6 so you can get great value until late. Food was very nice and great service. Highly recommend to book as it does get very busy.

I was here for my 50th birthday meal. Staff were fantastic and food fab also. But the views are out of this world. It's a cable car ride to get up to restaurant which takes around 3 mins. We booked table for 6:30 (and booking is recommended) we had table for 2 hrs, plenty of time to eat and watch the sunset. Amazing.

We only had a couple of drinks here so I can't comment on the food. The five stars reflects the amazing location of this restaurant. The views are incredible and it is a great place to relax with a drink and look out over the Old Town, the islands and the coastline. We visited in the late afternoon and many of the tables had evening reservations so worth booking especially if you want a meal here.

We had very low expectations given this is the only restaurant on the top of Mount Srd. But we were pleasantly surprised by the two beef dishes we ordered. The beef was tender and tasty. Service was a bit irratic but okay.

WE stumbled by Panorama Restaurant quite by accident. Of course we didn't accidentally ascend the cable car- rather we rejected the menu of the 'inside' restaurant as they were only offering main meals, not realising that this was exactly the same menu.... but with an added lunch pages! Phew! Of course, we were drawn in by the views and were amazed to find our edge-side seats also came with a fantastic cocktail menu and really great food.

Whilst our lunch only consisted of sandwiches, everything was absolutely spot on and the sandwiches were indeed some of the best. Perfectly toasted, great fresh ingredients, perfectly filling. Our waiter was lovely and recommended their sister restaurant which actually didn't even come close to our experience up in the Panoramic Restaurant.

I would highly recommend extending your experience of the stunning views form the top of the cable car by enjoying a spot of lunch with some of the best views i've ever eaten besides.

5 Points, the view is amazing, fans are keeping the guests cool and the portions are big, beautifully arranged and delicious. The staff is catering to your every need, before you even voice a wish they are already working to fulfill it. They made one little mistake with the orders and made up for it by sending us free dessert.

The food was pretty average and pricey! The view was great and it's the only place to visit once you reach the top from the cable car however the choices offered were not very vast and the food was not too great.

Stunning views, romantic, beautiful food a simple must do for your time in Dubrovnik you won't be disappointed! A little slow service but this time flies when gazing at the stunning views, sometimes you expect a place like this to lack in the food department but our meals were spot on

We arrived early, in advance of our booking and the staff bent over backwards to fit us in. Eventually giving us an indoor seat by the window (very welcome on a cool, windy evening).
The food was delicious and the cocktails were generous. As you might expect, you pay a premium for the views which, whilst being good of the old town, aren't as great for sunset as they could be. In my opinion, they built the restaurant on the wrong side of the cable car station.

We went up in the cable car at lunchtime but were able to get a very nice table without booking. The cable car was 130Kuna round trip for an adult and the views are stunning. The service was excellent and the the staff were friendly. we had a gin and tonic 72Kuna, a glass of dry rose wine 52Kuna and shared a sandwich (that was delicious) for 76Kuna. You can also get full meals or just tea and coffee.

I loved Panorama. The view, the breeze, the nice waiter, the food! Great night all around. My friends and I didn't have a reservation for the evening, but we were able to get a table. They apologized that it didn't have a view overlooking the city, but we didn't mind. However, after we ordered our wine they came over to us and said a reservation for a party of four didn't show up and that we could move to their table, which had the best view of Dubrovnik! The food was really delicious, the wine was as well. We loved having some kruskovac (pear liqueur) after our meal! It was delicious. Loved every minute of our time at Panorama! A must visit!

To get to Panorama you need to get a cable car up the mountain from just outside of Dubrovnik old town. My ticket cost 140 kuna (return). I'd heard lots about the view from this restaurant and I was not at all disappointed. The view was absolutely spectacular. You can see the entire city of Dubrovnik from the coast, the boats coming in and out, the neighbouring islands, the city walls surrounding the old town, the churches, simply everything. We went on a day where the sun was shining, it was 31 degrees Celsius, and,there was not a cloud in the sky. The water was glistening a deep blue- it was breathtaking! We had drinks because of table availability for dinner- i would recommend booking in advance if you want food. The service was mixed, out waiter couldn't do enough for us, but the staff who greeted us were not very professional. We were left waiting for ages and then two of the staff had an argument in front of us. Also, a family who seemed to know the staff well came in and had a dog with them who preceded to urinate in one of the plants. I personally would have been furious if i was eating dinner in such a romantic setting and saw this happen. Thankfully i was only having drinks as mentioned and was sat about 15meters away. The views alone,make this an essential stop in your Dubrovnik experience.

We went here on our first night of staying in Croatia, we phoned to try and book a table but they said they were fully booked, we decided to take the cable car up anyway to have a look at the view and managed to get a table luckily! Amazing views never eaten somewhere so beautiful before! The staff were all very chatty, friendly and helpful and the food was also brilliant! I would advise to book in advance if you want a table but would definately recommend!
Fantastic place to have lunch, good quality food very reasonable prices and a view to die for. Perfect afternoon excursion .

Me and five friends visited during the evening. They got us a table without reservation. We ordered desserts (cake) coffee which was excellent and cocktails made perfectly. This is absolutely a place to recomend with really friendly but reserved waiters and staff. If you consider eating here, go for it!

Spectacular view and very friendly host. A must do. 
We arrived by cable car on a tour. Had a fun 1 hour buggy ride.

This cafe is at the top of the cable car, overlooking Old Town Dubrovnik. The view is incredible! This is one of those places where it's worth sucking up the bad service and high tourist prices. Because it's worth it for the chance to keep gazing at the beautiful 180 degree view of Old Town.
Highly recommend this place for its incredible location - overlooking the city and the sea. And the food was pretty good as well. A bit overpriced, but still worth it.

Our Airbnb host booked us a table on top of the hill. It was our honeymoon and we had a superb table. The service was good and the food was exquisite. I think we paid more for the view than the food yet it's a must.

This restaurant is by far the best restaurant I've ever been to - you get a cable car up to it and the views are absolutely breath-taking! The food is delicious, the cocktails are great and the service is exceptional - it is a must when visiting Dubrovnik! Top tip: book a table well in advance!

I love this every minute. We reserved a outside table for two with a view just a say ahead and got it perfect. Stunning view, amazing customer service, great drinks, good food and even an affortable price! The best place in Dubrovnik. It was a littlebit windy but we got blankets and we found it very nice. A tip is to just take the gondole one way, and taxi back since we had to wait for a while when going down again since they dont go as often late in the night. Thank you for a great and romantic experience.

We arrived early for our reservation and thought we may have to stand in the bar area for a while, but as soon as our table was available we were seated. We had the most wonderful view at sunset on the terrace and watched the city light up below. I had presumed that the setting maybe compensation for standard food and was completely wrong. The food was excellent, our party of four had the beef pasta and steaks all of which were very hot and tasty. The service was very good too and all the staff were lovely. There is no pretence here, just good honest food and service. The cable car wasn't too busy and we only had to queue for around 10 minutes, but recommend you get there around half an hour before your dinner reservation so you can get some pictures at the top before dinner.

We arrived on cruise ship went up cable car for view and decided to try lunch. Once we were seated, it was a great experience. Service was great, we sat at 2 different tables, they tried to get us a better view. The food was good and the dingac wine is excellent for us, since we are used to Napa Cabernets.

The food and wait staff was excellent. Our waiter helped move our table to be closer to the window for the view of Dubrovnik. Interesting view of the cable cars passing the restaurant on their journey. The food is very reasonable. A great place to have a leisurely meal in Dubrovnik.

We did not book ahead but we got a table right away anyway. Attentive staff, great food and amazing scenery. This restaurant held a high level and was no more expensive than restaurants in the old town. Escape the heat in the old town and enjoy a nice breeze in a fantastic restaurant.
Beautiful place set up high. Food good not too expensive staff nice ONE critisn took 25 minutes and asking twice to get the bill
This restaurant is in my top 5 ! The food was really teasty, the staff very friendly, the view from the table is unbelivable!

Rude waiters and terrible food.. I had a risotto which had a hair in it and the shrimps were not de-veined. We ordered a table salad, which arrived with a hair in it too. 
This place is extremely over-rated.

We tried booking this restaurant by email and was told it was fully booked for the week ahead. We did the cable car ride and tried to make a booking in person...arranged without a problem! Why tell people by email it is fully booked, but then take bookings in person?
The food and service for the meal was excellent! The waiter was informative about the menu selections and also spent time explaining Croatian wine to us. 
Highly recommended if you can overcome the booking process. We ate at 7.30pm (rather than the later time of 9.00pm) and this ideal as we watched the superb panoramic view change from daylight to evening

Our time at the restaurant was great. I contacted the restaurant a moth or 2 before to books the desired seats we wanted which was organised with no complications. From start to finish it was great, communication was easy and response was fast. The meal was great, food was top quality and the views are the best views of Dubrovnik you can ask for. Waiter was very friendly and funny, they give out a ringer for each table to request the waiter to call to the table which was great. It was my girlfriends birthday and the took out 2 free birthday drinks for us :) Great experience.

We had lunch at Panorama after riding up in the cable car.. the views are outstanding! We booked a head of time and we're lucky to be seated at a table on the edge so had uninterrupted views.. the service was great as was the food... the waiter was very helpful when choosing the wine and our experience was fabulous over all... not cheap but well worth it

We were very lucky to get a table in the restaurant on a beautiful evening as the view down to Dubrovnik is amazing. The cable car takes you straight to the top of the hill and instantly you can appreciate the view, it is stunning. And if the view wasn't worth the trip alone then the food made it anyway...it was delicious and our waiter Roberto was the best .... knowledgable about the food and really good humoured. He made the whole experience so memorable. So don't leave it to chance make sure you book well in advance so will not regret it.

Made advance reservations for a Friday evening to eat on the terrace. The weather was not as good so we ended up eating in the interior of the Panorama Restaurant. When our bill came, we were surprised to learn that we were given a 10% discount due to the weather. Service and food were both excellent. I had octopus and my husband had the sea bass. Our bill was 431 kuna ($66USD) including a wine and beer. Excellent views of the Old City, Lapad Bay and the nearby islands. Need to take a cable car to the restaurant. Free wifi. Afterwards, we went outside the restaurant, took photos and watched the sunset.
Best location ever. On the top of the hill , reached by cable car. Amazing views. Delicious food Prices a bit higher than average , but worth . The sunset is a must go

Dined here on previous visits so only natural to go there for lunch on arrival in Dubrovnik. Food, view and staff are great - the ride up in the cable car sets you up for a memorable visit. Would recommend the octopus, huge portions. Also went for dinner, a first for us, to experience the view and ambiance at night and was not disappointed. This is a must for any visitor to Dubrovnik.

We ate here on our wedding anniversary, a surprise booking by our holiday companions before we left the UK.
You HAVE to eat here if you are in Dubrovnik just for the view alone- our dinner conversation was very stilted as all we could all do was to stare down at the amazing view, particularly as the sun started dropping and giving a whole different view of the city and the outlying islands. This place looks mega busy and you will definitely have to book. It's a lovely looking place with crisp white tablecloths placed on tables positioned on small terraces all over the top of the mountain. Our waiter was a lovely guy who entertained us and was totally professional- thanks for a lovely evening Mario!
The food was great overall- just a small minus from me that the Lambshank I had didn't fall apart as much as I would have liked- there wasn't anything wrong with it but could have done with another 30 mins in the pot!
But don't let this put you off, it's a special place to have a special meal and you shouldn't miss it.
I still think that the complimentary " firewater" that is given to us guys everywhere is an acquired taste - much preferred the one given to ladies, but I might be a bit of a whimp!
Getting there is really easy in the cable car and adds something even more special to the whole experience.

We ate here on a Monday and booked a table on be front row with the best views. Definitely book ahead of time as lots of people were turned away or given tables with no view. 
We were running late and rang the restaurant to let them know. They very kindly let us keep the table with a reduced time but that was fine by us and understandable. 
The view is stunning and the service was efficient and very friendly. We both ordered steak. My boyfriends was perfect but mine was very overdone. Can't complain with a view like that. 
Must do in Dubrovnik.

We visited here on our honeymoon as we'd been bought a meal here by my brother and his wife.

You take the cable car up, which for us wasn't a great experience due to the daft ticketing system/sweltering wait but this is unrelated to the restaurant itself.

We had a table booked on the edge overlooking Dubrovnik and the view really was absolutely spectacular. Tip - stay until after dark to catch the view of the city all lit up, just as impressive in its own right.

Our service from Roberto was top notch, he's certainly a character and added to the memorable nature of our stay.

Blankets were provided as the temperature turned cooler, which my wife enjoyed!

Thankfully in such a great setting the food didn't let the experience down. I had the beef tagliata (marinated for ten days apparently) and it was delicious, a lighter dish too as its essentially served with a lovely fresh salad. My wife had the beef pasta and also enjoyed her dish.

Desserts were very nice and pretty generous portions.

Bit of a mix up involving payment, as despite my brother booking and paying in advance with Anita, the restaurant had no record and we had to contact them in the UK. Thankfully this was resolved.

Given it's location the restaurant is also fairly reasonably priced.

Would absolutely recommend this to anybody going to Dubrovnik, the views alone would be worth it but cracking food and service too.

Went there for a light Lunch. The steak sandwich was delicious. The steak was beautifully cooked. Everything was amazing. Views are simply stunning. It must also be great at night. A well run operation which was really busy but with no long waits. Staff are really friendly and efficient. Prices are fine considering the location. A must do when visiting Dubrovnik.
Very good food and really good waiters! We sat inside by the window which was so cool! The room was a bit chilly though due to too much ac.

We havent'made a reservation but the time we arrived was late so immediately they gave us a table with a view.The food was delicious the coktails amazing and the stuff very kind.I found the prices logical because of the view service and the evnironment that the restaurant provides.

With the absolute most stunning setting of the City of Dubrovnik, this restaurant hit every note of excellent service and delicious food. It was very romantic for our night out on our honeymoon in the beautiful city. My husband had a ribeye steak that was so tender and cooked perfectly. I had the best lasagna bolognese that I have had in a long time! Well worth the price for and elegant meal. Did I mention the view? ;)
We visited this bar/restaurant for a drink and snack and it lived up to our expectations offering truly exceptional views over Dubrovnik. Recommended !
