First off get a table on the edge booked and go for dinner at sunset FANTASTIC. we did not book a table and the restaurant was very busy but the lovely staff managed to squeeze us in and we were very lucky to get the table we did. Order a bottle of wine order some nice food and sit back and take in the beautiful view as the sun goes down. Very romantic.

Just want to say a huge thank you to Roberto and the team on making our evening at Panorama the most enjoyable perfect night. My partner had emailed them prior to our holiday to say he was going to propose whilst in the restaurant and they put us in the most beautiful spot. From start to finish Roberto and the team couldn't of done enough for us. The food and drink was lovely and nothing was rushed or felt too much trouble for them. We couldn't be happier that such a special time took place in your restaurant. We had a beautiful sunset and was topped of by the cable car trip to and from the restaurant. We would definitely recommend to anyone and we will be sure to return in the near future!

We originally tried to get a dinner reservation but they didn't have any openings for several days so we decided to go for lunch instead and it was great! We got a table on the edge with fantastic views and flowers all around the table area. We had a light meal, but full meals are also available at lunch time. The waiter was very attentive and friendly and they don't rush you, so you can truly enjoy the experience and the view! We enjoyed our meal and the location very much. I would definitely recommend it!

Amazing view, fabulous staff and fab food. The menu is varied so you can have a full meal or light lunch. Local red wine that was recommended was lovely. 4 of us ate and had a variety of dishes and all were delicious. Did I mention the view??! Most definitely worth the trip up the cable car!!

This place is worth it for the view, but understandably not great value. Our food was very nice and we had a glass of Croatian sparkling wine each as the sun went down. My only complaint was that once our mains had been taken away, the waiter didn't come back, either to offer us the dessert menu OR the bill, for about half an hour. We could see him standing chatting to a table like he had no other customers to serve. Eventually I had my hand stuck right up in the air to try and get his attention and as he came to serve the table next to us and gave me what I guess he thought was a "cheeky" grin and said "They were first!", I'm afraid I finally had enough of his amateur attitude and told him quite bluntly we had waited a long time. He suddenly seemed to realise he had neglected us and did give us 10% off our bill, but it seems a shame to receive such unprofessional service in such an acclaimed restaurant.

We were lucky as a table of only 2 to turn up and get a space without booking - would strongly suggest that larger groups or those wanting a sea view / edge table book in advance!
Such an amazing view of the old town, you have to do this if you are in Dubrovnik. Have the carpaccio, it's well priced for the great location. Book in advance to get a seat with a view.

Whist up at the top, we called in her just for a cocktail.. well it was only 11.00am and we were not hungry.. The view is amazing if you are lucky to get a seat at the wall.. Would have loved to come back for an evening meal..
It was truely an exceptional experience to have dinner and cocktails with a view of old town and sunset.

We went at dinner and had to wait only about 15 minutes for table, but we were lacky, thank You for the waiters.
We highly recomend the place for people who enjoy quality food with breathtaking view.
Romantic place for couple and other visitors. Definetly a must restaurant when visiting at Dubrovnik.
Although it is maybe slighty expensive, meal and ticket for cable car, but really worth it.
Recomended to make reservatios both rastaurant and buy cable car ticket in advance in internet.
Roberto made the meal spectacular. The food (my wife had the Tuna Salad and I had the steak sandwich), was perfect to match the view. We'll definitely be back next trip to Dubrovnik!

We were granted the best table at Panorama Restaurant with a marvelous view to Dubrovnik. We also had blankets on our table that you'll find handy since we are more than 450m high. We had a great romantic dinner, octopus and beef, and our waiter Mario was very professional and kind. We were the last couple in the restaurant since we left at 23:50 to catch the last cablecar. Great escape from busy Dubrovnik.

Definitely recommend booking a table here, preferably on the edge overlooking the Old Town. The service was brilliant and as we were celebrating a birthday, we received a complimentary dessert which was a nice touch. I thought the food was reasonably priced given the amazing views and I'd absolutely return if I ever visited Dubrovnik again. The sandwiches were very tasty, the salad had a generous amount of meat, and the cocktails were a great way to finish off the meal!
Just had drinks on the deck. Very relaxing and good views, friendly service, nice comfortable surroundings.

It is super to go up by cable car and have a lunch or a wine (beer) in the panorama restaurant. You have, by sunny weather- which is almost every day -, to be early as the tables are fast gone, you can also make reservations (book it on the best side the edge looking down on the old town, it is not cheap, but worthy to go up and have a look down on the old town. The best view!
The trip with the cable car takes only a couple of minutes, be early so you do not wait long in the queue.
Just stopped for a drink due to not having the time for lunch. Will go back and hopefully enjoy their food.

Anyone making the trip to Dubrovnik must visit Panorama. We managed to luck into a table right at the edge. The view is simply incredible. We didn't want to leave. The food was excellent. Not the cheapest but absolutely worth every penny.

If there is one place to eat whilst in Dubrovnik it is this restaurant. The views over Dubrovnik are outstanding and it really is an experience. I have eaten here previously in 2014 so I made sure to return during this holiday as I love it so much. The food is beautiful. Excellently made and there is something on the menu to suit everyone. The prices are also very reasonable considering the location of the restaurant. Our servers were fantastic extremely attentive and always smiling. They made good recommendations regarding wine and beer as well as little extras to compliment our food. The host went out of his way to get us a table with a view. We hadn't realised that you could book a table in advance. The restaurant was very busy but the host did not want us to be disappointed. Great experience. Hope to return again.

We booked a table right on the edge months before our visit to guarantee a great view as it was our anniversary.
The staff were very friendly & even though there was some kind of mix up in the kitchen & we ended up waiting a very long time between courses it was worth it!
The sea bass was lovely & it also meant that we had the table for a lot longer than our allotted time as the tables with the best views are the most sought after. 
It is expensive, but when the views are that good you expect to pay a premium.

After you take the cable car on mount Srfj in Dubrovnik this is a must visit place if only for the view which is breathtaking. Staffed by very welcoming and friendly staff.we had a hamburger which was excellent but the fries were nothing more than what you get at McDonald.The salad was pronounced to be Google. Two drinks (wine and beer) and food cane to about fifty Canadian dollar equivalent.

The view from this restaurant is amazing. In order to get one of the tables with the prime views at dinner, however, you will need a reservation. The service is attentive, but not at all rushed allowing you to take in the view for as long as you would like. The food and drinks were very good and reasonably priced considering it is the only restaurant up there.

Spent a leisurely Sunday lunch time in the Panorama. One of 3 restaurants run by the same group in the town. Started with a drink and stayed for lunch! Very good service and food - and if lucky then the view is second to none with the town directly below. The cable car runs till midnight during June - August and so dinner is an option, if you prefer the twinkling lights of Dubrovnik.

It's really worth getting the cable car up and enjoying drinks if not food at this beautiful spot. Given they have a captive audience the price is very fair and you can't ask for a finer view in Dubrovnik imho.

Having visited the Nautika restaurant and given that a 5 star rating, I was expecting more from the panorama which is part of the same collection of restaurants. 
The restaurant was very busy and loud at dinner so not the greatest place for a romantic meal.
An amazing view, but this did not make up for the rather bland and overpriced food. It is certainly worth taking a short trip up the hill and I would maybe have a drink here if visiting again but I would consider eating back down in or around the city.

Our waiter Martin, with impeccable service, grace and a wicked sense of humour enhanced the most overwhelming visit to Panorama Restaurant! I felt on top of the world
Thank you Martin, you're pretty amazing!

Our hotel receptionist recommended the restaurant and he certainly did not lie! Food was excellent: we ate local cheese and olives for starter and those were one of the best we've ever had. Fish of the day was tuna steak and it was perfectly cooked and beautifully served. Seasonal fruits and cheese cake were the cherry on top. Sunset view over the city and sea was undescribable!

Our waiter Mario recommended excellent local wine for the main course. Service was professional and gentle, we were remotely well taken care of during the evening. We had to wait a while to get seated and afterwards again to pay our bill, but the experience was overall so good that it really didn't matter. Our evening was without a doubt one of the best experiences we've had in many countries!

We had dinner here and saw the sunset. Staff constantly offering to take photos of you by the view and sunset. The food was great and had very nice cocktails. I couldn't recommend this restaurant enough!

if you catch a table in the front row u get the most awesome view u can imagine. the restaurant looks super nice and is very cozy. the service is just awesome and the food is a 8 out of 10. prices are a lil higher but absolutely worth it. we can recommend this to everybody who wants a exclusiv dinner in an awesome atmosphere

The view was magnificent with no doubt. We were seated at slightly inside which was not just next to the side to allow us to look downward. 

Although we only had drinks, the manager kindly helped us and changed our table to the scenic side when someone else left. Really good service so we would recommend everyone going up to be there. Reservations may be useful if you want to sit at scenic side.

We went there for dinner at sunset , Amazing views all over dubrovnik. 

Food was good, nice atmosphere and friendly staff . You won't be disappointed . 

We sat outside and was provided with heaters and blankets for when it got a little bit chilly after dark .

 All in all made for good evening .
great views for lunch good wide choice of food available would go again dinner at sunset would be good

We called in the morning to try book a table but were out of luck as fully booked on a wednesday evening..but we tried our luck and we were in...we managed to get a table when we went for the view and a drink at the bar in the evening..well worth it..stunning views over the entire town/city and such a great atmosphere...excellent staff that couldn't do enough for us..a lovely location for both close friends or a romantic evening.

This restaurant is something special. The view is amazing, and can I give you a tip I'd say to sit outside of the weather allows. The food is excellent and the staff is professional. One word of caution: the starters are enormous! 
As another tip: go and eat breakfast at dubravka restaurant in the center. Panorama and dubravka have an collaboration so you'll get a coupon for 10 % off on the next meal, for example at panorama!

Amazing!!!
Service. Food. View 
Marijo our waiter was delightful steak sandwich and salad fizz coffee and cake.
Breathtaking scenery.

I would highly recommend for lovely friendly staff and an amazing amazing view!! We only had a quick drink but the guy serving us could not have been nicer and the food looked fantastic, if we had time I would have come back for dinner and wished we had done this-Loved the buzzer service on the tables! You press your little button and the waiter comes over-great idea too!

My friends and I visited this restaurant to enjoy the sunset over Dubrovnik and the Adriatic Sea. Since it was the only restaurant at the very top of the cable car it was convenient. The service was good but the food was unmemorable.

We had an amazing experience at Panorama Restaurant! On top of spectacular views, we had the best service and great food! Initially, there were no seats by the edge. When one became available, Tihomir took the initiative to move us. He was very friendly and offered to take our picture. It turned out to be my favorite of the trip! We also met Marijo, who was very cordial and a pleasure to speak with. Thank you for an afternoon we will never forget!

We went for some drinks right before sunset and it was fabulous! Had some nice champagne and watched the sun go down. The staff was very attentive and good to us, even giving us a complimentary glass and some blankets as it cooled off.

You cannot visit Dubrovnik without visiting this Restaurant! It is the one at the top of the Cable car and the views are breath taking. As there were 15 of us in our party I pre-booked this restaurant before our holiday. I wanted seats at the edge looking down onto the old town so booked it about 3 months before we were due to visit. So glad I did, we had a fantastic evening. Food delicious, service brilliant. We were given a glass of Prosecco each with a strawberry in without any charge, thought that was a nice touch. There were blankets on each seat and also heaters as it tends to drop cool up there once the sun has gone down. Everyone enjoyed their meal so 15 happy people. Just check the cable car times if you're going to book. The last cable car down was 9pm at the end of May/June but I think in the full season it is much later. This restaurant is a must!

Situated at the top of Srd Hill by the upper cable car station and it certainly has 'panoramic' views. It is 'wait to be seated' but the wait isn't for long and definitely worth it. The staff could not be more helpful, all are smartly dressed and very efficient...how some of them carried those heavy trays without dropping anything, I don't know. Food is served quickly (from the inside restaurant) despite how busy both restaurants are and beautifully presented. You can pick up a leaflet from their sister restaurant- 'Dubravka 1836' located at the entrance to Dubrovnik Old City, to get 10% off.

Lovely staff seated us at a fabulous table with a view to for for. The food menu was extensive but we were there about 11am so didn't want to eat. An iced coffee and a coffee with Ameretto were ordered and enjoyed under the canopies with a warm gentle breeze... Lovely!

We were very excited to use the cable cars and enjoyed the views but the best part of the attraction is this restaurant! 
It is located at the top of the hill on a rocky terrace, we were there during the day but I imagine it would be lovely on an evening. We had a couple of coffees and a sandwich which was delicious and reasonably priced given the restaurants location. The staff were very attentive and incredibly friendly. 
You will not find a better view of Dubrovnik than from this restaurant, we took the mojarity of our photos up here. I'm very glad we visited because it was lovely.

This restaurant is perched high above the old city and accessible by cable car. It has exceptional views and awesome service. They provide blankets and heaters for when it gets cold. It's kid friendly because they offer items for kids, including virgin cocktails.

We only had drinks here, but I can imagine a meal up here in the evening with the sun setting would be wonderful. Friendly staff, lovely scenery, captive audience prices, but with a 10% discount voucher to use in their other restaurant outside Pile Gate

Amazing view. The staff are excellent and the menu is good. Not too expensive from the old town,but the views and music make it wonderful. Would recommend booking so you can get a seat with a great view.

We had a short light lunch here as part of our visit. We were very fortunate to get a table at the edge of the hill which had fantastic views down over the old town. The service was excellent and the food was good.
Location, amazing. Service, outstanding. Food, delicious. The whole experience was first class. Highly recommend.

If you visit Dubrovnik, one of the must-do experiences is to travel to the summit of the mountain overlooking the city and linger over its view. We found a thoroughly suitable way to let the city reveal itself is while eating a leisurely, delicious lunch at the Panorama and peering over the edge of the decking at the "Pearl of the Adriatic". With a soft cloud cover gently lofting over the city, the varying play of light intensity caught our eye first on one building, then another. The food was definitely good, the service was great, and the cost only slightly more expensive than might be expected if you were just going to a "view restaurant." A sunset dinner might be more romantic, but an early lunch was a great value and the source of an enduring bond to the beauty of Dubrovnik.

Ate dinner here. The setting next to the cable car station overlooking Dubrovnik is perfect. We had reserved a table early and were seated on the edge of the terrace with an unobstructed view of Dubrovnik. It did get cool when the sun set and being high there was a col wind blowing. But the restaurant brought along a portable electric heater and blankets for us. With a little forethought we should have brought warmer clothing with us. Now to the food. The food was good but the selection of deserts was remarkably uninspiring. We chose the cheese board with olives for desert which was very good. We found the cheese board in the 'Starters' section on the menu. Service was friendly and helpful. A must restaurant when in Dubrovnik but not just for the food.

My wife and I dined here one afternoon during our visit to Dubrovnik. 

We booked a table a couple of weeks in advance requested a spot with an uninterrupted view. 
Boy did they honour that, a table right on the edge in one of the corners with views to die for!

We arrived a little early and the restaurant was busy with people trying to be seated that had not booked prior, our table was already ready for us which was nice. 

The food and wine is excellent and so reasonably priced considering the location. 

The waiter dropped my wife's lasagne en route to the table which caused a delay in us receiving our food. He offered us a round of drinks to apologise which wasn't necessary but welcomed, we were just happy to be sat there taking in the breathtaking view. 

I would 100% recommend Panorama, make sure you book in advanced and request a good table.

If you go up on the cable car you must visit the restaurant. The waiters are friendly, service was quick and the steak sandwiches were superb and with the views over the Old Town of Dubrovnik this should not be missed
Small restaurant with open air seating. Unforgettable view on a old city of Dubrovnik. Professional service very good choice of vines.
We were given a prime view, staff were so helpful and meal amazing. Don't miss the cable car trip and a visit to this restaurant .

We used the cable car to come up here. Views were amazing - my boyfriend had booked ahead and we got a prime view at the front overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik. Although the food is by no means cheap, it was pleasant, and we had such a wonderful experience. The service was outstanding too. Thank you for a lovely birthday!

We sat here for nearly an hour using their free wi-fi and nursing two coffees each. The views are stunning and we were moved to a window seat when one came free without asking....the food looked nice. Toilets very clean too.

Walked up hill and enjoyed 4 hours at this nice restaurant. We had a tasty Greek salat olives and potatoes. Cocktails were really good. Service and food was perfect. We recommend the walk path as a good exercise. Coming up at the top to relax and enjoy the view is definitely worth it!

Took the cable car up and had lunch here last week. The staff were very nice especially when we came to pay as 2 of us wanted to pay Kuna and the other 2 in Euro. This was not a problem for them. As not all places take Euros . The food was very nice and fresh. The view from the top is fantastic you can see the old town, islands , cruise ships, boats on a sunny day it's lovely. Well worth going up.
We went for lunch today and it was excellent. My daughter loved the steak sandwich and my BBC cocktail was superb. We got a table with a fantastic view of the old town. Service was very good too.

We had appetizers and drinks here. View is tremendous. Would advise getting a reservation for sunset, we were lucky to get a table but had to wait. We also had the croation cheese platter appetizer which was really nice and a great way to try some local cheeses. Local beer on tap. It was certainly not cheap but views worth it.

Would recommend taking the cable car. As with other dubrovnik taxi experiences, we were ripped off. On this ride the meter was turned off and we were just given a price. Our rates (same route, same time of evening over 5 nights) varied widely with some fares being 70 kuna and then some as high as 120 Kuna, appears that some drivers are manipulating the meters. Other visitors had this problem as well. Hope the city can fix this problem.

We decided to go for an early Sunday lunch at Panorama when we visit Mount Srd. It was quite busy, and we hadn't booked, so we had to put our name down and wait for a table to become available. After a short wait (approx 10/15 mins) we were taken to our table and we were pleased to find we had a table right on the edge overlooking Dubrovnik Old Town - I don't think we could have got a better table!

Food was very tasty, and the service was good even though they were very busy. We liked that we were given a button to press if needed our waiter but we never needed to use it as the waiter was so attentive. I would definitely recommend for both the food and the views!

On taking the cable car to the top, the views there are truly stunning! We decided to have lunch here and were seated overlooking the city, it was amazing. There is gentle music playing which really added to the experience. The food was delicious and beautifully presented. Staff were excellent giving you a buzzer to press should you need anything, so no waiting for someone to come along for drinks etc.
This is a wonderful place to eat and take in the superb views overlooking the city.

This is a must! We booked a table outside an hour prior to sunset (note that there is some seating that's not on the edge overlooking the city so make sure to request it in your booking too). Service was a little slow but the staff was otherwise very attentive (we got heating lamps and extra blankets as the night progressed). The octopus and squid were very good. We were too full for dessert but their latte was excellent. Yes, it's a little pricey but the views of the Old City are worth it and the sunset was gorgeous.

Everything about this place was brilliant. The location, the view, the service, the food... Second to none. We arrived without pre-booking for lunch on a busy Thursday afternoon. We were seated straight away and presented with a varied (if slightly limited) menu. Seeing as we were at the top of the mountain, this was understandable! We had the Sea Bass and the Steak Tagliata. Both were absolutely perfect and reasonable sized portions. Very impressed, we will be back!
Ambience, service and food- all three absolutely impeccable! Amazing way to end our holiday! Best to reserve before hand (easy to do online) to ensure you get a seat!

My wife and I came here two years ago and had a very romantic evening, with a magnificent meal and fabulous table, on the terrace. We took some friends with us this year and had really bigged it up. As expected they didn't let us down, the food was exceptional and the view from the table at sunset can't be beaten. The waiters couldn't have been more obliging. Again, the best restaurant anywhere.

We had dinner here for our 25th anniversary. The view was fantastic. The staff was very friendly, taking pictures for us and letting us to move to a table looking down on the city after dinner. When we said we came here for the anniversary, he gave us a small desert after dinner. We enjoyed teas and fantastic views at the table.

After climbing (or taking the cable car up) mt srd, this is the obvious place to go for a celebratory drink. Obviously, it's going to be a little pricey (great spot + no competition).

We were pleasantly surprised by the level of service. Our server stood on railings to open our patio umbrella and take the perfect photo of our group. 

Not all servers were as friendly as ours. Some were visibly frustrated by tourists standing in their way taking photos. They repeated told them that the restaurant is for customers only. I think in this case the tourists spoke neither English or Croatian.

Do your server a favour and let them find you a table and serve you, as you would in any other restaurant, and I'm sure you'll have a pleasant experience.

Had a great lunch at the Panorama. Whilst taking our drink orders, our waiter excused himself for a moment and returned to say he had found us a better table which was right at the edge of the restaurant with amazing views over Dubrovnik. Excellent customer service from wonderful staff combined with delicious food and a very refreshing local rosé made this a lunch to remember!
Took ages to get seated, then the waiter seemed to forget us so took ages to order. Food pretty expensive for mediocre quality.

Our table was right at the very edge of the terrace, looking down on the city and offering the most incredible view I’ve ever seen. I had a cheeseburger, which wasn’t very imaginative but then we had already been in Croatia for nearly two weeks and I was ready for something a little less traditional. My wife had the “chicken rustica” with potatoes, carrots, garlic, and gravy, which she enjoyed very much. 

Service was terrific. We had had a long wait for a table so I was afraid we might be rushed along once we sat down, but that didn’t happen.

Very highly recommended.

This a 'must stop here' restaurant. The views alone are terrific. The staff are friendly and helpful and the coffee first-rate. We got a good table overlooking the old city - but all the tables are good.
The views from the restaurant are fantastic but so was both the quality of the food and the service. A little expensive but definitely worth it.

Drove up and though we didn't have reservations, still scored a lovely table on the terrace. I would recommend making reservations so you get the tables on the edge. The views were still captivating at our table and visually stunning. The service was excellent by all members of the staff. They were very gracious taking wonderful pictures of everyone dining there. The food was surprisingly well prepared as usually view restaurants excel in views more then food. The sea bass and chicken with bacon were both tasty and artistically prepared. The walnut cake was divine and the wines were very good. 
One of the best dinners we had in Dubrovnik.
If you want the WOW factor this is the place to go. Stunning voews of Dubrovnik Old Town, coastline and surrounding hills inland

Panorama is the place to dine to make your trip to Dubrovnik complete. The breathtaking scenery is complimented by the amazing food & service. 

I was fully attended to by waiter Marijo as it was quite windy that day and he made sure my table was warm by providing blankets and a heater. 

The cheeseburger I had for lunch was nice and juicy. Am glad I made the trip up the cable car to you guys. 

Thumbs up Panorama !!

Aida

The restaurant is wery nice located on the hilltop above Dubrovnik. We had a exellent lunsj up there. But be aware that there may be some waiting to get a table. We took taxi up from dubrovnik and cablecar down. Price was the same.

We travelled to the top by cable car to enjoy a cocktail and watch the sun set and we stayed for a three course dinner! The view over Dubrovnik is spectacular, book a table at the front edge of the terrace if possible. Service is beyond excellent with the waiting staff being courteous, friendly and efficient. We enjoyed carpacio and smoked ham and olives for starters followed by octopus for the main course and cake and coffee for desert.
Incidentally the cocktails were excellent too

Waiting to board the tour bus we had a drink and used the restrooms. We didn't have time for WiFi. They are happy to accept Euros. They were well spoken with very good English and very welcoming. We wished we could have stayed longer and would go back.

The service is mainly from the younger people who made me and my friends very welcoming and comfortable, especially the lady who works at the entrance, i think her name was jelena and she's very charming and polite ! Tumbs up for the restaurant, i will come back soon 100 % ! 😊
Lovely view and service! Menu was a little pricey, even for Dubrovnik. Perfect place for a glass of wine (or two!)!

My daughter and I took the cable car to the top on a really clear day . The view was just breathtaking! We got lucky and got one of the best corner tables at the Panorama restaurant while up there. We were told that not only is this the most magical and unusual location in Dubrovnik area, but it's among the top most amazingly located venues on the entire Adriatic. The place gets pretty crowded and making reservations would be very advisable unless you don't mind waiting for a table . It is open seven days a week for lunch and dinner and they serve Mediterranean cuisine. I found that the food was just average , but the novelty of being in such a beautiful location made it all worthwhile.

We went up because we fancied a ride in the cable car, and ended up staying for a long, lazy lunch. The views are spectacular, the food good (and not as expensive as you'd think, given the location), and the waiting staff are lovely. We went up to the fort after our lunch and had a look around the Homeland War exhibition, which was fascinating. If you're visiting Dubrovnik, definitely factor in a cable car ride and food at the Panorama - not to be missed.

The service is from mainly younger people, who made us most welcome and comfortable, thank you. Our coffee and cake was excellent and the best bit was the views. The tables are set out along the view line, you must have a beer or coffee just to take in the views!

Special place at the top of the cable car, especially first thing in the morning. Great cappuccino, yummy cakes, friendly staff, and THE most amazing view...
Ps: and you can pay in Euros, too.

Although a little one the pricey side the views and service are incredible, it was a little windy when we visited but staff were quick to give us blankets and a heater, the food was very tasty and overall was a nice treat

I would recommend reservations although we did without. Use your discount card from
Dubravka 1836 or get a discount card at Panorama and use it there.

I had Fried Squid which is like the National dish but oh so good with the Malvazia wine.

We booked a week before our visit and were rewarded by a table at the very front of the terrace. 

We ate at 8 and saw the sunset which was beautiful. 

People have commented on the price but I don't think it was that unreasonable. When I go to a restaurant I understand I am paying for the atmosphere and service as well as the food and we enjoyed all three. 

We were worried we would be cold eating outside but there is an abundance of heat lamps and blankets so you need not worry.

Two of us had steak, 2 cocktails and a glass of wine and two desserts for 77kuna.

We arrived there in a group without a reservation and they accommodated us quickly. We were seated in a seat which had the best views of the Old City and next to the top by the cross. We enjoyed the wine, the food and the staff were amazing! The seafood is simply amazing and freshly caught daily. We would go back next time for sure!

We've been here last summer and it was a clear summer night with a spectacular view. Make sure that you make a reservation so you can get a seat and with a bit of luck or patience you can pick a table with a better view. We got seated at a table in the middle but we had to ask the waiter to move us closer to the Dubrovnik "night scene" :))) . This is what you call a restaurant with a view! Also the food was very nice so it was a perfect night out just for us ;)

We got the cable car up to the top and considered just having a drink at the restaurant. After sitting down and seeing the views, we just couldn't get enough so stayed for another 2 hours and had a steak sandwich each, more drinks and a gorgeous cheesecake. 
All the staff were lovely, very chilled out and weren't pushy at all which was great considering the restaurant was busy; there was no feeling we had to hurry or rush our time there at all.
The atmosphere was extremely peaceful and the quality of the food was a lovely surprise also.

Booked a table in advance after researching restaurants in Dubrovnik and am so glad I went for this one.
The main reason was the views, which are absolutely spectacular - up both coastlines, over looking the old town, the mountains behind - definitely the most magical place I have ever had a meal.

The service was impeccable, our waiter Mario doing everything to make our time as enjoyable as possible - he was great. All staff were great though. We were provided with blankets when the sun went down.

The food was great - but for me the meal was about the view. We did have a short wait for desert (but was enjoying the view and changing hues on the horizon) - and Mario advised this would now be gratis. My parter also enjoyed her cocktails.

This place is actually cheaper than many other restaurants in Dubrovnik - and worked out around the same price as a higher end meal in the U.K. Come the bill, we had 10% off our meal, and also complementary traditional Croatian liquor which was a lovely touch.

This was one of our favourite evenings in Croatia, and I defiantly recommend this, as the memories will be with us for a lifetime. Thanks Panorama Restaurant.

The GF and I were lucky to get a table at the very edge of the restaurant so had an excellent view. We ordered coffee, but the food looked excellent. Friendly service who dealt with a large table who were quite difficult (wanted a table of 10, which was difficult to do because of the umbrella's preventing tables being moved). They were very difficult to get hold of to pay our bill- I went to pay someone rather than waiting for the bill and was told to wait- it appeared only one person could take our money.

This was our favourite thing we did on our trip to Dubrovnik. We had a great table right by the edge of the restaurant overlooking the city. Probably the best view for lunch you could have! The service was great, very friendly and attentive. Our waiter was happy to stop and take pictures of us even though they were busy. We had a cheese plate to start and then steak sandwich and risotto which were both great. The price is reasonable, I expected it to be more expensive due to the location. It's the same price as the old town really. Absolutely beautiful place, loved it.
A word of warning, don't try to walk down the mountain instead of getting the cable car! The lady at the ticket office told us it was a 30 min walk back down, it took us about 1hr 30 and it's a very steep and rocky path! Not good after 3 wines!! :-/
Can't recommend this place enough, fanatic service from lovely waiter lucka. Great prices I had the best club sandwich.
The panorama is simply perfect .. the show has spoiled us a bit but the look at this beautiful city is amazing. Here we are sure to return!

We visited this resturant as a hen party of 12. We had booked in advance but unfortunately the cable car had stopped due to weather. We got taxis up and some of the girls were a bit frightened by the cliff edge! Once we arrived we were warmly welcomed in to our table and the service was amazing! They couldn't do enough for us. We wasn't rushed at all and they were so lovely. The food was amazing and everyone was very impressed. After our very long and relaxed lunch they had given us a bottle of prosecco and 20% off our bill!!! If I return to Dubrovnik I will 100% go to this resturant again and I have been telling everyone to go! 

Many thanks

Stunning setting, Good food, Friendly staff and very good service. We were lucky enough to be given a table by the edge so had amazing views. May have to wait for a table and expect it will be extremely busy in the summer so worth booking. Will definitely book if back in the area.

We arrived at the restaurant around lunch time and were seated immediately.

The staff were very helpful and friendly.

We had some drinks and a small lunch. All were very good. 

The view from here was spectacular. Definitely worth a visit even for just a drink!

We had to wait for an hour for a table for 5. But well worth the wait. 

I have never eaten in a restaurant with such a view. I have been lucky enough to eat in a few of the highest towers around the world and this view beats them all. 

We had a 2-3 hour lunch and not once felt rushed (may of been the amount we were eating and drinking). 

The food was very good for lunch. 

What really made our visit was our waiter. He was very attentive with a great sense of humour. He was very professional but great fun. 

Do not miss an opportunity to visit if visiting Dubrovnik it is a must do.

Wonderful food, excellent service with the most stunning view over Dubrovnik. The hospitality of the staff made it an extra special meal, from giving us plenty of time to look over the fabulous menu to brining blankets when it was getting chilly. The food was absolutely delicious and what a view!! We loved it. Hvala!

The view from the tables are fantastic as the pictures show, however the food is extremely expenisve! Ordered a Beef Taglitelle and it was just meag with some rocket, no taglitelle?! The cost was equivalent to £20 and I needed to eat again due to the lack of food on the plate. Cable Car amazing, restaurant attached to it not so much!

We could not have been happier with our visit to Panorama. We weren't sure how long it would take us to walk from Old Town, take the cable car, etc....As a result, we arrived really early! We took in the views from every angle, walked all around, did all the selfies our group could handle and were still an hour before our reservation. The maitre'd graciously ushered us to the outdoor bar, apologized profusely for not having our table ready (an hour early) and comped our kids sodas and adults glasses of champagne. He pointed to our table and explained that as soon as the people there paid their bill, they would clean it up and get us seated...again apologizing for not being ready for our early arrival. Once we were seated, our waiter was also delightful. It was a little chilly, so he made sure the kids had blankets to put over their laps so that they would be comfortable. The food was the best meal we had on our trip....every dish was absolutely amazing. The final pleasure was watching the sun set over Dubrovnik as we rode the cable car back down. It was a perfect experience in every way.

This open air restaurant is perched high on the hill overlooking Dubrovnik Old Town. You have to take the cable car to reach it, they run every 15 minutes and it takes about 4 minutes to reach the top. Ask for a table by the front facing balcony and watch the sun set whilst you eat. The views are glorious. The service is perfect,the waiters speak excellent English and are very helpful. The food was great too and it's not too expensive either, we paid £53.00 for two mains and a bottle of wine.
They provide portable heaters and blankets for around your shoulders as it gets chillier.
The restaurant takes last orders for dinner at 8pm.

A "must see" place, very friendly staff , beautiful restaurant with huge terrace to enjoy the most breathtaking view of Dubrovnik, from the old city to the islands, from The panorama restaurant : you see it all! Not too forget, the food is divine and reasonably priced
We rented a car for the week so we didn't use the cable car to get there

My wife and I loved this place as we had the best meal and the view. There was a queue and were asked if we had booked which we had not. They found us a table right by the railing a few minutes later. We had a lovely meal with bottle of Chardonnay and desserts and paid about £80. it was ok. for the food and view.
The restaurant I would not rave about, but the view!!!! Oh, the view. So definitely take your time and visit

We spent a day in Dubrovnik. This was a very nice experience. On the end we decided to drive with our car up the hill. On top we got a great view over whole Dubrovnik. Just great. But surprising we also found a very nice restaurant with great view. The restaurant is very high class but with very friendly people and great food. It is not cheap but considering prices in Dubrovnik I would say - worth its price

Visit Dubrovnik without that place would be not complete. 
We have been there on may 1st and we had to wait for table. I am afraid that during high season places are not easy available.

We had lunch here at the cafe yesterday. The restaurant was really busy and we were lucky to get a table with only a 10 minute wait. My wife had the ceasar salad which she really enjoyed and I had a very average cheeseburger. The views are however stunning.

Fantastic views make this a unique dining experience. We did not have reservations but I would recommend making one to ensure a quality table. We had a great salad and steak. Fantastic service. Not rushed at all, service needs very relaxed.

We booked a table for the evening in the window at this restaurant and had a wonderful experience. The view is absolutely amazing ! We went in April so it was a bit too chilly to sit outside. Our waiter was very friendly( I think his name was Blatz) and gave suggestions of what to eat to help us choose. He also took lots of photos for us ! We all had cocktails which were great and we all loved the food . We really enjoyed our evening and had a lot of fun with Blatz, thank you for entertaining us !!

We visited here last week after going up in the cable car and we weren't disappointed. The view from here is simply stunning. We were given a table outside, close to the edge so we could really enjoy looking at the old town from above. It was a pleasant surprise to find patio heaters and fleecy blankets to wrap around you if it's chilly! 

We only wanted a coffee, and I fancied some chips, while my other half had a piece of cheese cake, but the menu certainly looked very tempting. Service was excellent and our waiter thoughtfully brought over two forks in case we wanted to share the cheesecake, and the chips were served with both mayonnaise and ketchup without me having to ask for it. 

I'm not sure how lucky you could be getting a table without a reservation during peak season; I imagine it to be totally packed. It might be worth booking ahead during the busier months, but I certainly recommend a trip up here. Another point to mention is that whilst the view over Dubrovnik is incredible, the view over the mountains behind is also worth taking time over. The Croatian War of Independence museum is also to be found up here (separate to the restaurant and you need to pay 40 Kunas to visit) and is just a short walk away from the Panorama Restaurant.

P.s The sea really is as blue as it looks in the pictures!!!

We were able to get a table outside without a reservation - I am not sure we would be so lucky in peak season so that's something to think about. We both had the beef tagliata with a side of rosemary potatoes. If a little underseasoned (no problem as there were plenty of condiments on the table) it was a delicious lunch and the view made it all the better. We shared a chocolate and walnut cake for desert which was fab! All in all a lovely spot for lunch. Not cheap especially if you add in the costs of the cable car to get up there but will be a highlight meal from our trip so was worth it.

We visited the Panorama for a drink on the first day of our break having travelled up on the cable car and decided to return the next day and have lunch. We booked a table for our party of 14 and when we arrived our waiter Mario couldn't have done any more for us. Food and drinks were served promptly and tasted amazing. We loved this place and would definitely return when we visit again!

We got lucky at this restaurant as we didn't have a reservation, but they had a couple of tables for 2 free. There was a good choice on the menu and the food was really nice and there was plenty of it. The staff were so lovely and chatty and wanted to make sure everything was OK for you. The views from the restaurant are amazing as it looks right over the old town.

Before I start describing the last experience, I have to be honest and admit that this was not our first visit, we're coming there occasionally and so far with the service it was OK. 
The place is wonderful, the view is phenomenal (if you catch the right table), choice of food and drink good, they cost a bit high, but it is normal for such places.
But , here's what happened to us a couple of days ago. We ordered a drink, waited 20 minutes, when the waiter came back with a request to repeat the order because they lost it ?!? OK, it happens, we repeated the order, waited for another 15 minutes, got a drink, drank it and wanted to pay and go. The waiter who served us disappeared, we asked other one to bring us the bill, brought it but did not take the money with an explanation that someone else will come. For the next 20 minutes we waited (with 3-4 requests to the waiters who were passing) and finally succeeded , but it was more than hour for one drink ? And it was not a crowd at all ...
High rating only for past experience and of course, location ..
Great food would recommend, the whole menu was great loads of choice. Risotto and veg is a must.. Martin out waiter was great.

We took the cable car to the top of Mount Syd and then went round the museum. Rather pricy but worth it. Just loved the Resturant, we were lucky to get a table with uninterrupted views of Dubrovnik below. Absolutely awesome view. Staff were superb. I just had tomato soup which was good. The burger and chips were tasty that my husband had. Turns out they have a sister Resturant just outside the old gate that we used several times. Would love to have come back for dinner in the evening the sun set would have been beautiful. Definitely worth the cable car rid
Super restaurant with the most beautiful view of the city. Food and service are excellent !!! I recommend everyone..

This unique restaurant ensures you the best view on Dubrovnik, great food (sea bass, squids, tomato soup, cheescake, apple pie) and super welcoming & friendly staff (with special thanks to Vedran the waiter). We definitely enyoed our dinner!

Friendly and helpful service- I had requested in advance for a great view as this was to be a special dinner. They accommodated and gave us the best corner seat available. They provide blankets and heat lamps as we were outdoors and it was still abit nippy at night (early April), and service was superb. We ordered white wine which paired with the bread. And the mains of ravioli and seafood were very tasty. The view is the real attraction though, and this was a night to remember.

panorama restaurant we found after taking the cable car up to mount srđ.............

the best view in dubrovnik.......

service is frendly.........

Last days in Dubrovnik and went to the top to catch a sunset. The ride itself is a rip off but what can you do.... but I admit the restaurant is well done. You have inside and outside sitting. It's easy to find, menu offers some options and the service is great. The prices are on the high side but not as crazy as other restaurants inside the wall or who claimed to be 5 stars. The cappuccino was excellent and the other food was okay. Presentation was good and again service was excellent. I would recommend to go there for diner,,, you will pay a little bit more but it would be worth the trip. Don't take the cable car, use Uber or can for 1/2 price of the cable car.
G
Great food, great staff,view! Some indoor seating and lots of heat lamps for the outside.food prices are reasonable.
A fine restaurant with quite nice food and a view beyond comparison. The location is top. Be sure to make a reservation.

Booked a table with unobstructed views in advance to celebrate my father's 70th birthday. Food quality varied by menu, but that really didn't matter much because the breathtaking view, ambience, and service was what we were after - and got. 

Mario, our waiter, provided us with the best restaurant service experienced in all of Croatia. If you visit this establishment and find that your waiter is Mario, then be assured that you will receive the best of Croatian hospitality.

While sunset itself is best seen across from the restaurant near the old wooden cross, we were able to admire from our table the rosy hues spread across the sky as dusk settled in.

Visited April 14th.

After our walk here in the April sunshine we were in need of a drink
The staff were really friendly and service was spot on. Not overly pricey considering the stunning view.Although we only ordered drinks this was not a problem and we spent am hour enjoying the view and getting ready for our walk back down . Worth the effort and food looked good too

We took the cable cart up for sunset which was quite a short trip up to the top but still very memorable. 

As a bachelorette group of 8 we weren't able to sit together despite making a reservation and were seperated onto 2 tables (unable to join them together) near the entrance without a view which was disappointing. 

Non the less, the bar staff did a great job and were very friendly and the cocktails were AMAZING! Very well made,beautifully garnished and served promptly. 

We dined at their sister restaurant which was probably the best meal we had for our entire trip. I would definitely come here again and recommend others to also, but would say it's more suited to smaller groups or couples.
amazing view get the cable car up its worth it. we booked a table on the edge it was well worth it. the food was nice

The views from this vantage point in Mount Srd of the Old Town and harbour of Dubrovnik are breath taking. The staff are incredible - I did not have a seat near the railing but they found me one as soon as it was available. Dora was awesome and Mario extremely attentive and polite. The food and drink were fair priced especially considering the ambience of this restaurant and excellent in quality especially the club sandwich and the desserts. And a very thoughtful touch - every chair had a neatly folded blanket to snuggle into when the sun goes down even though the patio heaters keep you warm anyway. If you are keen on landscape photography, you would love the sunset !!

We found Panorama Restaurant after taking the cable car up to Mount Srd. Before heading back down, we saw this restaurant and decided to give it a try, The first impression was great because of the hostess, Violeta. She was warm, inviting, charming, and she answered all of our questions. With a welcome like that, we knew we were in for a treat!

The best part of the restaurant is the view. When we sat down, the first thing we said was, "wow, what a view"! Luckily, we had a great table right near the front so we could take in the view unobstructed. If you're looking for delicious food, yummy drinks, and a welcoming staff then this is your place! We will go back on our next visit and I hope we run into Violeta again!

My partner and I booked a table 2 days in advance for 6pm asking for a good view of the town if possible. We were delighted to be given the best table with an amazing view . The staff couldn't do enough for us , Tihomir was our lovely waiter who took lots of photos for us . The food and sparking wine ( Croatian- Tomac) was excellent. We had steak , chicken and cold meat and cheese starters- all v good . The sunset was amazing too . Fabulous views right along the coast .

I booked a table here as I wanted to make sure we were sat on the edge. We got given a table right on the edge in a corner, must have been one of the best spots. 

The staff were absolutely lovely, they set up the umbrella and a patio heater and gave me a blanket. 

We had a drink and enjoyed the views before ordering our food. The menu is quite small but a good selection and surprisingly it was really reasonably priced too. 

M other half had the chefs squid and a side of roasted veg, this was really yummy and I had the Tortelini in a local cheese sauce which was also lovely. We also had a bag of fresh bread to share. For dessert we had cheesecake and creme caramel and a complimentary glass of local pear liqueur finished off with a coffee each.

I think our final bill was around £50 which was really not bad at all especially when we got to enjoy an amazing sunset as well. 

It is so worth eating here, book a table and ask for a good view and book it so you are up there for the sunset. It's just gorgeous.

Panorama is situated at the top of the cable car, it takes a prominent place overlooking the old town and not easy to miss as the cable car pretty much opens up on it. On arrival the staff were attentive and friendly, the coffee superb and the club sandwich was freshly made and top notch. Considering the location of the restaurant they could have asked extortionate prices for their food but have chosen not to. Enjoy the stunning views cosy under the blanket supplied when the breeze hits. Well recommended for a lunch time visit.

We had lunch on the terrace after visiting the nearby Museum of the Croatian War for Independence. The views are fabulous and the food and service excellent. It is the perfect spot to enjoy a light meal and a beer while admiring the achingly beautiful surroundings.

We happened upon this restaurant after taking the cable car up to the top and fancied a drink when we saw it. The hostess sat us down at arguably the best seat in the whole place, right on the edge overlooking all of Dubrovnik old town. Although it was sunny they still provided patio heaters and blankets if we were cold. We decided to eat and were not disappointed, the food was incredible and we drank local beer and local sparkling wine, both of which were very good. The prices although locals believe it to be expensive, were not bad considering the strength of the british pound at the time. If you find yourself at the top of the mountain I would highly recommend it.
The view in the restaurant was amazing and more importantly, warm! We stopped by for drinks but found the staff rude and unwelcoming, unlike everywhere else we went in the city

The view and atmosphere are stunning, and the cable car were fun. But, the food (lunch) wasn't good at all. We were three friends, eating club sandwich, steak sandwich and hamburger. The meat was over cooked and didn't taste good, the only thing tasting good was French fries... 

The food is important for us, so it destroyed our stay at the restaurant Panorama.

As long as you're not afraid of heights, try table 31. It's in the corner on the edge looking straight out across the whole of the bay. Take the cable car up and you won't be disappointed. We spent four hours there just relaxing. What food we had was very fresh and tasty, but we both only have a chicken club sandwich as we had dinner plans that evening. However the wine was lovely and not expensive at all. 

The service is very efficient and super friendly.

What a spectacular place to eat! My husband booked a table at the Panorama Restaurant for my birthday - what a treat! We had the BEST seat in the house, the food was delicious and our waiters Luca and Roberto couldn't have done more for us. The weather was glorious and we spent a fabulous 3 hours at the top with the added bonus of watching the sun set. I cant praise the staff and restaurant enough - thank you all for making my birthday a very special occasion.
We were surprised by the quality and good value of the food. The view is spectacular. Would definitely recommend!

This restaurant is the family member of Nautica restaurants, which offer quality food and nice service. Panorama restaurant has a fantastic view over Dubrovnik Old Town and New Town, as well as Adriatic sea and Lokrum Island. We took coffee, beer and snacks. Service is very nice and staff are very attentive and friendly. This restaurant has a very nice calm music which doesn't distract you from enjoying the city view and the beauty of Dubrovnik. Wifi is free and fast.

This Panorama Restaurant is placed on the top of the hill Srđ, just above the old City of Dubrovnik. The location for the restaurant is just perfect. Besides the amazing view to the City of Dubrovnik, island Lokrum and the open sea horizon, the food is also excellent and the staff is very polite and helpful. You can reach the restaurant also by car, but the most convenient is to take the Dubrovnik Cable Car, which is a beautiful experience by itself. No matter how is the weather, sunny and hot or cold and rainy, I should recommend this restaurant as the excellent choice for nice meal, dinner, breakfast or at any other occasion.

We went to Dubrovnik old city had a hard time finding a spot for parking. Finally got it and walked down a lovely road with a fascinating view. Took the cable car ride to the pan Roma restaurant the ride was fabulous but the highlight was the panorama restaurant. Again extremely polite and helpful staff and the view of a lifetime. The food was excellent juicy and tasty. The burgers were sumptuous and nice. This was one of the best spots we visited in Dubrovnik

We were here for lunch on a misty and cloudy day and it was still worth it going. No noise, amazing views, tasty food and good service from the staff is what we experienced. Other touristy places such as this one should look up on them.
Gorgeous view of the sea and the town. Marijo was a fantastic waiter. He made me feel at home❤ He and the other waiters were fantastic. I hope to return soon!

What an absolutely beautiful spot for lunch and a few drinks. The view is truly breathtaking, the service was impeccable and the food and drink was equally as impressive. A birthday lunch my wife will never forget.

Very good restaurant, you must visit at least once. Located high above Dubrovnik, and offers stunning views of the Old Town and Lokrum Island. It is well worth the climb. You can ride the cable road, it is convenient and fast, but expensive. To go to the cable station from the city a little tedious. If you have a car, there is a way on the auto road. Be sure to reserve your table, otherwise you'll wait or have risk not sit on the front line, where the species. The phone can be found on their website. Food and winecard is good, but the prices are too high because of the panoramic view, which is the main thing here. Especially good for dinner at sunset.

This was one of the highlights of my trip to Dubrovnik. The views are great! It was a little chilly but they provide blankets so we sat outside. The food was lovely, I had a salad and even the salad didn't disappoint, the desserts are really nice. Definitely good value for money and great overall experience. Staff were really polite and helpful. I'd really like to go again but once it gets dark to see the lights. Definitely a must visit if you got to Dubrovnik!

the food was great, the views amazing and the service tip top. It is worth the time to get there.
Best lasagna ever
This restaurant offers a beautiful view of the most beautiful on the world.food falls into the plan. if you are in Dubrovnik visit.

If you take the cable car above Dubrovnik , which you should definitely do , you will be at this restaurant . We did not eat here , just had drinks . The view from this outdoor restaurant/bar is truly amazing . Take the time to sit for a while , have a cold beer or whatever and just soak up the unbelievable beauty that you will behold below you .
It is a lovely restaurant and the staff are all very friendly and helpful.The food is good with lots of choices. You have to book in advance . Bit pricey

Worth a visit for the view, it gets cold up there so be prepared. The food was very average, and a bit overpriced for what it was. Still, really worth it for the view. Would recommend it as an experience, just be warned that the food is average at best and rather pricey. We also had to wait despite booking in advance

Not one to be missed. If visiting Dubrovnik, the cable car ride is a must do attraction and once you are at the top, this is the restaurant that awaits you and it's very good. I thought it was 'up there' with any other eaterie we went to whilst there. 
yes, we only had simple fare like burgers and sandwiches , but it was very well made and presented and tasted really good. I would definitely recommend eating here. The staff were friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. In fact, I've just changed my rating from a four to a five. It's nowhere near a 5 star restaurant, so I'm not saying that, but the food was great and the staff are awesome.

And I never even mentioned the incredible views............... oh....make sure you get the cable car return ticket as the walk back down is a complete NIGHTMARE!
Lovely meal at dusk. A little expensive but it is at the top of the mountain so it’s to be expected. Stunning views across Dubrovnik to one side and the mountains on the other.

The scenery at this restaurant is outstanding, well worth booking ahead to get a table at sunset, defo make use of the blankets they provide when it gets a bit cooler! The food was stunning and the staff were lovely, cannot recommend highly enough

Had a snack and a beer in the Panorama restaurant after the tram ride to the top of Srd Hill. The service left much to be desired compared to most in the area, but to sit and enjoy the amazing views made it easy to wait a few extra minutes for our food and drinks. There was nothing terribly bad about the experience, just a very disinterested staff. Put aside that and I could eat every meal with that view, lol.

The highlight of our stay in Dubrovnik. The food is excellent, the service friendly and attentive, The real winner, hands down, is the view. Panoramic views of the old town and surrounding islands complemented by an uninterrupted view far out to the horizon. A very special place. I can't even remember how much it cost, because it really does not matter. Would urge everyone to spend an afternoon up here.
we absolutely loved this place, it was quite windy but the heaters and the blankets were ok, the view was unbeatable, the food was nice, the service good - try it out
Spent romantic dinner with my fiancé during our Croatia holiday. The view is spectacular, the restaurant really charming and delicious good food. The staff friendly and quality.

Got one of their last table for sunset even if we didn't reserve...
Nice view, heated terrasse and blankets provided for a cold evening, food/wine was good, more expansive than other options, but the view is worth it !!!

Having eaten breakfast an hour prior, we weren't at all hungry upon arriving atop the plateau where the cable car deposits passengers. Then we saw Panorama Restaurant's outdoor dining patio on the edge of a cliff, overlooking Dubrovnik, and we knew we'd find something to eat regardless.

The staff was just fabulous. The men wear dapper fedora style hats, and Hubby commented that he wanted one. We were astonished when Miroslav actually took off his hat and put it on Hubby's head, then told him to keep it !

Roberto was our server, and he was not only excellent, but a lot of fun. Since we didn't want much food, we ordered desserts and coffee. Hubby had apple strudel and I had three scoops of ice cream, covered in whipping cream and chocolate sauce. The dessert portions were enormous, and though everything was pricier than most of Croatia, you have to consider that Dubrovik is tourist central, and this particular restaurant is probably THE must-do restaurant in Dubrovnik.

We figured $8 USD each for dessert and $4.50 for cappuccino or latte was the price you pay for dining with such a magnificent view. Then Roberto brought our bill, which was discounted 10% - because it was the end of the season, he said. He saved us $3.

Despite that we were ordering only coffee and dessert, nobody rushed us, and we were treated like royalty by all. We absolutely loved the views, the food, the staff and everything about Panorama. Don't miss this restaurant if you visit Dubrovnik.

We just had a glass of wine in the Restaurant as we were eating later but we wanted to sit down and admire the views. I looked at the menu and the prices looked good and the food on the other tables. The wine was reasonably priced for the location.

Beautiful setting with beautiful views. The service was excellent and we were fitted in although we hadn't booked. The food was excellent also and blankets were supplied when it got a little chillier with the wind.

Armed with our 10% discount card provided by their sister restaurant Dubravka 1836, we took the cable car to the most stunning views of Dubrovnik and whilst there had lunch at The Panorama, you can certainly see how it gets its name.
They have a nice indoor section but everyone was sitting at tables on the outside terrace overlooking the old city and beyond. This was fantastic and you really do feel you are perched right on the edge. We were served promptly by the friendly waiters and our lunch was of very good quantity and quality, this combined with the aforementioned views, made a fantastic dining experience, cannot recommend it enough.

We came here for both the food and the views. I can safely say neither disappointed. We opted to sit outside, best option I think, and were rewarded with incredible views, up and down the coast. We both had steak sandwiches with fries, plenty of beef and a lovely dressing on the salad. Absolutely delicious! Although we would have liked to have had a piece of cake afterwards, we were too full. The waiters are friendly and the service quick, though you do not feel rushed. Cost is on a par with other good restaurants in Dubrovnik.

The Panorama is adjacent to the top cable-car station, providing excellent views down to Dubrovnik old town, whether you sit outside or inside (as we did). I was a little reluctant to eat here as I suspected an expensive, tourist-trap establishment (careful Scot) but not at all - we had burgers and fries and a lovely steak sandwich and fries followed by ice cream. It was not expensive at all. The interior is fairly bright, modern, basic furnishing and decor - service is "professional reserved". I was pleasantly surprised and enjoyed my lunch.

The restaurant at the top of the cable car is split into two - inside and outside.

We opted for the inside restaurant as it was very windy when we visited. 

Ok it is slightly more expensive than other restaurants in the old town, but, ultimately you are paying for the view. 

As we were going to eat later, I opted for a large beer and the wife for a tea and a slice of their chocolate and walnut cake. I'm told the cake was very good!

Total cost 118 kn.

High above the old town, this restaurant at the top of the mountain via the cable car, had fantastic views over Dubrovnik. 
A reasonably priced menu with snacks - try the steak sandwich - and a great cocktail and wine menu. 
A fabulous place for a long lunch when the sun is shining, just gazing over the old town and the Adriatic. Just heaven!!

We had lunch here after a visit to the Homeland War museum. It was dreadful wet weather outside so there was a queue to eat inside as that is a smaller area, this was very well managed. Once in the restaurant we had an excellent lunch, we weren't rushed at all even though they could have covered the table 3 times over, we were even given a complimentary ice cream when we finished our meal. Excellent service and I wouldn't hesitate to eat there again.

Had lunch here with friends , the views and setting are just stunning, the food is very good and a good selection of wines , service is very friendly and staff well trained . Don't miss out on this fabulous restaurant.
Amazing view, friendli staff.Good menu with snacks or full meals. Food is ok.Prices very reasonable as well. Recommend to visit , enjoy and dont't forget your camera!!!
The view from there is just amazing. You can see all of Dubrovnik area and all the way towards the Montenegro border. The food is OK but on the pricey side.

Outside part of restaurant is terraced ensuring all tables have a good view down to Dubrovnik Old City.

Restaurant is reasonably priced considering it has a cpative market. As it was lunch we ordered for three of us a cheeseburger from the snack menus, a Greek salad and the ham and olives from the cold starter menu. Each dish was more than substantial for a lunch. With a couple of drinks each (well it was nice weather so we lingered) total bill 504 Kn
Fabulous food - great beers ! Lovely warm day for this trip - so the skies were clear & the views were amazing !

Great place to have lunch on a sunny day obviously because of the views.
Kept it simple with the cheese burgers and fries for both me and my wife and was very enjoyable,beers are the most expensive though at 50 Kunos each.

After an exhausting 50m walk from the cable car station, we decided to indulge in the panoramic views, with a drink and a bite to eat, at the Panorama Restaurant. The staff were friendly and polite. Neither the food or the drink is cheap, but you get what you pay for and that is the location. You will not get this view anywhere else, while sipping your pina colada and eating a chicken club sandwich. A cocktail, beer and 2 up market sandwiches, will set you back around 300 kn (a time of review), so you decide.

Spectacular setting atop the hill. Very classy setup.
Good menu with snacks or full meals. 
OK prices considering the location and captive audience. 
We had club sandwiches which were really good with very tender chicken. 
Staff friendly service quick and attentive.
Worth visiting to top off the cable car visit.

We had walked up Mount Srd from our cruise ship docked just outside town and were mighty grateful that this restaurant was there. You can eat inside or out and as we only wanted a snack and a drink following our trek we chose to sit outside. A good decision as the view is fantastic. The food is good but if you order a burger their standard is medium so if you don't want to see it a little red in the middle ask for it to be well done. As you are high up and the wind can chill you at times of the year (we were there in Autumn) blue blankets are supplied for your use. The staff were very friendly and the place is well worth a visit.

We went here for lunch on Sunday 14th October. It was a beautiful sunny, warm day. We were a group of 8 and were given a fabulous table. The food and service were superb. Would thoroughly recommend it. Blankets and heaters available if it gets chilly. The indoor restaurant looked good too and had floor to ceiling glass windows. You can have everything from tea and coffee and cake to snacks or a full blown meal.

Booked a table here to ensure we were there for sunset and had the most wonderful experience. The food was excellent (steak, cooked to perfection and a large portion size). Accompanied by a beautiful bottle of Croatian red wine and service which was impeccable.
Having been here last year and being very disappointed that we hadn't booked and couldn't stay for food, only drinks, we were determined to get the full dining experience this year and it did not disappoint. Food, service, and drinks were amazing. I cannot put into words how much we enjoyed our whole evening here. Go. You will not be disappointed!!

Amazing! Beautiful breath taking view, thoughtful service, fleece blankets for your knees, excellent local wines. I loved the lasagne bolognese, great value and enough for two, in the UK this experience would cost a fortune, not here, here they put their customer first! Cannot recommend this enough!

Visited afternoon in October hadn't booked got table on the edge service fantastic waiters wear trilby hats polite and attentive my partner had a club sandwich and a beer I had the best kir royale made with champagne not prosseco !! Fantastic xperience the view is breathtaking a. Special place indeed !! Reasonably priced I thought !!

Had dinner here during my 3 night stay with my boyfriend in Dubrovnik. Right from the door we felt very welcome! Staff were attentive and very polite. We were fortunate enough to have a table that overlooked the sunset and it was a spectacular view!

Food was pretty standard..You pay for the view and the experience which is definitely worth it! 

If you want a cheaper night, get the cable car up and just enjoy the sunset and views from the the viewing points!

1) Amazing panorama view. View is especially nice during sunset.
2) Very friendly staff. Willingness to give the customer the best experience possible.
3) Price is a bit steep, but food is good. Must try is their hazelnut cake.
Excellent Dinner, beautiful view, great Service. It is must to be place in Dubrovnik!!! It was a great evening for us...
I really enjoyed the view, and if you ask me the prices are ok, cause nobody canpay you the view. Excellent food and staff, would go again.

Great views from the top station of the cable car over Dubrovnik and the islands. Was pretty chilly for eating outside, but the waiter brought us a heater and blankets. Prices are on the high side, but then the restaurant has a monopoly at the top of the mountain. But the views are worth the extra cost!
Great position beside the cable car , we stopped for a few drinks and glad we did , the stepped nature of the restaurant gives lots of opportunities to see the spectacular views!

After a morning on the wall this was the perfect place to stop for lunch and a lazy couple of hours. you could equally do this at night and watch the city light up. We arrived just before midday and got a table on the edge looking down over the city. Recommend this as the view is lovely. We had beer and a burger which both hit the spot! Prices very reasonable as well. Do it.

We were there a bit earlier before the tourist groups flooded in so got a table with scenery views. The food was average and coffee was overpriced. Waiters were not interested to check on customers and not so much selections on the menu. I'm not sure about others but the view wasn't as great as the rating, cable car's wire and cables hanging everywhere so not much of chance to take good photographs, however, seeing my your own eyes is good but this can be done in everywhere else in Dubrovnik as long as you are higher up.

Decided to have a coffee on the terrace which hugged the edge at the top, nice table allocation and blankets provided on each chair if you were feeling the cold. Efficient service and a lot of people were eating. We had drinks only on this occasion, one expresso, one cappuccino and 2 beers sitting in the sun
Thought we may be rushed off but left to our own devices which was nice
Bill coffees 58 KN c £7 and beers 80 KN 
Would eat next time
We were happy,we got a table without reservation. Amazing view, friendly staff, fast service. But, prices are very high. Anyway very nice experience.

It was lovely but pricy and if your not eating you don't get the tables at the edge for the better views but you can see any way. I thought the drinks were pricey but that's normally the case. The waiter we got was friendly enough. I think you can't go up and not sit with a cold drink and admire the views.

Tomato soup that was flavorful, and substantive; good breads; and interesting cheese platter; attentive service. And of course the views were marvelous. While the prices are high, even for Dubrovnik, they weren't that much higher than other good restaurants. I would come back for a long leisurely lunch with the best view.

When we went in cable car to view Dubrovnik we decided to have lunch in the Panorama. It is a lovely restaurant and the staff are all very friendly and helpful.The food is great with lots of choices and reasonably priced.

Mandatory pilgrimage from Dubrovnik to watch the sunset. You don't have to go in the restaurant but it's a good place to have your dinner. Booking essential. 

Can get windy as the sun drops so be prepared for that. 

Staff and service really first class. 

Food was a curates egg. Drinks, wine, starters were excellent. Our mains were a bit disappointing, mainly due to the quality of the meats rather than the preparation. 

I would imagine that this is a rare event as they were taken off the bill without a word - so the palce would go bust if this happens a lot. 

Overall, not the very best but recommended.

We got a cable car up to the top of the cliff. We had a table at the front of the cliff which has the best uninterrupted views. Food was great, service was outstanding - the best service I have ever had at a restaurant - the views are breathtaking. We saw the sun setting. Small bar area where we had drinks before dinner. Definitely have to visit. You have to book in advance as this place gets busy.

They unfortunately screwed up a lot off things during our visit: our booking, food and the bill. And this surely affects my scoring. BUT the place is really nice - awesome view, our waiter was really good and apologized and they gave us a discount for the trouble. 

I would still recommend you to go there for sure! We were probably just unlucky.

We visited Panorama mid September after seeing it on TripAdvisor. I booked a table through the Guest Relations desk at the Hotel Dubrovnik Palace a few days before and asked if they could ensure that we had a table with a good view at sunset. 

The cable car up to the restaurant/viewing point was very busy as it was close to sunset but once up there the views of Dubrovnik, the Old Town and surrounding areas were unbelievable especially as the sun was going down.
