We arrived at the restaurant slightly early but where told that they'd come and get us when our table was ready. 5 minutes later we were led to a table that probably offered the best view I've ever had during a meal. The waiter was more than too happy to take a great photo of the 3 of us and we were offered blankets to keep us warm as we ate (useful when you've got a 3 year old with you). 

The meal itself was just as tasty as the view and service was good too. It's a bit pricey for a meal when you include the cable car up but worth every penny when you're eating with views offered from this restaurant. 

Will not hesitate to book again the next time we visit Dubrovnik.

This was the most superb situation for a restaurant, and there was nothing to dissapoint.
The food, the service, the views everything was excellent.
If you are visiting Dubrovnik this is a 'must do'.
Take a ride up on the cable car to the restaurant, but recommend booking it is very popular.

Amazing place! You have to book in advance - 3 days in main season. Ask for the table with the view! You have to use the cableway, there is a long queue every day. The menu in restaurant is simple but everything is fresh and tasty. Bit pricey.

Our group of 6 climbed up the hill and we decided to have some well deserved desserts and somethibg to drink. Staff was not very friendly and often talking being turned away, which I felt a bit ignored. Food was not great but not bad either. Good views from restaurant and outdoors are nicely arranged that view is usually not obstructed and there is a feel of some privacy.

Great place but need to book in advance which we did, long queues on cable car to get there so allow plenty of time 
Views are spectacular 
Service is excellent

Wonderful lunch at outdoor table directly above old town. Pricey but well worth it.
Beef Carpaccio salad and cold beer - awesome

Stopped off from a taxi tour of Dubrovnik with very informative taxi driver. This place has amazing views and can also be reached by cable car. We only had a beer, but the food looked good. Very close to the borders of Bosnia and Montenegro.

We ate lunch here twice after traveling on the cable car, the food is standard fair and satisfying for lunch, sandwiches , burgers etc. The portions are quite large too

What swings it is the view - but watch out for the wasps

This restaurant gets very popular with people wishing to dine whilst watching the sunset. You would have to book in advance to guarantee one of the three rows from where you could actually see the bay/town and sunset. 

I had Tuna Salad whilst my partner had the Chicken Cesar Salad. We finished the evening with cocktails.

We felt like the waiting staff rushed us to leave so that they could use the table for the queue of people who had not booked.

Nothing special other than the location. Plenty of nicer restaurants in and around the town were you could linger over your drinks rather than clock watching for the last cable car.

We stopped here for a drink after taking the cable car up. It's nice to relax and enjoy a drink overlooking Dubrovnik but that's it. The service was relatively slow and it's a bit more on the pricey side.

Anyone that moans about the prices or the costs etc has no idea what they are talking about. For the views on offer, the service and the overall experience it's worth every penny, and it's not even that expensive. 2 of us had a Greek salad to start (shared), 2 large beers, 2 glasses of wine, a sprite, x2 cheeseburger and chips and a bottle of sparkling water. Came to 600 kuna. Yes that's more than you will pay in the old town in most places - but you also don't have the view that Panorama offers. And the friendly service too. Food was brilliant, portions were good but not huge. Great beer and wine. Make sure you do it. Couples, families , groups etc Good way to break up the cable car journey.

We literally stumbled across this place when using the cable cars. As it’s at the top of cable cars the views across Dubrovnik are totally amazing. We only had coffee and a soft drink and didn’t eat. You really do need to book well in advance to eat here it understandably gets booked up very quickly. Looking at the menu this is not a cheap place to eat but seeing the food being delivered to other tables it is clearly a fine dining restaurant and the service to match. Even our coffee and soft drinks were presented beautifully and the service was excellent.

Panorama is a gorgeous vantage point from which to watch the sun set. We had cakes and drinks which were affordable, and waiters are attentive, friendly and speak English well. They provide warm blankets to customers to protect you from the chill up top, and you can also ask them to turn on the heating units placed next to tables.

Be sure to reserve the tables by the edge (with the best unobstructed view) in advance - we walked in at 5pm and had to sit further inside (there were 3 tables and a walkway between us and the view). Despite restaurant being on multiple levels we had to walk towards the edge where other diners were in order to get an unobstructed picture of the sunset. 

That said, view in general is beautiful - our waiter Mario helped take a photo of us at our table that showed the sea and old town below. 

No restroom attached - you'll need to go to the cable car station a few meters away for that.

We decided to Grab some lunch at this place.
As it was very hot that day, we stayed inside und the building. The ac worked well too. The lunch was good n the price was acceptable. 
If its only around max 25 C, I'd prefer to get a table outside as the view is so much better.

A cable car ride to get us up there but the food and service at the Panorama were very much worth the trip. Cocktails and lunch were excellent and of very good quality.
The staff were a great advert for the restaurant and very helpful.

Having reached the top of the cable car, we decided to eat in the Panorama restaurant.
The views were magnificent, the menu and wine list varied and the quality of food great.
We spent two hours over a nice bottle of Pino Gregic Croatian white wine, and the largest and most delicious club sandwich 
I have ever seen, this also came with lovely crisp fries.
The waiters were friendly and very helpful, and help make our lunch a truly memorable experience.
A visit to this restaurant is a must.
Very tasty and good quality food! Excellent view! Great service) I loved this place. It is already my 5° time here.

Definitely worth a visit for a drink or a small lunch, not for dinner. Views are best in the day and they provide blankets as it can get quite windy. Got a complimentary pudding as well and we were moved to a better table once one became free. Service was friendly as always in Croatia. 

Don't forget your camera!!

Booked a table here for my friends 50th whom was on holiday with us in Dubrovnik. I'd arranged everything from the UK via email and the restaurant went out of their way to make sure all arrangements went to plan. You get to Panorama via Cable Car which adds to the experience, with fantastic views of Dubrovnik town. Upon arrival, the restaurant had reserved us a table with amazing views. We went up in daylight, watched the sun set and then dined through the evening to see the town walls light up. As you'd expect, the food was lovely - overall, a memorable occasion which will stay with us forever.

Decided to meet some friends up here for lunch. Not a fan of restaurants at these places as usually the food is either bad or worse. Surprise ! The table tat we had was almost at the edge. The view was just amazing. To see the old town as well greater Dubronvik was awesome. Ferries leaving and arriving at the port. Had a great bottle of white, with an excellent chefs squid plate. My wife had the seafood risotto, which was not great but above average. The rice was just overcooked a touch. Overall a great lunch experience. Don't just come up. Stay and enjoy the experience.

Let's be honest....everyone eats here for the stunning view. Surprisingly, the restaurant has a lot of positives other than the view. The outside is set up in a tiered fashion so that no matter where you sit, you get a great view. Opt for sitting outside as long as the weather is decent because they have blankets and heat lamps to keep you warm. The service was good and the food was good and not overpriced. Wasn't my favorite meal in Dubrovnik but it was definitely above average.
Gorgeous place to eat and drink. Phenomenal views! Not too pricey, you don't mind paying a little more for a drink when you've got the views to compliment! Sunset time is beautiful but very busy.

Located on top of the hill and overlooking Dubrovnik. Beautiful spot to spend some time there and have a great meal. The perfect timing would be around sunset to have the best view. I went there for dinner and we had a w0onderful and tasty meal. You can access the restaurant by the cable car but note that the last ride is at ten pm. We took a cab and the ride is not too long. The staff are friendly and helpful and they directly handed us some blankets since the weather was a bit chilly. All the table (or at least most of them) overlook the city. The food was quite good. We had two appetizers (a fish platter (exquisite) and a cheese platter) and each one of us had a steak. Wine was on the menu as well (local wine which was great). 
The place is definitely a must try. They do close at 11 pm in the not so touristic seasons and open later during summer. The prices are mid-range and for all that we had the total amount of the bill was not too expensive. The only comment that I would give is that they should have a nicer choice of music. The DJ was mixing all kinds of music. If you are around Dubrovnik, definitely to the effort to go have a delicious meal in Panorama.

I don't think you will ever find a restaurant with a better view than this! Add to that the excellent service and the delicious food, and you can't go far wrong. The prices are a little high, but it's worth paying it for the special view as a treat. I would recommend booking ahead if you want one of the tables on the edge of the terrace with the best views. The terrace has heaters and blankets are provided, so it is still comfortable even if it become a little windy. For the best views, arrive an hour before sunset and watch the magical old city of Dubrovnik change from light to dark beneath you. A very memorable experience!

I visited around lunchtime on 26/9/16. I waited only a very short time for a table, and chose to sit on the side with views of the mountains rather than the sea - still a stunning view! The service was extremely warm and friendly, and I didn't feel pressured or hurried even as I did stay for some time to enjoy the view. All drinks and food arrived fairly promptly after ordering. My steak sandwich was delicious (though I wished it had been made on more substantial bread than white toast). Coffee after my meal was very nice too. As you might expect, the cost here is paying for food and also for the incomparable view, but even so, I didn't think my meal of sandwich, soft drink, and coffee was excessively expensive. 

I reiterate: the location and view really is amazing! I highly recommend enjoying a long and relaxing meal here to appreciate the beautiful Croatian coast.

After walking over Mt Srdj, we decided to try to get into restaurant but did not want to wait. Got a table on edge immediately and enjoyed even better views and thrilled at overlooking such beauty! To our surprise the food was excellent along with drinks! Glad we chose something very touristic because it was a very romantically setting! Almost could touch cable car as it floated along. We were not rushed to leave so we stayed a while and took in view!

If you go to the top do make time for a lunch in the sun at this great location. Do try to get a table by the cliff edge - it can be breezy but they come round with blankets should you feel the cold. The food was good as was the beer. It will cost a bit more but remember where you are and the view - enjoy. Very pleasent staff as well.

Decided to have a drink whilst at the top of the cable car run. The views are simply stunning but you pay for it!! Approx £18 for two beers and an apple juice! The service was second to none - made very welcome!

This restaurant is the one with the sunset view when you reach on the top via the cable car. The view is good but the thick cable car wires spoil the perfect view. And food is priced steeply and the portion size of side dishes is tiny. They insist on reservation though clearly some tables were vacant. A good view though not perfect.
We pre booked before we travelled from London and Anita found us a lovely table. We arrived 16 minutes early but that was no problem for them.

Headed up about 6pm on a Saturday night. If u want a great spot for the sunset id advise booking in advance but in saying that we did score a good table for 2 inside but we ran to beat the rest of our cable car companions lol (all outside tables were booked I had overheard someone say). Service was fantastic, seafood dinner was delicious and also well priced. Overall a fantastic night and highly recommend.

Went to panorama restaurant for early lunch. Table overlooking Dubrovnik and the view was absolutely stunning. The food was good and so was the service. Think we were lucky with our timing so go early if as was really filling up by the time we were leaving. Was well worth a visit.
Superb views and delicious light lunch of wine, cheese and olives - perfect end to our stay in Dubrovnik....definitely recommended!

Restaurant is accessible at the top landing of the cable car. Highest "attraction" viewpoint overseeing Old Town and the best sunset view of the ocean on one side and the mountains on the other side. Definitely recommend making a reservation ahead of time requesting for a table if you'd prefer to either be inside with the view or outside on the terrace with a view. It can get windy up on the terrace but they have heat lamps and blankets for guests outside. If you don't want to wait for a table, one could also grab a drink and stand in a roped off section with a view facing the ocean and Old Town. 

The food was great and the waitstaff was attentive. The view was the main highlight of the restaurant and the waitstaff understands this and do not rush guests during their stay. In fact, they went above and beyond to make sure the guests' were comfortable during their stay while enjoying the views.

My fiancé and I decided to lunch here spontaneously after taking the cable car up. It's on the pricier side but worth EVERY penny. We were originally seated slightly away from the edge but as soon as a table left we were asked if we would like to move, which we did. The view is breathtaking and our food was fresh and delicious (recommend the the trio of dalmatia) unforgettable and so romantic.

The restaurant is at the top of the mountain, open all day/ evening and is accessible via the cable car which also runs all day/ evening (until 22:00). 

The food was quite expensive. We weren’t that hungry so just opted for desserts and a cocktail. We had the walnut cake and the Dubrovnik/ Croatian Caramel… not bad but not amazing. The location was beautiful though, as long as you’re sat next to the windows.

We’d been up on the mountain all day so were still in shorts and t-shirts in the evening – we felt quite underdressed to be honest! It wasn’t black tie or anything but people were clearly there for a fine dining evening experience ha.The staff were nice though.

The view is the main attraction of this restaurant. We went for dinner and the sun was coming down, so Dubrovnik looked amazing. In order to get the best views, it was necessary to make a reservation a couple of weeks before our visit. Once there, we just ordered a couple of appetizers, but they were really delicious and pretty big actually. The service, though, it's a bit slow since they always have so many people. It was overall a great experience.

You can reach this wonderful restaurant by cable car. The view was like a fairy tale. Blaz from the staff was definitely an artist in serving and advising about the foods and wines in the menu. But you must take your jacket with you because it is really too high to be warm :)

We were advised by friends to go here so we went on our first night in Dubrovnik. We emailed ahead to reserve a cliff side table. When we arrived the staff were very friendly immediately and showed us to our table. The view was not quite as we expected so we asked to move to another table right on the edge with a better view in my opinion. This was no problem at all and staff handled it very well and were very professional and polite. The view is nothing but spectacular. I suggest arriving just before sunset as this is truly special. We were recommended a lovely local wine which was not cheap but very good none the less. I had the prawns buzzara and my partner had the stuffed squids. Both dishes were a decent portion and delicious. We also enjoyed the grilled vegetables cooked to perfection. Yes this restaurant is geared towards the tourist market mainly but it absolutely delivers and you get good value for your money. The setting is very romantic and makes for special evening out. Also worth noting is that you can pre book your cable car tickets to get up to the restaurant online to avoid queuing to buy tickets on the day as it can get very busy. Definitely worth doing when in Dubrovnik!

A must visit tourist attraction as well as an amazing place to stop for a drink and something to eat, whether that be a snack or a quick bite. Nice and attentive staff with reasonably priced drinks and food, but the view beats all comers. Even if you aren't hungry, at least stop for a drink and try and get a table at the front to gain an amazing unobstructed view of Dubrovnok and surrounds - a photographers dream! Well worth the queue for the cable car. Can highly recommend.

Panorama was the perfect choice to celebrate our wedding anniversary and I would highly recommend it!

We arrived a bit early as we weren't sure how long the cable car would take - after taking some pics and having a look around we went to check if our table might be ready early - luckily it was!

We had a front row table on the terrace at 8pm - the view of Dubrovnik and the sea tinkling below was utterly mesmerising! You couldn't ask for a more romantic setting!

I ordered Dalmatian Trio to start and my husband had beef carpaccio- both were yummy and we ended up sharing mine as it was a big portion. The octopus was tender - probably the best I've had! I then had fillet of the day which was Tuna - it was cooked perfectly and very tasty. My husband had octopus which was also cooked brilliantly. We were having a rest before picking a dessert when our waiter arrived with a lovely hazelnut dessert (on the house) with 'happy anniversary' piped on - it was such a thoughtful touch and very much appreciated! The service throughout our meal was great - just the right amount of attention and there whenever we needed (even snapping some pictures for us) whilst never being overbearing.

I booked the table at Panorama about 10 days before as I wanted to ensure to had a first row terrace table for our celebration - the restaurant came back to me quickly on email and the whole process was very easy! I'd recommend booking if you want to be sure of the best spot.

This restaurant really made our anniversary special - an unbeatable view paired with great food and service at a very reasonable price!

Four of us had lunch at Panorama Restaurant at the end of August. I am happy that I had thought to reserve a table a week before we arrived in Dubrovnik. We were seated at a table right at the edge with spectacular views of the city below. We lingered a bit over drinks before lunch just so we could take full advantage of the spot. 

Our waiter was friendly and very attentive. The food was good - good enough to make the experience one we will always happily remember.

We came here as a family of 7 and got a great table by the edge looking out over the bay and Dubrovnik. The staff was really nice as was the food. Prices were ok, not too expensive considering the view. You have to take the cable car up which is 120 Kuna for a return, taxi takes too long. Definitely recommend this place!

This is at the top of the cable car. We sat outside and the views are truly spectacular. The service was fantastic and we relaxed and enjoyed delicious strawberry daiquiris whilst waiting a short time for our lunch. The risotto with shrimp and courgettes was delicious. It was listed as a starter but it was plenty for my lunch. My daughter really enjoyed the chicken and pumpkin seed salad. The dressing was delicious and there was plenty of chicken. My son enjoyed his club sandwich but he said it needed some mayonnaise as it was a bit dry, however the chicken on it was very good quality. 600 kn or $120 AUD for everything.

A must after going up with cable car. I didnt try the food. I think it is more oriented for drinks and coffee to sit and enjoy the great views of dubrovnik, and take some nice photos. Should be tried for sure.
View is amazing. Small restaurant with great food and service. Visit if u can. I luv it. Visit this place if u can.

It was just a perfect afternoon!

I came to the restaurant alone to have a coffee and to enjoy the view while waiting for my partner.
Got served a lovely cappuccino and attentive waiter looked after me while I was alone :)
Then, when my partner arrived, we got an amazing table with the breathtaking view on the old town and the sea.
We ordered just a snack: sandwich with fries and a tuna salad. All fresh and very tasty!
Gorgeous weather, friendly staff and nice music in the background (not to noisy) made it a really nice addition too it all. We enjoyed our meal very much.

Prices relatively high but still acceptable so don't get discourage it is worth paying for the experience! 

Overall really a perfect afternoon, highly recommended "to-do" in Dubrovnik!

The best are the great view over dubrovjnik.

Service are good 

Food Nothing to be thriller about ok but not more.
Good wine knowledge from the waiter. 

A little tourist trap and overpriced.

3 of 4 meat dishes was not cooked as they should.

Food 3
Winelist 3.5
Atmosphere 5
Service 3.5
Price 3

Can not really recommend
You have to take the cable car to get to the restaurant. Cable car cost is 120 kn per person round-trip. Great view! A very pricey ambience.

Lovely little outdoor restaurant overlooking Dubrovnik. It's amazing to enjoy a snack and a drink looking out over such a fantastic view. We went for lunch and I had a beef carpaccio salad which was delicious. The service was good and the staff were very friendly. You maybe pay a little bit for the view, but it's by no means overly expensive and you can't really begrudge it in such a beautiful setting!

We decided to book Panorama after reading the great reviews on here and it didn't disappoint! Given its location it could serve any food and charge whatever price it liked, so I was a little skeptical that reviews were based more on the view than the food. However, it exceeded our expectations! We booked a table for 6:30pm in order to see the city in both dark and light (booking is a MUST if you want a perfect view). We visited on a Monday evening and it was almost fully booked. We were seated promptly to our table, located right on the edge with uninterrupted views of the city and Lapad. My husband and I both ordered steak and it was cooked to perfection. A little on the pricier side but not extortionate given the setting. As the sun faded the waiters brought around fleece blankets to take off the chill; as it did get a little windy. I wouldn't hesitate going back here. It was a beautiful romantic dinner with amazing views of the city. If you are visiting Dubrovnik and taking the cable car ride then this restaurant is a must!

Amazing views and lovely restaurant setting. We went at lunch and had to wait about 10-15 minutes for a table but it was worth it. The service was really friendly and attentive. We had salads which were huge and really tasty- one tuna and one chicken, really filling and good value for money. Would highly recommend.
the views are to die for and the food was lovely, however a bit expensive but you pay that bit more for the view

the panorama has one of the best views i have ever experienced whilst eating dinner 
the service and the staff are fantastic 
we sat down for dinner just as the sun was setting and it was breathtaking 
i would recommend the duck on the menu or the seafood dishes all cooked to perfection 
its a must for a romantic dinner

The views are magnificent, and eating at table on the edge to watch the sun set is definitely a memorable experience. (Booking essential). The food is good and the service efficient and friendly. Overall, recommended. (And if you don’t want to eat, you must make sure you have drink in the bar).
Beautiful place with incredible view of Dubrobnik town and coast! Great food, Nice staff! Must see when in Dubrovnik!
It is located on top of cable car. Only proper restaurant. Siting both outside and inside. Fantastic view . Can spend hours. Booking in advance is good . Slightly expensive but worth

An absolute must when you visit Dubrovnik. The views from the top of the cable car station are stunning so why not sit down and enjoy some beautiful food while you are there. We were there for lunch and all I can say is whoa.our waiter was absolutely super . He made sure our every need was catered for. Apologies if I have got his name wrong but thank you blaz.

Great! Everything was perfect! 
Food, view, service are excellent.

A must visit when in town
Highly recommended

My wife and I visited on 7th, September 2016. having travelled up in the Cable car, the views from the restaurant are stunning. It was a great location to have a cold beer whilst enjoying the views. The staff were very attentive and informative. If you do the Cable car ride, then you must enjoy a drink at the restaurant

This meal was my treat for braving the cable car! Had a good front table at lunch time . I had the shrimp and asparagus risotto and my Husband had Lasagne with a lovely bottle of Rose Wine The views over the Town were breath taking. Service was very attentive. Would highly recommend

Recommended by a friend, we decided to take the cable car to the top the hill and enjoy the panorama view with some refreshment in this restaurant. The view is speechless and restaurant is perfect for that. However the food is actually surprising high quality for such a "tourist" place. The service was also exceptional. He made a small mistake in our order and gavr us free coffee and discount for return. The right way to treat tourist and do tourist business!

Worth eating at this restaurant if only having a coffee or drinks to enjoy the views. We did not try the food when we were there because it was only 10 in the morning so we had cappuccinos, so I cannot say anything about the food, but the service was great. Food is pricey, but you cannot beat the panoramic views of Dubrovnik.

The restaurant is acessible via cablecar, hiking path or paved road (very narrow on some places, people who suffer from vertigo - be advised).

The location is amazing, with a wonderfull view on the old city of Dubrovnik. Me and my family had calamary and grilled chicken for lunch, and we've chosen chocolate cake with walnuts for dessert. 

The restaurant itself had a pleasant vibe, clean, with some lounge music in the background - but not too loud.

The waitress was very polite was always there when needed. After our order, the food came after about 15 minutes. Long enough to chat a little bit and appreciate the view (our sitting places were next to the glass wall).

The chicken and calamary were served with ratatouille and with a small basket with bread inside. Both were well prepared and quite delicious. 

The chocolate cake was also delisious, although maybe a little bit too sweet.

All in all, it was a very good meal, and at the end we had such a pleasant suprise, we could not believe our eyes:
Instead of paying 70 Euros total, we got a discount of 30%!!

I'm definitely glad that I've visited this amazing place, and I would recommend it to everyone who visits Dubrovnik!

P.S. Be sure to make a reservation!
If you are in Dubrovnik you simply have to go to this restaurant. Have a drink and snack and enjoy the view to Old Dubrovnik!

Totaly worth going up there and eat on the restaurant! The food was super good (we both eat lansange). And the drinks were also good, the veiw is amazing and the service is good! A must do when you are in Dubrovnik! // Camilla From sweden

Called in for a coffee after a buggy trip and stayed for lunch. Views were fab, staff friendly although service a little slow. Like all of Dubrovnik it was expensive but portions are large - we shared two appetisers and this was plenty for lunch - especially liked the charcuterie plate which came with lovely bread and olives.

Make sure you book a trip to this restaurant during your stay in Dubrovnik, and aim to eat over sunset. Request a table by the rail and you will be treated to magnificent views of the old town and a glorious sunset. 

Sadly the food wasn't quite up to the standard I was expecting as it is a sister restaurant of one of the best restaurants in Dubrovnik but it was still tasty. 

You can walk up the mountain but I would recommend the cable car however they do not run that frequently

Book several days in advance if you want a cliff side table. We queued for 15 mins for a table outside but the queue moved fairly quickly. Attentive service. Good quality dinner with both cheap and expensive options. Fantastic romantic setting watching sun set as you have dinner. Blankets provided as it gets cooler but best to remember layers of clothes. Good choice of wines and beers. I'd recommend the chicken caesar salad or cheeses to start followed by a fish dish eg the octopus was excellent.
I wass there with my wife and the waithers were nice,the food was exelent,the bill in my opinnion a little to much but you forget the bill when the sun set begins.

This restaurant at the top is very expensive and the food served with style and good. However, it should be excellent for the price you pay not good. Would not eat there again purely because of the price. The food was good. I would have a drink there instead.

I visited the Panoramic restaurant with family in late August. The cable car journey is really something to see with great views of the old town, islands and the coast line. 
The restaurant is in a lovely location I really enjoyed my experience but I have been used to faster service as I live in a city so it may just be something I'm used to. The service however was still very good and I will always remember this dinner as I watched the set whilst we ate. I would definitely dine here again.

We had a wonderful lunch here, seated outside overlooking Dubrovnik..stunning views and atmosphere and very good food too (Chicken and Pumpkin seed salad ! Yum!).. best cocktail avaliable in Dubrovnik (a "BBC")..and very kind, considerate service. A small mistake (quickly rectified) , and they waived our entire bill, though we would have been very happy to pay, and we weren't complaining (and would not have complained on here)..I don't know of many places where you can get such good service in such a spectacular setting.Thank you to the staff for a memorable experience.

We really enjoyed our visit to this Resturant. The view is fantastic, however the variety of food is not much. My daughter ordered a cocktail drink and she found a fly. The waiter apologies and he did all his best to make us happy by giving free desserts and drinks to all of us. The food was nice. We had to pay for the cable car to reach the Resturant. In total is was expensive dinner but with nice view before the sunset . We couldn't find reservation outside , however we were luck as it was very windy that day and our table was inside. It is a must place to visit.

Ok, so we didn't exactly have a full meal here but used it as a a coffee and cake stop. The staff were really attentive and it wasn't a problem that we only wanted snacks. We turned up on spec at around 2pm on a Saturday and easily got a table. There were some fussy people waiting who only wanted a table right at the edge of the cliff. I think all tables have a great angle of the views as they're on individual plateaus (ok, if you prebook you'll probably get a fabulous view at the edge). It's pretty windy at the restaurant and they have industrial strength parasols to cope with the conditions! Yes, it's not cheap (hey it's Dubrovnik, what is?!) but treat yourself this once even if it's just for a coffee.

Good restaurant with a beautiful and impressive view. The waiters are very kind, the good kitchen and the correct bill for the location. 
We spent a pleasant romantic moment!!!

Might have been a little windy as we looked down on the city below but provided great entertainment as the waiters hats flew across the restaurant. Superb view and location worth the cable car up. Staff were excellent as was the food. Blankets provided for those that did not like the wind but saying that l would highly recommend a visit here would love to go back on a barmy summers nights expect the nighttime views are even better. Not to be missed

I was there on dinner with my girlfriend and we were so amazed with a view that with didn't concentrate so much on food. But the food was also good. Great place to take someone on date. Prices are moderate for Dubrovnik.

The first place we ate in Dubrovnik was this place and we were not dissapointed. Although we went for more lunchtime snack meals, the food and service and of couse the view were excellent. It really got our holiday off to an impressive start. The only negative is not about the restaurant but that it is quite expensive to get there and back in the cable car. Having said that I wouldn't want to have missed the experience

View is just amazing, and food is very good. i ordered steak, and is well served. caipirinha was not a Brazilian, but good! make sure to ask for more sugar on the caipirinha. 

servers are very polite with 5 start treatment. 

i would recommend to any one.

You can't beat the location and view of Restaurant Panorama. The atmosphere is great for either a romantic or family dinner, and the food is amazing. I highly recommend the octopus! The service was also great. 
Don't forget to factor in the cost of the cable car! The cable car was a bit pricey, but well worth the cost, as it is a fun experience with incredible views! This is a great way to experience Dubrovnik.

Visited today for lunch around 1.15 pm. Entrance 'guarded' by disinterested waitress. No one else in restaurant but only allowed seat at door because she says she was expecting a large party and they would get window seats. Had steak sandwiches. Quite expensive and meat almost raw. French fries OK. No one else came to restaurant during our half hour lunch nor up to the time we returned on the cable car. Not a pleasant visit.

Had dinner here. Food was good. You need to reserve to get the tables with the best view. We stiil had a good view over the mountains to Bosnia. The staff were great and did not seem to mind everyone leaving their tables to watch the stunning sunset. The food was good, the prices reasonable but it is the view and the sunset that makes the place.

Exactly what you might expect from this sort of tourist attraction- fantastic location and views but average food. Not great, not bad, just average. Prices on the high side for the quality of the food but if you can go there, it's still worth it for the view.

For better table with a view I recommend make reservation. During our visit of Dubrovnik dinners were reserved 5 days in advance. We decided to reserved table for lunch instead, but it was great experience too. Food was really tasty, top service and we felt relaxed and satisfyig. Highly recommend!

Well worth the cable ride. Panorama has wonderful views of Dubrovnik old town and the food was lovely too. Not too keen on Croatian red wine but the one we got in here was fine. Staff were lovely, all very helpful. Definitely worth a visit. There's also a dune buggy ride at the top for the adventurous. There were plenty of tables at all different levels and an inside restaurant for wet weather.

Booked in advance, I think that's necessary. Also, leave enough time to wait in line for the cable car - we were 15 mins late. Received best table (due to reservation I assume) and had a nice meal. The food was not the best and if it were not for the view I would think this restaurant is just OK. The view is worth the trip and the meal. Booked for about 1 hour before sunset and it was perfect. All in all good experience but probably would not return if we ever make it back to this amazing city.

We stopped in for a drink on a hot day but stayed for a snack and a coffee after visting the lookout on the cable car.
The food and drink was a little pricey, but you pay for the wonderful views. It was so peaceful and cool in the restraunt that what we thought was going to be a short 20 minute "Beer break" ended up being a lot longer after adding a snack and coffee to it.
The food and coffee were good but not great, but in a place like this, you come for the view and not the food.

Really comfortable restaurant near a cable car. Amazing view to neverending sea and wild mountains. Waiters in restaurant were very kind and we had an opporunity to eat one of the best hamburgers ever :) I really thank you for this nice and romantic experience!

Can't rate this restaurant highly enough, we went at sunset and the views were incredible. The food was great too despite being a tourist hotspot. We had two starters, two mains and 4 beers which came to approx £80, the starters were so big that neither of us could finish out mains. Definitely worth a visit.

Call it a personal bias, but how many restaurants with a breath taking view actually offer a decent menu... I can count on the fingers of one single hand how many I have actually been to. Panorama is touristy, there's no denying that, but the food is acceptable considering It is located at a major tourist spot. If you are planning to come for dinner and watch the sunset, book a few days in advance. We did not have reservations, but at 3 pm there were few people waiting for lunch so we managed to snatch a table with a breath taking view of Dubrovnik. After your first bottle of Pošip, a local white wine, life becomes more than perfect...

Very first visit to this place and what a wow factor got a taxi there as cable car had big ques. Food was lovely staff so helpful and polite watched the sun set which was stunning this place is definitely worth a visit.

This restaurant is located on top of Mt Srd and has a magnificent view of old town Dubrovnik and the ocean. We went up in the cable car, which was interesting. I had contacted them a couple of weeks prior to reserve a table next to the railing, and was happy with the table we were assigned. The wait staff was attentive, though a little over-worked. The food and the local wine we ordered were good. The best part of the evening was the spectacular sunset we could see, right from our table. I am happy to recommend the Panorama restaurant and would suggest that you reserve a table in a good location to catch the sunset.

Clearly, the view is amazing, which enticed us (two couples) to stop for a drink. The waiter was funny and attentive and suggested some snacks, which we happily accepted. We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food, great service and reasonable prices (for a touristy-spot). We stayed for a second round of drinks and lunch, which was wonderful. Definitely worth a stop.
We had a wonderful lunch enjoying the beautiful view. It was a little pricey, but the food was great while we enjoyed the view. We had a prime table but felt no rush to spoil our leisurely meal.

What an amazing surprise this restaurant was. A terraced setting on the mountain top overlooking Dubrovnik and it's stunning red roofed Old City. Our table was at the mountain edge and we were seated by an amazing member of the staff Marijo. We had delicious cocktails while watching the sunset. Our starters were salads, both of which were delicious. Steaks for mains were cooked to perfection and so very tasty. Desserts, Irish coffee, complimentary grapa followed. We were treated so well and after a few hours made the return cable car trip to the city. Don't miss out on a meal at sunset here, you will not be disappointed. Also very good value for money, you don't need a fortune to experience this.

Had lunch here whilst visiting Dubrovnik, we went up via cable car, had to wait about 2 mins to be seated as it was busy. Great service by all waiters. I had Tuna salad and a glass of wine which were both delicious. My boyfriend had a burger and a beer, he said it was one of the best burgers he had. Lovely views from restaurant.
The view is amazing but the tables that have a view are booked two weeks before. The waiters not friendly at all, the food is normal.I personally didn't like it that much

We travelled up via cable car and were delighted to discover this restaurant. We enjoyed a very pleasant lunch here with good wine and welcoming, friendly and efficient service. Both vegetarians and non-vegetarians are well catered for and the views from the restaurant are spectacular. Although it is slightly expensive the feeling of well-being it generates makes the cost very worthwhile. We would, therefore, highly recommend it.
If you want to have the most beautiful view over the city of Dubrovnik this is the right place for you.

When you do the trip up the mountain by cable car - especially in the late afternoon do not miss to have a sunset drink there with stunning views over the city and coastline. I had a very well down Mojito there - can not say anything about the food as we did not eat, but locationwise it will be for sure very nice for lunch or dinner.
Excellent ice coffee, very helpful staff and the view, well, it's amazing obviously! We were here around noon, it was boiling hot but at least it wasn't crowded.

We could not fault the experience. Every member of staff was polite and welcoming
from booking the table to the waiting staff on the night. We had a front line table so the view was stunning. Cocktails great, food great. No complaints from our 3 teenagers either. Perfect evening, would highly recommend.

We wondered into this restaurant on a whim during sunset after taking the cable car. We were luckily accommodated in between reservations. I suggest making a reservation ahead so you are not turned away like so many others we saw. I'd also suggest you ask for a reservation for the best view to the sunset. My wife and I loved the grilled octopus, cheese plate, and the staff recommended local wine.

We booked a table 2 days in advance and asked for a 'view' table! It was gorgeous! We booked the table for 18.45 and had the table until 21.00 (although we were not rushed off) - we went up on the cable car about 17.30 and had an hour or so wandering around the summit taking pictures. We then ate our dinner watching the sunset and then after the sunset, all the lights being turned on.
The food was very good as well, and considering the location, was only slightly more expensive than restaurants in Dubrovnik. Staff were very friendly and service was excellent.

This is the only restaurant at the top of the cable car and the prices reflect the captive market. Having said that, the quality was good so it's not a rip-off! They do coffee, drinks, wine, ice cream, light lunches, etc. and on a sunny day it's great just to laze around before going back down the cable car...
We had an amazing dinner with an even more amazing view! The best thing to do is to arrive before the sun sets! Great food and top of the line service!

My wife and I went there for Dinner and it was unforgetable. You will need to book well in advance. They have two sittings in high season - we took the 9pm one which was perfect as at that time it was dark and the view over the old town was brilliant. It seems like every table has a view of the old town. The menu selection is not huge but we were very happy with our dishes. Service was first class and prices were OK for such a fantastic location. Suggest you take the cable car at 7pm so you get plenty of pictures during the daylight. The sunset was spectacular. You can have a drink in the resturaunt bar while you wait for your table. All in All an unforgetable experience.

As you would imagine, with the only total view of the city, tables (and prices) here are at a premium. We only stayed for a drink and we found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. They found us a nice table overlooking Dubrovnik and seemed to communicate in a number of languages which is great because there is a real mix of people here and also pretty impressive! Our drinks cost us a little more than in other places but we're far from extortionate, from what we saw of the food menu that looked fairly reasonable too and it smelt yummy! It's well worth stopping here for a drink and a rest and the view if noting else before you continue on your Dubrovnik adventures.

The wind pushed aside our plans for dining outside but we were seated by a Windows so we still loved our view. This is not a place for those who fear heights. You have to get hear by tram or cab and quite frankly the cab ride was scary (tram was not going due to wind). Cocktails were great as was out starters. Server so very helpful in wine. When my friend didn't like her original wine choice he promptly brought another for her to taste. My tuna entrée was cooked to perfection. No complaints. Completely local after dinner drink was a nice touch to a delightful evening. Although many suggested that Panorama is all view, I disagree. The food and the service go hand in hand with the amazing sights.

Front table booked for the views which are amazing.
The meal was also was amazing cheese plater for starter then onto a plate of king prawns, small lobsters. All washed down with local prosecco.
To spoil things not offered dessert menu.
To Finish off,the sunset over the Eliphanti islands.

I visited the Panorama Restaurant with my boyfriend last week and it's an experience I'll never forget. Everything was perfect. The view is like nothing I've seen before and the photographs will never do it justice. The staff were extremely polite and took time to ensure we were happy - their photography skills were also excellent. The food was delightful - the portion sizes were large and the menu offers plenty of choice. I would recommend emailing and booking ahead to ensure you get a table at the terrace.

What a fantastic experience. Myself and my partner visited Croatia in August this year and one of our day trips out was specifically to go up the cable car and to visit the Panorama restaurant. We were most definitely not disappointed with our time spent there. The staff were incredibly friendly and the food was brilliant. We were lucky enough to have the most central table and probably the best view overlooking Dubrovnik. We had originally wanted to sit outside but would have had to have been put on on a waiting list as of course lots of people wanted to sit outside. I'm going to say I'm happier that we sat inside as we had air-conditioning and still one of the best views in a restaurant I have ever seen. The restaurant is smaller than I thought. We went around lunch time and I was surprised how quiet it was. Just brilliant, a must.

If you want a wonderful dining experience with an amazing view of Dubrovnik & the Adriatic, this is the place! We were met by friendly staff, very helpful and pleasant waiter...the food was delicious, cheesecake for desert melted in your mouth, and a spectacular view of the sunset!! A definite must if you're in the area...and a reservation is helpful.
It's a "must" place to go if you visit Dubrovnik. Try to be there to see the sunset ; the view and the colors are beautiful. We tasted the meet plates and we enjoyed a lot !

As per the title, dinner was fantastic! The food was superb. I had the duck - I would recommend it to anyone. Service was very friendly and prompt. Dinner was served quickly and the waiter was extremely knowledgeable of the menu. Would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants a relaxing dinner. If I am ever in Croatia again, I will be back.

View was incredible but is free from the viewing tower and the mountain itself. Wine was good, staff were varied in their attentiveness, however the food was awful. Neither my friend nor I could finish our dishes (seafood risotto & a steak salad). Would recommend getting the cable car up, and maybe getting a drink if you want to stay a while but seriously recommend eating before or after your trip. Hopefully they improve the food as it has such great potential!
Just had a quick visit, sadly all the tables at the edge of the terrace were taken but the food was good, the service attentive and the prices reasonable for such a prime location.

Apart from the obvious music cock up where the whole eve they seemed to have one track on repeat without breaks this place is truly lovely offering that all important personable service that we all love.

Again I'd booked ahead of time and relayed my wishes and to their word they met my requests with that all important smile.

Again recognised for my mothers birthday holiday they too bought out a lovely sparkly surprise on a yummy desert to celebrate.

Great views...
Great times...
Service with a smile...

LOVELY so thank you Panorama!!!

Nice and chill restaurant with an outside terrasse on top of the hills facing old Dubrovnic.
Tables are set on small terrases, giving a intimate environnement.
It must be done at sunset with nice glass of wine and of course any of their seafoods main course..
It's just perfect for a romantic dinner !!!
Carefull, a light jacket is needed when sun leave.. Otherwise, they still have light blankets to keep the coldest ones warms ;)

The service was excellent, we were met with a smile, seated and then greeted by a great waiter. The food was marvelous. There was easy listening music playing in the background and we ate outside on the terrace. The view over Dubrovnik, the Adriatic and the sunset were all breath taking. We loved everything about our experience. If you plan to visit during high tourist season, be sure to make reservations well in advance.
The view from the terraced restaurant was beautiful .The food & drinks were good for lunch .Nice way to chill out .The waiters were polite & helpful
One of the most spectacular views I have seen in 6 continents of travelling. Superb service friendly and attentive but not over bearing. Great food. Would 100% recommend a visit!

We went here at sunset, without a reservation, as it was fully booked for two days. But the staff were very accommodating, they found us a table and then we were moved to a fantastic table with the perfect view. I would advise to book early on or go late evening. The view was spectacular, with the staff and the food matching this. I had a honey and nut duck, with green beans, which was incredible. By far, my favourite restaurant in Dubrovnik! The prices were very reasonable too, I have been to restaurants in Dubrovnik, where the food and staff did not match. You will not be disappointed.

Lucky to bag on outdoor table by the edge, book in advance!!

The service and food were spot on, the view, unbeatable. Of course you are paying a bit extra but it's certainly worth it here. If we had time we would certainly do sunset dinner!

beautiful restaurant, with big menu and very professional service.
beer: 8euro , lazagne: 13euro , bottle of Moet : 100euro

nadherna restauracia s perfektnou obsluhou. drahsia, ale ako zazitok na nezaplatenie.odporucam. pivo cca 8eur, flasa Moetu cca 100eur , lazane okolo 13eur.

We had dinner at Panorama on recommendation from the hotel we stayed at. And what a treat! The meals were very good and the price very reasonable. Service was also very good. Be sure to make a booking in advance and request a table overlooking Old Town and the Adriatic as it is a very popular spot. The views at sunset are mindblowing.

Decided to have a snack and drink once I'd braved the cable car ride.
My husband and I had steak sandwiches which were tasty....a well deserved beer and glass of prosecco.
We then got moved to a table near the edge.....worth asking to move if a table becomes free....
We stayed to share a dessert and have a cocktail....I was able to wrap up in the blanket provided as it became cooler .
Lovely service...lovely views....

Bit pricey but they have a captive audience 😀
Had a lovely Caesar salad overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik at a super reasonable price considering. Took the cable car up and walked back down- allow about an hour

We reserved an outside table at the Panorama for dinner on the last evening of our holiday in Dubrovnik, and we were so pleased we did. Booked for 7.30pm (having been told we had the table until 9.15) so we could see the sunset, but we arrived early at 7pm and were immediately seated at our table, so had plenty of time for a cocktail before ordering! I recommend booking - we lost count of the number of people who we watched being turned away, as all the outside tables were fully booked. 
We shared the burrata to start - not as described as it was a large piece of fresh mozzarella with salad leaves, cherry tomatoes and pesto dressing on two pieces of toasted ciabatta. However, it was delicious and large enough for two of us. We then had the king prawns, a side of fries and the ribeye steak, cooked as ordered and both very tasty, followed by a cheesecake for dessert and a baileys coffee, again both were spot on. The whole meal including drinks - a cosmopolitan, 2 large beers, and a bottle of the white Pinot (very nice) - came to 1082 kunas. For the quality of the food we thought this was very good - the only thing overpriced in my opinion compared to the UK was the wine and unfortunately there was no 'house' wine on offer. However, the service was excellent throughout, the atmosphere very special and the view was simply magnificent - most definitely worth a few pounds extra. If you reserve one table whilst in Dubrovnik, make it here :)

Was a very busy day but and the restaurant was full but we agreed to take a table at the back, rather than a view of the coast, so were seated quickly. Good menu with a broad range of choices. We opted for the salad dishes and some beer. They were really tasty and good value, especially considering its a bit of a captive audience at the top of the cable car.

Definitely worth a visit...I can see how an evening meal would be very memorable at this location!

Our last night in Dubrovnik we wanted to see our vacation spot from the top. I was worried about the tram because I'm pretty scared of heights, but the ride up was smooth and very beautiful. We got to the restaurant early and they sat us right away. We opted to sit inside because of the wind - we still had the incredible view. Also, the staff was very attentive and had a lot of fun with us. We ordered appetizers, which were great. I would suggest the Dalmatian cheeses - very good. However the drinks were terrible! My "martini" was basically a glass of vermouth with whole olives. The Negroni my husband had was a Campari soda. Our pals who has wine seemed please with their choices. We all order a bunch of separate things so we could all enjoy parts of every meal. Another disappointment - my risotto was very plain, the tuna steak was overcooked, the duck was also overdone. If you are looking for an incredible view, enjoy a glass of wine, and munchies... this is it. Skip dinner.

It was a magical experience to have a lovely meal overlooking the ancient city of Dubrovnik, with the lights glittering some 1,200 feet below. Gorgeous views, great food, most attentive service. Marijo, you rock! You are so nice to everyone!

9 of us dined here second week of August (4 adults/5 teens). Having seen previous posts had pre booked which I think is probably essential in peak season. Fantastic views as the sun set with the nice touch of soft blankets provided for those of us who had not twigged it is cooler up a mountain after sunset!

Staff patient and helpful and the food was also excellent well exceeding my expectations for such a tourist hotspot.

If arriving at restaurant by cable car leave plenty time for queuing as it was very busy given the numbers heading up to see the sunset.

Not a budget evening but well worth it for both food and views.

This place is simply not to be missed. Amazing views, amazing service, lovely food and drinks. And very reasonable prices. What more could you ask for? If you have only a day or even if you have a couple of days, Panoroma is a must visit! A great place to chill and take in the views. Loved this!

Dinner in the restaurant was lovely and we were pleased to be inside as it was extremely windy. It would be nice to eat outside in calmer weather. The menu had enough variety and all 6 of our party enjoyed their choices. The ribeye steak was particularly good although the cooking instruction was misunderstood and it came out well done instead of rare. It was still the most tender steak I've ever eaten anywhere! Staff were attentive and service was quick. Good value for money. The views from the restaurant are amazing, particularly at sunset.

We booked ahead and got a table (number 12) right at the edge for 18:45 so that we could dine and see the sun set! The cable car trip, both two and from, added an extra dimension so even if you don’t eat it’s an amazing view of Dubrovnik.

Amazing food, cocktails and service! For the location it was also very fairly priced.
Sitting atop the mountain you can dine or drink with an amazing view of the entire city.
We visited in the evening and were provided with blankets for warmth and fantastic service.
Be sure to book in advance however to ensure you get a table with a view - the view tables are on the right which you can request on your booking.

Up in the mountain, at the top of the cable car, this is a unique restaurant, with breath taking views of Dubrovnik. Food is very good and well served. Waiters courteous and attentive. Highly recommended! 
PS it can be a bit cold at night, and, although they offer blankets, a jumper handy is recommendable.
It's worth the trip up the cable car for a spot of lunch, a cocktail and some incredible views. Service was great and we had a lovely sophisticated lunch overlooking the city and sea. Very nice!

My partner and I visited this restaurant during our holiday and we were very impressed. The view is incredible and we enjoyed a refreshing tuna salad (to share) and a beer each which came to 188kuna.

Prices weren't overly cheap, however you were paying more for the view which was definitely worth it.

Service was good, despite the restaurant being quite busy. I would highly recommend this as a place for a drink or food during your visit up top.

Have a coffee or cocktail here, the view is amazing. Cable car will bring you right to it. Menu looked great although we just indulged in cocktails before heading over to Konoba Dubrava, just down the street.

We had a beautiful, memorable meal at Panorama yesterday. We wanted to be there for sunset and managed to book in thanks to very efficient and caring email communication with the restaurant. The view doesn't need any words, it speaks for itself. The food was excellent and reasonably priced considering quality and location. I had an excellent ribeye steak. Our waiter Marioj was very professional but also friendly and genuinely caring. We can't recommend this enough. Go! Now!

First of all all once you take the cable car up the mountain to see the incredible view of Dubrovnik you have very few options once you are up there! The only restaurant on top is the Panorama restaurant off course the name says it all you eat there for the view. But the food is very good also. Fair price considering where you are. I would recommend to spend more time at the top, take 1h, have some good food and a drink and then go back down the cable car. Great Experience!

We took the cable car up to the top of the mountain during the early evening and had dinner at Panorama. The food was excellent and the atmosphere was very relaxing. We tried the burrata salad, pasta and prawn risotto. Servers were attentive and polite. This is the best view that you can get of Dubrovnik!

Went for lunch, had the best table inside, with terrific views! Actually surprised that the prices weren't as bad as we'd anticipated - but we all chose from the snack menu, not the full menu!

Nice to combine with the cable car ride, or else I would have found just the cable car quite expensive on its own.

We took the cable car up to the Panorama restaurant on our last night in Dubrovnik as we had heard about the beautiful views. We chose the outside restaurant and, although we could not be seated at the front tables, we had an excellent view out of the island of Lokrum. 
As expected the food is quite pricey but they do offer a snack menu which is a bit cheaper if you order before 6pm. We were there early in the evening so ordered two burgers from the snack menu which were tasty.
We hadn't accounted for the insects at the top of the hill and so our experience was slightly spoiled by two very persistent wasps who just would not leave us alone while we were eating. The waiter was very apologetic about this but really there was not much he could do. Try to bring some repellent (or something to hit them with) as we ended up leaving sooner than we would have as they had somewhat spoiled the romantic atmosphere!
Worth it just for the views alone though.

How can you beat the view? The service was a bit dodgy, but that may have been due to the time we were there (about 4, so after lunch but before dinner). The drinks were great but pricey; coupled with the view though they were worth it. The food smelled great but we had other plans so we didn't sample the menu.

Beautiful views from the restaurant . 
Inside and outside seating . It's on top when you go up by cable car. 
Good selection of drinks and food on the menu. Average service . Clean restaurant.
two double espressos and 2 fresh orange juices in the best view restaurant in Dubrovnik shaded by large umbrellas and with good service x

This was the only restaurant in Dubrovnik where we made a reservation beforehand, it was worth for doing, as we had a great table with the great view to the city. Still: that was the only "great" we had there. Wine was good but also priced accordingly, drinks were overpricedd for our budget, and the food closer to "below average" than "above the average". Spinach lasagne I had was salty and it has way too much parmesan to the top of it (and by the way, I love salty food as well as parmesan!), and the lasagne bolognese my friend had was dry in addition to parmesan- and salt problem. When making the reservation we were informed the table needs to be free again at 21:30, and we completed our dinner in given time. At the end we were waiting attention from the staff - around 20 minutes or so, before got anybody to deliver our invoice to us. Not nice to have first hurry and then just wait and wait when staff were running back and forth without anybody to notice we are ready and willing to leave.

Booked months ahead to secure a good table with view, and we were not disappointed. 

We stayed from about 6.30pm to 10pm and watch the view change from daylight, sunset to evening. 

Everyone enjoyed the wine and meals were good (steak, fish, salad, desserts), but it was really the view that made the dining experience. 

Would definitely revisit.

No question, amazing view but the Food was only just about average. Expected better cooking for the price. We had steak and fish, both highly over cooked. The cold starters were ok. Cocktails were warm.
I'd go up again for the view (which you can do without going to the restaurant) but I think the quality of food back in town is higher and cheaper.

Made reservations in advance for my wedding anniversary and was so glad I did so. We were ushered to house seats and had very attentive but unobtrusive waiters all evening. Special thanks to Baz and his colleagues who were attending to us all evening. 

Starters was burrata cheese and squids from mains. Mains was sea bass and catch of the day which was tuna. Both dishes were excellent especially the tuna steak!

The reservation at 7pm was great as we caught sunset at 8pm. The view as aptly described by its name Panorama is excellent. Highly recommended!!

Managed to book a table at the very front of the restaurant so our view was spectacular overlooking the whole of Dubrovnik. Staff were very friendly and the meal was lovely.
Unfortunately the evening ended earlier than expected when a huge thunderstorm arrived and they had to shut the outside part of the restaurant, luckily enough we had just finished eating and the restaurant gave us desserts for free as we had to rush them. If visiting Dubrovnik this is a must
Nice view of dubrovnik, good food and nice staff! Recomended when you need a fresh shadow in summer..................

We came to the resturant after the trip with the cable car and visiting the war museum. We didn't have a reservation and the resturant was fully booked, but we asked at the desk, and were very lucky when there was an opening because somebody did not show up. We probably got the best table in the restaurant, just in time to enjoy the increadible sunset. 

Additionally, we are treated with the best service so far in our Croatian vacation, with attentive and timely waiters. The food was very good, and allmost matched the view. 

The only negative point they could have improved was the terrible musac they keep playing, luckily not too loud. And be aware, it is a bit expencive, but on this location we thought it was well worth it. Recommended!

We thoroughly enjoyed our meal here, and would highly recommend booking a table to watch the sunset!

We booked a table on the terrace and were fortunate enough to be sat with a perfect view of the Islands and sunset. We ordered cocktails prior to having our food...these were a little delayed, but the waiter kindly have us a discount because of this (even though we really didn't mind too much at all!)

We enjoyed 3 fantastic courses; beef carpaccio, spaghetti, lamb, a sublime steak and finished with some cheesecake. The food was fantastic, and reasonably priced for a restaurant in this location. The staff were polite and helpful, and service was very good. We were able to sit and enjoy some cocktails after our meal and didn't feel rushed at all. It's also lovely to escape the humidity of the old town and sit with the cool mountain breeze.

The view is simply amazing too. Definitely do this as a treat! Just give yourself plenty of time to get the cable car up there too

Friendly, proffessional and very obliged staff; to start off with. A restaurant with a fantastic view and very good food and drinks.

A must if visiting Dubrovnik.

Good food, great views, if not a bit windy, but thats not the restuarants fault. The waiter did spill our cocktail over the adjoining table, and seemed rather young to be doin gthis at this height! However the manager was in speedy response. Very accomodating as they provided blankets for the ladies who were feeling chilly, Good food and great setting. Romantic too. Definitely worth the trip.

We decided to go up to the restaurant for some drinks for the sunset. Although we didn't have a reservation the staff were so lovely and accomodating. Also the apple cake is to die for. Great, would definitely recommend it

Excellent location on the top of the hill above the old town. Views and sceneries are breathtaking. Food menu is very varied, and quality is average. I think its a bit on the high side of prices. Its worth the time just for the panorama

We had a wonderful evening at this restaurant. Arriving at sunset from the cable car, we were lucky enough the get a great table inside with a spectacular view of the old town. It was a little chilly when e arrived but the very obliging waiter kindly adjusted the air conditioning. The food was lovely. the price was a little on the high side but not ridiculous and totally worth it for the fantastic setting. Would definitely recommend for dinner but probably best to make a reservation.
We would definitely recommend you to have dinner here. The view and the food are amazing. Also, the staff is very friendly and polite.

Situated at the top of Mount Srd overlooking the old town the views are amazing. The food and service were superb. Prices were very reasonable considering the overall experience. We had a birthday celebration and the staff couldn't have been more attentive. Thank you for a lovely evening.
We reserved online that guaranteed us an excellent table with a great view of the old town at night.

Last year we tried Restaurant Nautika, so this year we had to try Panorama Restaurant. What a splendid view of Dubrovnik and surrounding! Lovely temperature on the mountain, as there is a little breeze that cools you off from the hot (but lovely) Old Town.

Normally I don't choose it for lunch, but being pregnant, I was so into red meat, that I took the ribeye steak. I asked on purpose for well-done, and to my surprise the meat was still tender! Delicious! Thinking back of the dessert, my mouth starts watering again.. 
You can choose anything, from small to big, an appetizer, a snack, lovely fish, pasta, rice, or just a nice drink, and everything has that little touch from Dubrovnik/Croatia.

Some people find it too expensive, but compared to prices in France, Holland, Luxembourg or Germany, I find it pretty equal and fair. Plus, you get to eat and taste real quality food.

The crew is super kind. You cannot leave the Panorama Restaurant without a smile. 
I would definitely come back.

Having read some reviews we tried to book a table for 8pm and sunset but they could only accommodate us at 6.30 or 9pm. 
We went for 6.30 which was excellent as we had the table guaranteed until 8.45 and managed to see the view in daylight, watch the sunset and see the city lights come on all before leaving.
The food was great and the service very good. The staff were really friendly and helpful and we did not feel at all rushed. 
Our waiter offered to take a photo for us and has obviously had a lot of practice and made sure he got us and the town below in the shot. 
The only downside ( and the reason for not giving 5 stars) was that lots of diners who were not lucky enough to have a table on the cliff edge were walking over to tables on the edge to take photos. Not what you really want as you are eating. Ok some were subtle when doing this but others quite obtrusive. Perhaps the staff need to ask diners not to do this and direct them to the upper bar area to do this if they feel the need as there was just as good a view from up there and they would not be intruding on anyone.
All that aside, I would thoroughly recommend the experience of fining here.

Definitely recommend to have drinks/food there. Of course the price is higher than in other restaurants, but it's worth it! Excellent and kind service, very good food/drinks and unique view over Dubrovnik.

We had the perfect table on a ridge on the edge of the mountain overlooking the beautiful old city of Dubrovnik, the island of Lokrum and much more. The waiters are super friendly and provide great service. We had club sandwiches, and ham and cheese sandwiches with fries. We had iced lattes, orange juice and of course - English Breakfast Tea. All served impeccably. I think it may be worth booking as we went at lunch time and we had the last table they had available .Especially book ahead if you are thinking of going in the evening.
Well delivered service and good fare but by gxxxd prices reflect their uncompetitive advantage as only supplier at this prime location

He did not tilt the glass...all foamed up obviously... very stupid if your job is serving drinks.
And the cheeseburger was horribly dry and I believe without any sauce at all.
Lasagna bolognese was very tasty though.

When you add in the cost of the cable car and the slightly higher than average prices in the restaurant it is not an inexpensive experience. Saying that the food is very good, as is the wine choice and the views at sunset are breathtakingly beautiful. All in all I would say it is something not be missed on your visit to Dubrovnik.

We had booked a table a few days in advance via email and that was all very easy. We could request a table with a view and were given some options of times and confirmed all of that by email. They replied to emails very quickly. 

We got a taxi from Pile Gate for 125 Kunas.
We arrived a bit early and had a drink in the bar. A good selection of beer and wine. We then got our table which was one with a great view.

We heard many people ask for a table who hadn't booked and were told that all of the most scenic tables were booked in advance.

Food was good. We both had a starter which was large and then we both had steak for mains. All good was tasty and good size. Service was friendly and helpful. 

Views were outstanding. Dinner very reasonable for the whole experience. Two starters, two mains, one beer, two glasses of wine was approx $140 AUD. 

We then got tickets for the cable car back down. 70 Kunas per person one way. 

Highly recommended.

Great romantic setting, we had dinner whilst watching the sunset. Great views over the old town. Our waiter was friendly and took lots of photos from different angles to try and capture the sunset. The food was excellent. I would recommend booking in advance, our hotel did this for us.
The view on Dubrovnik from up here is breathtaking. I've enjoyed a great Tuna Salad and just loved the view!
Treat yourself to the coffee up here - best view! And surprisingly not expensive. Cakes are gorgeous too!

Came up with the Cable car with no actual intention of having supper. We decided to eat anyhow, and managed to get the best table in the restsurant, overlooking the Old Town and the whole Dubrovnik peninsula. The food, especially the Meat, was Great, and the service was impeccable. Definitely a must-do thing. Book a table before hand to be on the safe side, we were Lucky to get ours!

The views from the restaurant are the main pull - if you've taken the cable car up, you should definitely stop by to enjoy your surroundings. The food & drink are ok - nothing to write home about. I found the attitudes of the staff to not be great - despite us going during a non-peak time of the day, they weren't willing to move a couple chairs around to fit us into a table with good views. Half the restaurant was empty but they insisted nothing could be moved. I'm not a finicky traveler but this seemed like a pretty simple request to me.

We knew of the restaurant prior to our visit throught the internet / brochures, but nothing actually prepared us for such a wonderful experinece.

Having braved the cable car (15 people t0 each car - a little crowded) to the top of the mountain overlooking Dunbrovnik in searing heat (even at 6pm),my wfie and I asked, more in hope than anythinh else, if there were any seats available. We should have booked but took a chance anyway. They said to try again in half an hour, but I hung around looking to see who was leaving hoping for a table. The views are stunning and the sunet was truly memorable. Got some lovely photos.

Obviously we wanted one on the side of the mountian overlooking Dubrovnik, but were told they were all reserved and accepted that we may have to go for a table away from the side.

However. I saw a table that was empty and asked if it was free an would it be possible to have that. The lady looked surprised and said she would check - lo and behold it was free. RESULT.

As went towards our seat another table suddenly became free nearer the edge and she asaked if we would like that table - the answer was a resounding YES. ANOTHER RESULT. That was our first stroke of luck.

The second storke was to get probably the best waiter there....superb sense of humour, extremely helpful and eager to please. 

We ordered a couple of cocktails and beers and also selected a bottle of local Merlot for the meal. Superb wine - 14.7 in strength and absolutely spot on.

Now comes the BIG mistake. My wife said she wasn't too fussy about a starter so i suggested we share a plate of mixed cheeses and olives. The mistake was that it was HUGE and having tried our very best eventually gave in to the pressure of what the rest of the meal was going to offer and left some of the starter. Oh dear - being someone who enjoys his food, thats not something I am proud of.

My wife chose a vegetarian main course which she absolutely adored and was pleased that there was a decent selection of veggie food which is not something Croatia readily offers in abundance.

To my surprise I chose the Lamb Shank which I did not expect to see on a Dubrovnik menu. Glad I did though because it was superb - fell off the bone.

More wine and more first class service and fun with the waiter, who when we asked for the desert menu, offered us the choice of the menu with the compliments of the management. So my wife and I decided on ice creams, which sounds a bit boring, but with three dollops of varying flavours with biscuits was absolutely excellent.

Finished with another cocktail whilst looking out over probably one of the best views from a restaurant I have encountered. Absolutley superb.

The setting was great - the service was great - our waiter was great - the whole experience was GREAT. The highlight of our holiday.

It cost a bit but who cares when you can have this sort of night out with your wife.

I would recommed the Panorama to anyone - but once peiece of advice 
BOOK IN ADVANCE - we were extremely lucky - other after us were not.

Although we got off on the wrong foot with my last name spelt wrong and the restaurant staff thinking i didn't have a booking. We still had an enjoyable experience with the food being fantastic, with a large serving and the view over the sunset just beautiful.
We started the evening with a cheese and smoked Dalmatian ham platter for entree. The spread of cheeses was fantastic and the ham didn't fail to deliver. For mains I had the Traditional Beef Stew with Noodles, the Beef was beautifully tender and the pasta was fresh and delicious. My fiancé had the Octopus which he said was the best he has ever had, extremely tender and full of flavour.
Highly recommend heading up the cable car not only for the view but for an unforgettable night.
Worth a visit when in Dubrovnik and worth every penny seeing this incredible country from that height. The view is breathe taking!

What a great place for all the right reasons. It was the last evening of our holiday but we will definitely be coming back. Our waiter Marijo and his assistant were attentive and friendly.
