They made a great recommendation for food. I had the duck. Full of flavour. Everything was just perfect. Everyone who goes to Dubrovnik must visit here.

We only ate here because of the length of the queue for the return cable car, and we were so glad we did. This was the best meal we had in Dubrovnik. We were very pleasantly surprised, especially as one would imagine that 90% of the customers here won't be back so they could serve any old muck! But the food was of a very high standard, and everything was delicious. It was also the only place in Dubrovnik where I managed to find a Merlot on the wine list!
Of course, the view is also amazing.

Just love this place....the view, the service, the food. It was lovely from start to finish. We got a table a little bit back from the cliff edge row of tables - the prized tables which need a booking - but the location still fantastic. As tables emptied we were offered the chance to move to such a table after our main course. We were happy so didn't take up the offer...we then had a free dessert delivered to the table by the manager. Just a nice touch that makes the bit of difference. BTW, we also loved our waiter but then, to be honest, every waiter we had in all restaurants whilst in Croatia has been superb.

Not a cheap night out but a great night out. 

Highly recommend as a must do in Dubrovnik.
Amazing view, food was great and the service is amazing. We ate burger and sladas great great. Everything was great, we will be back for dinner 🎉🎉

We had a lovely evening here. Travelling up the hill on the cable car was great and the view is spectacular when you reach the top. We had booked the restaurant through our hotel (hotel kompas). At first we were seated at a table away from the hill edge, therefore the view wasn't brilliant. However, without asking, after a few minutes a waiter explained that he had a better table for us and we were seated at a brilliant table on the edge with a fabulous view of the sunset. It's good to go around 8pm as you can watch the sunset. Their was also a beautiful view of the moon on the other side - it was bright yellow and rose really quickly from behind a hill! We were then given a free glass of prosecco each for our short wait! The food was absolutely delicious, my partner and I had one of the best steaks we've had.

I would definitely recommend this restaurant if you are visiting Dubrovnik. It's a great experience, including the cable car. It was fairly reasonable considering the location - the steak was around £25. A lovely night and highlight of our holiday.

My second visit to Panorama, went last year and had to go back. An amazing setting, book for about 8pm to see the sunset, and watch out for the moon rising over the mountains behind, glowing orange from the sun going down. 
We booked through our hotel, and were slightly disappointed to be given a table away from the front- needn't have worried, a member of staff came to get us whilst we were looking at the menus to say that they had a better table, right at the front....then he brought us each a complimentary prosecco with a strawberry in it to apologise for the inconvenience 😊 we hadn't complained - think they must get a lot of business from Hotel Kompas!
Food was delicious. I had the lamb shank and other members of my party steak - perfection. Great fun going up and down on the cable car too.

an excellent place to cool down from the heat of Dubrovnik. The restaurant is stepped down so that most tables have an amazing view of the Old Town. Service and the food are good and the menu is veried.

After calling to make a booking to be told that we could only get in the next day and the second sitting that started at 9:15pm we thought why not we never know if we'll be back.
All I can say is it was worth the wait as sitting up on top of the world looking down over the Old Town of Dubrovnik and surroundings was unbelievable.
We went up early and sat watching one of the best sunsets that you will see.
My wife and I started with Lasagne she had the one with spinach and I had the bolognese, well it was a meal on its own and was excellent.
For main I had the Grilled Beefsteak that was accompanied by pepper sauce and young potatoes with rosemary and garlic. My wife had the chefs recommendation which was duck in a balsamic glaze and both meals were of exceptional standard.
Both meals were combined with very attentive staff that were there even to take the photo of a life time at the end of the meal.
You would expect to pay ridiculous amounts of money for great food, great staff and a view to die for, but no this was very affordable and a lot better than I expected.
Don't go to Dubrovnik without going to Panorama restaurant.

Went to Panorama for lunch with my best friend on our last day in Dubrovnik. We thought it was a must-see, and indeed it is. The food was good, and the view was amazing. Didn't think the prices were outrageous, all things considered. Worth checking out for sure.

We booked a table for two the previous night knowing we were going to take the cable car to the top to see the views. 
We got a seat at the edge where we could see the views perfectly. 

We got in at 6pm and out at 9pm so we got to enjoy both the day and night view while the sun was setting. Amazing and beautiful. 

All staff working there was extremely friendly. The main dish I ordered was "chef's recommendation" which was duck breast and was delicious! The desert was "Chocolate cup" which had chocolate ice cream and sauce. It was too big for one person. I could have shared with my boyfriend. 

Cosmopolitan could have been slightly better. 

The end bill was huge but it was all worth it. I recommend this for dinner place during your visit in Dubrovnik.

We had lunch there after doing the city wall tour. The chicken salad is very good. The views are excellent and the service is also very good- it is lovely and cool in the very hot weather . The prices are average for the area

We booked well in advance and had a 4 table setting right on the edge, looking down on the Old Town or Dubrovnik and the Adriatic Sea.

We had a lovely dinner, can't remember exactly what, but did include seafood and pasta, with some wine and beers.

The staff were lovely and took some pictures for us as we sat waiting for the food,

Watch the sunset over the Adriatic Sea, good food, drinks and good friends....awesome.

Would do it all again if we return to Dubrovnik! 
Don't miss the chance.

We visited Panorama Cafe after our sunset dune buggy tour so we were dirty and dusty. Many other tables were dressed up, but we did not feel uncomfortable dressed down. The evening views are incredible. Though we did not get the best table (be sure to book a table with a good view a day in advance!) we could get up and see the sights from different points in the restaurant. The rib eye was incredible! The atmosphere was very nice and relaxing - we didn't feel rushed..I think we stayed and talked and drank wine for over two hours! I believe this is the only dining option at the top of the cable cars, and it does not disappoint.

We managed to get a table for two at very short notice after a last minute cancellation, and we were so happy we did!
The staff were lovely and very accommodating to all of our needs. The views were absolutely stunning and totally worth the visit. The food was also excellent and we even got complimentary coffee and desserts after my husband said his steak had been a little overcooked (although it was still lovely). 
They definitely went the extra mile and made our experience a great one! Will definitely visit again!
I really enjoyed my sea food starter but main dish of chicken imperial was very disappointing. If I could go back then I would just get two of the sea food starters.

We took the cable car up to Srd Hill in the late afternoon so we could take advantage of the sunset and also have an evening meal at the Panorama restaurant. We had not booked and were unable to get an outside table but there was availability in the inside area and we were very happy with this as it was air-conditioned! We were seated at a wonderful table overlooking the Old City. We were half board at our hotel and this was the only evening meal we ate outside of that. I have to say that it was well worth it and both myself and my husband had wonderful food all washed down with a beautiful Croatian Merlot (Negroland). We were given a complimentary local liqueur at the end of our meal which was also delicious. We were never rushed and had a wonderful waitress serving us which made the whole experience truly magical.
The view from the restaurant is amazing! I recommend a visit at sunset. Food is ok, but nothing special. So the last star is just for the view.
Lovely food especially the chocolate ice cream cup. The wine is very good too. Also the salad was very fresh and delicious. Very good portion size.

Have to book at least 3 days in advance, they run 2 'shifts' 6-9pm, 9-12pm. Sunset is usually 8:30pm. Must arrive at funicular stop at least 1 hour before reservations as there are queues for tickets then for the cable car. Food is ok (best to try the specials), everything is double the price but same quality as on the ground. OK experience, dining there is mainly for the views, not food or wine.

Went here with my fiance last night for sunset at the recommendation of our cab driver. We took the cable car up before sunset and managed to have perfect timing with seeing the sky change over dinner. Absolutely beautiful view. The restaurant was crowded but we managed to get (possibly) the best table there, right next to the railing looking down. The food is pricey but would be on par with a nice dinner in the USA. My fiance ordered the chef recommendation, duck breast, and said it was by far the best duck he had ever had. I ordered chicken imperial and the chicken was average but the vegetables were delightful. 

It gets chilly at night so I would recommend bringing a sweater. The restaurant also has blankets that they will bring out for use. The servers were friendly and even brought over two after dinner drinks on the house. I recommend bringing some kn to tip in cash since you cannot add to the card. We were given a 10% discount card for our next visit. 

Overall, it is pricey but well worth it.

Obviously the view from this place is amazing. Visited for dinner and sat right at the front next to the glass 

The prices are abit more than you'd expect, £10 for a club sandwhich but it's understandable with the view

There isn't really anywhere else to go up there so if your hungry it's not a bad choice

We had reservations for outside but the rain brought us inside which was perfectly fine. The view is unreal! Marijo was our server and he was very attentive and friendly. I highly recommend this restaurant.

We took the cable car up to Panorama to take in the views and have a glass of wine. Once we got up there and saw how beautiful it was we put our names on a waiting list for any cancellations for dinner. Luckily a table came up fairly quickly and we were shown to our table. We were so glad we did. The food was outstanding. We shared some meat and olives to start and both opted for beef. The presentation of the food was lovely, all the staff were really accomodating and the wine recommendation was perfect! Sitting there watching the sunset and the world go by was just perfect. Thank you to all the staff for squeezing us in and the excellent service we received (I think our waiter was called Mario so a special thanks to him)! We would definitely return to this restaurant and would recommend to anyone visiting Dubronik! Thank you!

The view is one of the best in the world. Since we wanted to linger, we decided to order. We were there at 10 am. They don't serve breakfast so we ordered lunch. I had a ham and cheese sandwich. It was on a baguette, cold cheese, about 5 or 6 slices, about 5 slices of hard prosciutto and 2 slices of tomato. Yuck! I left 75% of the yucky bread. And ate one slice of cheese and a few pieces of prosciutto. My husband had the steak sandwich. He said it was road side diner quality. We had a bottle of sparkling water, some coffees, all for a price of 370 kunas, or $55. We went out for breakfast right after we took the cable car back.

I thought this might be low quality and over priced due to the location and lack of competition. It was really good though - service was exceptional.
Of course you go for the views but the food was pretty good also!

Our table was not right on the edge, but we could still admire the blue sea and enjoy the views. For lunch we took a tuna salad and a seafood plate. Both were very good. The tuna salad was not that original, but no complaints. The seafood plate however was delicious, and had a great freshness to it. Also amazing iced coffees for dessert. Service was very good, they were able to find us a table very fast even though the place was full.

This restaurant is a bit more expensive than other places in Dubrovnik but you will never have views like this in another restaurant! We had lunch here looking out over the sea, food was good but the location really makes it special.

We took the cable car to the top and decided to stop by for a drink. Cocktails were large and tasty, but a bit pricey. However, considering the prime location of the restaurant we understood the price tag and deemed it worthy.

As we were getting a bit peckish we shared a beef sandwich, which was really delicious. The staff were very friendly and attentive, which made the experience very pleasant. I can definitely recommend this amazing site for everyone who is visiting Dubrovnik.

This restaurant has not only the most breathtakingly beautiful view in the world, genuinely but the food was surprisingly excellent considering it's a tourist spot. It's just so romantic,carved out of lots of terraces on different levels seated under umbrellas which are all different heights it's truly enchanting with a tiny matchbox Dubrovnik below and the islands scattered to your right where you watch the sunset go down and the moonlight rise up and twinkle on the sea. Rarely can I remember ever seeing a view as incredible as this. If there is nothing else you do in Dubrovnik come here. The food wasn't even that expensive. We had the chefs special which was duck with hazelnuts in a caramel sauce. Quite heavenly. My husband had a cheese platter to start followed by lamb shank which was delicious. I had carpaccio as a starter which was too salty and the prawns in a tomato sauce which was ok. We did love it which is why we returned the next evening. And if you choose your food wisely you will have a superb time. Mario our waiter was outstanding!

This restaurant is in a superb location at the top of the cable car station. Amazing views over Dubrovnik Old Town and the beautiful coastline. We arrived around 6.30pm but were told that all the tables with the best views of the city were booked. We took a table several rows back with views of the mountains which was still stunning.
Food was very poor quality. The burgers were raw in the middle and when asked if everything was okay, we replied that we were unable to eat our meals as they were undercooked. The waiter apologised, gave us our bill and we were charged the full price.
This was our only poor meal during our week in the Dubrovnik area. There are so many good restaurants to choose from but Panorama Restaurant is one that I will definitely not be recommending.
Views only offset by high prices for food and drinks. Service impeccable and tables very well presented.

We visited the Panorama Restaurant for our last evening in the city. We had high expectations after the staff in our hotel recommended it. We booked two days prior, as this was also recommended. You get the choice of two hour sittings, 19.00 & 21.00, but we did not feel rushed. I took a recommendation from our waiter Marijo, who was fantastic, as we all members of the staff that met. This is a must eat in restaurant, so book as soon as you arrive in town. Also use the cable car up and down. The journey is 60 seconds, but the views are stunning, as they are from the top. We had table 44, which was just the best.
We did not eat dinner here, but did grab a quick drink and enjoyed the views. Staff was friendly, everything completely met expectations.

Me and my partner booked a table for 2 here to finish off our fabulous week in Croatia.. This seemed a beautiful place to finish the holiday and wow!! it was breathtaking. The views are remarkable and well worth seeing if you are able to go! We were seated in a wonderful table also with a great view and couldn't wait to spend the evening in this perfect location but unfortunately it went down hill from here..

Initial service, drinks and our starter were all very good it was going so well until our mains... We both ordered the grilled beef steak with veg. As it came out, it looked lovely and was served professionally.. I took to the steak with my knife and could honestly not even cut into it. It was hard, low quality and cold. Personally I like to eat my meal hot? My partner said his was also served warm which for a steak is not really acceptable? I kindly asked for it to be re heated or another steak cooked and our waiter apologised and took away my food saying they will make me a fresh one. Already a little annoyed as my partner had pretty much finished his meal, I was still waiting on mine. It finally came and it was the exact same steak that was taken away before only cooked more (far too over cooked really..) this time a little warmer but STILL not as hot as it should have been?! I am not really a fussy person when eating out but to me, food being served hot is essential. I then realised my veg had been taken off and never came back so I was left with just a lump of very over cooked meat. I was rather disappointed and tried to attract attention but this proved difficult. In the end I had another cold plate and several wasps all helping themselves to my food. I was furious considering the prices they charge here are not cheap, I really was expecting better. I had to leave my own table to find attention and eventually was spoken to. I explained the situation and we were given sincere apologies and our bill on the house however for us it did just ruin the experience and by then we did just stand up and leave. To be fair to the management they tried to organise anything we wanted to compensate us through another meal or anything of our choice, but we chose to call a taxi and leave. Kindly they paid for the taxi bill which we appreciated but overall we were sad that it was such a let down. I would suggest going here for a drink and not a meal!!
Amazing views of Dubrovnik, delicious food & cocktails and the staff are so friendly! 100% recommend you to visit if you are in the area.

We walked up Mount Srd and a stop at the Panorma Restaurant for refreshments was very welcome, and a good respite from the rain which had just begun. The cable car wasn't running because of a storm the previous night, so the restaurant was quiet and we were lucky enough to secure a table in front of the huge glass windows giving a stunning panoramic view of Dubrovnik below, and out to the islands beyond.
We had drinks and a large slice of chocolate and walnut cake which was beautifully presented. It wasn't cheap but then I guess you pay for the view, which was well worth it. I imagine on days when the cable car is running and in the height of summer it could get very busy so maybe book in advance if you know you definitely want to eat here - the main meals I saw being served to other tables looked very good.
I had the best sea food starter in this restaurant, and the main of sea bass was absolutely delicious, perfectly cooked!

This was the most exquisite setting for dinner. Stunning views across the Adriatic. We went at sunset which was pretty idyllic! We tried to book a table but couldn't so we popped in on the off chance and were seated straight away. The food was lovely too! Excellent quality and attentive service. We treated ourselves to cocktails as the sun set. A perfect end to the day!

We visited this for a quick lunch after doing the buggy tour (amazing!) and we're lucky enough to be given a view at the edge after a couple who had reserved didn't show. We just had club sandwiches and a beer but the food was lovely, the views over the old town very romantic and the staff didn't make us feel out of place for being filthy covered in dust!

The food and drink may seem slightly overpriced but, considering where you are and the fact that they have a captive audience, it's actually quite reasonable when you take into account the stunning views.
The quality is good and the service is mostly quick, friendly and efficient.

Our table was not right on the edge, but we could still admire the blue sea and enjoy the views. For lunch we took a tuna salad and a seafood plate. Both were very good. The tuna salad was not that original, but no complaints. The seafood plate however was delicious, and had a great freshness to it. Also amazing iced coffees for dessert. Service was very good, they were able to find us a table very fast even though the place was full.

This restaurant is a bit more expensive than other places in Dubrovnik but you will never have views like this in another restaurant! We had lunch here looking out over the sea, food was good but the location really makes it special.

We took the cable car to the top and decided to stop by for a drink. Cocktails were large and tasty, but a bit pricey. However, considering the prime location of the restaurant we understood the price tag and deemed it worthy.

As we were getting a bit peckish we shared a beef sandwich, which was really delicious. The staff were very friendly and attentive, which made the experience very pleasant. I can definitely recommend this amazing site for everyone who is visiting Dubrovnik.

This restaurant has not only the most breathtakingly beautiful view in the world, genuinely but the food was surprisingly excellent considering it's a tourist spot. It's just so romantic,carved out of lots of terraces on different levels seated under umbrellas which are all different heights it's truly enchanting with a tiny matchbox Dubrovnik below and the islands scattered to your right where you watch the sunset go down and the moonlight rise up and twinkle on the sea. Rarely can I remember ever seeing a view as incredible as this. If there is nothing else you do in Dubrovnik come here. The food wasn't even that expensive. We had the chefs special which was duck with hazelnuts in a caramel sauce. Quite heavenly. My husband had a cheese platter to start followed by lamb shank which was delicious. I had carpaccio as a starter which was too salty and the prawns in a tomato sauce which was ok. We did love it which is why we returned the next evening. And if you choose your food wisely you will have a superb time. Mario our waiter was outstanding!

This restaurant is in a superb location at the top of the cable car station. Amazing views over Dubrovnik Old Town and the beautiful coastline. We arrived around 6.30pm but were told that all the tables with the best views of the city were booked. We took a table several rows back with views of the mountains which was still stunning.
Food was very poor quality. The burgers were raw in the middle and when asked if everything was okay, we replied that we were unable to eat our meals as they were undercooked. The waiter apologised, gave us our bill and we were charged the full price.
This was our only poor meal during our week in the Dubrovnik area. There are so many good restaurants to choose from but Panorama Restaurant is one that I will definitely not be recommending.
Views only offset by high prices for food and drinks. Service impeccable and tables very well presented.
